body: Telkom Indonesia has launched its AI Center of Excellence, a hub for artificial intelligence development through cross-sector collaboration, with four pillars: education, industry collaboration, showcase display, and advanced capabilities. The company aims to deliver AI solutions to corporations, government agencies, and micro, small, and medium enterprises, and has partnered with companies and universities including Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison, NeutraDC, Feedloop, and Bandung Institute of Technology.

The Indonesian rupiah dropped nearly 1% to its weakest level since August 1, while the stock index fell 2% to its lowest point since August 12, amid student protests against lawmakers' pay. Bank Indonesia and the Indonesia Stock Exchange regulator have issued statements to stabilize the market, with Bank Indonesia intervening in offshore and onshore markets and buying government bonds.

The World Trade Organization (WTO) has ruled in favor of Indonesia in its trade dispute with the European Union (EU) over countervailing duties imposed on palm oil-based biodiesel products, with the WTO panel declaring that the EU's measures were inconsistent with WTO provisions. This decision is expected to benefit Indonesia's biodiesel industry, which generates over $30 billion in export earnings annually and supports the livelihoods of millions of smallholder farmers.

The Indonesian rupiah dropped nearly 1% to its weakest level since August 1, while the stock index fell 2% to its lowest point since August 12, amid student protests against lawmakers' pay. Bank Indonesia and the Indonesia Stock Exchange regulator have issued statements to stabilize the market, with Bank Indonesia intervening in offshore and onshore markets and buying government bonds.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will introduce a new system to verify data of subsidized 3-kg LPG buyers starting 2026, aiming to eliminate the need for repeated ID submissions and ensure more accurate distribution. The initiative is part of the ministry's broader effort to transition to a beneficiary-based subsidy model, which includes plans to introduce a single national tariff for 3-kg LPG cylinders in 2026, with companies like Pertamina potentially impacted by the changes.

Telkomsel has fully restored 4G internet services in eight areas of Papua and Maluku after repairing a damaged backup undersea cable, with the affected districts now back online. The company is offering compensation to affected users, including replacement data for prepaid customers and prorated billing discounts for postpaid users, amid ongoing repairs to another section of the undersea cable.

Stockbit, a leading investment stock trading app, recorded the highest number of trades and largest transaction volume on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, handling over 976,000 transactions worth IDR 3.32 trillion on August 25, 2025. The company has led all 95 securities companies in Indonesia in terms of trading activity so far this year, with over 58 million transactions made on its platform, driven by growing public interest in investing, especially among younger people.

Suzanna Tanojo, an insider, sold 281,735,300 shares of PT Victoria Investama Tbk. at IDR 170 per share, reducing her holding from 3,769,123,138 shares to 4,050,858,438 shares, representing a 12.55% decrease in her stake.

Suzanna Tanojo, an insider, purchased 1,279,815,731 shares of PT Victoria Investama Tbk. at IDR 170 per share, increasing her holding from 2,489,307,407 shares to 3,769,123,138 shares. The transaction, worth IDR 2,171,189,024, occurred on August 28, 2025, and represents a significant increase in Tanojo's stake in the financial holding company.

Chemical Asia Corporation Pte, Ltd, an institutional shareholder, sold 2,133,830,231 shares of PT Victoria Investama Tbk., a financials sector company, at IDR 170 per share, resulting in a complete divestment of its 213,383,023,100 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

Chemical Asia Corporation Pte, Ltd, an institutional shareholder, sold 41,720,000 shares of PT Victoria Investama Tbk, reducing its holding from 2,175,550,231 to 2,133,830,231 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 6,456,000,000,000, represents a 1.93% decrease in Chemical Asia's ownership stake in the financial holding company.

Deputy Minister Todotua Pasaribu identified racketeering as a major obstacle to Indonesia's investment climate, citing its impact on production costs and pricing competitiveness. Meanwhile, Q2 investment realization reached Rp477.7 trillion, an 11.5% increase from the same period last year, with foreign direct investment contributing Rp202.2 trillion and domestic investment accounting for Rp275.5 trillion.

Trukindo Persada Sejahtera, an insider, purchased 132,400 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK) in the energy sector, specifically oil-gas-coal sub-sector, increasing their holding from 62,951,400 to 63,083,800 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

Trukindo Persada Sejahtera, an insider, sold 6,970,000 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK), reducing its holding from 63,083,800 to 56,113,800 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed. This sell transaction may indicate a decrease in confidence in the company's prospects.

PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya, an institutional holder, sold 12,382,300 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK), reducing its stake from 79,694,200 shares to 67,311,900 shares. The transaction type is sell, with no disclosed purpose.

Mohammed Bawazir Trading Co., Ltd has signed a letter of intent to purchase $60 million worth of Indonesian processed foods, with an initial focus on ready-to-drink coffee, biscuits, and canned tuna. The deal is expected to further boost Indonesia's exports to Saudi Arabia, which have already risen 49.53% year-on-year to $1.70 billion from January to June 2025.

Syngenta Indonesia launched a rice cultivation guidebook and a drone learning center to enhance rice productivity and national food self-sufficiency. The guidebook, compiled from Syngenta's field experiences and farmer engagement, covers the full spectrum of rice farming practices, while the drone learning center aims to enable farmers to utilize drones for efficient fertilizer and crop protection application.

The Ministry of Cooperatives has agreed to relax licensing regulations for Red White Cooperatives, allowing them to obtain business identification numbers and access Indonesian Standard Classification business fields. This move is expected to simplify the process for cooperatives to market state-owned enterprise products, with 80,605 village cooperatives already having legal entities and cooperative identification numbers.

Batam, Riau Islands Province, has been designated as a national model for special economic zone development in Indonesia, with five SEZs located in the province, including the Nongsa Digital Park and the Parkes SEZ, which will feature the Mayapada Apollo Batam International Hospital, a joint project between Mayapada Group and Apollo Hospitals. The hospital, to be operated by Mayapada Healthcare, aims to serve the international market and strengthen Batam's position as a national investment hub and prominent destination for international medical tourism.

Danantara has announced a partnership with GEM Limited, a global company from China, on a $1.42 billion nickel project in Indonesia, which aims to produce 66,000 tons of nickel mixed hydroxide precipitate per year. The project is expected to involve collaborations with PT Vale Indonesia Tbk and other global partners, and is part of Indonesia's efforts to advance its downstream industrialization agenda while prioritizing sustainability and innovation.

Minister of Creative Economy Teuku Riefky stated that the national aviation sector has the potential to create a sustainable and competitive creative economy, becoming a new driver of national economic growth. The Ministry of Creative Economy signed a memorandum of understanding with Whitesky Group (no ticker) to make Indonesia an innovation hub for air transportation modes, providing added value to the creative economy.

The Indonesian government is promoting the Sidoarjo Halal Industrial Zone to attract both foreign direct investment and outbound investment, with several countries including South Korea, Malaysia, and Japan showing interest in investing. The government is also offering tax incentives such as tax holidays and tax allowances to make the special economic zones more appealing to investors.

The Pantura Authority, led by Vice Admiral Didit Herdiawan Ashaf, will offer solutions to protect the northern coast of Java from coastal flooding, land subsidence, and natural disasters, with a focus on industrial special economic zones. The 'giant sea wall' project, funded through public-private cooperation, aims to stretch 700 kilometers from Banten to East Java.

PT Bumi Suksesindo's Tujuh Bukit copper project in Banyuwangi Regency is projected to become Indonesia's third-largest copper mine, increasing national copper production by 10-15%. The project, with an estimated 8.2 million tons of copper and 22.9 million ounces of gold, is expected to operate for 30 years, processing 24 million tons of ore annually and generating significant economic benefits for the region.

Eramet, a French miner, is partnering with Indonesia's government-run geological agency to explore lithium potential in Central Java, with the goal of developing the country's electric vehicle (EV) battery industry. The company has already taken samples and is studying them at its research center in France, with plans to move to the exploitation phase if lithium content is sufficient.

PT Archi Indonesia Tbk (ARCI) has appointed PT MacMahon Indonesia as the mining services contractor for its Copra underground mine through its subsidiary, PT Tambang Tondano Nusajaya. The 34-month cooperation period is expected to provide added value to the company, improving its business continuity and financial operational performance.

PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BNI) and JCB International Indonesia have launched the BNI JCB Corporate Card, a credit card designed to support the financial needs of Japanese corporations operating in Indonesia. This is JCB's first corporate card product in Indonesia, aiming to foster stronger partnerships between Japanese and Indonesian businesses.

Danantara Indonesia is set to launch patriot bonds worth $3.1 billion, with two series of five-year and 10-year maturities, each valued at Rp25 trillion, to fund national strategic projects, including large-scale waste management. The bonds, with a fixed coupon rate of 2%, will be managed by Mandiri Sekuritas and are scheduled to be sold on October 1, 2025.

Bank Mandiri (BMRI) has welcomed the Indonesian central bank's decision to lower the benchmark BI rate by 25 basis points to 5.00%, expecting a positive impact on the economy. The bank's credit growth has been strong, with wholesale credit growing 15.8% year-over-year and mortgage lending rising 14.2% year-over-year, while maintaining a strong asset quality with an NPL ratio of 1.06%.

PT Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) through its subsidiary PT Telkom Data Ekosistem has partnered with Sembcorp Development Ltd to develop sustainable data centers across Southeast Asia, with initial focus on Indonesia and Singapore. The partnership aims to deliver low-carbon data centers, with NeutraDC currently operating at 80 megawatts capacity and planning to expand further.

The US has agreed in principle to exempt Indonesian palm oil, cocoa, and rubber from a 19% import tariff, with the removal taking effect once a final agreement is reached. This development, combined with progress in free trade agreement talks with the European Union, could boost investor confidence and help Indonesia reach its 5.4% growth target in 2026.

Indonesia's Ministry of Trade reported that the Indonesian pavilion at Gamescom 2025 generated potential transactions worth $17.07 million, mainly from game development services and intellectual property subsectors. This achievement highlights the competitiveness of Indonesia's gaming industry, which could contribute significantly to its growth, with potential revenue boost of around 40%.

A Saudi company has agreed to purchase $12 million worth of ready-to-eat meals from PT Halalan Thayyiban Indonesia (no ticker) to supply to Hajj pilgrims in 2026, strengthening trade ties between the two nations. The deal is expected to boost Indonesia's exports and drive economic growth.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will construct gas pipeline networks in 15 districts and cities during the 2025-2026 period, with a focus on local content and material readiness. The program aims to increase the use of natural gas, particularly in households, and represents a concrete manifestation of the government's commitment to energy diversification through clean energy development.

Layman Holdings PTE LTD, an institutional investor, sold 534,854,100 shares of Leyand International Tbk, reducing its stake from 654,854,100 shares to 120,000,000 shares, representing a decrease of 81.65% in its ownership. The transaction was executed at a price of IDR 89 per share, with a total transaction value of IDR 47,615,449,000.

Danatara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, is preparing to issue patriot bonds to strengthen collaboration between the government and private sector, supporting the country's long-term development agenda. The initiative aims to provide national business groups with an opportunity to demonstrate their commitment to Indonesia's development efforts.

PT Sarana Mitra Luas Tbk, an institutional holder, bought 4,400,000 shares of PT Sarana Mitra Luas Tbk, increasing its stake from 0 to 4,400,000 shares. The transaction, valued at approximately IDR 2,028,000,000, took place on August 26, 2025, at prices ranging from IDR 458 to IDR 462 per share. This significant purchase indicates a strong interest in the industrials sector company.

The Ministry of Forestry has clarified that PT Sumber Permata Sipora (SIPORA) has not yet obtained a forest utilization business permit to operate on West Sumatra's Sipora Island, despite receiving a commitment approval in March 2023. The company must fulfill several requirements, including mapping geographic coordinates and completing an environmental impact analysis, before the permit can be issued.

The Indonesian government has implemented regulations to encourage the use of electric vehicles in the mining sector, with companies like PT. PLN supporting the development of national charging infrastructure. The adoption of electric vehicles is expected to reduce operational costs and environmental impact, with the mining industry aiming to contribute to the country's net zero emission target by 2060.

The Ministry of Industry is urging automotive component manufacturers to expand into producing parts for other transportation sectors, such as aviation and maritime, as the global shift to electric vehicles (EVs) accelerates. The move aims to maintain factory utilization and demand as conventional vehicle production declines, with the government stressing that domestic manufacturers already possess the necessary technology and facilities to diversify.

State Asset Fund Danantara plans to issue Rp 50 trillion in 'Patriot Bonds' with a 2% coupon rate, significantly lower than comparable government bond yields. Critics warn that the below-market yields may pressure investors to buy into the bonds based on nationalism rather than financial returns.

Insider Michael J.P Widjaja purchased 3,292,400 shares of PT Bumi Serpong Damai Tbk, increasing his stake to 13,123,100 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 30,032,440,800, was executed on August 25, 2025. This buy transaction signifies Widjaja's confidence in the company's prospects, potentially influencing investor sentiment in the Indonesian properties and real estate sector.

Indonesia's Environment Ministry is developing a new national registry system to serve as a central hub for climate data, aiming to improve data accuracy and support evidence-based decision-making. The system will also facilitate the implementation of economic value carbon, including carbon trading, and help track progress towards the country's emission reduction targets.

The establishment of the Mineral Industry Agency is expected to strengthen Indonesia's research potential in critical minerals, particularly rare earth elements, which are in high demand globally. The agency will play a key role in extracting and protecting strategic minerals, supporting the development of downstream industries.

The Indonesian government has launched a new agency to manage strategic minerals, particularly rare earth elements, amid surging global demand. The agency, headed by Minister of Higher Education, Research, and Technology Brian Yuliarto, will be responsible for extracting, safeguarding, and developing the industry.

Bank Indonesia aims to expand local currency transactions with Japan beyond trade to include financial market activities, such as purchases of Indonesian government bonds, to broaden market participation and reduce exchange rate volatility. The Local Currency Transaction (LCT) cooperation between Indonesia and Japan has reached USD 5.1 billion in transactions from January to July 2025, up from USD 2.23 billion in the same period last year.

PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia, an institutional shareholder, sold 179.5 million shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk (DADA.JK) at IDR 14 per share, reducing its holding from 4.59 billion shares to 4.41 billion shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

PT. Bangun Karya Artha Lestari, an institutional shareholder, sold 529,075,600 shares of PT Bangun Karya Perkasa Jaya Tbk, reducing its stake from 81,195,500 to 28,287,940. The transaction, valued at 529,075,600, took place on August 25, 2025. The purpose of the transaction was not disclosed.

PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia, an institutional shareholder, sold 70,000,000 shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk (DADA.JK) at IDR 13 per share, reducing its stake from 4,662,137,600 to 4,592,137,600 shares.

PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia, an institutional shareholder, sold 20,000,000 shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk (DADA.JK) at IDR 12 per share, reducing its holding from 4,682,137,600 to 4,662,137,600 shares. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia, an institutional shareholder, sold 100,000,000 shares of PT Diamond Citra Propertindo Tbk (DADA.JK) at IDR 12 per share, reducing its holding from 4,792,137,600 shares to 4,692,137,600 shares. This transaction represents a 2.1% decrease in PT Karya Permata Inovasi Indonesia's ownership stake in the properties-real-estate company.

PT Laut Biru Teknologi, an institutional holder, sold 437,598,226 shares of PT WIR ASIA Tbk, reducing its stake from 974,438,726 shares to 536,840,500 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 875,196,452,000, was executed at a price of IDR 200 per share.

Bank Indonesia has launched cross-border QR code payments with Japan, allowing Indonesians and Japanese tourists to make cashless transactions via mobile phones, with 35 merchants in Japan eligible to use the system in its early phase. The initiative aims to simplify transactions and establish a more inclusive digital economy, particularly for micro, small, and medium enterprises.

Layman Holdings PTE LTD, an institutional investor, sold 44,943,800 shares of Leyand International Tbk, reducing its stake from 699,797,900 shares to 654,854,100 shares, representing a 6.3% decrease in ownership. The transaction was valued at IDR 3,996,411,200,000.

Eramet Indonesia received an additional production quota of 10 million tons from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources, increasing its 2023 and 2026 nickel ore production target to 42 million tons. The company's nickel reserves at the Weda Bay mine are sufficient to support mining activities for over two decades.

The Indonesian banking industry is projected to post a stronger performance in the second half of 2025, driven by falling interest rates and cautious yet expansionary lending strategies. Bank lending grew 7.03% year-on-year in July 2025, with a capital adequacy ratio of 25.81% and non-performing loans standing at 2.28%.

Indonesia and the US are nearing a deal to exempt palm oil, cocoa, and rubber from tariffs, with the exemption taking effect once a final agreement is reached. During talks, Indonesia offered billions of dollars worth of investment in US purchases of crude, LPG, planes, and farm products in exchange for zero tariffs on almost all American goods entering its market.

The Indonesian nickel industry is facing challenges due to the revised RKAB regulation, which reduces the mineral coal production period from three years to one year, causing planning difficulties for companies. Additionally, the increase in royalty rates, ranging from 14% to 19% per ton, has drawn protests from business circles, particularly nickel players, with Eramet Indonesia (ERamet) CEO Jérôme Baudelet expressing concerns over the impact on the industry.

PT PP (PTPP) has secured a new contract worth Rp3.35 trillion to build a combined cycle gas turbine power plant in Batam, Riau Islands, which will have a capacity of 120 megawatts. The company's total new contracts have reached Rp14.78 trillion as of August 2025, representing 53% of its full-year target of Rp28 trillion.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new policy allowing coal companies to negotiate lower prices with buyers, while royalties and taxes will still be calculated using the government's coal benchmark price. The move aims to counter a steep export slump after buyers, particularly from China, rejected the previous pricing system.

Eramet Indonesia (ERAM) has confirmed its collaboration with Danatara Indonesia, a sovereign wealth agency, to establish a strategic investment platform in the nickel sector, covering upstream to downstream operations. The partnership will leverage Eramet's technical expertise and experience in managing large-scale mining projects, with discussions currently in early stages.

Bank Central Asia (BCA) reported a 9.9% year-on-year net profit growth to IDR14.1T in Q1 2025, driven by robust loan growth of 12.6% and a net interest margin of 5.8%. According to Maybank Securities, BCA's strong asset quality and ample liquidity will enable it to remain resilient amid macroeconomic volatility and optimize its returns through higher-yielding assets.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is awarding mining companies that have implemented innovative social responsibility programs, known as PPM, which focus on education, healthcare, and economic empowerment. The award aims to promote best practices in the mining industry and recognize companies that have made a positive impact on local communities.

The World Trade Organization (WTO) has ruled in favor of Indonesia in its dispute with the European Union over the imposition of countervailing duties on Indonesian biodiesel imports. The decision is expected to strengthen Indonesia's export commodities, particularly palm oil biodiesel, and have a positive impact on the country's economy.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has implemented facial recognition technology at 22 stations to speed up the boarding process, reducing the need for physical documents and saving IDR 230 million in paper costs from January to July 2025. The technology has been used by 16,398,343 customers, with savings reaching IDR 599 million in ticket printing costs.

The Indonesian government has guaranteed the welfare of farmers despite the recent decline in rice prices, with the Minister of Agriculture confirming that the government will maintain a minimum purchase price of IDR 6,500 per kilogram of unhusked rice. The government has also implemented market operations to ensure price supply stability, with a target to distribute 1.5 million tons of rice through the food supply price distribution program.

The Bangka Belitung Islands will be home to Indonesia's largest tin ore processing plant, with an estimated investment of 1.5-2 trillion rupiahs ($100-133 million), led by Chinese company Tong Fang. The project is expected to boost economic growth and create new job opportunities, with 70% of the workforce coming from local residents.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has permitted businesses to sell mineral coal commodities below the mineral benchmark price, revoking a previous decree that regulated coal sales based on the benchmark price. This new policy aims to increase transparency and certainty in calculating taxes and production fees, while preventing undervaluation and transfer pricing practices.

Indonesia's Food and Drug Authority (BPOM) is collaborating with Australian stakeholders to accelerate access to new synthetic antibiotics, aiming to combat antimicrobial resistance and support the country's pharmaceutical self-sufficiency. Recce Pharmaceuticals (no ticker) is developing the antibacterial drug, which is expected to be available in Indonesia by 2026.

The largest tin ore processing plant in Indonesia will be built in Bangka Belitung Islands with an investment value of IDR 1.5 trillion to IDR 2 trillion from Chinese investors, with PT Tong Fang as the project developer. The plant is expected to start operating within the next year, with a planned capacity of 300 tons per month, and will create new jobs, with 70% of the workforce relying on local human resources.

The Indonesian government has expressed strong support for digital finance innovation, with Deputy Minister of Investment Todotua Pasaribu highlighting efforts to improve regulations and attract global investors. The country's crypto industry has shown strong progress, with transactions reaching Rp 650.6 trillion in 2024 and 22.1 million registered investors as of November last year.

The Indonesian government's allocation of subsidized microcredit to the production sector has reached 60.3% in the first semester of 2025, creating a significant multiplier effect on the national economy, including job creation and economic impact. As of August 19, 2025, the total disbursement of microcredit has reached Rp169.2 trillion, with Rp101.9 trillion allocated to the production sector.

PT Samuel Tumbuh Bersama, an institutional holder, sold 123,762,300 shares of PT Nusantara Sawit Sejahtera Tbk (NSSS.JK) at IDR 404 per share, reducing its stake from 9.8344% to 9.7196% as of August 22, 2025.

The Indonesian government plans to develop a biodiesel plant in Merauke, South Papua, with production targeted to start in 2027, aiming to fulfill domestic energy needs. The government is also evaluating the implementation of the B40 program, with a plan to upgrade it to B50 next year, with an allocation of 15.6 million kiloliters this year.

The Indonesian Palm Oil Association projects a 1.5 million ton decrease in crude palm oil exports this year, potentially hindering the government's plan to implement a mandatory 50% biodiesel program by 2026. The decrease in exports will affect the funding of the program, which is currently derived from export levies on crude palm oil.

Indonesia's crude palm oil production reached 4,823 thousand tons in June 2025, a 15.7% increase from the previous month, while exports surged 35.37% to 3,606 thousand tons, driven by strong demand from China, India, and other countries. The cumulative export value from January to June 2025 rose 34.64% to US $17.277 billion, supported by higher export volumes and stronger average prices.

Four companies under MIND ID, including PT Aneka Tambang Tbk., PT Bukit Asam Tbk., PT Vale Indonesia Tbk., and PT Timah Tbk., reported positive performance in the first half of 2025, with notable achievements in gold sales, coal production, and nickel matte production. The companies' solid operational results demonstrate the holding company's role as a key driver of transformation in the mining industry in Indonesia.

SUGENG SURYADI, an insider, purchased 7,225,600 shares of PT Benteng Api Technic Tbk (BATR.JK) on 2025-08-22, increasing their holding from 550,375,000 to 557,600,600 shares. This buy transaction represents a 1.31% increase in their ownership stake.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has raised concerns over the financial strain posed by the Jakarta-Bandung high-speed rail project, warning that the multibillion-dollar project has become a 'ticking time bomb' unless urgent debt restructuring is carried out. The project, operated by PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China (KCIC), has booked significant losses, including Rp4.2 trillion in 2024 and Rp1.6 trillion in the first half of 2025, with KAI absorbing Rp951.5 billion in net losses as of June 2025.

The Indonesian Ministry of Environment and Forestry has launched an investigation into alleged radioactive contamination of frozen shrimp exports to the US, following the detection of cesium-137 by US authorities. The probe will focus on a processing facility in Cikande, Banten, which sources shrimp from Lampung, and may impact Indonesia's seafood exports, including those of PT Bahari Makmur Sejati (no ticker available).

Indonesian and German Foreign Ministers discussed accelerating the implementation of the Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement and expanding trade and investment opportunities. Discussions also covered key priorities such as renewable energy, artificial intelligence, infrastructure, food security, and labor cooperation.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has raised concerns over the financial strain posed by the Jakarta-Bandung high-speed rail project, warning that the multibillion-dollar project has become a 'ticking time bomb' unless urgent debt restructuring is carried out. The project, operated by PT Kereta Cepat Indonesia China (KCIC), has booked significant losses, with KAI absorbing Rp951.5 billion in net losses as of June 2025.

Players in Indonesia's cryptocurrency industry are urging the central bank to recognize stablecoins as a legal means of payment, citing their potential to bridge volatility and facilitate daily financial transactions. Tokocrypto's Chief Marketing Officer, Wan Iqbal, noted that discussions around stablecoins have been ongoing since 2016, and emphasized their benefits in expanding the utility of the rupiah.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has introduced a series of fiscal incentives to attract investment in energy transition and sustainable development sectors, with a total allocation of Rp27.9 trillion in tax incentives in 2023. The incentives include tax holidays, tax allowances, and super tax deductions, aiming to encourage companies to shift from fossil-based sectors to greener industries.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has introduced a series of fiscal incentives to attract investment in energy transition and sustainable development sectors, with a total allocation of Rp27.9 trillion in tax incentives in 2023. The incentives include tax holidays, tax allowances, and super tax deductions, aiming to encourage companies to shift from fossil-based sectors to greener industries.

The Indonesian Ministry of Environment and Forestry has launched an investigation into alleged radioactive contamination of frozen shrimp exports to the US, following the detection of cesium-137 by US authorities. The probe will focus on a processing facility in Cikande, Banten, which sources shrimp from Lampung, and may impact Indonesia's seafood exports, including those of PT Bahari Makmur Sejati (no ticker available).

SUGENG SURYADI, an insider, bought 7,225,600 shares of PT Benteng Api Technic Tbk (BATR.JK) on August 21, 2025, increasing their holding from 550,375,000 to 557,600,600 shares. This transaction signifies a 1.31% increase in their ownership stake.

EKADANA PRAYOGA SURYADI, an insider, bought 5,950,400 shares of PT Benteng Api Technic Tbk (BATR.JK) on 2025-08-21, increasing their holding from 420,875,000 to 426,825,400 shares. The transaction was worth IDR 59,504,000,000.

Rudy Margono, an insider, purchased 11,070,900 shares of Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk (GPRA.JK) on August 21, 2025, increasing his holding from 10,054,500 to 21,125,400 shares. The transaction was made at prices ranging from IDR 148 to IDR 150.

Bima Kurniawan, an insider, sold 202,800 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) on 2025-08-21, reducing their holding from 25,771,900 to 25,569,100 shares. The transaction was executed at prices ranging from IDR 1,035 to IDR 1,045.

On August 21, 2025, insider Patrick Rudolf Dannacher acquired 355,700 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) at IDR 1,015 per share, increasing his stake in the technology company to 55,797,650 shares. As an insider, Dannacher's purchase may indicate confidence in the company's prospects.

David Yaory, an insider, acquired 5268100 shares of PT Delta Giri Wacana Tbk (DGWG.JK) on 2025-08-21, increasing his holding from 4250000000 to 4255268100 shares. The transaction involved 10 trades at prices ranging from IDR 410 to IDR 430 per share.

The local government of Banjarmasin City, South Kalimantan, received IDR 45 billion in royalties from coal mining companies, including PT Arutmin and PT Adaro Indonesia (ADRO). The revenue is part of the regional income for 2025, with a total of IDR 2.5 trillion allocated in the revised regional budget.

Analysts view a potential merger between PT Elnusa (ELNUSA) and PT Pertamina Drilling Services Indonesia (PDSI) as a positive catalyst for inorganic growth, with estimated synergies and efficiencies leading to a 61.7% boost in PT Elnusa's net profit. The merger, which would require around Rp2.3 trillion, could shift PT Elnusa's financial position from net cash to net debt ratio of 0.04 times.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has issued a written warning to 103 listed companies, including PT Kimia Farma, PT Bank Mayapada Internasional, PT Sri Rejeki Isman, and PT Green Power Group, for failing to submit their first-half 2025 financial reports by the July 31 deadline. Out of 947 listed companies, 752 firms had complied with the reporting deadline, while 103 firms failed to do so, and may face stricter sanctions, including trading suspension, if they continue to be non-compliant.

The Indonesian central bank is set to implement a quick response code payment system with China by the end of 2025, following a successful trial phase. The system is expected to facilitate cross-border transactions, with digital payment transactions in Indonesia growing 45.30% year-on-year to 4.44 billion transactions in July 2025.

PT Bank Central Asia (BCA) has denied allegations of irregularities in the acquisition of its majority shares by Djarum Group in 2002, stating that the market capitalization at the time was around Rp10 trillion, not Rp117 trillion. The bank also clarified that it does not owe the government Rp60 trillion and that all obligations were settled in 2009.

PT Bank Central Asia (BCA) has denied media reports alleging irregularities in the acquisition of its majority shares by the Djarum Group, stating that the acquisition reflected actual market conditions with a market capitalization of around Rp10 trillion at the time. The clarification comes amid renewed political calls for the state to reclaim a controlling stake in PT Bank Central Asia (BCA), with the National Awakening Party supporting the proposal to reclaim the majority stake without requiring additional funding.

The Indonesian central bank is set to implement a quick response code payment system with China by the end of 2025, following a successful trial phase. The system is expected to facilitate cross-border transactions, with digital payment transactions in Indonesia growing 45.30% year-on-year to 4.44 billion transactions in July 2025.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has issued a written warning to 103 listed companies, including PT Kimia Farma, PT Bank Mayapada Internasional, PT Sri Rejeki Isman, and PT Green Power Group, for failing to submit their first-half 2025 financial reports by the July 31 deadline. Out of 947 listed companies, 752 firms had complied with the reporting deadline, while 103 firms failed to do so, and may face stricter sanctions, including trading suspension, if they continue to be non-compliant.

Analysts view a potential merger between PT Elnusa (ELNUSA) and PT Pertamina Drilling Services Indonesia (PDSI) as a positive catalyst for inorganic growth, with estimated synergies and efficiencies leading to a 61.7% boost in PT Elnusa's net profit. The merger, which would require around Rp2.3 trillion, could shift PT Elnusa's financial position from net cash to net debt ratio of 0.04 times.

Indonesia's Ministry of Agriculture, National Food Agency, and State Logistics Agency announced coordinated measures to curb rising rice prices, citing a projected 31.37 million ton production against 30.97 million ton consumption and a surplus of 9.33 million tons for 2025. They plan to distribute 1.3 million tons of rice by December 2025, with 94.29% of the 18.27 million beneficiary households already reached, using channels such as indomaret, alfamart, and military support, while monitoring stocks of 3.93 million tons and employing a digital tracking app to prevent fraud.

GAC Indonesia has showcased its lineup of electric vehicles, including the Aion UT, Aion V, and Aion Y Plus, at the 2025 Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show, demonstrating its long-term investment strategy in the domestic electric vehicle industry. The company has established a dedicated EV plant in Cikampek, West Java, with an initial production capacity of 20,000 units annually, planning to expand to 50,000 units in the coming years, with pre-booking prices for the Aion UT starting below RP330 million.

PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) has launched a pilot project for the production of kalium humat, a soil conditioner and organic fertilizer, in collaboration with the Faculty of Engineering, Universitas Gadjah Mada. This innovation is expected to support national food security, reduce production costs for farmers, and promote sustainable agriculture.

Insider Mochamad Bhadaiwi purchased 843,000 shares of PT Xolare RCR Energy Tbk (SOLA.JK) on August 20, 2025, at prices ranging from IDR 175 to IDR 178, increasing their holding from 119,052,300 to 119,895,300 shares.

Kartika Hendrawan, an insider, purchased 50,000 shares of Petrosea Tbk (PTRO.JK) on 2025-08-20, increasing their holding from 1,688,000 to 1,738,000 shares. This transaction suggests Hendrawan's confidence in the energy company's prospects, potentially impacting investor sentiment.

Michael, an insider, bought 123,000 shares of Petrosea Tbk (PTRO.JK) on 2025-08-20, increasing his holding from 1,950,000 to 2,073,000 shares in the energy sector, specifically oil-gas-coal sub-sector.

Erwin Ciputra, an insider, bought 400,000 shares of Petrosea Tbk (PTRO.JK) in the energy sector, increasing their holding from 8,654,000 to 9,054,000 shares. This transaction represents a 4.62% increase in their stake.

Layman Holdings PTE LTD, an institutional investor, sold 20,202,100 shares of Leyand International Tbk (LAPD.JK), a utilities company, on August 20, 2025. The transaction reduced its stake from 72,000,000 shares to 69,979,900 shares, representing a 3.4% decrease in ownership.

PT Rukun Raharja Tbk, an institutional shareholder, sold 10,000,000 shares of PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk (RATU.JK) at IDR 6,000 per share, reducing its holding from 1.90 billion shares to 1.89 billion shares. The transaction occurred on August 20, 2025.

PT Rukun Raharja Tbk, an institutional shareholder, sold 10,000,000 shares of PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk (RATU.JK) at IDR 6,000 per share, reducing its holding from 1.90 billion shares to 1.89 billion shares. The transaction occurred on August 20, 2025.

PT Investasi Sukses Bersama, an institutional holder, acquired 10,739,675 shares of PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (WIFI.JK) at IDR 3,000 per share, increasing its stake from 2,878,347,729 to 2,889,087,404 shares, representing a 0.37% increase in ownership.

The US FDA has advised consumers and retailers to avoid eating, selling, or serving frozen shrimp imported from PT Bahari Makmur Sejati (BMS Foods) due to detection of radioactive isotope cesium-137. Walmart has been recommended to recall products sold under the brand name Great Value, and BMS Foods has been placed on import alert, halting its shipments to the US until the issue is resolved.

PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional (KPI), the refinery and petrochemical arm of state energy company Pertamina, has acquired a 14% stake in PT Patra SK, a base oil lubricant company, from SK Enmove Co., Ltd. This acquisition is part of KPI's strategic plan to maximize value and strengthen its business portfolio, with opportunities to expand its market both domestically and internationally.

The Attorney General's Office has questioned six officials from PT Pertamina (PERT) and its subsidiaries over an alleged corruption case involving crude oil refinery products between 2018 and 2023. The questioning is part of an ongoing effort to gather evidence and build a case against the suspects.

Pertamina NRE's subsidiary, Citicore Renewable Energy Corporation (CREC), reported a 28% year-on-year revenue growth to ₱2.66 billion and a 38% surge in net profit to ₱630 million in mid-2025. CREC's stock price has also seen a 30% growth since the start of 2025, reaching ₱4.21 on August 15, 2025.

PT PP (PTPP) has started construction of the New Priok Eastern Access Section II, a key logistics route within Jakarta's Tanjung Priok seaport, with a target completion time of 600 calendar days. Despite a 55.61% drop in net profit in the first half of 2025, the company's share price showed signs of recovery, rising 16.67% year-to-date.

The Constitutional Court has rejected a petition against the Value-Added Tax (VAT) rate increase from 11% to 12%, citing that the rate change is reasonable and represents a flexible fiscal policy. The ruling opens up the possibility of future VAT rate hikes, which could be implemented as early as next year to address tax revenue shortfalls and widening deficits.

The Indonesian central bank lowered its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5%, marking the third cut this year, to support economic growth amid controlled inflation. The deposit facility and lending facility rates were also reduced to 4.25% and 5.75%, respectively, with the rupiah weakening to Rp16,260 per US dollar after the announcement.

Bank Indonesia is expected to cut its benchmark rate by 25 basis points to 5% on August 20, 2025, as inflation stays below the 2‑4% target and the rupiah remains strong. Economists from Bank Permata (PMP), Citibank Indonesia (C), and Maybank Indonesia (MY) note uneven growth, slowing bank lending, and foreign‑exchange dynamics, suggesting BI may still have room to cut rates but could hold steady amid tariff‑war inflation risks.

The Indonesian government plans to increase tax revenues by 13.5% to Rp 2,357.7 trillion by 2026, focusing on high-risk sectors and strengthening supervision of the digital economy. The government aims to tap into the shadow economy, which accounts for a substantial portion of GDP, and improve oversight and compliance through digital tools and data integration.
Institutional shareholder PT Fersindo Nusa Jaya acquired 866,000 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK) in the energy sector, increasing its holding from 99,806,300 to 100,672,300 shares.

Trukindo Persada Sejahtera, an insider, purchased 7,874,600 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK), increasing their holding from 59,329,500 to 67,204,100 shares. The transaction, which took place on August 19, 2025, indicates a significant increase in the insider's ownership stake in the energy company.

Trukindo Persada Sejahtera, an insider, purchased 3,220,000 shares of Sumber Energi Andalan Tbk (ITMA.JK), increasing their holding from 56,109,500 to 59,329,500 shares. The transaction type is buy, and the sector is energy, specifically oil-gas-coal.

PT Graha Inti Harapan, an institutional shareholder, purchased 93,062,185 shares of Suparma Tbk (SPMA.JK) on August 19, 2025, increasing its stake from 243,671,894 to 336,734,079 shares. This buy transaction represents a significant increase in ownership, but the purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

Insider Nalinkant Amratlal Rathod acquired 2,000,000 shares of PT Ancara Logistics Indonesia Tbk (ALII.JK) at IDR 575, increasing their stake to 340,572,700 shares. The energy sector company, focused on oil-gas-coal, did not disclose the purpose of the transaction. This buy transaction suggests Rathod's confidence in the company's prospects.

Indonesia's Financial Services Authority (OJK) has shut down over 1,800 unlicensed financial entities, including illegal online lenders and fraudulent investment schemes, as part of a nationwide crackdown on financial crimes. The authority has blocked 72,145 scam-linked accounts and frozen Rp 348.3 billion in illicit funds, with estimated losses from scams reaching Rp 4.6 trillion since November 2024.

Wahyu Dwi Jatmiko, an insider, sold 11,700,000 shares of PT Logisticsplus International Tbk (LOPI.JK) on 2025-08-19, decreasing their holding from 12,687,560 to 987,560 shares. The transaction was executed at a price of IDR 59 per share.

Axel Tobias Joel, an insider, sold 32,559,868 shares of PT Geoprima Solusi Tbk, reducing their holding from 50,000,000 shares to 17,440,132 shares. The transaction occurred on August 19, 2025, at a price of IDR 376 per share. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

PT Infiniti Wahana, an institutional shareholder, purchased 2,000,000 shares of Steady Safe Tbk (SAFE.JK) on 2025-08-19, increasing its holding from 255,387,413 to 257,387,413 shares. This buy transaction indicates a significant increase in ownership, but the purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

The Japanese government is set to provide subsidies to Japanese telcos to establish maintenance centers in Indonesia, aiming to expand their presence in the Southeast Asian market. This move is expected to offer competition to Chinese firm Huawei, which currently dominates Indonesia's telecommunications infrastructure market.

The Japanese government is set to provide subsidies to Japanese telcos to establish maintenance centers in Indonesia, aiming to expand their presence in the Southeast Asian market. This move is expected to offer competition to Chinese firm Huawei, which currently dominates Indonesia's telecommunications infrastructure market.

The Indonesian government will significantly reduce state funding for toll road construction starting 2026, allocating only 28 kilometers of new toll roads, compared to hundreds of kilometers built under the previous administration. The government will instead focus on supporting surrounding areas to boost traffic volume and commercial viability of toll road projects, with infrastructure spending consolidated into a broader 'economic function budget' worth Rp 820.4 trillion.

PT SIBALEC, an institutional holder, bought 69,882,400 shares of Kabelindo Murni Tbk (KBLM.JK) on 2025-08-19, increasing its holding from 381,134,800 to 451,017,200 shares. This transaction represents a 18.32% increase in PT SIBALEC's ownership stake in the industrials sector company.

The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) opened 0.18% higher at 7,912.6, extending last week's 4.84% surge, driven largely by technology shares, but analysts warn of profit-taking pressures and vulnerability to correction. Investors are closely watching Bank Indonesia's policy meeting on August 20, which could provide direction on benchmark interest rates, and commodity markets, such as crude palm oil, may offer a buffer.

The Indonesian central bank has expanded its QRIS payment platform to Japan and China, marking a significant milestone in cross-border payment system innovation, with 57 million users in Indonesia and a recorded 4.31 million transactions worth IDR1.15 trillion between Indonesia and Malaysia. The expansion aims to provide convenience and efficiency for tourists and strengthen economic ties between countries.

The Indonesian central bank has announced the expansion of the Quick Response Code Indonesian Standard (QRIS) payment platform to Japan and China, with 57 million users and a recorded 4.31 million transactions worth Rp1.15 trillion between Indonesia and Malaysia since its launch in May 2023. The expansion aims to provide convenience and transaction efficiency for Indonesian tourists and strengthen economic ties between countries, with notable collaborations including 238,216 transactions worth Rp77.06 billion with Singapore and 994,890 transactions worth Rp437.54 billion with Thailand.

Sales of residential property in Indonesia fell by 0.90% year-on-year in the second quarter of 2025, according to Bank Indonesia's residential property price index survey, driven by global economic uncertainty and credit hurdles. This downturn affected all housing segments, with sales of small, medium, and large homes contracting by 6.70%, 17.69%, and 14.95% respectively.

Sales of electric motorcycles in Indonesia dropped by 20-30% in the first half of 2025 due to uncertainty over government subsidies, leading manufacturers to scale back production. The Indonesian Electric Motorcycle Industry Association reported 63,146 subsidized electric motorbikes were sold in 2024, averaging around 5,100 units per month, but sales plummeted 30-40% lower in the first half of 2025.

Sales of electric motorcycles in Indonesia dropped by 20-30% in the first half of 2025 due to uncertainty over government subsidies, leading manufacturers to scale back production. The Indonesian Electric Motorcycle Industry Association reported 63,146 subsidized electric motorbikes were sold in 2024, averaging around 5,100 units per month, but sales plummeted 30-40% lower in the first half of 2025.

Indonesia aims to raise Rp 2,357.7 trillion in tax revenue in 2026, a 13.5% increase from this year, which may lead to a tougher stance on tax collection. The government plans to strengthen its tax administration system, expand data sharing, and tax digital transactions to achieve its revenue target.

The Indonesian government is struggling to increase its tax-to-GDP ratio, which has remained stagnant at around 10%, with analyst Deni Friawan citing the country's huge underground economy as a major factor. The government aims to attract Rp 3,147.7 trillion in state revenue next year, with Rp 2,357.7 trillion coming from taxes, marking a 13.5% year-on-year increase.

Bank Indonesia has officially launched the Quick Response Indonesian Standard (QRIS) cross-border digital payment system in Japan, marking a milestone in QRIS' regional expansion. The system has facilitated significant transactions across Southeast Asia, with 994,890 transactions worth Rp 437.54 billion in Thailand, 4.31 million transactions worth Rp 1.15 trillion in Malaysia, and 238,216 transactions worth Rp 77.06 billion in Singapore.

The Indonesian government's 2026 downstreaming program is expected to increase national investment value by 20.35% to Rp7,450 trillion, contributing to formal job creation. The program aims to improve labor productivity, which has been stagnant, with an average growth rate of 2.6% per year from 2013 to 2022.

Bank Central Asia (BCA) representatives testified in court, presenting Nikita Mirzani's account mutation data, sparking debate on banking secrecy and individual privacy. Legal experts argue that Indonesian law allows such disclosures when requested by law enforcement, particularly under anti-money laundering law.

Bank Indonesia has launched a trial program to interconnect its QR code-based payment system, Quick Response Indonesian Standard (QRIS), with China's payment system, marking a significant step towards regional financial integration. The collaboration is expected to bring benefits such as smoother cross-border trade transactions and expanded tourism flows between the two countries.

The US is interested in promoting Indonesia's semiconductor industry following a tariff deal that saw Washington slashing its reciprocal tariffs from 32% to 19%. Indonesia has prepared special economic zones for semiconductor development, offering incentives such as tax holidays and duty-free treatment to investors.

PT BUMI RESOURCES MINERAL TBK (BRMS) will announce a $500 million loan facility from a consortium likely including Bangkok Bank, Bank Permata, and BCA, earmarked for completing its underground gold mine in Palu (targeting 4.9 g/t gold and 2,000 t/yr capacity by 2027) and for copper exploration in Gorontalo, Aceh, and Banten. The funding will also refinance a $120 million loan from Bank Mega and support ongoing drilling that could unlock JORC‑compliant copper reserves.

Insider Patrick Rudolf Dannacher acquired 1,900,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk., increasing his stake to 55,441,950 shares. The transaction was executed in two tranches at prices of IDR 1,018 and IDR 1,045. As a result, Dannacher's ownership in the technology company has risen by 3.55%.

Bima Kurniawan, an insider, sold 400,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) on August 15, 2025, at prices ranging from IDR 1,085 to IDR 1,090. This transaction reduced their holding from 26,171,900 shares to 25,771,900 shares.

Bambang Susilo, an insider, sold 300,000 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) on August 15, 2025, at IDR 990 per share, reducing their holding from 25,833,400 to 25,533,400 shares. The purpose of the transaction is unknown.

Irwin Ka Pui Wan, an insider, sold 40,000,000 shares of PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk. (AMMN.JK), reducing their holding from 79,056,600 shares to 39,056,600 shares. The transaction was executed at a price of IDR 8,595 per share. The purpose of the transaction was not disclosed.

Wong Michael, an insider, sold 24,139,700 shares of PT Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur Tbk. (BIPI.JK) on August 15, 2025, reducing his stake from 34,039,700 shares to 9,900,000 shares. The energy sector company operates in oil, gas, and coal. The purpose of the transaction is unknown.

PT Harimas Tunggal Perkasa, an institutional holder, sold 600,000,000 shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk (IMPC.JK) on 2025-08-15, reducing its holding from 24.87% to 24.27%. The transaction consisted of two trades at IDR 660 per share.

PT Tunggal Jaya Investama, an institutional shareholder, sold 800,000,000 shares of PT Impack Pratama Industri Tbk (IMPC.JK) at a price of IDR 660, reducing its stake from 23.93% to 23.13%. The transaction amounts to IDR 528,000,000,000. The purpose of the transaction is not disclosed.

President Prabowo Subianto has announced plans to reform Indonesia's state-owned enterprises (SOEs), aiming to increase their contribution to the state budget and eliminate the budget deficit. The newly established sovereign wealth fund, Danantara, will lead the reforms, with a goal of increasing SOE dividends to at least $50 billion per year, up from Rp 86.4 trillion in 2024.

Multi Bintang Indonesia, a Heineken-owned brewer, reported a 6% increase in net revenue to Rp 1.47 trillion and a 5% rise in gross profit to Rp 867 billion in the first half of 2025, driven by its flagship brand Bintang and premium segment growth. The company also made progress in its digital transformation and sustainability initiatives, maintaining its leading position in Indonesia's beer market.

Barli Leoponco, an insider, acquired 4653109 shares of Suparma Tbk (SPMA.JK) on August 15, 2025, increasing their holding from 12183595 to 16836704 shares. This buy transaction represents a significant increase in Leoponco's ownership stake in the basic materials company.

On August 15, 2025, Joseph Sulaiman, an insider, purchased 3,722,487 shares of Suparma Tbk (SPMA.JK) at IDR 278 per share, increasing his stake from 13,114,217 shares to 16,836,704 shares, representing a 37.5% increase in his ownership.

Edward Sopanan, an insider, acquired 4,653,109 shares of Suparma Tbk, a basic-materials company, on August 15, 2025, at a price of IDR 278. This transaction increased his holdings from 12,183,595 shares to 16,836,704 shares, representing a significant increase in his stake in the company.
Welly, an insider, sold 13,028,705 shares of Suparma Tbk (SPMA.JK) on 2025-08-15, reducing their holding from 2,535,748,981 shares to 2,522,720,276 shares, representing a 0.51% decrease in ownership.

PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN) reported a dramatic jump in copper cathode output to 19,805 t in Q2 2025, lifting EBITDA to USD 86 m and cutting the net loss to USD 146 m for the first half, while analysts project further revenue gains from expanded smelter capacity and a 0 % U.S. copper tariff. Despite operational challenges and high interest costs, market analysts maintain a buy stance with target prices ranging from IDR 8,300 to IDR 9,000 per share.

Indonesia has launched its Nationally Determined Contribution (NDC) 3.0 document, aiming to reduce emissions by 440 million tons CO₂e by 2030 and 525 million tons by 2035, with a potential to earn up to $600 billion and create 14 million job opportunities in the green sector. The government will focus on accelerating the retirement of coal-fired power plants and strengthening programs to prevent forest land fires, with the goal of achieving net-zero emission by 2060.

PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional (KPI), a subsidiary of state-owned energy company Pertamina, has successfully conducted a production trial of bioavtur or sustainable aviation fuel using used cooking oil as raw material. The production trial is part of KPI's commitment to developing green energy and reducing carbon emissions in the air transportation sector.

PT Kilang Pertamina Internasional (KPI), a subsidiary of state-owned energy company Pertamina, has successfully conducted a production trial of bioavtur or sustainable aviation fuel using used cooking oil as raw material. The production trial is part of KPI's commitment to developing green energy and reducing carbon emissions in the air transportation sector.

Mochamad Bhadaiwi, an insider, bought 748,000 shares of PT Xolare RCR Energy Tbk (SOLA.JK) at IDR 178 per share, increasing their holding from 118,304,300 to 119,052,300 shares. This transaction represents a 0.63% increase in Bhadaiwi's stake in the basic-materials company.

Indonesia's Jakarta Composite Index surged 1.03% to an all-time high of 8,012.63 after President Prabowo Subianto delivered his inaugural state address, pledging to keep the economy on a steady growth path. The market capitalization reached a high of Rp 14,503.29 trillion during the session, with the index closing at 7,931.

The Indonesian government is set to issue a new ministerial regulation regarding changes to the mining work plan budget by early September 2025, allowing mining companies to submit their latest RKAB 2026 by the end of September. The new regulation will require mining companies to re-register their RKAB annually, starting from 2026.

President Prabowo Subianto announced that Danantara, Indonesia's newly established sovereign wealth fund, will play a pivotal role in creating millions of quality jobs through strategic investments, managing over $1 trillion in assets. The country's economy grew 5.12% in Q2 2025, with investment surging 13.6% year-on-year to Rp 942 trillion, generating 1.2 million new jobs.

The IDX Composite Index briefly reached an all-time high above 8,000 points during intraday trading, closing the day down 0.41% at 7,898.37 points, despite maintaining strong weekly momentum. Top gainers included Mitra Adiperkasa (MITRA) up 3.03%, Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper up 2.24%, and Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur (INDF) up 1.80%, while top losers were Vale Indonesia (INCO) down 6.11%, Bank Tabungan Negara (BBTN) down 5.19%, and MAP Aktif Adiperkasa (MAPI) down 4.38%.

The $20 billion investment from Qatar in transit-oriented development housing projects near train stations in Indonesia has been delayed due to a board reshuffle at PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI). The project aims to build one million housing units, with 80% funding coming from developers, and is expected to reduce housing prices by up to 50%.

Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) has seen a 16% increase in its stock price since the start of the week, driven by foreign investors' net purchase of Rp1.45 trillion. The company plans to streamline its portfolio into four main segments and is committed to expanding its enterprise segment, which currently contributes less than 20% to its total revenue.

The Financial Services Authority (OJK) has dissolved two pension funds owned by state-run insurer Asuransi Jiwasraya as part of the company's ongoing liquidation process, following a corruption scandal that resulted in losses of IDR 16.8 trillion. The dissolved entities are the Financial Institution Pension Fund and the Employers' Pension Fund, with OJK appointing separate teams to oversee their liquidation.

Crude palm oil and its derivatives are expected to remain among Indonesia's top export earners in the second half of 2025, driven by positive developments including the Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement and stronger global prices. Export value surged 24.81% to $11.43 billion in the first half of 2025, with average international CPO price jumping 22.21% to $1,053.03 per ton.
Error processing filing transaction.

The Asian Development Bank (ADB) has approved a $500 million policy-based loan to support Indonesia's efforts to improve its tax collection, which has been struggling to meet its annual revenue target. The loan aims to modernize tax administration through digitalization and strengthen international tax cooperation, with estimates suggesting it could increase Indonesia's tax-to-GDP ratio by 1.28 percentage points by 2030.
Error processing filing transaction.

PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MERDEKA) has ramped up nickel output through three high‑pressure acid leach smelters, with the ESG New Energy Material (ESG) plant already delivering 6,080 t MHP nickel in Q2 2025 and a total of 10,649 t in the first half of the year, while sales reached 9,465 t at an average price of USD 12,266 per ton, generating a cash margin of USD 3,271 per ton and an estimated USD 30.96 million for the period. The company plans to add 90,000 t annual capacity by mid‑2026 with the SLNC‑managed smelter and additional feed‑preparation facilities, positioning it to meet its 25,000–30,000 t target for 2025.

Indonesia's National Economic Council Chairman Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan plans to meet with US Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick to resume negotiations on sector-specific tariffs, aiming to ease import duties on key Indonesian exports such as palm oil. The move comes after the US imposed a 19% tariff on Indonesian goods, which took effect on August 7, with bilateral trade between the two countries totaling $40.2 billion in 2024.
Error processing filing transaction.

Despite declining crude prices, Indonesia's energy and mineral sectors contributed approximately Rp 138.8 trillion to the country's non-tax state revenue in the first half of 2025, with minerals and coal being the biggest contributors. The government aims to generate Rp 513.6 trillion in non-tax revenue this year, with Rp 254.5 trillion expected to come from the energy and mineral industries.

On August 14, 2025, PT Cahaya Aero Services Tbk, an insider, acquired 258,433,590 shares of PT Cahaya Aero Services Tbk, increasing its holding from 0 to 258,433,590 shares. This buy transaction marks a significant increase in the insider's stake in the infrastructure company, specifically in the transportation-infrastructure sub-sector.

Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia visited China to inspect the construction of a massive floating liquefied natural gas (LNG) processing facility, set to be one of the largest globally, with an annual production capacity of 1.2 million metric tons LNG and an investment value of approximately $963 million. The project, operated by Genting Oil Kasuri Limited (subsidiary of Genting Group), is expected to commence production in West Papua in 2027.

Woori Card Co., Ltd., an insider, sold 66,171,662 shares of PT Woori Finance Indonesia Tbk, reducing its holding from 2,259,723,668 to 2,193,552,006 shares. The transaction occurred on August 14, 2025, in the financials sector, specifically in financing services. The purpose of the transaction was not disclosed.

Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has appointed a new president director, Bobby Rasyidin, and overhauled its board of commissioners and directors to strengthen its corporate strategy and accelerate innovation. The move is in line with Indonesia's new State-Owned Enterprises Law No. 1 2025, which allows for the appointment and dismissal of SOE commissioners and directors without a physical shareholders' meeting.

The Indonesian government's recent regulatory overhaul has attracted foreign investors, including those from China and Europe, to build public electric vehicle charging stations, with opportunities remaining vast in the country's early-stage electric vehicle industry. Vinfast (no ticker) has pledged to contribute to Indonesia's EV ecosystem by building 63,000 charging stations nationwide.

The Dwi Soetjipto Research Center and partners launched an initiative to develop corporate leaders capable of driving Indonesia's vision to become a developed country by 2045, with Pertamina (PERT) cited as a successful transformation example, achieving a 122% increase in net profit from $1.45 billion in 2014 to $3.15 billion in 2016. The initiative emphasizes the importance of leadership traits such as risk-taking, trust-building, and willingness to embrace change for effective transformation.

Bank Indonesia has introduced a Payment ID system, a unique nine-character identifier generated from national identification number data, to consolidate a person's financial information and support economic analysis, credit distribution, and targeted government programs. The system, currently in trial phase, is designed to improve access to financing for micro, small, and medium enterprises, and will not be used to monitor individual purchases, but rather to identify broader economic trends across sectors.

Erajaya Swasembada (ERAA) reported a net profit of Rp 568 billion in H1 2025, an 8.5% increase from the same period last year, driven by strong mobile phone and tablet sales. The company's partnership with Chinese electric vehicle maker XPeng is expected to support its growth as a brand holder for premium EVs in Indonesia.

Perplexity AI, valued at $18 billion, has submitted a $34.5 billion all‑cash bid to acquire Google’s Chrome browser, a move backed by major investment funds and a pledge to invest $3 billion over two years to upgrade Chrome’s infrastructure while keeping its source code open. The offer comes as Google faces a U.S. antitrust lawsuit and has yet to respond, and if accepted would mark Perplexity AI’s largest acquisition to date.

The Nusantara Capital Authority is auctioning 24 construction projects worth Rp18.46 trillion, focusing on development of legislative and judicial complexes, as well as supporting infrastructure for Indonesia's new capital. The projects include the construction of the DPR II building complex worth Rp2.2 trillion and other supporting infrastructure projects totaling Rp2.22 trillion.

The implementation of 'Roatex's' Multi-Lane Free Flow (MLFF) toll collection system in Indonesia is facing delays due to technical challenges related to infrastructure readiness, distance measurement accuracy, and sensor hardware quality. These issues were highlighted during December 2023 tests, where only two out of fourteen trials were successful, raising concerns about the system's reliability and potential for user complaints.

The Indonesian government has launched a national artificial intelligence roadmap, proposing the creation of a sovereign AI fund to be managed by Danareksa Indonesia, with a target size and timeline yet to be disclosed. The fund aims to position Indonesia as a regional hub for AI technology, with potential GDP growth of 2.3-3.1% by 2027, according to a report by Boston Consulting Group.

The Bali real estate market is experiencing a significant transformation, with unstable projects facing legal issues and being replaced by developments that prioritize legal transparency and sustainable profitability, such as PGD Aparthotel, developed by Premier Global Development, which ensures full legal compliance and partners with Ribas Hotels Group for professional management. This shift is driven by the government's efforts to uphold the law and protect public interests, resulting in a safer and more stable investment environment for properties like PGD Aparthotel.

Indonesia's nickel downstreaming program has boosted exports, with values reaching $14.1 billion in 2024, but faces challenges due to a shortage of nickel ore resulting from overinvestment over the past five years, with total demand currently at 261.3 million tonnes. The program has also attracted significant investments, with foreign direct investment and domestic direct investment in the basic metals processing industry reaching $13.6 billion and Rp 35 trillion, respectively, last year.

Pertamina, Indonesia's state-owned energy company, has launched its first sustainable aviation fuel made from used cooking oil, marking a regional milestone towards greener air travel. The fuel production involves a broad supply chain within Pertamina's subsidiaries, with Pertamina Patra Niaga obtaining international sustainability certifications.

Indonesia is set to sign a comprehensive economic partnership agreement with Canada, which will see trade liberalization of up to 90.5% of total tariffs on Indonesian goods entering the Canadian market, with bilateral trade valued at nearly $3.6 billion in 2024. The agreement is expected to boost Indonesia's exports to Canada, which totaled $1.4 billion in 2024.

Indonesia and Peru have signed a comprehensive economic partnership agreement, which will see Peru drop most tariffs on Indonesian goods, with Indonesia granting similar concessions to Peru, aiming to increase bilateral trade to $5 billion in coming years. The agreement will benefit key Indonesian exports such as palm oil, vehicles, and footwear, with palm oil tariffs dropping to 0%.

Bel S.A. has acquired a 22.5% stake in Keju from Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya for Rp 708.75 billion, with the deal expected to accelerate the development of the cheese business in Indonesia. Keju posted a strong first-half performance in 2025, with net sales climbing 12.2% year-on-year to Rp 681.36 billion and net profit jumping 37.5% to Rp 91.47 billion.

Indonesia's nationwide program using palm oil-based biodiesel has helped the country save at least $3.68 billion in foreign exchange this year, with a target to distribute 13.5 million kiloliters of B40 biodiesel in 2025. The program has also created added value worth Rp 9.51 trillion by turning crude palm oil into biodiesel.

PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MDKA) reported that its Pani Gold Project has reached 67% completion and is on track to start commissioning in late 2025, with initial gold production targeted for Q1 2026. The company also reported strong quarterly results, with gold production from Tujuh Bukit mine reaching 25,143 ounces and copper production from Wetar mine reaching 1,854 tonnes.

Indonesia's investments in energy and mineral resources sectors reached $13.9 billion in the first half of 2025, a 24.1% year-on-year increase from $11.4 billion in the same period in 2024, with oil and gas attracting $8.1 billion worth of investments. The government is also pushing for downstream industry development, with 18 projects worth $38.6 billion submitted for pre-feasibility studies, including a coal gasification project that could attract a $1.2 billion investment from a Chinese investor.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia's net income declined 11.25% to IDR1.63 billion in the first six months of 2025, with total interest Shariah income decreasing 2.59% to IDR6.3 trillion. The bank's loans grew 6% year-on-year, driven by a 9.45% increase in consumer loans and a 15.6% rise in corporate loans.

PT Gunbuster Nickel Industry (GNI) is expected to finalize a new funding subsidiary with Jiangsu Delong Nickel Industry Co by mid‑August 2025, after a management handover in January that cut production by 30‑40% and a creditor meeting scheduled for the same month. Danantara Investment Management Agency (DAN) is exploring a consortium with Chinese firms to acquire GNI, potentially contributing USD 20 billion in equity and a USD 60 million syndicated loan, while the company remains under Jiangsu Delong (JDL) and has faced supplier payment delays amid falling nickel prices.

The implementation of Indonesia's multi-lane free flow toll collection system has been delayed due to conflicting interests between toll road operators and the prospective operator Roatex, with discussions ongoing around core business functions, profit-sharing mechanisms, and security protocols. The project, worth IDR 4.49 trillion (USD 294.12 million), aims to improve Indonesia's toll payment system using global navigation satellite system technology.

The implementation of Indonesia's multi-lane free flow toll collection system has been delayed due to conflicting interests between toll road operators and the prospective operator Roatex, with discussions ongoing around core business functions, profit-sharing mechanisms, and security protocols. The project, worth IDR 4.49 trillion (USD 294.12 million), aims to improve Indonesia's toll payment system using global navigation satellite system technology.

Indonesia’s government is urging a shift from coal‑dependent extractive industries to green manufacturing, targeting 61% renewable power by 2035 and supporting EV and solar panel hubs in West Java, while 90% of business leaders seek earlier renewable transition. This strategy aims to boost economic growth, create jobs, and enhance exports, aligning with the Prabowo Subianto administration’s 8% growth target and net‑zero emissions goal.

The Indonesian Fintech Lending Association (AFPI) has warned of the alarming scale of illegal online lending in the country, with outstanding financing from illegal lenders reaching Rp230-260 trillion, far exceeding the Rp83.52 trillion from registered platforms. AFPI is pushing for regulatory changes to allow for faster takedown of illegal lending applications.

The implementation of Indonesia's multi-lane free flow toll collection system has been delayed due to conflicting interests between toll road operators and the prospective operator Roatex, with discussions ongoing around core business functions, profit-sharing mechanisms, and security protocols. The project, worth IDR 4.49 trillion (USD 294.12 million), aims to improve Indonesia's toll payment system using global navigation satellite system technology.

Joao Angelo de Sousa Mota has stepped down as President Director of Agrinas Pangan Nusantara (AGRN) after only six months, citing the absence of budget allocations to carry out the firm's programs. Mota claimed that despite President Prabowo Subianto's commitment to food security, the government stakeholders have failed to provide tangible support, leaving the company's funding at zero.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange has set a target to increase its market capitalization to RP 20,000 trillion by 2029, with a market cap-to-GDP ratio of 60%, and aims to become one of the world's ten largest exchanges. The benchmark Jakarta Composite Index has gained 6.41% year-to-date, with market capitalization reaching a record RP 13,781 trillion, and the exchange is confident that it can break into the world's top 10 exchanges by 2029-2030 with continued corporate earnings growth and strong foreign investor interest.

The Indonesian government is pushing for the integration of the Indonesian Sustainable Palm Oil (ISPO) certification program with the replanting program for oil palm smallholders, aiming to increase participation and competitiveness among smallholders. According to Dwi Nusantara, Acting Head of Upstream Plantation Fund Distribution Division at Plantation Fund Management Board, integrating the two programs can optimize implementation and provide incentives for smallholders to participate in the ISPO certification program.

Harga emas batangan bersertifikat di Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (TICKER) telah turun Rp 6.000 per gram, dari sebelumnya Rp 1.951.000 per gram menjadi Rp 1.945.000 per gram. Harga buyback oleh Logam Mulia juga turun Rp 6.000 per gram, dari sebelumnya Rp 1.797.000 per gram menjadi Rp 1.791.000 per gram.

Danatara has issued a directive prohibiting members of the board of commissioners of state-owned enterprises and their subsidiaries from receiving tantiem, incentives, and other income outside of their salaries. The move, signed by Danatara CEO Rosan Roeslani, aims to ensure that any such benefits are based on actual operational performance rather than manipulated accounting or cosmetic numbers.

Twenty-two out of 27 publicly traded companies in Indonesia reported their first-semester 2025 financial performance, with only four companies achieving net profit growth. The remaining 18 companies experienced a decline in profit, with some incurring significant losses during the same period.

The decline in stock prices of large-cap banks has led to retail investors increasing their ownership, as seen in the rising portion of shares held by individuals, with Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) having 10.55 billion shares owned by individual investors as of July 31, 2025. Despite this, the stock price of Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) has fallen 9.31% to Rp 3,700 per share since the end of 2024.

The Indonesian Stock Market Index (IHSG) increased by 0.58% to 7,533 on Friday, despite a 0.06% decline on a weekly basis, as investors await the Federal Reserve's decision on interest rates and Indonesia's retail sales data. Bank Mandiri (BMRI) is mentioned as a stock to watch, with a price of Rp 4,670, as investors look for opportunities in the market.

The performance of several palm oil companies in Indonesia, including PT Perusahaan Perkebunan London Sumatra Indonesia Tbk and PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk, grew positively in the first semester of this year. These companies, which are part of the Salim Group, contributed to the overall positive growth of the crude palm oil industry in Indonesia.

PT Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal Tbk is exploring opportunities in electric vehicle (EV) cargo, driven by the increasing demand for EVs, particularly from Chinese manufacturers such as BYD. The company has recently handled a large-scale shipment of 7,000 EV units from BYD Zhengzhou.

Menara Telekomunikasi reported a positive performance in Semester I-2025, with PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk (MITRA) recording a revenue of Rp 4.59 trillion, a 2.17% year-over-year growth. Despite the low single-digit growth, the company's performance remains positive.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia's (BBRI) asset quality deterioration is expected to have peaked, with early signs of stabilization in funding and asset quality, and net interest margin is expected to reach 7.76% in H2 2025.
