The bank's credit costs are expected to remain elevated at 3.2% in 2025 and 3% in 2026, despite a 11.5% year-on-year net profit decline in H1 2025.

According to Bank Indonesia's survey, residential property sales in Q2-2025 decreased by 3.8% year-on-year. However, PT Asuransi Jasa Indonesia (ASJI) reported a 23.67% increase in property insurance premiums to IDR 549.35 billion in June 2025, compared to IDR 444.22 billion in the same period last year.

Unitlink saham recorded an average return of 3.5% in July 2025, rebounding from a 1.9% contraction in June 2025, driven by the strong performance of the Jakarta Composite Index. This marks a 1.6% average return for the year 2025 up to July, making it the best-performing unitlink type.

Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) allocates over IDR 80 billion in the first semester of 2025 to expand to new regions, aiming to counter the impact of weak consumer spending. The company, which operates Azko stores, has been affected by the decline in consumer purchasing power since the beginning of the year.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 7,533, up 0.58% on Friday, but down 0.06% for the week, as investors await the US Federal Reserve's interest rate decision and Indonesia's retail sales data. Bank Mandiri (BMRI) is recommended by analysts with a target price of IDR 4,670.

In the first semester of 2025, 22 out of 27 IDX-listed companies reported their financial performance, with only 4 companies achieving net profit growth, while 18 companies experienced a decline in profit or increased losses. The majority of the companies struggled to maintain their profitability amidst challenging market conditions.

The World Gold Council reported that demand for gold as an investment instrument in Q2-2025 was the highest since 2013, driven by economic uncertainty. This increase in demand has outpaced the production capacity of mining companies worldwide, including those listed on the Indonesia Stock Market (IDX).

PT PLN (Persero) (IDX: PLN) is expected to face significant costs due to its plan to increase gas-fired power plant capacity by 10.3 gigawatts, with estimated annual costs reaching IDR 155.8 trillion. The company's gas purchase costs are projected to rise to IDR 84.98 trillion per year by 2034, assuming a gas price of USD 6 per million British thermal units.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia's (BBRI) asset quality deterioration is expected to peak, with early signs of stabilization in funding and asset quality, and net interest margin is expected to reach 7.76% in H2 2025. Credit costs are expected to remain elevated at 3.2% in 2025 and 3% in 2026, with loan-at-risk ratio plateauing at 11.1% and restructured loans flat at 6.4% of total loans.

The performance of Indonesian healthcare stocks, including those in the hospital and pharmaceutical businesses, improved in Q2 2025, driven by cost efficiency and higher revenue intensity. However, analysts from BRI Danareksa Sekuritas, Ismail Fakhri Suweleh and Wilastita Muthia Sofi, noted that the sector still faces challenges from declining patient traffic and consumer spending.

Despite a surge in domestic investment, Indonesia's foreign direct investment (FDI) fell 6.95 percent year-on-year to Rp 202.2 trillion in the second quarter of this year, accounting for only 42.3 percent of total investment. Analysts cite global uncertainties, particularly US import tariffs, and competition from other Southeast Asian nations as factors contributing to the decline in foreign capital.

Indonesia's coal production has reached 357.6 million tons in the first semester of 2025, accounting for 48.34% of the target production of 739.67 million tons for the year, with 238 million tons allocated for export and 104.6 million tons for domestic use. The country's coal exports contribute to 45% of the world's electricity needs, but the current decline in coal prices by 25-30% poses a challenge to the industry.

The Indonesian government's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources reported that the country's energy and mineral resources sector attracted IDR 225.8 trillion (USD 13.9 billion) in investments in the first half of 2025, a 24.1% increase from the same period last year. The mining and energy sectors contributed significantly to this growth, with 18 strategic projects expected to create 273,636 jobs across Indonesia.

The Financial Services Authority is working to maintain growth momentum in Indonesia's peer-to-peer lending sector, ensuring balanced benefits for lenders and borrowers, while addressing challenges from illegal lenders and loan default communities. The sector offers annual returns of up to 15-20% for lenders, but also comes with higher default risks, and regulators are urged to adopt risk-based rate setting and strengthen enforcement against illegal lending practices.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has announced that 7 companies are preparing to go public through initial public offerings (IPOs) by the end of 2025, with total assets ranging from medium to large scale. Meanwhile, 4 companies are planning to raise additional capital through rights issues, adding to the 10 listed companies that have carried out rights issues in 2025, totaling Rp16.62 trillion.

The Indonesian Transportation Ministry has recorded interest from at least 22 investors to develop urban cable car systems in several regions, with estimated investment costs of around Rp2.38 trillion for a 10-kilometer line. The ministry has also received interest from four foreign investors to develop cable car systems serving feeder lines for Jakarta's MRT and Greater Jakarta LRT.

Surge (SURGE) has acquired PT Investasi Jaringan Nusantara for IDR 599 billion, strengthening its business network and expanding its coverage in the telecommunications digital infrastructure sectors. The company reported a 155% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR 227.91 billion in Q2 2025, with revenue rising 66% to IDR 513.46 billion.

PT Buana Lintas Lautan Tbk (BULL) is planning to conduct a private placement to raise capital, aiming to issue up to 1.4 billion new shares, equivalent to 10% of its fully paid and listed shares. The move is seen as an effort to address the company's financial challenges, including a decline in revenue and profit due to external factors.

PT PLN (Persero) is expected to face significant risks and increased costs due to its plan to add 10.3 gigawatts of gas-fired power generation capacity by 2034, which will lead to a total burden of IDR 155.8 trillion per year. The increased capacity will drive up gas purchase costs, with projected annual costs reaching IDR 84.98 trillion by 2034.

PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk and PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk have gained attention from global index managers, becoming the new stocks listed in the global index. This achievement is a significant milestone for both companies, highlighting their growth and potential in the Indonesian stock market.

Eagle High Plantations (BWPT) has been unable to close above IDR 120 per share since August 1, 2025, despite its recent price improvement from below IDR 70 per share in mid-July. The stock's current price movement suggests a significant resistance at the IDR 120 level.

The US has set a 19% tariff on coffee imports from Indonesia, lower than the tariffs imposed on competitors such as Brazil, Colombia, and Vietnam. This move is expected to boost Indonesia's coffee exports, providing a competitive advantage in the global market.

The price of gold bars certified by Logam Mulia, a subsidiary of PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM), remains unchanged at IDR 1.951 million per gram, while the buyback price is IDR 1.797 million per gram. If an investor had bought gold a year ago, they would have gained 27.54% if they sold it today.

The Indonesian government has reclassified crypto assets from intangible commodities to securities, exempting them from value-added tax. As a result, crypto transactions in Indonesia will only be subject to final income tax, rather than value-added tax.

In 2025, Indonesia's stock market is led by conglomerate stocks, with majority of the top 10 leaders being conglomerate stocks such as Barito, Sinarmas, and Salim groups. Only two state-owned companies, PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) and PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk (TLKM), made it to the top 10 leaders, with ANTM surging 102.62% and TLKM rising 8.49% since the beginning of the year.

The US has imposed a 19% import tariff on Indonesian coffee, lower than Vietnam's 20% and Brazil's 50%, creating an opportunity for Indonesia to increase its coffee exports to the US. This comes as the US applies high tariffs on Brazilian coffee, making Indonesian coffee a more attractive option.

PT Harum Energy Tbk (HRUM) reported a revenue of USD 645.3 million in 1H 2025, up 8% year-over-year, but its coal segment saw a 22% year-over-year decline in revenue to USD 243 million. The company's coal sales volume also decreased by 9% year-over-year to 2.9 million tons during the same period.

PT Multifiling Mitra Indonesia Tbk (MFMI) reported a 40.99% year-over-year decline in net profit to IDR 8.29 billion, despite a 4.83% increase in revenue to IDR 88.2 billion. The company's financial performance was affected by various factors, leading to a significant drop in its net profit.

PT Medela Potentia Tbk (MDLA) has introduced an eco-friendly approach to delivering pharmaceutical products using 100 electric motorcycles, reducing carbon emissions and noise pollution. This innovative approach is expected to enhance the company's logistics and contribute to its growth in the pharmaceutical industry.

The US has imposed a 19% tariff on Indonesian coffee imports, lower than Vietnam's 20% and Brazil's 50%. This may create an opportunity for Indonesia to increase its coffee exports to the US, particularly as Brazil faces higher tariffs.

PT Medela Potentia Tbk (MDLA) has introduced an eco-friendly approach to delivering pharmaceutical products using 100 electric motorcycles, reducing carbon emissions and noise pollution. This initiative is expected to contribute to the company's growth in the pharmaceutical industry.

The Indonesian government has reclassified crypto assets as securities, exempting them from value-added tax (VAT) and instead subjecting them to final income tax. This change in status is expected to boost the country's crypto market.

PT Harum Energy Tbk (HRUM) reported a revenue of USD 645.3 million in 1H 2025, up 8% year-over-year, but its coal segment saw a 9% decline in sales volume to 2.9 million tons, leading to a 22% contraction in coal revenue to USD 243 million. The company's overall performance was disappointing in the first half of 2025.

PT Multifiling Mitra Indonesia Tbk (MFMI) reported a 40.99% year-over-year decline in net profit to IDR 8.29 billion, despite a 4.83% increase in revenue to IDR 88.2 billion. The company's financial performance was affected by various factors, leading to a significant drop in its net profit.

Facing declining coal demand and pressure to transition to renewable energy, Indonesian coal mining companies are investing heavily in non-coal sectors such as solar energy, gold mining, and electric vehicles. 'Indika Energy', for example, aims to derive half its revenue from non-coal sources by 2028, allocating a significant portion of its capital expenditure to these ventures.

PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk (DSSA) has joined the list of large-capitalization stocks in the MSCI Global Standard Indexes, with a market capitalization of IDR 606 trillion, ranking 8th in the top 10 market capitalization list on the Indonesia Stock Exchange. Other companies that have previously entered the MSCI Indonesia Index include PT Bank Central Asia Tbk, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk, PT Bank Mandiri Tbk, PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk, PT Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk, and PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk.

PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk's subsidiary, MDI Ventures, is under investigation for corruption and money laundering in its investment in PT Tani Group Indonesia, with a total investment of USD 25 million or approximately IDR 400 billion. The investigation is currently ongoing, and MDI Ventures has committed to cooperating with the authorities and upholding good corporate governance principles.

PT Danantara Asset Management is set to facilitate the development of PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGEOTH) through a collaboration with PT PLN, aiming to promote geothermal energy in Indonesia. The partnership is marked by a memorandum of understanding, paving the way for further cooperation between the parties involved.

The certified gold price on Logam Mulia's official website decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,951,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,797,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices on the platform.

The gold price has increased by 2.43% in a week to USD 3,482.4 per troy ounce, with Aneka Tambang's gold price also rising by 2.5% to IDR 1,959 million per gram. The strong prospect of gold is driven by the weakened US dollar amid economic uncertainty, trade tensions, and the Federal Reserve's interest rate policy.

PT Makmur Berkah Amanda Tbk, a company listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) since March 13, 2020, is preparing several business agendas for 2025, focusing on industrial area development and investment in its subsidiaries, including PT Makmur Berkah Hotel and PT Makmur Berkah Amanda Hotel. The company's main business areas include industrial area development and industrial area services.

PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk (PROV) is set to issue IDR 420 billion worth of bonds, Provident Investasi Bersama Tahap V Tahun 2025, with a public offering period on August 20-21, 2025, and listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on August 27, 2025. The bond issuance is part of the company's efforts to raise capital and support its business growth.

Morgan Stanley Capital International has announced the rebalancing of its MSCI Global Standard and Small Cap indices, effective August 27, 2025. Several Indonesian stocks have been nominated to become new constituents of the global indices.

PT Elnusa Tbk, a subsidiary of PT Pertamina Hulu Energi, is set to repay its Sukuk Ijarah Berkelanjutan I issued in 2020 worth IDR 715.75 billion. The company has allocated IDR 700 billion from its internal funds to repay the principal and IDR 15.75 billion for the interest, which will mature on August 11, 2025.

PT Segar Kumala Indonesia Tbk (SKUI) reported a 55.7% year-over-year increase in fruit sales to IDR 1.43 trillion in Semester I-2025, driven by its successful market penetration strategy implemented in 2024. The company's sales revenue jumped from IDR 922.58 billion in the same period last year.

PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) has developed an integrated application, QLola BRI, which has resulted in a 33.9% year-on-year increase in transaction volume, reaching Rp 5.970 trillion in June. The application has also seen a 41.3% year-on-year increase in active users, reaching 88,000.

PT Merdeka Copper Gold Tbk (MERD) is allocating IDR 1.72 trillion to settle the principal and interest of its 12th continuous bond, Merdeka Copper Gold III Year 2022 Series B, which will be paid to PT Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia before the maturity date of September 1, 2025. The company is taking this step to meet its financial obligations.

Indonesia's motorcycle sales dropped 2.09% to 3.1 million units in Semester I-2025, according to the Indonesian Motorcycle Industry Association. This decline has affected the financing industry, which is closely tied to motorcycle sales.

PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk, a manufacturer of automotive components, is calling on the government to provide stimulus to revive the automotive industry, which has been sluggish this year. The company believes that government incentives, which were previously implemented during the COVID-19 pandemic, had a significant impact on the automotive industry supply chain, including the component industry.

Morgan Stanley Capital International has announced the rebalancing of its MSCI Global Standard and Small Cap indices, effective August 27, 2025. Several Indonesian stocks have been nominated to become new constituents of the global indices.

PT Dharma Samudera Fishing Industries Tbk (DSFI) is diversifying its market reach beyond the US, where it enjoys a 19% import tariff advantage, to mitigate the impact of weakening demand in Europe. The company is seeking to expand its market presence to stay competitive.

The gold price has increased by 2.43% to $3,482.4 per ounce, with Aneka Tambang's gold price also rising by 2.5% to IDR 1,959 million per gram. According to Lukman Leong, an analyst at Doo Financial Futures, the prospect of gold remains strong due to the weakened US dollar, driven by economic uncertainty, trade tensions, and Federal Reserve's interest rate policy.

PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk (PROV) is set to issue IDR 420 billion worth of bonds, known as Obligasi Berkelanjutan II Provident Investasi Bersama Tahap V Tahun 2025, with a public offering period on August 20-21, 2025, and listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on August 27, 2025. The bond issuance is part of the company's efforts to raise capital and support its business growth.

PT Makmur Berkah Amanda Tbk, a company listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) since March 13, 2020, is preparing several business agendas for 2025, focusing on industrial area development and investment in its subsidiaries in the hospitality sector. The company has two subsidiaries, PT Makmur Berkah Hotel and PT Makmur Berkah Amanda Hotel.

A survey by Bank Indonesia found that respondents from over 40 commercial banks are optimistic about credit growth until end-2025, driven by a promising monetary economic outlook. The banks applied more cautious lending standards in Q2 2025 compared to the previous quarter, but expect lending standards to remain relatively unchanged in Q3.

PT Matra Tri Abadi acquired 960,000,000 shares of PT Aviana Sinar Abadi Tbk, increasing its ownership from 1,080,000,000 shares to 2,040,000,000 shares. The transaction was done at a price of IDR 15 per share, with a total value of IDR 14,400,000,000,000. The purpose of the acquisition is stated as 'Akuisisi' or acquisition.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) has officially opened a new branch in Taipei, Taiwan, aiming to tap into growing trade remittance flows between Taiwan and Indonesia, with remittances from Taiwan to Indonesia exceeding Rp 40 trillion annually. The branch will offer integrated financial solutions, including savings products, financing services, and remittances, and is expected to facilitate Taiwanese investment into Indonesia.

PT Harapan Ruang Investindo, a shareholder, sold 960,000,000 shares of PT Aviana Sinar Abadi Tbk (IRSX.JK) at IDR 15 per share, completely divesting its stake in the company. The purpose of the transaction was divestment. This transaction signifies a complete exit from the company.

PT Matra Tri Abadi acquired 1,080,000,000 shares of PT Aviana Sinar Abadi Tbk, worth IDR 19,440,000,000, increasing its holding from 0 to 1,080,000,000 shares. The acquisition is for the purpose of acquiring the company. This transaction marks a significant change in ownership structure, with PT Matra Tri Abadi becoming a substantial shareholder in PT Aviana Sinar Abadi Tbk.

PT Mitra Digital Investindo sold 1,080,000,000 shares of PT Aviana Sinar Abadi Tbk, reducing its holding from 1,080,000,000 shares to 0 shares, with a transaction value of IDR 19,440,000,000,000. The purpose of the transaction is divestment.

Sentul City, Indonesia's largest land bank holder, is partnering with sovereign wealth fund Danantara to develop a health-focused special economic zone inspired by China's Chengdu Biotown, with a potential land sale payment of Rp 2 trillion from Malaysia's Genting Plantations. The project is expected to capture rising demand for industrial land from data center operators, with Sentul City already hosting tenants such as Neutra DC Sentul and Indokeppel Data Center 1.

Nikel smelter companies in Indonesia are facing significant pressure due to a nearly three-fold increase in sulfur prices, a crucial reagent in the high-pressure acid leach (HPAL) process. This surge in sulfur prices may impact the production costs of nickel, a key component in electric vehicle batteries.

PT Papirocks Indonesia Tbk is planning to expand organically and inorganically, following a change in its shareholding structure. Budi Aditya Erna Mulyanto and Irsyad Hanif have increased their stakes in the company, paving the way for strategic growth initiatives.

PT Dharma Samudera Fishing Industries Tbk (DSFI) is diversifying its market reach beyond the US, where it enjoys a 19% import tariff advantage, to mitigate the impact of weakening demand in Europe. The company is seeking to expand its market presence to stay competitive.

PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk (HEAL) is expected to face challenges in the second half of 2025, particularly in its patient segment under the National Health Insurance program, which may impact its revenue. However, the company's long-term strategies are expected to support its prospects.

Catur Jatiwaluyo sold 140,000,000 shares of PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk. (PPRI.JK) at IDR 50 per share, divesting their entire stake in the company. This transaction resulted in Catur Jatiwaluyo's ownership decreasing from 140,000,000 shares to 0 shares.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) increased by Rp 16,000 per gram to Rp 1,959,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 16,000 per gram to Rp 1,805,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

PT Mayora Indah Tbk's (MAYO) performance is projected to recover in the second half of 2025, driven by a double-digit growth in sales in July 2025 due to improvement in the domestic market. This trend is expected to continue, indicating a positive outlook for the company's future performance.

PT MNC Tourism Indonesia Tbk (KPIG) has been included in the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index, which is expected to boost the company's stock sentiment in the short term. However, the company's current business hurdles may hinder a longer-term upward trend.

The Directorate General of Taxes is integrating new systems and technologies to improve digital surveillance of taxpayers, including coordination with the Directorate General of Population and Civil Registration to develop a digital ID. This move aims to strengthen digital population data and enhance tax monitoring.

Prajogo Pangestu's wealth is expected to increase as two of his companies, PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk and PT Petrosea Tbk, have officially entered the Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) index. This inclusion is likely to boost the companies' stock prices, further enriching Pangestu's wealth.

MSCI has announced the rebalancing results for its Global Standard and Small Cap indexes, with PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi and PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk (DSSA) officially entering the MSCI Global Standard Indexes. This move is expected to have an impact on the Indonesian stock market.

PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka Tbk (KIJA) reported a 14% year-over-year increase in consolidated revenue to Rp 2.72 trillion in the first half of 2025, driven by strong performance in the period. The company is optimistic about its second-half 2025 performance, building on its recent success.

PT Selamat Sempurna Tbk (SMSM) received dividend income of approximately IDR 3.69 billion from its subsidiary, Sure Filter Co., Ltd. The dividend was received on August 6, 2025, as disclosed by the company's Vice President Director, Ang Andri Pribadi.

Most Indonesian cement producers, including PT Semen Indonesia Tbk (SMGR), PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa Tbk (INTP), and PT Cemindo Gemilang Tbk (CMNT), experienced a decline in performance in the first half of 2025 due to weak market conditions, oversupply, and high energy and logistics costs. However, PT Semen Baturaja Tbk (SMBR) managed to buck the trend, reporting a 29.76% increase in revenue and a 987.70% surge in net profit.

PT Timah TBK (TINS) has contributed IDR 839.99 billion to state revenue in July 2025, reflecting a positive trend in its contributions over the past five years, with a peak of IDR 1.51 trillion in 2022. The company's commitment to responsible natural resource management has enabled it to achieve this milestone.

The Indonesian Nuclear Energy Regulatory Agency (BAPETEN) has granted approval to PT Thorcon Power Indonesia (TPI) for the construction of a 500 MW nuclear power plant in Pulau Kelasa, Bangka Belitung. The approval was given based on a decision by the Head of BAPETEN on July 30, 2025, following TPI's application on January 21, 2025.

PT Pertamina Hulu Energi, a subsidiary of Pertamina Group, is committed to ensuring the sustainability and increase of oil and gas production despite the decision of oil-producing countries, including Russia, to increase oil production by 547,000 barrels per day by September 2025. Currently, Pertamina Hulu Energi manages 24% of the total oil and gas blocks in the country and 80% of national oil drilling, contributing significantly to domestic oil production, with 69% of domestic oil production supplied by the company.

The Indonesian government's target to build 100 GW solar power plants in 80,000 cooperatives is expected to have a positive impact on the domestic solar panel industry, despite facing financing challenges. The project aims to accelerate the use of renewable energy, particularly in remote villages.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IDX) declined 0.18% to 7,490 on Thursday, driven by capital inflow of IDR 666 billion and profit taking in conglomerate stocks. Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia's VP of Marketing, Strategy, and Planning, Oktavianus Audi, and Phintraco Sekuritas' Equity Research Analyst, Alrich Paskalis Tambolang, attributed the decline to these factors.

The sales of Indonesia's Savings Bond Retail Series SBR014 have reached Rp 14.92 trillion, almost reaching the national quota of Rp 15 trillion. The bond offering officially ended on August 7, 2025, with the Director of State Debt, Novi Puspita Wardani, announcing the successful outcome.

PT Indika Energy Tbk (INDY) reported a 20.05% year-over-year decline in revenue to USD 956.82 million in 1H 2025, resulting in a 89.34% drop in net profit to USD 2.24 million. The majority of INDY's revenue came from the energy resources segment, amounting to USD 788.51 million during the period.

BYD has taken the Indonesian electric vehicle market by storm with its affordable Atto 1 model, priced below IDR 200 million per unit, and has sold 19,825 units in the first semester of this year, capturing 55.3% of the market. The company's success is attributed to its competitive pricing, which is expected to further decrease with the government's incentives for battery production and tax breaks.

PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) reported a 4.45% year-over-year revenue growth to IDR 59.84 trillion and a 51.48% increase in net profit to IDR 5.83 trillion in 1H 2025. Meanwhile, PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) also saw a 2.0% revenue growth to IDR 37.60 trillion during the same period.

LSIP reported a revenue of IDR 1.03 trillion in Q2 2025, up 12% year-over-year but down 20% quarter-over-quarter, while its net profit decreased by 17.6% quarter-over-quarter and 1.9% year-over-year to IDR 323 billion. The company's performance is expected to improve in 2025, driven by the increase in commodity prices.

Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) is set to announce the results of its August 2025 rebalancing, which will affect Indonesian stocks. The announcement is highly anticipated by market players and investors, as MSCI is a leading global stock market index provider and its inclusion can attract local and global investors.

The illegal cigarette trade continues to plague the Indonesian tobacco industry, with law enforcement agencies still conducting raids on illegal cigarette operations. Bentoel Group (BTLI) is among the industry players affected by the illegal trade, as well as increasing excise duties on cigarettes.

PT Mayora Indah Tbk's (MAYO) performance is projected to recover in the second half of 2025, driven by a double-digit growth in sales in July 2025, thanks to improvements in the domestic market. This recovery is expected to continue, indicating a positive outlook for the company.

MSCI has announced the results of its rebalancing for the MSCI Global Standard and Small Cap indexes, with PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi and PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk (DSSA) officially entering the MSCI Global Standard indexes. This move is expected to have an impact on the Indonesian stock market.

PT MNC Tourism Indonesia Tbk (KPIG) has been included in the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index, which is expected to boost the company's stock sentiment in the short term. However, the company's current business constraints may hinder a longer-term uptrend.

Prajogo Pangestu's wealth is expected to increase as two of his companies, PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk and PT Petrosea Tbk, have officially entered the Morgan Stanley Capital International (MSCI) Index. This inclusion is likely to boost the companies' stock prices, further increasing Pangestu's wealth.

PT Timah Tbk (TINS) has contributed Rp 839.99 billion to state revenue through tax and non-tax payments as of July 2025, with a total contribution of up to Rp 1.51 trillion in 2022. The company's director, Restu Widiyantoro, stated that this achievement reflects TINS' commitment to responsible natural resource management, with the company's total contributions showing a positive trend over the past five years.

Indonesia is intensifying its search for lithium, a key component of electric vehicle batteries, with the Energy and Mineral Resources Ministry partnering with French mining company Eramet to explore new mineral deposits. The country currently imports around 80,000 tonnes of lithium annually from Australia to support its growing EV battery sector.

Irsyad Hanif acquired 140 million shares of PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk through a buy transaction, increasing his holding from 27.8 million shares to 167.8 million shares. The purpose of the transaction was for long-term investment.

PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara sold 606 million shares of Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA.JK) on August 7, 2025, at a price of IDR 75 per share, reducing its ownership from 857 million shares to 796 million shares. The transaction purpose is divestment.

The new tariffs, which include import duties up to 200% on pharmaceuticals and 100% on computer chips, are already disrupting global supply chains, with companies worldwide reporting billions of dollars in higher costs and losses. Indonesia, which secured a 19% tariff rate, sees the deal as a competitive edge, while companies like Honda and Toyota are expecting to incur significant costs due to the new tariffs.

The Indonesian government is reviewing a plan to offer tax incentives to electric vehicle manufacturers that adopt nickel-based batteries, aiming to leverage its natural advantage as a strategic supplier to the EV industry with 52% of the world's total nickel reserves. The proposal includes government-borne value-added tax, import duty exemptions, and luxury goods sales tax relief, with nickel-based product exports having surged to $33.9 billion in 2024, and global demand for EVs projected to reach 39 million units by 2030.

The US has officially imposed a 19% tariff on Indonesian goods, with Indonesia accepting the rate as 'final binding', although negotiations are ongoing to lower import taxes on certain goods such as nickel, palm oil, and cacao coffee. The tariffs are part of a broader trade policy by US President Donald Trump, who aims to address the US' $17.9 billion trade deficit with Indonesia, with Indonesia committing to import $15 billion worth of American energy products and remove 99% of tariff barriers on American industrial food products.

The European Union's recognition of Indonesian palm oil as a sustainable commodity is expected to increase Indonesia's exports and strengthen its image as a responsible producer, with trade value between Indonesia and the EU reaching $30.1 billion in 2024. This recognition is a significant step for Indonesian palm oil derivative products to enter the global market, especially in Europe, with key export products including palm oil, copper ores, and fatty acids.

The Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA) is expected to take effect in September 2025, offering zero percent tariff for Indonesia's export products, including textiles, palm oil derivatives, and processed foods, with 98% of tariff posts to get preferences. The agreement is expected to boost Indonesia's exports to the EU, with around 80% of tariff posts to be zero percent, opening up bigger opportunities for trade and investments between the two regions.

The Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA) is expected to take effect in September 2025, offering zero tariffs on various Indonesian export products, including textiles, palm oil derivatives, and processed foods, with 98% of tariff posts to get preferences. The agreement is expected to boost Indonesia's exports to the EU, with around 80% of tariff posts to be zero percent, opening up bigger opportunities for trade and investments between the two regions.

Indonesia may benefit from the US-China trade war as foreign companies consider relocating their factories to the country to avoid steeper tariff hikes, with the country's garment industry already seeing increased orders. Indonesia has attracted Rp 432.6 trillion in foreign direct investments between January and June 2025, with top investors including Singapore, Hong Kong, China, Malaysia, and Japan.

PT Sarimelati Kencana (SRTG), the operator of Pizza Hut in Indonesia, successfully turned around its losses to profits in the first half of 2023. The company's impressive performance is a significant turnaround from its previous losses.

The certified gold price on Logam Mulia's official website decreased by Rp 7,000 per gram, from Rp 1,950,000 to Rp 1,943,000 per gram. The buyback price also dropped by Rp 7,000 per gram, from Rp 1,796,000 to Rp 1,789,000 per gram.

Indonesia's Q2 2025 economic growth rate of 5.12% has sparked debate among analysts, with some questioning the methodology used by the Central Statistics Agency. Meanwhile, the majority of listed companies on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) have reported declining profits in the first half of 2025, with only 13 out of 30 LQ45 index constituents reporting profit growth.

Garudafood Putra Putri Jaya Tbk (GOOD) is set to partner with French company Bel S.A. to develop its subsidiary business, PT Mulia Boga Raya Tbk. The two companies have signed a framework agreement on August 6, 2025, marking the first step in their collaboration.

PT Jasa Marga Tbk's (JSMR) weak performance in the first half of 2025 is expected to affect its financial report for the year, due to delayed construction of new toll roads and minimal toll tariff discounts. This is predicted to negatively impact the company's financial performance.

Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) shares closed up 1.37% at IDR 1,490, near its all-time high of IDR 1,560, with foreign investors dominating purchases and domestic investors selling. In the past week, foreign investors recorded a net buy of IDR 75.3 billion in TAPG shares.

Raja, an oil and gas company owned by Happy Hapsoro, reported a net income of USD 127.64 million in 1H 2025, a 3.34% year-over-year growth. The company's revenue was driven by its gas distribution segment, which contributed USD 73.67 million, as well as its oil and gas lifting segment, which contributed USD 25.15 million.

Several e-commerce platforms in Indonesia, including Shopee, Tokopedia, and TikTok Shop, are set to impose transaction fees on sellers due to increasing operational costs, declining purchasing power, and intense government regulations. The fees, ranging from Rp 1,250 per transaction, aim to help the platforms sustain their businesses amidst industry challenges.

The Indonesian government has set the biodiesel price at Rp 13,527 per liter in August 2025, a 5% increase from the previous month, driven by the global crude palm oil price movement. The conversion value of crude palm oil to biodiesel remains unchanged at US$ 85 per metric ton.

PT PLN (PLN) recorded electricity sales of 155.62 terawatt hours in 1H 2025, a 4.36% year-on-year increase, driven by solid performance and synergy across institutions. The company's net profit for the period reached IDR 6.64 trillion, up 32.8% from the same period last year.

Most automotive sector stocks in Indonesia, including PT Astra International Tbk and PT Astra Otoparts Tbk, reported a decline in net profit, with a 2.15% and 7.38% year-over-year decrease, respectively. This decline in performance was observed in the first semester of 2025.

Indonesia Battery Corporation (IBC) is preparing to hold an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders to appoint a new President Director, replacing Toto Nugroho, who is involved in a corruption case related to crude oil and refinery at Pertamina. The company's Vice President of Investor Relations, Marvin Reinhardt, assured that the change in leadership will not affect the company's performance, particularly in its electric vehicle battery ecosystem development project.

The Savings Bond Ritel SBR014 with a 2-year tenor has reached a subscription rate of 96.3%, amounting to IDR 9.63 trillion, while the 4-year tenor has a lower subscription rate of 90.8%, amounting to IDR 4.45 trillion. The data was provided by Bibit, one of the distribution partners.

In the first half of 2025, 12 major banks in Indonesia saw a two-digit growth in non-interest income, with OCBC NISP (no ticker), Maybank (no ticker), and Bank Permata (no ticker) recording the highest growth rates of 139%, 18.8%, and 16.8%, respectively. Meanwhile, net interest income growth was sluggish, with some banks even experiencing a contraction.

The Indonesian government is considering transferring the authority for mining permits and supervision of galian C minerals from local governments to the central government, following a fatal landslide incident at a mine in Cirebon in May 2025. The move aims to improve safety and oversight in the mining sector.

Indonesia's economy grew 5.12% in Q2 2025, surpassing expectations, driven by a significant increase in investment growth to 6.99% and a flat household consumption growth of 4.97%. The Central Statistics Agency's (BPS) data has raised questions, and a more detailed explanation is needed to maintain public trust and confidence in the market.

The Indonesian government has announced the addition of five international airports this year, bringing the total to 22 airports. This decision is stated in the Minister of Transportation's Regulation No. KM 26/2025 and No. KM 30/2025.

PT Hillcon Equity Management, the controlling shareholder of PT Hillcon Tbk (HILL), sold 75 million shares at IDR 268 per share, reducing its stake in the company. The transaction was disclosed in the Indonesia Stock Exchange's information disclosure on Wednesday.

The IDX fell 0.15% to 7,503.75 on Wednesday, dragged down by the banking sector, particularly big banks, despite Indonesia's domestic product growth of 5.12%. Meanwhile, the domestic house price index grew only 0.9% year-over-year in Q2-2025, the slowest growth since 2003, due to declining purchasing power and rising layoffs.

PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) shares are still trading at a premium compared to regional banks, with a price-to-book value (PBV) ratio of 3.92 times as of August 5, 2025. This is higher than its regional peers, such as DBS Group (1.99 times), OCBC (1.26 times), and Maybank (1.26 times).

PT Jasa Marga (JSMR) reported a 1% decline in total revenue to IDR 12.9 trillion in the first half of 2025, despite a 3% increase in operating profit margin to 36% and a 4% increase in EBITDA margin to 47%. The company's net profit, however, fell 20.3% year-over-year to IDR 1.87 trillion in the same period.

Major banks in Indonesia have increased their Casa (Current Account Savings Account) ratio in the first semester of 2025, driven by their efforts to reduce funding costs. Bank Central Asia (BCA) reported a 14% year-on-year growth in its payroll service users as of June 2025.

Prajogo Pangestu, the controller of Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (CUAN), sold 1 billion shares of the company, equivalent to 0.889530% of the total shares issued. The transaction was reported on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on Wednesday.

PT Japfa Comfeed Indonesia Tbk (JPFA) reported a net profit of IDR 1.23 trillion in 1H 2025, a 16.42% year-over-year decline from IDR 1.47 trillion in the same period last year. The company's disappointing performance was reflected in its financial metrics, with a significant drop in net profit.

PT Jasa Marga Tbk's (JSMR) weak performance in 1H 2025 is expected to affect its financial report for the year, due to delayed construction of new toll roads and minimal toll tariff discounts. This is predicted to negatively impact the company's financial performance.

Triputra Agro Persada (TAPG) shares closed up 1.37% to IDR 1,490 on Wednesday, still near its all-time high of IDR 1,560 per share achieved on August 1, 2025. Foreign investors dominated buying, with a net foreign buy of IDR 75.3 billion in the past week, while domestic investors sold more shares.

The Indonesian government has announced the addition of five new international airports this year, bringing the total to 22. This development is expected to boost the country's aviation industry and economy.

The Indonesian government, under President Prabowo Subianto, is preparing a credit scheme to support its 3 million housing project for low-income citizens, with a increased financing limit of Rp 5 billion. This scheme aims to provide financing for property developers participating in the program.

Telisa Aulia Falianty, senior advisor at BRI Danareksa Sekuritas, emphasized the need for sustainable and innovative financial support for Indonesia's nickel sector to meet future demand and remain competitive in the global market. She highlighted alternative financing options, such as transition bonds and green banks, and urged stakeholders to focus on producing high-grade nickel products to maintain stable prices.

PT Rukun Raharja (RAJA) plans to acquire a company engaged in liquefied natural gas infrastructure, aligning with its long-term strategy to strengthen its financial structure and promote sustainable expansion in the energy sector. The company recorded a revenue of USD 127 million in Q2 2025, up from USD 123 million in the same period last year, despite a 4% year-on-year decline in net profit to USD 15.3 million.

Harita nickel is launching a pilot project to recycle tailings from its nickel processing operations, aiming to reduce environmental impact and enhance operational efficiency. The project, which employs technology from China, targets to process around 1.5 million tons of tailings annually, converting waste into usable iron products.

Robin Sunyoto, an insider, purchased 1,712,500 shares of PT Hero Global Investment Tbk (HGII.JK) on 2025-08-06, increasing their holding from 11,017,500 to 12,730,000 shares. The buy transaction type is for investment.

Termurti Tiban purchased 1,200,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA.JK) on August 6, 2025, at a price of IDR 499 per share, increasing their holding from 450,000 shares to 1,650,000 shares, with the purpose of investment.
Suresh Vembu acquired 1,200,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk through a buy transaction, increasing their holding from 3,727,500 shares to 4,927,500 shares, with a purpose of investment.
Nery Polim, an insider, purchased 1,800,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA.JK) at IDR 499 per share, increasing their holding from 1,165,000 to 2,965,000 shares for investment purposes.

Bambang Soetiono S. acquired 3,000,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk at IDR 499 per share, increasing his stake to 7,780,000 shares from 4,780,000 shares. The purpose of the transaction is for investment.

Jimmy Tandyo, an insider, acquired 6,000,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA.JK) at IDR 499 per share, increasing his stake to 48,000,000 shares. The purpose of this transaction is for investment. This buy transaction marks a significant increase in Jimmy Tandyo's ownership in the company.

Mery Sofi, an insider, purchased 6,000,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA.JK) on 2025-08-06, increasing their holding from 2,303,000 to 8,303,000 shares. The transaction was made for investment purposes.
Soegiarto Adikoesoemo acquired 3,000,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk at IDR 499 per share, increasing their holding from 142,267,000 to 145,267,000 shares for investment purposes.

Haryanto Adikoesoemo, an insider, purchased 6,000,000 shares of PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA.JK) on August 6, 2025, at a price of IDR 499 per share, increasing his ownership stake from 206,604,600 to 212,604,600 shares. The purpose of this transaction is for investment.

The US decision to reduce tariffs on Indonesian copper to 0% is a significant development, with Indonesia's copper reserves standing at 21 million metric tons and domestic refinery production at 350,000 metric tons in 2024. Freeport Indonesia, a subsidiary of Freeport-McMoRan, is a major player in the Indonesian copper industry, operating a smelter facility in Gresik with an annual processing capacity of 1.7 million tons of cathode output.

Despite the end of government subsidies, PT NFC Indonesia Tbk (NFCX) managed to boost its sales due to its corporate-focused sales strategy, which differs from other electric vehicle players. The company expects consumer sales to rebound with the government's plan to reintroduce subsidies this month.

The Indonesian government's plan to build a mass rapid transit and develop a health economic zone in Bali is expected to have a positive impact on several corporations, including PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk, PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk, PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk, PT Hatten Bali Tbk, and PT Multi Bintang Indonesia Tbk. These companies are likely to benefit from the project, which could lead to increased revenue and growth opportunities.

Mexc Ventures, a unit of global crypto trading platform Mexc, has made a strategic investment of $200 million in Triv, an Indonesian crypto exchange. The investment is expected to support the growth of Triv's other business units, including Cryptowave Media.

PT Matahari Putra Prima Tbk (MPPA) shares jumped 13.79% to IDR 66 per share on Tuesday, with an intraday high of IDR 73, the highest level since January 2025. The stock has been trending upwards since mid-July 2025, after being stuck in a range for about four months.

The Institute for Development of Economics and Finance has raised doubts over the credibility of Indonesia's second-quarter economic growth figure, citing a disconnect between macroeconomic data and industry reports, particularly from retailers, with household consumption growing 4.97 percent in the second quarter. The growth figure is also contradicted by softening indicators such as declining household consumption, falling vehicle sales, and a drop in the consumer confidence index, with foreign direct investment data falling to Rp202.2 trillion in the second quarter from Rp217.3 trillion a year earlier.

PT Gunung Raja Paksi Tbk (GGRP) reported a 57.76% year-over-year decline in sales to USD 84.48 million in H1 2025, resulting in a loss of USD 20.98 million, compared to a net profit of USD 118.42 million in the same period last year. The majority of steel producers in Indonesia experienced a decline in revenue with varying profit and loss performances.

Widodo Makmur Perkasa (WIDO) reported a revenue of IDR 398.5 billion in 1H 2025, an 84.5% increase from IDR 215.9 billion in the same period last year, driven mainly by its poultry business which contributed around 75% of total revenue. The company's other business lines, including meat processing, cattle farming, and agricultural commodities, also contributed to the growth.

PT Dyandra Media International Tbk (DYAN) reported a 14.46% year-over-year decline in net revenue to IDR 668.67 billion in 1H 2025, resulting in a 62% drop in net income to IDR 32.40 billion. The company's convention and exhibition segment was the hardest hit, with revenue plummeting 50.83% to IDR 60.54 billion.

Mitra Pinasthika Mustika (MPMX) experienced a decline in revenue and net profit in the first half of 2025, with revenue decreasing by 3.25% year-on-year to IDR 7.44 trillion and net profit dropping by 23.92% year-on-year to IDR 248.97 billion. The company aims to improve its performance in the second half of 2025, despite being affected by macroeconomic pressures since the first quarter.

Indonesia is still negotiating with the US to lower tariffs on palm oil exports, with a deadline looming as the US is set to impose 19% tariffs on Indonesian goods on August 7. Indonesia's palm oil exports have risen 8.91% year-on-year to $11.43 billion in the first half of 2025, according to the central statistics agency.

Indonesia's GDP growth rate for Q2 reached 5.12% year-over-year, exceeding market expectations, which led to a 0.68% increase in the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) to 7,515. This growth is expected to influence the stock market, with Aneka Tambang (ANTM) being a recommended stock to watch.

Despite facing pressure from declining commodity prices and weakening demand, the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources is confident that it can achieve its non-tax revenue target of IDR 124 trillion from the mineral and coal sector this year. As of the end of July 2025, the realization of non-tax revenue from the sector has reached IDR 76.9 trillion, or 62% of the target.

PT MD Entertainment Tbk (MDEN) saw its stock price surge in the last three trading days after hitting its lowest level since May 15, 2023. The company's rights issue, which allowed existing shareholders to purchase additional shares, also attracted new investors from South Korea.

The Organization of the Petroleum Exporting Countries (OPEC+) has agreed to increase oil production by 547,000 barrels per day starting September 2025, which may lead to a global oil supply surplus and lower oil prices. This could impact the Indonesian crude price, with the potential to decrease by 500,000 barrels per day.

PT Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) reported a net profit of IDR 10.97 trillion in Semester I-2025, a 6.68% year-over-year decline from IDR 11.76 trillion in the same period in 2024. The company's revenue also decreased by 3.04% year-over-year to IDR 73 trillion in Semester I-2025.

In July 2025, Indonesian equity funds recorded a positive return of 2.72% month-over-month, with some products achieving double-digit returns, such as PT Sinarmas Asset Management's Simas Syariah Unggulan fund, which saw a 17.52% return month-over-month and 15.06% year-to-date.

The Indonesian Financial Services Authority (OJK) is finalizing a financing scheme to support the government's free nutritious meal program, which will provide credit opportunities for banks. The scheme will cover operational financing, refinancing, and capital expenditure (capex) for capacity enhancement.

The Indonesian government and truck entrepreneurs have agreed to implement a zero over dimension over load (ODOL) policy by 2027, aiming to eliminate excessive truck transportation. This policy is expected to have a significant impact on the transportation industry and related businesses in Indonesia.

PT Pyridam Farma Tbk (PYFA) reported a net loss of IDR 213.20 billion in 1H 2025, a 108.44% year-over-year increase. The company's financial performance was disappointing in the first six months of the year.

Bank Indonesia reported a 30.51% year-on-year increase in digital banking transactions, reaching 11.67 billion in H1 2025, driven by innovation in mobile and internet banking services. Mobile banking transactions surged 32.16% and internet banking transactions rose 6.95% during the same period.

PT Indosat Tbk (ISAT) is projected to record a profit increase in 2025 despite a decline in its first semester performance, with revenue reaching IDR 27.11 trillion, down 3.10% year-over-year, and net profit of IDR 2.33 trillion, down 14.6% year-over-year. The decline in revenue was mainly due to a 5.5% decrease in data revenue to IDR 20.9 trillion, following a 5.5% decrease in total subscribers to 95.4 million.

Despite a decline in the aggregate non-performing loan (NPL) ratio, several major banks in Indonesia have reported an increase in NPLs, highlighting the need for continued monitoring of asset quality. As of June 2025, the gross NPL ratio stood at 2.22%, down from 2.26% in the same period last year, while the net NPL ratio rose to 0.84% from 0.78%.

Indonesia's economy grew 5.12% in Q2 2025, beating market expectations and outpacing several major Southeast Asian economies, driven by positive growth across all industrial sectors. The Jakarta Composite Index rallied to an intraday high of 7,541.35, while the rupiah strengthened slightly to 16,385 per US dollar.

Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign fund, is working on a debt restructuring plan for the Jakarta-Bandung high-speed railway, which has a $7.3 billion debt, mostly financed by Chinese loans. The railway, operated by KCIC, a joint venture between Indonesian and Chinese state-run enterprises, has recorded 2.9 million passengers between January and June 2025, up 10% year-on-year.

The national steel industry in Indonesia has experienced a decline in performance during the first half of 2025, with most steel producers reporting a decrease in revenue and varying profit and loss results. PT Gunung Raja Paksi Tbk (GGRP) specifically saw a 57.76% year-on-year decline in sales to USD 84.48 million in H1 2025, resulting in a loss of USD 20.98 million.

Mexc Ventures, a unit of global crypto trading platform Mexc, has made a strategic investment of $200 million in Triv, an Indonesian crypto exchange. The investment is expected to support the growth of Triv's other business units, including Cryptowave Media.

The national steel industry in Indonesia has experienced a decline in performance in the first half of 2025, with most steel producers reporting a decrease in revenue and varying profit and loss results. PT Gunung Raja Paksi Tbk (GGRP) recorded a 57.76% year-on-year decline in sales to USD 84.48 million in the first semester, resulting in a loss of USD 20.98 million.

Three new suspects, including the President Director of PT Padi Indonesia Maju, a subsidiary of Wilmar Group, have been named in the rotten rice scandal. The suspects, who are senior officials of the company, are being investigated by the Police's Food Task Force.

PT Matahari Putra Prima Tbk (MPPA) shares jumped 13.79% to IDR 66 per share on Tuesday, with an intraday high of IDR 73, the highest level since January 2025. The stock has been trending upwards since mid-July 2025, after being stuck in a range for about four months.

Indonesia's economy grew 5.12% year-on-year in Q2 2025, driven by government-issued stimulus packages and increased household consumption. The government's fiscal policy measures, including tax-related incentives and wage subsidy assistance, helped boost domestic demand and maintain consumer confidence.

PT Pertamina (PERT) and PT PLN (PLN) have agreed to develop 19 geothermal energy projects with a total capacity of 530 megawatts to support Indonesia's transition to clean energy. The partnership aims to optimize cooperation schemes, conduct feasibility studies, and establish a joint work team to accelerate project implementation, with a goal of reaching 1 GW capacity in 2-3 years.

Indonesia's economy grew 5.12% year-on-year in Q2 2025, beating expectations, which may lead to a stronger rupiah, but analysts are divided on the currency's future trajectory due to global risks and uncertainty. The rupiah currently trades between Rp16,350-Rp16,450 per US dollar, with some expecting it to appreciate towards Rp16,340-Rp16,440, while others predict a weakening towards Rp16,500.

Indonesia will start importing lithium from Australia to support its growing electric vehicle industry, with the country aiming to produce 9 million electric motorcycles and 600,000 electric cars and buses by 2030. The move is expected to cut fossil fuel consumption by 21.65 million barrels and reduce carbon emissions by 7.9 million tons.

The Indonesian government plans to disburse IDR 2,121 trillion in the second half of 2025 to meet its annual spending target and boost economic growth to 5.2%. The government's spending in the first half of 2025 reached IDR 1,406 trillion, a modest increase of 0.6% compared to the same period last year.

PT Abadimukti Gunalestari, an insider, sold 17,795,500 shares of Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk (GPRA.JK) on August 5, 2025, reducing its holding from 2,624,694,200 to 2,606,473,920 shares. The transaction was made for investment strategy purposes.

Indonesia's economy grew 5.12% in Q2 2025, driven by rising household consumption, increased investment activity, and stronger collaboration between the government and business community. The government has implemented targeted stimulus policies, including a 100% value-added tax exemption for residential properties, to maintain this momentum and support key sectors such as agriculture, manufacturing, and e-commerce.

Indonesia is set to sign a free trade agreement with the Eurasian Economic Union (EAEU) in December, expanding its non-traditional markets and unlocking new avenues for economic cooperation. The trade deal is expected to double trade turnover between signatories within the next 3-5 years, with a potential surplus of $7 million in the first half of 2025.

Patrick Rudolf Dannacher purchased 128,100 shares of PT ITSEC Asia Tbk. (CYBR.JK) on August 5, 2025, increasing his holding from 51,711,150 to 51,839,250 shares. The buy transaction was made for investment purposes, with prices ranging from IDR 940 to IDR 960.

Triv, an Indonesian crypto exchange platform, has secured a $200 million investment from Mexc Ventures, marking a significant milestone in its growth trajectory. The new funding will enable Triv to expand its range of available crypto assets, boost platform liquidity, and launch innovative products, with Indonesia's crypto trading value surging 335.9% year-on-year to Rp 650.61 trillion in 2024.

Indonesia and the European Union are finalizing the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), which will eliminate tariffs on virtually all goods, with the potential to double trade to $60 billion. The deal is expected to be signed in 2026 and ratified by 2027, opening up markets for Indonesian commodities and boosting investments in renewable energy and pharmaceuticals.

PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) shows signs of improvement despite a decline in annual performance, prompting several securities to raise their target stock prices driven by expectations of improved sales volume, cost efficiency, and share buyback initiatives. The company's prospects are expected to continue improving in the future.

PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk acquired 325,024,100 shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk, increasing its stake from 48,579,574,040 to 48,904,598,140 shares. The transaction was made for investment purposes. This buy transaction suggests the company's confidence in its own growth prospects.

The Indonesian stock market fell 0.97% to 7,464.64 on Monday, driven by foreign investors' net sell of Rp 1.01 trillion worth of shares. Since the beginning of the year, foreign investors have net sold Rp 62 trillion worth of shares as of August 1, 2025.

Petrosea TBK's prospects are expected to improve after acquiring HBS Limited and its subsidiaries in Papua Nugini, which will diversify its business into gold mining and significantly boost its margin. The company signed a conditional share sale purchase agreement worth US$25.76 million, which will be effective once all conditions are met.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) has secured a $500 million credit facility from several national and international banks, including DBS Bank Ltd, MUFJ Bank Ltd, and United Overseas Bank Limited, among others. The credit facility, which consists of a term loan and a revolving loan, was signed on August 1, 2025.

PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk (FORE) reported a 46.78% increase in revenue to IDR 662.37 billion in the first half of 2025, but the stock failed to gain momentum. Despite the impressive financial performance, investors took profit, leading to a decline in the company's stock price.

Foreign investors recorded a net sell of IDR 58.69 trillion in the Indonesian stock market and IDR 77.39 trillion in rupiah-denominated Bank Indonesia certificates from the beginning of the year to the end of July 2025. Meanwhile, they made a net buy of IDR 59.07 trillion in government securities during the same period.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CHDY) recorded large crossing transactions on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on Monday, 4 August 2025, with a total value of IDR 262.50 billion. The transactions involved 150 million shares, with a price of IDR 1,750 per share, executed through Henan Putihrai Sekuritas.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 73.12 points or 0.97% to 7,464.64 on Monday, accompanied by a net foreign sell of IDR 1.02 trillion. The IHSG has accumulated a 1.97% decline over the past week, but still up 5.43% since the beginning of the year.

MAP Group (MAPG) has strengthened its fashion sport business by introducing Sports Direct, adding to its existing retail network of Sport Station and Foot Locker. The move is seen as a response to the growing athleisure trend, where consumers are increasingly seeking athletic wear that also serves as a social identity.

The investment portfolio in Indonesia has recorded a good return so far this year, driven by safe-haven assets such as gold and major currencies, with gold prices rising 19.92% year-to-date to USD 3,399.8 per ounce. Meanwhile, Antam's gold bars have also increased by 17.35% year-to-date to IDR 1.91 million per gram.

PT Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa Tbk (INTP) reported a revenue of Rp 8.03 trillion, down 1.13% YoY, and a net profit of Rp 494.75 billion, up 13.81% YoY, in 1H 2025. Despite the decent performance, the company is expected to face challenges in the second half of 2025.

Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (TICKER) achieved a net profit of Rp 1.88 trillion in the first semester of 2025, representing a 4.98% year-over-year increase from Rp 1.79 trillion in the same period last year. The company's impressive performance is in line with the majority of retail companies listed in the LQ45 index, which also reported strong financial results during the same period.

The Indonesian government has announced plans to impose royalties on commercial music playbacks, including international songs, in response to copyright infringement reports by the Sentra Lisensi Musik Indonesia collective management organization. This move is expected to impact businesses, including restaurants, that play music in their establishments.

Foreign investors withdrew a total of Rp 16.24 trillion from the Indonesian financial market between July 28-30, 2025, with Rp 2.27 trillion from the stock market, Rp 1.37 trillion from government bonds, and Rp 12.6 trillion from rupiah-denominated securities. Since the beginning of 2025, foreign capital outflow from stocks has reached Rp 58.69 trillion and Rp 77.39 trillion from State Revenue Bonds.

Digital banks in Indonesia have reported higher net profit in the first semester, driven by increased net interest income and non-interest income, despite higher funding costs. Their efficient operational costs have also contributed to higher net interest margins, outperforming conventional banks.

Several nickel producers in Indonesia have released their financial reports for the first half of 2025, with most of them experiencing significant growth in performance. PT Pam Mineral Tbk, for instance, reported a 152.07% year-over-year increase in sales to Rp 1.05 trillion in 1H 2025.

Bank Indonesia is set to launch its Payment ID system on August 17, 2025, which will record financial transaction histories in a more detailed and integrated manner. The system is expected to become an important instrument in improving creditworthiness assessments, and has been welcomed by the banking industry.

The Abadi liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in the Masela block has officially entered the front-end engineering design (FEED) phase, with the government focusing on accelerating the permitting process to meet the project's target. The project has completed the SKK Migas level process, according to Kepala Satuan Kerja Khusus Pelaksana Kegiatan Usaha Hulu Migas Djoko Siswanto.

PT Waskita Karya Tbk (WSKT) is planning to divest 35% of its shares in the Cimanggis-Cibitung toll road asset worth IDR 3.3 trillion, with a target to complete the acquisition by the end of this year. The company also plans to divest other toll road assets, including Pemalang-Batang and Kuala Tanjung-Tebing Tinggi-Parapat, this year.

The Indonesian government through the Nusantara Capital Authority is preparing to hold the second phase of the IKN project auction, scheduled to take place in early August. The project's second phase will focus on the construction of the legislative and judicial areas, along with their supporting ecosystems.

Several listed companies in Indonesia are set to distribute interim dividends for 2025, with PT Akr Corporindo Tbk (AKRA) announcing a dividend payout of IDR 989.98 billion or IDR 50 per share. The dividend will be distributed on Tuesday.

Indonesian gold producers are optimistic about their performance until the end of the year, driven by the 40% increase in global gold prices to USD 3,374 per ounce. The companies are planning to expand their business to capitalize on the trend.

As of now, 800 listed companies have submitted their mid-year financial reports, with around 74% of them reporting net profit in the first semester of 2025. This indicates a positive trend in the Indonesian stock market.

The Abadi liquefied natural gas (LNG) project in the Masela block has officially entered the front-end engineering design phase, with the government focusing on accelerating the permitting process to meet the project's target. The project has completed the SKK Migas stage, according to Kepala Satuan Kerja Khusus Pelaksana Kegiatan Usaha Hulu Migas Djoko Siswanto.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) has secured a $500 million credit facility from several national and international banks, including DBS Bank Ltd, MUFJ Bank Ltd, and United Overseas Bank Limited, among others. The credit facility, which consists of a term loan and revolving credit, will be used to support the company's business activities.

Petrosea TBK's prospects are expected to improve significantly with its acquisition of HBS Limited and its subsidiaries in Papua Nugini, diversifying its business into gold mining. The conditional share sale purchase agreement, valued at US$25.76 million, is expected to boost the company's margin.

The Indonesian government, through the Otorita Ibu Kota Nusantara, is preparing to hold the second phase of the project's auction in early August, focusing on the construction of legislative and judicial areas. The project's second phase has completed its preparation, including budgeting, according to Kepala Otorita Ibu Kota Nusantara, Basuki Hadimuljono.

PT Fore Kopi Indonesia Tbk (FORE) reported impressive financial performance in the first half of 2025, with revenue growing 46.78% to Rp 662.37 billion. Despite this, the company's stock failed to rise, with investors instead taking profit from the release of the financial report.

The Indonesian stock market index fell 0.97% to 7,464.64 on Monday, driven by foreign investors' net sell of Rp 1.01 trillion worth of shares. Since the beginning of the year, foreign investors have net sold Rp 62 trillion worth of shares as of August 1, 2025.

DANA, an Indonesian digital wallet platform, has reduced gambling-related activity on its platform by 80% through its predictive fraud detection system, which continuously updates risk parameters and typology analysis to stay ahead of illegal patterns. The company's efforts have been praised by regulators, with the Financial Intelligence Unit projecting Indonesia's online gambling economy to reach US$73 billion by year-end.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has announced that three large-scale companies, including one owned by a prominent Indonesian conglomerate, are set to go public through initial public offerings (IPOs) in the second half of 2025. As of August 1, 2025, a total of 22 companies have listed their shares on the IDX, raising IDR 10.39 trillion.

The Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA) is expected to enhance trade and economic cooperation between the two regions, with the EU investing approximately $1.37 billion in Indonesia in 2024 across 14,200 projects. The agreement is projected to double Indonesia's trade value with the EU to $60 billion, with key sectors including renewable energy, electric vehicles, and pharmaceuticals.

Australia is building a strategic reserve to provide price certainty for critical minerals, including rare earths, to reduce dependence on China. Shares of Australian producers such as Lynas Rare Earths and Iluka Resources rallied more than 6% and 8% respectively, following the announcement.

The Indonesian Automotive Industry Association (Gaikindo) may revise its 2025 car sales target of 900,000 units downward due to slowing national demand, with wholesale car sales declining 8.6% to 374,740 units in the first half of 2025. Gaikindo attributes the weakening demand to macroeconomic pressures affecting middle-class purchasing power.

Indonesia's Jakarta Composite Index surged 8.04% in July, driven by easing global trade tensions and improving economic outlook, with market capitalization reaching an all-time high of IDR 13,700 trillion. The rally was supported by strong corporate share buybacks, with 36 companies executing buybacks totaling IDR 3.7 trillion, and analysts expect the index to continue its upward trend towards 7,800.

Freeport Indonesia (IDX: FPIN) reaffirms its commitment to prioritizing the domestic market, despite the US introducing zero percent import tariff on Indonesian copper concentrate and copper cathodes. The company aims to produce 441,000 tons of copper cathode from its new smelter facility in Gresik, East Java, with an annual copper cathode output reaching up to 600,000 tons.

Indonesia's vehicle and auto parts imports increased by 31.29% year-over-year to $5.35 billion in the first half of 2025, driven by higher capital goods imports. Meanwhile, the country's car exports also rose by 7% year-over-year to 233,648 units, with Toyota Motor Manufacturing Indonesia (TMMIN) being one of the major contributors.

Indonesia's coal production for the first semester of 2025 was recorded at 371.66 million tons, representing an 8.47% decrease compared to the same period in 2024, with coal exports also declining by 6.13% to 185.98 million tons. The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources predicts that national coal production for 2025 will be lower than last year, but still aims to reach over 700 million tons by the end of the year, with a target of 735 million tons.

PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) reported a 16% increase in coal production to 21.73 million tons in the first semester of 2025, driven by supply chain optimization and logistics sector strengthening. The company's consolidated revenue reached IDR 20.45 trillion, up 4% year-over-year, with a net profit of IDR 833.05 billion and EBITDA of IDR 2.2 trillion.

PT Gorontalo Minerals has reported a JORC resource estimate of 392 million tonnes with a grade of 0.49% Cu and 0.43 g/t Au, and targets earth mineral production by 2026. The company has obtained construction production permits and is committed to empowering local communities through employee recruitment, suppliers, and business-to-business collaborations.

Indonesia is set to expand its coal mining capacity by 31 million tons per year, with 94% of new projects producing thermal coal for domestic power generation and export markets. However, this expansion poses economic risks and contributes to climate change, with estimated methane emissions equivalent to 1.3 billion tons of CO₂e annually.

PT Timah Tbk has set a tin metal production target of 21,545 metric tons by December 2025, with the company working to optimize production volume and increase resources to meet the target. The company's tin metal production in the first half of 2025 was 6,870 metric tons, down 29% compared to the same period in the previous year, with the average price of tin metal cash settlement price on the London Metal Exchange (LME) in the first semester of 2025 at USD 32,115.77 per metric ton, up 9.6% compared to the same period in the previous year.

PT RMK Energy Tbk (RMKE) reported a 3.5% year-on-year growth in service revenue, driven by increased operational efficiency, despite a 53.5% decline in overall operating revenue due to weakening coal sales. The company maintained profitability with a net profit of IDR 87.6 billion and a debt-to-equity ratio of 0.16 times, demonstrating its commitment to financial stability.

PT Mineral Industri Indonesia (MIND ID) reported a 74.61% increase in revenue to IDR 44.16 trillion in 1H 2025, driven by its efforts to strengthen its business lines and expand into mining and mineral downstream sectors. Despite a 33.47% decrease in net profit, the company managed to strengthen its assets and reaffirmed its commitment to developing sustainable projects that support national economic growth.

President Prabowo Subianto aims to make Indonesia an economically independent country, targeting 8% annual economic growth rate, and has launched several initiatives such as sovereign fund Danantara and rural cooperatives to boost growth. The government's efforts are expected to add at least $80 billion to national foreign exchange reserves and generate a 1-2 percentage point increase in annual growth.

The certified gold price on Logam Mulia's official website decreased by Rp 2,000 per gram to Rp 1,946,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 1,000 per gram to Rp 1,792,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices on the platform.

PT Bank Jago Tbk achieved the highest net profit growth of 154% year-on-year, reaching IDR 127 billion in Semester I-2025, surpassing its previous record. This significant growth marks a turnaround for the bank, which reported a net profit of IDR 50 billion in the same period last year.

PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI) reported a 24.3% year-over-year growth in its sustainable credit portfolio, reaching Rp 185.2 trillion by the end of June 2025. This growth outpaced the overall credit growth in the banking sector, highlighting the increasing focus on environmental, social, and governance (ESG) considerations in lending.

PT Triputra Agro Persada Tbk (TAPG) successfully maintained its production in the first half of 2025, which is expected to drive future growth. The company reported a net profit of IDR 1.69 trillion, up 75.3% year-over-year, with revenue from contracts with customers reaching IDR 5.50 trillion, a 35.11% increase from the same period in 2024.

Zheng Yuan Investment Pte. Ltd. through PT Batu Investasi Indonesia has acquired 493,088,500 shares, equivalent to 61.69% of PT Tourindo Guide Indonesia Tbk's (PGJO) fully paid and issued capital. The acquisition price is below the current market price of PGJO's shares, and a tender offer is expected to be held soon.

Era Mandiri Cemerlang TBK (ERAA) shares have surged 87.3% in three consecutive trading days, with a 34.92% increase on July 30, followed by 23.53% and 12.38% increases on July 31 and August 1, respectively. The stock's trading volume has also seen a significant jump, breaking out of its stagnant level of around Rp 60 per share since June 16, 2025.

Intiland Development (DILD) reported a 11.02% year-over-year (YoY) decline in revenue to IDR 1.21 trillion in 1H 2025, but managed to reduce its cost of goods sold and direct expenses by 16.8% to IDR 791.34 billion, resulting in a 3.03% growth in gross profit to IDR 424.64 billion.

The Indonesian startup industry is facing a major crisis as several startups have been accused of fraud, resulting in financial losses for investors and the ecosystem. Recently, the South Jakarta District Attorney's Office detained several executives, including a director of MDI Ventures, a subsidiary of PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk, and former executives of PT Tani Group Indonesia, which owns agricultural startup Tanihub.

The Indonesian fintech P2P lending industry has been plagued by default cases in recent years, with companies such as Investree, Modal Rakyat, Koin P2P, and Tanifund experiencing payment failures. The latest case involves Akseleran, which is facing lawsuits from lenders who have reported losses due to default.

The Indonesian government's decision to extend the 100% tax incentive for property purchases until the end of the year has been welcomed by the real estate industry, although it is deemed insufficient to boost sales among middle to lower-income buyers. The incentive, which eliminates the 10% value-added tax, is seen as a direct benefit for non-subsidized property buyers.

Cimory (CMRY) reported a positive performance in the first half of 2025, with sales reaching IDR 5.15 trillion as of June 30, 2025, a 16.59% year-over-year increase from IDR 4.41 trillion in the same period last year. The company's strong sales growth is a testament to its successful business strategy.

Bank Woori Saudara's net profit plummeted 74.8% year-on-year to IDR 82.66 billion in the first half of 2025, despite a 4.15% increase in net interest income to IDR 871 billion. The bank's poor performance was mainly due to a surge in provisioning costs, rather than a decline in revenue.

Out of 30 LQ45 index companies that have released their financial reports for Semester I-2025, only 13 companies reported profit growth, while 17 companies experienced a decline in net profit. The reports highlight a mixed performance among Indonesia's top companies.

The Indonesian Ministry of Trade has officially transferred its authority to regulate and supervise digital assets, including cryptocurrencies, to the Financial Services Authority (OJK). This move is expected to increase public interest in cryptocurrencies and accelerate their adoption, according to Reku's Chief Compliance Officer Robby.

DANA, an Indonesian digital wallet platform, has reduced gambling-related activity on its platform by 80% through its predictive fraud detection system, which continuously updates risk parameters and typology analysis to stay ahead of illegal patterns. The company's efforts have been praised by regulators, with the country's financial intelligence unit projecting Indonesia's online gambling economy to reach US$73 billion by year-end.
