Several Indonesian startups, including Investree, eFishery, and Tanihub, are under scrutiny for alleged unhealthy business practices, such as money laundering and fraudulent accounting. This has raised concerns about the weak governance of digital startups in Indonesia, with experts attributing the pressure to achieve quick profitability as a major contributor to these issues.

Indonesian banks' profit from securities investments surged 117% in the first four months of 2025, driven by gains from selling and holding securities, while net interest income only grew 4.1% year-on-year. Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) and CIMB Niaga reported significant gains from securities investments, with BRI's profit from securities sales rising 39.6% to IDR 1.19 trillion.

The Indonesian government aims to attract IDR 13,000 trillion in investments from 2025-2029, with the mineral and coal downstreaming project expected to draw in USD 20 billion or IDR 327.67 trillion. Holding Pertambangan Mining Industry Indonesia's corporate secretary, Pria Utama, emphasized the company's consistent role in driving national mining downstreaming.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources stated that the domestic market obligation for coal in the first semester of 2025 is mainly allocated for power generation and smelting, with 50% of the total volume dedicated to power plants and the remaining for smelting and other industrial sectors. This allocation is expected to support the country's energy and industrial development.

Indonesia's crude palm oil (CPO) export prospects are expected to improve with the Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, which targets to export 1 million tons of CPO to the EU per year without tariffs. This development, along with the US's 19% import tariff on Indonesian products, is seen as a positive move for the industry.

The Indonesian government has extended the 100% tax incentive for the property sector until the end of 2025, which is expected to boost the performance of property issuers in the second semester of 2025. Meanwhile, Bank Indonesia is still open to the possibility of lowering interest rates further this year.

The Indonesia Stock Market (IDX) closed at 7,537 on Friday, up 0.71% from the previous day, and is expected to be influenced by the financial performance of listed companies in the first semester of 2025. Ciputra Development (no ticker provided) is recommended with a target price of IDR 900.

Real Estate Indonesia views the government's decision to extend the 100% tax incentive for property as a positive move, but notes that current regulations are not sufficient to boost medium to low-end property development. The incentive allows non-subsidized property buyers to pay only the net property price without the additional 10% tax.

Several Indonesian startups, including Investree, eFishery, and Tanihub, are under scrutiny for allegedly engaging in unhealthy business practices, such as money laundering and fraudulent accounting. This has raised concerns about the weak governance of digital startups in Indonesia, with experts attributing the pressure to achieve profitability as a major contributing factor.

Shares of Era Mandiri Cemerlang TBK (ERAA) have risen sharply for three consecutive days, with a total gain of 87.30% to IDR 85 per share. The stock's trading volume has also surged, breaking out of its stagnant level of around IDR 60 per share since June 16, 2025.

Zheng Yuan Investment Pte. Ltd. through PT Batu Investasi Indonesia has acquired 493,088,500 shares, equivalent to 61.69% of PT Tourindo Guide Indonesia Tbk's (PGJO) fully paid and issued capital. The acquisition price is lower than the current market price of PGJO shares, and a tender offer is expected to be held soon.

PT Triputra Agro Persada Tbk (TAPG) reported a net profit of IDR 1.69 trillion in 1H 2025, a 75.3% year-over-year (YoY) increase, driven by a 35.11% YoY growth in revenue from contracts with customers to IDR 5.50 trillion. This strong performance is expected to be a catalyst for future growth.

The growth of sustainable banking credit in Indonesia has been robust this year, with PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk's sustainable portfolio reaching Rp 185.2 trillion by the end of June 2025, representing a 24.3% increase compared to the same period last year. This growth outpaces the overall credit growth of banks in the country.

The Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA) includes a special protocol recognizing Indonesian crude palm oil (CPO) as meeting sustainability standards, which will benefit all parties involved and potentially boost Indonesia's exports to the European market. However, the agreement's benefits may be short-term due to the EU's Deforestation Regulation, which requires products sold in the EU to be free from deforestation.

The Financial Services Authority (OJK) plans to establish standardized treatment for dormant bank accounts, ensuring financial system stability and legal certainty for both banks and customers. The move comes amid public debate over blocking dormant accounts, which has resulted in a 70% reduction in online gambling deposits and a significant decrease in transaction frequency.

Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) has signed a term loan facility agreement and revolving credit facility agreement totaling USD 500 million with a syndicate of lenders, including DBS Bank Ltd. and United Overseas Bank Limited, to be used for general corporate purposes. The facilities have a tenure of 60 months from the agreement date, with an interest rate calculated based on the term SOFR reference rate plus an aggregate margin.

The price of gold bars certified by PT Aneka Tambang (ANTAM) remains unchanged at IDR 1.948 million per gram, with a buyback price of IDR 1.793 million per gram, resulting in a difference of IDR 155,000 per gram. If investors had bought gold a year ago, they would have gained 25.30% if they sold it today.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has started using biodiesel, a blend of 35% palm oil and 65% fossil fuel, to reduce gas emissions from its locomotives. As of last year, there were 47 biodiesel refueling locations for KAI's locomotives.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has suspended trading of PT Wahana Interfood Nusantara Tbk (WIIN) and PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk (BUVA) due to significant price increases suspected to be driven by speculation. The suspension is effective from the first trading session on Friday, following a review by market observers.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) reported a 1.31% year-over-year decline in net profit to IDR 600.46 billion, accompanied by a 3.57% YoY decrease in sales to IDR 1.82 trillion. All segments of the company's sales weakened, including pharmaceutical products, which fell from IDR 66.19 billion to IDR 62.85 billion.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) is set to reactivate the investor residence code in September 2025, with technical preparations and testing currently underway. The code, which is currently in the trial phase, aims to provide more detailed information on investor data.

PT HM Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) has strengthened its market leadership in Indonesia's tobacco industry, with a 0.8% increase in market share to 31% in the first semester of 2025. Despite declining purchasing power and consumer shifts to lower-priced products, Sampoerna has maintained its dominance in the national tobacco industry.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) reported a 1.31% year-over-year (YoY) decline in net profit to IDR 600.46 billion, accompanied by a 3.57% YoY decrease in sales to IDR 1.82 trillion. The company's pharmaceutical product sales also fell 4.9% YoY to IDR 62.85 billion.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) will reactivate the investor residence code in September 2025, with the current process still in the testing phase. The exchange is currently preparing the technical aspects and testing before the reactivation.

PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure Tbk's (TBIG) performance prospects are seen as challenging, with its first half 2025 performance slowing down, reflected in the consensus of analysts who do not give a buy recommendation, with a target price of IDR 1,808.64 per share. Out of 17 analysts, 14 recommend holding and 3 recommend selling.

PT Steel Pipe Industry Indonesia Tbk (ISSP) reported a net profit of IDR 213.36 billion in Semester I-2025, a 1.80% increase compared to the same period last year. Despite a 6.45% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 2.61 trillion, the company managed to boost its net profit.

Danatara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, has secured $10 billion in unsecured credit lines from 11 foreign banks, including DBS, HSBC, Standard Chartered, and UOB, as well as $7 billion in equity investments from sovereign wealth funds, to support its investment strategy. The fund's ability to secure these investments at a borrowing rate comparable to the government's 10-year bond yield of 6.58% has raised questions about the strategic merit of taking on such debt and its potential impact on long-term financial returns.

PT Erajaya Swasembada Tbk (ERAA) saw a significant revenue increase in Q2-2025, driven by the sales of iPhone 16 series in Indonesia, contributing Rp 27.81 trillion or 79.35% to its total revenue of Rp 35.04 trillion. The company's mobile phone and tablet segment was the main contributor to its revenue growth.

PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure Tbk's (TBIG) performance prospects are seen as challenging, with 14 analysts recommending 'hold' and 3 analysts recommending 'sell' due to its slow first half 2025 performance. The consensus target price is at IDR 1,808.64 per share.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) increased by Rp 47,000 per gram to Rp 1,948,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 47,000 per gram to Rp 1,793,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in the gold price at the Indonesian state-owned mining company.

Rumor has it that KKR & Co., a global investment firm from the US, is finalizing its decision to sell its stake in Nippon Indosari Corpindo (NIPP), a Indonesian bread maker company. The news was reported by DealStreet Asia, but the company's director, Indrayana, has yet to respond to requests for confirmation.

The Indonesian government has instructed state-owned enterprises (BUMN) and their subsidiaries not to distribute incentives, bonuses, or other forms of income to their commissioners. This decision is seen as a positive sentiment for the performance of BUMN.

PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk reported a strong performance in Semester I-2025, with INDF recording a 4% increase in net sales to Rp 59.84 trillion, up from Rp 57.30 trillion in the same period last year. The company's strong performance was driven by its consumer sector business.

Most listed companies affiliated with Prajogo Pangestu's business empire have released their performance reports, with varying results but mostly positive. PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk, for instance, reported a 49.22% increase in revenue to USD 462.11 million in the first semester of 2025, but its net profit dropped 93.43% year-on-year to USD 1.94 million.

Inpex Corporation has completed the tender for the front end engineering design of the Abadi LNG project, with the tender feed already signed. The project is expected to be completed by the end of 2025, with tenders for procurement of goods and services to follow in 2026.

PT Panorama Sentrawisata Tbk (PANR) reported a 19.2% increase in revenue to IDR 1.8 trillion in Semester I 2025, driven by a 41% jump in net profit to IDR 40.9 billion. The company also successfully reduced its bank debt by 67% to IDR 163 billion, improving its debt-to-equity ratio to 0.15x from 0.42x.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources will announce the export tariffs for coal and gold in August 2025, following an agreement with the Ministry of Finance. The decision is expected to impact the country's mining industry and related stocks.

The Indonesian government has extended the 100% tax incentive for the property sector, which is expected to boost sales in the second half of 2025. This stimulus is seen as a positive move for the sector, with the Chairman of the Indonesian Real Estate Broker Association, Clement Francis, predicting an increase in buying interest from consumers.

Trimitra Trans Persada Tbk (TRTP) has successfully conducted its initial public offering (IPO), raising IDR 140.81 billion from the sale of 563 million new shares at IDR 250 per share. The logistics company plans to use the funds to support its expansion plans.

The ongoing Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show 2025 is expected to boost car sales, which have been affected by low consumer purchasing power, with multifinance companies offering financing options and promotions to attract customers. The event is seen as an opportunity for multifinance companies to increase their sales and revenue.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new policy on remuneration for directors and commissioners of state-owned enterprises and their subsidiaries, aiming to improve company performance. The policy requires remuneration to be based on the company's actual financial performance, which is expected to boost the profitability of state-owned companies.

PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk reported strong performance in Semester I-2025, with INDF recording a 4% increase in net sales to Rp 59.84 trillion, up from Rp 57.30 trillion in the same period last year. The company's strong performance was driven by its consumer sector business.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced that it will reveal the export tariff rates for coal and gold in August 2025, following an agreement with the Ministry of Finance. The decision is expected to impact the country's mining industry and related stocks.

PT Panorama Sentrawisata Tbk (PANR) reported a 19.2% increase in revenue to IDR 1.8 trillion in Semester I 2025, driven by strong performance in the tourism sector. The company's net profit also surged 41% to IDR 40.9 billion, supported by a 67% reduction in bank debt to IDR 163 billion.

Trimitra Trans Persada Tbk (TRTP) has become the 20th listed company on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) in 2025, raising IDR 140.81 billion from its initial public offering (IPO) of 563 million new shares at IDR 250 per share. The logistics company plans to use the funds for expansion.

Most listed companies affiliated with Prajogo Pangestu's business empire have released their performance reports, with varying results but mostly positive. PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk, for example, reported a 49.22% increase in revenue to USD 462.11 million in the first semester of 2025, but its net profit fell 93.43% year-on-year to USD 1.94 million.

Indonesia's palm oil exports rose 24.81% year-on-year to $11.43 billion in the first half of 2025, driven by increased market access to the European Union. The country shipped around 11 million tons of palm oil over the six-month period, with an average price of $1,053.03 per ton, up 22.21% year-on-year.

The Indonesian government aims to attract USD 20 billion in investment from downstream projects in the mineral and coal sector, which is expected to contribute significantly to the country's total investment target of IDR 13,000 trillion between 2025-2029. The government has offered various incentives, including tax facilities and support for machinery and capital expenditure, to support the development of large-scale projects such as gasification and methanol production.

PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk (BRMS) reported a solid performance in Semester I-2025, with a 97.27% year-over-year increase in sales to USD 120.84 million, driven by the potential development of its mining assets. The company's strong results are expected to continue, providing growth opportunities for the future.

Petrosea (PTRO) has signed a conditional share sale purchase agreement to acquire all shares of HBS Limited for a total transaction value of AUD 40 million, or approximately USD 25.76 million, as part of its business development strategy to expand internationally and diversify into the gold and mineral sector. The acquisition is expected to strengthen the company's performance and create operational synergy between Indonesia and Papua New Guinea, allowing HBS Group to expand its service scope and offer more comprehensive solutions to the mining industry.

PT Astra International Tbk acquired 313,271,000 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, increasing its holding from 1,233,240,000 to 1,536,595,000 shares, representing a 2.04% increase in its ownership stake. The purpose of the transaction is for investment. This buyback may indicate the company's confidence in its future prospects and potentially boost investor sentiment.

Indonesian car owners pay up to 10 times more annual vehicle taxes than their Malaysian counterparts, discouraging middle-class consumers and weakening the domestic automotive market. Toyota Astra Motor's Avanza model, for example, has an annual ownership tax of Rp 5 million in Indonesia, compared to Rp 500,000 in Malaysia, leading to a significant price difference.

Claudia Ingkiriwang, Ellen Yanury Luassa, Ing-Ing Cindy Eva, Adi Putera Widjaja, Henri Widodo and PT Surya Fajar Capital Tbk sold 493,088,500 shares of PT Tourindo Guide Indonesia Tbk. (PGJO.JK) on August 1, 2025, reducing their holding from 493,088,500 shares to 0 shares. The transaction was done for the purpose of selling shares.

The Indonesian government's mandatory B40 biodiesel program has reduced diesel fuel imports, saving the country Rp147.5 trillion in foreign exchange, and has also contributed to a reduction in greenhouse gas emissions. The program, which aims to increase the use of biodiesel to 50% by 2026, has also created employment opportunities for over 14,000 people and added value to crude palm oil.

The Indonesian government's mandatory B40 biodiesel program has reduced diesel fuel imports, saving the country Rp147.5 trillion in foreign exchange, and has also contributed to a reduction of 41.46 million tons of CO2e per year. The program, which aims to increase the use of biodiesel to 50% by 2026, has also created employment opportunities for over 14,000 people and added value to crude palm oil of Rp20.9 trillion.

The US has imposed a 19% tariff on Indonesian goods, a 13 percentage point drop from the previously announced rate, in exchange for trade concessions including the elimination of tariffs on US goods and major energy purchases. The new tariff regime will take effect on August 7, with Indonesia's neighbors such as Malaysia, Thailand, and the Philippines also facing similar tariffs.

The certified gold price at PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) remained stable at IDR 1.901 million per gram, while the buyback price was still at IDR 1.746 million per gram. This information is available on the official website of Logam Mulia, a subsidiary of PT Aneka Tambang.

Crude palm oil (CPO) stocks have seen a significant surge in price, driven by positive H1-2025 performance and strengthening CPO prices. PT Pradiksi Gunatama Tbk (PRAD) and PT Austindo Nusantara Jaya Tbk (ANJT) have seen their stock prices jump by 236.08% and 149.65%, respectively, to IDR 1,425 and IDR 1,785 per share.

The Indonesian government has officially implemented a 0.25% tax on gold bullion purchases through bullion banks, as stated in the Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 51/2025. Despite this new policy, business players such as Pegadaian and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BSDE) believe it will not deter people from investing in gold.

PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (ALFA) reported a positive performance in the first half of 2025, with a net profit of IDR 1.88 trillion, up 4.98% from IDR 1.79 trillion in the same period last year. The company's financial report highlights its strong retail business, contributing to the increase in net profit.

PT Vale Indonesia Tbk's (INCO) performance improved in Q2-2025, driven by a 9% increase in nickel production to 18,557 tons, up from 17,027 tons in Q1-2025. The company's nickel matte production was the main factor contributing to the improvement.

The Indonesian government is set to provide credit for the housing sector to achieve its target of 3 million units per year, with the Minister of Housing and Settlements stating that the housing credit regulation is ready to be signed. This move is expected to boost the housing sector and support the government's megaproject.

Major private banks in Indonesia reported growth in net profit, while state-owned banks experienced a decline in profit due to thin net interest income and increasing provision burdens. Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) and Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) saw their profits decline by 11.5% and 5.6% year-on-year, respectively.

PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) released its financial report for the first semester of 2025, reporting a net sales of Rp 18.2 trillion, a 4.4% year-over-year decline. However, the company saw a 13.1% growth in sales compared to the second semester of 2024.

The US government is set to impose a 19% tariff on Indonesian products starting August 1, 2025, down from the initial plan of 32%. The Indonesian government is still negotiating to reduce the tariff for certain export products, citing that neighboring countries such as Malaysia and Singapore will face lower tariffs of 15% and 10%, respectively.

Triputra Agro Persada (TPAG) reported a 35.11% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 5.50 trillion in 1H 2025, driven by contracts with customers, resulting in a 75.31% surge in net profit to IDR 1.69 trillion as of June 30, 2025. The strong performance was seen across most subsidiaries under the Triputra Group.

Bank Mandiri's economist, Andry Asmoro, predicts Indonesia's trade surplus to decrease to USD 3.32 billion in June 2025, lower than the USD 4.3 billion surplus in May. The decline is attributed to an increase in imports from China.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new tax regulation, effective today, imposing a 0.21% final income tax on crypto and bullion transactions, up from the previous 0.1-0.2% range. This move aims to boost tax revenue and is outlined in the Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 50/2025.

The increasing use of digital technology has benefited several general insurance companies in Indonesia, with digital channels contributing 0.3% to total premiums in Q1-2023 and 0.4% in the first three months of 2024. Despite the small proportion, the digital channel has provided a business opportunity for insurers to target a wider market amid economic uncertainty.

PT Sentul City Tbk's performance is expected to improve following the acquisition of its land by Genting Plantations Bhd's subsidiary, with a total value of IDR 2.05 trillion. The acquisition involves two plots of land, one with an area of 80 hectares worth IDR 1.76 trillion and another with an area of 72 hectares worth IDR 288 billion.

PT Vale Indonesia Tbk's (INCO) performance improved in Q2-2025, driven by a 9% increase in nickel production to 18,557 tons, up from 17,027 tons in Q1-2025. The company's nickel matte production was the main factor contributing to the improvement.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new tax regulation, increasing the final income tax on crypto transactions to 0.21%, as stated in the Minister of Finance Regulation 50 of 2025. This move aims to boost tax revenue, with the previous tax rate ranging from 0.1% to 0.2%.

The US government is set to impose a 19% tariff on Indonesian products starting August 1, 2025, down from the initial plan of 32%. The Indonesian government is still negotiating to reduce the tariff for certain export products, citing that neighboring countries such as Malaysia and Singapore will face lower tariffs of 15% and 10%, respectively.

PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (ALFI) reported a positive performance in the first half of 2025, with a net profit of IDR 1.88 trillion, up 4.98% from IDR 1.79 trillion in the same period last year. The company's financial report showed an increase in profit, driven by its retail business.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) declined 0.87% to 7,484 on Thursday, driven by profit-taking, poor financial performance of several listed companies, and technical conditions. Foreign investors recorded a net sell of IDR 1.26 trillion, according to Alrich Paskalis Tambolang, Equity Research Analyst at Phintraco Sekuritas.

The IDX closed July 2025 with a 0.87% decline to 7,484.34, but still accumulated an 8.04% gain in the past month. Head Research at Kiwoom Sekuritas, Liza Camelia Suryanata, warned that the IDX may still be pressured by external factors, including the implementation of US President Donald Trump's tariff policy starting August 1, 2025.

Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison (ISAT) reported a 3.10% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 27.11 trillion and a 14.6% year-over-year decline in net profit to IDR 2.33 trillion in the first half of 2025. The company's financial performance was affected by various factors, leading to a decline in its revenue and profitability.

Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur (IDX: INDF) reported a 56% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR 5.54 trillion in the first half of 2025, driven by reduced foreign exchange losses. The company's operating profit margin remained strong at 22.5%, despite a 5% decline in earnings before interest and tax to IDR 8.48 trillion.

A new report reveals that Indonesian banks have financed the coal sector with over $7.2 billion between 2021 and 2024, with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) being the largest contributor with $3.2 billion. The report highlights the contradiction between the government's ambitious renewable energy targets and its continued support for the coal industry, which poses significant risks to the banks involved and the country's long-term environmental sustainability.

The Indonesian Nickel Miners Association (APNI) has urged the government to implement production control and national environmental, social governance standards to address the oversupply of nickel, which has led to declining prices and shrinking margins for upstream industry players. APNI also advocates for a review of the national nickel industry's development direction to ensure its long-term viability and competitiveness.

The Indonesian Ministry of Transportation aims to secure Rp853 trillion in private sector funding to extend the country's railway network from 6,461 kilometers to 10,524 kilometers by 2030, with key projects including 1,200 kilometers of new track in Kalimantan and 100 kilometers in Papua. The plan also includes upgrading railway rolling stock, with a target of 5,314 locomotives and 62,542 carriages by 2030.

The influx of Chinese trucks into Indonesia has triggered unhealthy competition in the commercial vehicle sector, particularly in mining operations, and poses a threat to the country's net-zero emission target. Local truck manufacturers such as Hino (HINO.IJ) and Isuzu (ISUZU.IJ) are struggling to compete with Chinese trucks due to their lower prices and perceived adequate quality.

PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk (SSIA) has seen its stock price surge 132.14% since the start of the year, prompting BRI Danareksa Sekuritas to downgrade its recommendation from 'buy' to 'hold' due to limited upside potential. The stock currently trades at IDR 2,600 per share.

PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGeo) stock price dropped 2.93% to IDR 1,655 per share on Thursday after releasing its Q2 2025 financial report, which showed unsatisfactory performance. The report was released on July 29, 2025, just before the stock market closed, causing the stock to correct from its all-time high of IDR 1,855 on the same day.

Indonesia has secured interest from a Chinese investor for its coal gasification project, worth around $1.2 billion, which could help reduce the country's reliance on liquefied petroleum gas and make energy prices more affordable. The project, which has been on the government's wishlist, has gained momentum with the submission of pre-feasibility studies to sovereign fund Danantara, with a total value of Rp 164 trillion.

According to a recent report, domestic banking funding for coal entrepreneurs in Indonesia has reached USD 7.2 billion from 2021-2024, amidst difficulties in securing project funding from international banks. This trend highlights the significant role of domestic banks in supporting the coal industry in Indonesia.

PT Timah Tbk (TINS) has reported a net profit of IDR 300.07 billion in the first half of 2025, achieving 93% of its target, driven by a 9.6% increase in tin metal prices and a 177% year-on-year increase in Indonesia's exports. The company's financial performance shows solid results, with key financial ratios including a quick ratio of 63.6%, a current ratio of 204.1%, and an operating profit of IDR 380 billion.

Hapsoro purchased 757,314,360 shares of PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk (BUVA.JK) at IDR 40 per share, increasing their holding from 871,690,099 shares to 1,629,004,459 shares. The purpose of the transaction is for the purchase of shares.

PT Mitra Sawit Baru, a shareholder, sold 1,893,285,900 shares of PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk (BUVA.JK) at a price of IDR 40 per share, reducing its holding from 1,893,285,900 shares to 0 shares. The purpose of the transaction was to sell shares.

The IDX Carbon trading market has seen limited activity since its launch in September 2023, with only 1,703 tons of CO2e traded in the first half of 2025, valued at IDR 157.23 million. The market's slow growth is attributed to the global shift away from carbon credits from the energy sector.

Indonesia aims to increase its renewable energy share to 70% by 2030, with a roadmap to add 42.6 GW of renewable capacity, including solar, hydro, wind, and geothermal energy. The country requires massive funding of $2.4 trillion to achieve its net-zero emissions goal by 2060, with investment in renewable energy reaching $1.77 billion in 2024.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) reported a consolidated net profit of Rp 26.5 trillion in the first half of 2025, driven by its strategy to boost low-cost funding and strengthen operational fundamentals. The bank's total assets rose 6.5% year-on-year to Rp 2,106.4 trillion, while third-party funds increased 6.7% to Rp 1,482.1 trillion.

Bank Central Asia (BCA) reported a strong first half 2025 performance, with consolidated loan growth reaching 12.9% year-on-year to Rp 959 trillion and net profit rising 8% year-on-year to Rp 29 trillion. The bank's credit growth was well-distributed across segments, including corporations, SMEs, and consumers, with asset quality remaining healthy and loan-at-risk ratio improving to 5.7%.

Indonesia aims to increase its renewable energy capacity to 35% by 2034, with a roadmap to add 42.6 gigawatts of renewable capacity, including solar, hydro, wind, and geothermal power. The country requires enormous funding of around $2.4 trillion between 2022 and 2060 to achieve net-zero emissions, with recent investment performance showing progress, including a 143.4% increase in renewable energy investment in 2024.

Minister of Investment and Deregulation, Rosan Roeslani, reported an 11.5% year-over-year growth in investment realization in Q2 2025, reaching IDR 477.7 trillion. The investment growth also led to an increase in job absorption, according to the minister.

The Indonesian Venture Capital Association (Amvesindo) has expressed concern over legal cases involving several venture capital companies, including MDI Ventures, whose director Donald Wihardja is accused of corruption and money laundering. The association is worried about the impact of these cases on the country's startup ecosystem.

The certified gold price at Logam Mulia's official website decreased by IDR 17,000 per gram to IDR 1,901,000 per gram, while the buyback price dropped by IDR 18,000 per gram to IDR 1,746,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices at the state-owned mining company.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has gained attention from investors following its acquisition of Fortuna International Inc. from Repsol E&P, S.à.r.l., which is expected to boost the company's performance.

PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk (DSNG) reported a 80% year-on-year net profit growth to IDR 915 billion in the first half of 2025, driven by increased sales volume and average selling price of crude palm oil. The company's revenue from the segment reached IDR 5.3 trillion, up 34% year-on-year, supported by a 3.9% year-on-year increase in fresh fruit bunch production to 1.1 million tons.

The Indonesian government will introduce a new tax on crypto transactions starting August 1, 2025, replacing the previous regulation, PMK No. 68/2022. The new regulation, Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 50/2025, aims to impose taxes on crypto asset transactions.

Several private banks in Indonesia reported positive growth in the first half of 2025, but their fundamentals remain weak, with profit growth mainly driven by a decrease in provisioning costs. Bank Central Asia (BCA) was an exception, with its net profit growing 8% year-on-year to IDR 29 trillion in the January-June period.

PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) achieved a positive performance in Semester I-2025, driven by the positive sentiment of rising gold prices throughout the year. The company's revenue reached Rp 15.05 trillion, up 82.6% year-over-year from Rp 8.24 trillion in Semester I-2024.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) weakened by 68.01 points or 0.89% to 7,549, driven by profit-taking after a three-week rally. Foreign investors also recorded a net sell of IDR 635.08 billion, as the market awaits the release of semester I 2025 earnings reports.

PT Hatten Bali TBK (HATT) reported a 6% increase in sales to IDR 130.77 billion in Semester I-2025, but its profit was eroded by 14.7% to IDR 21.01 billion due to rising sales expenses. The company aims to improve its performance in the second half of 2025.

The property sector, particularly housing, continues to face pressure in the first half of 2025, with Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) disbursing only IDR 18.3 trillion in mortgage loans from January to June 2025, an 8.04% decrease from the same period in 2024. This decline indicates a challenging market for property developers and related industries.

Danantara's CEO, Rosan Roeslani, announced a funding scheme for six coal gasification projects worth IDR 164 trillion, which is part of the 18 hilirisasi projects with a total investment value of USD 38.63 billion or IDR 618.3 trillion. The funding will not only rely on state-owned enterprises (BUMN) and Danantara, but also open to private companies to support the program.

PT Pertamina Hulu Energi (PHE) is set to absorb oil produced from thousands of community wells starting August 2025, as announced by Director of Strategic Planning, Portfolio, and Commercial Edi Karyanto. The company is ready to purchase oil from identified community wells, which is expected to boost the country's oil production.

The Indonesian government's plan to increase online transportation tariffs by 8-15% has been met with criticism, with Maxim Indonesia (MAXI) arguing that it may not address the root issue of driver income and could burden consumers. The plan is a response to driver protests, but its effectiveness in improving driver welfare is uncertain.

Due to plummeting global nickel prices and declining demand from China, 28 production lines from several nickel smelters in Indonesia have ceased operations, with four smelter plants shutting down completely. This development is expected to have significant implications for Indonesia's nickel industry and economy.

The decline in coal prices, down 7.78% to $115.50 per ton, is expected to impact the performance of mining contractors and service providers. This trend may affect the stock prices of companies operating in the mining sector.

Pegadaian's gold business has dominated the company's performance, with its gold deposit service reaching 1.3 tons as of July 15, 2025, nearing its target for the year. The company is confident in achieving its target, driven by the strong contribution of its bullion business.

MitraTel (MTel) reported a 2.17% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 4.59 trillion in the first half of 2025, according to its financial report as of June 30, 2025. The company's revenue growth was driven by its strong performance in the telecommunications sector.

The Deposit Insurance Agency (LPS) will implement a guarantee program in 2028, with a premium payment scheme similar to the banking industry, where insurance companies will pay premiums twice a year. The program's benefit limits and premium payments are expected to be similar to those in the banking sector.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has announced changes to the LQ45 index constituents, effective August 1, 2025, with PT Essa Industries Indonesia Tbk and PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk being eliminated from the index. Meanwhile, two new stocks will be added to the index, and several other LQ45 stocks are worth monitoring for potential upside.

PT Puradelta Lestari Tbk (DMAS) reported a 46.09% year-on-year decline in net profit to IDR 433.01 billion in H1 2025, affected by global uncertainty and its impact on the domestic market. The company, which develops the Deltamas industrial area in Cikarang, West Java, saw its financial performance deteriorate in the first half of the year.

PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk (HEAL) is expected to face challenges in the remaining year due to a declining trend in referrals to advanced healthcare facilities. According to CGS International analyst Jason Chandra, BPJS has limited referrals to FKRTL, which is a classification for all hospitals, resulting in a decrease from 9% in 2023 to 7% by the end of 2024.

BCA Digital's mobile banking app Blu has reached 3 million customers, with over 90% of its user base comprising Gen Zers and millennials, and total third-party funds exceeding IDR 11.7 trillion (USD 793 million). The app aims to promote financial literacy and maturity among young Indonesians, offering various youth-focused services such as Bluaccount Teens and Bluinvest.

Astra International (ASII) reported a 2% increase in net revenue to IDR 162.9 trillion in the first half of 2025, compared to the same period in 2024. However, the company's net profit was corrected during the same period.

PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) reported a positive performance in Semester I-2025, driven by the positive sentiment of rising gold prices throughout the year. The company's revenue reached Rp 15.05 trillion, surging 82.6% year-over-year from Rp 8.24 trillion in Semester I-2024.

Danantara's CEO, Rosan Roeslani, announced a funding scheme for six coal gasification projects worth IDR 164 trillion, which is part of the 18 hilirisasi projects with a total investment value of USD 38.63 billion or IDR 618.3 trillion. The funding is open to private companies, in addition to state-owned enterprises and Danantara, to support the program.

PT Pertamina Hulu Energi (PHE) is set to absorb oil produced from thousands of community wells starting August 2025, as announced by Director of Strategic Planning, Portfolio, and Commercial Edi Karyanto. The company is ready to purchase oil from identified community wells, which is expected to support the country's energy sector.

The Indonesian government will introduce a new tax on crypto transactions starting August 1, 2025, replacing the previous regulation, PMK No. 68/2022. The new regulation, outlined in the Minister of Finance's Regulation No. 50/2025, aims to impose taxes on crypto asset transactions.

Indonesia's government has drafted a grand design to develop its downstream sector across 28 commodities, requiring $618 billion in investments by 2040, which is expected to boost exports by $857.9 billion and create 3 million jobs. The program has already recorded Rp 280.8 trillion in investments between January and June 2025, with Rp 193.8 trillion going to minerals, mainly nickel and copper.

Indonesia's daily crude oil production has reached 608,000 barrels per day, surpassing the government's target of 605,000 barrels per day for the first time in 17 years. The country aims to increase its national crude output to 1 million barrels per day by 2030, with initiatives such as reactivating mature oil wells and easing investment requirements for domestic and foreign firms.

The mineral and coal sector has contributed Rp71 trillion to Indonesia's state revenue as of July 15, 2025, with the sector expected to reach a target of Rp254.49 trillion by the end of the year. Despite a decline in performance, the government is pushing for the use of low-emission technology in the sector to reduce carbon emissions.

The Trump administration’s new tariff on refined copper products, effective Friday, has pushed US copper prices down more than 17% as the market re‑prices against London benchmarks, while Chile’s Codelco praised the exclusion of cathodes and Freeport‑McMoRan said it will review the order. The move, part of a Section 232 investigation, is expected to hurt US mining firms like Freeport‑McMoRan, Hudbay Minerals, and Arizona Sonoran, but could benefit Chilean and Peruvian producers such as BHP’s Antofagasta mine.

PT Abadimukti Gunalestari, an insider, bought 27,962,100 shares of Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk (GPRA.JK) on July 30, 2025, increasing its holding from 2,548,027,020 to 2,575,989,120 shares. The transaction, worth IDR 4,223,832,000, was made for investment purposes.

Pertamina Hulu Energi, a subsidiary of Pertamina (PERT), is waiting for instructions from the energy ministry to develop the resource-rich Ambalat block with Malaysia, with the company possessing the technical and financial competence to carry out the project. The joint development plan is still in the exploratory stage, with discussions ongoing to determine the modalities and technicalities of the project.

Indonesia's geological agency revealed that only 20 out of 128 sedimentary basins are actively producing oil and gas, with the remaining basins lacking subsurface geological data. The government aims to accelerate data collection and auction 60 new oil and gas working areas between 2025 and 2026, targeting domestic oil production of 1 million barrels per day by 2030.

Baru Gold Corp. (TSE: BARU) has placed a reclamation bond for its Sangihe Gold Project in Indonesia, marking a significant step towards production operations, with a current market cap of C$30.13m. The company's overall score is impacted by its weak financial performance and valuation, but technical indicators and corporate events provide some optimism for potential future improvements if production commences as planned.

Pertamina Geothermal Energy (IDX: PTRG) is set to begin drilling its first exploration wells at the Ulubelu geothermal project in Lampung, a significant step in Indonesia's clean energy transition. The company has secured necessary permits and aims to reach a financial investment decision in the third year of development.

Indonesia's sovereign fund, Danatara, is planning to partner with American engineering company KBR to set up 17 modular refineries throughout Indonesia, with an estimated investment of $8 billion. The move is part of a recent tariff deal with Washington, which includes Indonesia's commitment to import $15 billion worth of American crude oil, liquefied petroleum gas, and gasoline.

Indonesia's palm oil industry is well-positioned to lead the biofuel revolution, driven by the government's ambitious biodiesel blending program and the sector's commitment to sustainable production practices. The country's palm oil producers are expected to benefit from growing demand for biofuels, particularly in India, and can reshape the industry's narrative by embedding sustainability into their brand.

Indonesia's palm oil industry is poised to lead the biofuel revolution with its sustainable production practices, leveraging its position as the world's largest producer of palm oil to meet the growing demand for cleaner energy. The government's ambitious biodiesel blending program and certification schemes are expected to drive growth and increase the value of the national palm oil produce.

Japanese-affiliated businesses have pledged to remain loyal to their Indonesian operations despite the US tariffs, with Japan being Indonesia's fifth-largest foreign investor with a total investment of $1.6 billion between January and June. Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign fund, has also signed a memorandum of understanding with Japan Bank for International Cooperation to jointly finance renewable energy projects.

The Jakarta South District Attorney's Office has detained three executives, including a director of MDI Venture, a subsidiary of PT Telkom Indonesia Tbk, and two former directors of PT Tani Group Indonesia, for alleged corruption and money laundering in the management of investment funds worth US$25 million. The case involves PT Metra Digital Investama and PT BRI Ventura Investama, which invested in PT Tani Group Indonesia between 2019-2023.

The property sector is expected to perform better in the second half of 2025, driven by positive sentiments such as the BI rate cut and the extension of the 100% tax incentive for property purchases below IDR 5 billion until December 2025. This is expected to boost consumer purchasing power, accelerate pre-sales, and positively impact property stock prices.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) increased by Rp 12,000 per gram to Rp 1,918,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 12,000 per gram to Rp 1,764,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

PT Radiant Utama Interinsco Tbk (RADI) has divested its stake in Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power to KS Orka and OTP Geothermal Pte. Ltd, ending speculation that PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGE) would acquire the stake.

PT Wijaya Karya Beton Tbk (WIKABETON) has successfully delivered its precast concrete lining product to the Metro Manila Subway Project in the Philippines, marking a strategic milestone in the company's expansion into the international market, particularly in Southeast Asia. This achievement demonstrates Wika Beton's capabilities in penetrating the global market.

Indonesia's downstream mineral industry attracted Rp 280.8 trillion in realized investment in the first half of 2025, accounting for nearly 30% of the country's total investment inflows. Foreign investors dominated the sector, accounting for 72.5% of total investment, with nickel industrialization playing a strategic role in electric vehicle battery production.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) shares have been placed under special surveillance by the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) due to its listing, following a similar pattern seen in PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk and PT Daaz Bara Lestari Tbk. CDIA has four days to rectify its situation and avoid being suspended from trading.

PT Mark Dynamics Indonesia Tbk (MARK) is diversifying its export markets to high-demand countries like China and India to mitigate market pressure. This strategy aims to ensure business sustainability and expand the company's customer base.

Tokocrypto, a cryptocurrency trading platform, reported a positive performance in the first half of 2025, with a transaction volume of USD 4 billion, a 10% increase compared to the same period last year. The growth is attributed to increasing investor interest in cryptocurrency assets, as well as the company's consistent product development strategy and improved user experience.

Foreign investors' selling pressure on Indonesian blue-chip stocks has started to ease, with a net purchase value of IDR 235.06 billion in the past week, focusing on stocks such as Astra International Tbk, Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk, Telkom Indonesia Tbk, and Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk. Although the value is not significant, it indicates a growing interest in Indonesian stocks.

With less than 10 days left in the offering period, the sales of SBR014 retail bonds have only reached 48.6% of the national target of IDR 10 trillion, equivalent to IDR 4.86 trillion. According to data from Bibit, one of the distribution partners, the two-year tenor bond has yet to meet half of its target.

The Indonesian government's recent decision to delegate the management of state-owned enterprises to a new agency has gone unnoticed by the public, who are preoccupied with political discussions. Meanwhile, the country's economy is affected, with PGeo's profit dropping by 28.37% despite a 0.53% increase in revenue.

PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGEOTH) reported a 0.53% year-over-year increase in revenue to USD 204.85 million in Semester I 2025. However, its net profit attributable to the parent entity decreased by 28.37% YoY to USD 68.96 million.

Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto and Malaysian Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim met at the Merdeka Palace, resulting in several agreements, including the facilitation of cross-border trade between the two countries. This agreement is expected to boost economic cooperation and investment between Indonesia and Malaysia.

The IDX Composite Index rose slightly by 0.04% to 7,617.91, with investors awaiting the outcome of the US-China trade meeting and the Federal Reserve's meeting. Meanwhile, investors are focusing on the financial reports of listed companies, with recommendations from analysts including Petrindo Jaya Kreasi (PJKA) with a target price of IDR 1,625.

S&P Global Ratings has affirmed Indonesia's sovereign credit rating at BBB with a stable outlook, reflecting strong international confidence in the country's macroeconomic stability and growth prospects. This rating is one level above the minimum investment grade, according to Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo.

Goto Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) is making progress towards profitability through optimization of incentives, with its on-demand service segment forming a strong business with sufficient scale to generate profits. The company has consistently shown improvement in adjusted EBITDA, according to OCBC Sekuritas equity analyst Gani.

The Indonesian government plans to build 17 small modular refineries across the country to increase oil production, following an agreement with the US to import crude oil. The refineries will be built in various regions, with the goal of reducing dependence on imported oil.

The Indonesian government has officially increased the final income tax rate on crypto asset transactions to 0.21% from the previous range of 0.1% to 0.2%, effective August 1, 2025. This policy is regulated under the Minister of Finance Regulation No. 50 of 2025.

The Indonesian government is set to launch a stimulus package in the second half of 2025 to drive national economic growth, which is expected to have a positive impact on several listed companies. The package includes programs such as discounts on airline tickets, toll fees, and train tickets to boost consumer spending during the Christmas and New Year holidays.

Tokocrypto, a cryptocurrency trading platform, reported a positive performance in the first half of 2025, with a transaction volume of USD 4 billion, a 10% increase compared to the same period last year. The growth is attributed to increasing investor interest in cryptocurrency assets, as well as the company's consistent product development strategy and improved user experience.

The Indonesian government plans to build 17 small modular refineries across the country to support the import of crude oil from the US, as part of the US-Indonesia trade agreement. The refineries will be scattered across various regions in Indonesia, according to Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto.

Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) has been placed under surveillance by the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) due to its poor financial performance, joining other companies such as PT Raharja Energi Cepu Tbk and PT Daaz Bara Lestari Tbk. CDIA has four days to improve its condition or face delisting risk.

PT Radiant Utama Interinsco Tbk (RADI) has divested its stake in Sorik Marapi Geothermal Power to KS Orka and OTP Geothermal Pte. Ltd, ending speculation that PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PERT) would acquire the stake.

Foreign investors' selling pressure on Indonesian blue-chip stocks has started to ease, with a net purchase value of IDR 235.06 billion in the past week, focusing on stocks such as Astra International Tbk, Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk, Telkom Indonesia Tbk, and Goto Gojek Tokopedia Tbk. Although the value is not significant, it marks a positive trend in foreign investors' sentiment towards the Indonesian stock market.

The Indonesian government has officially raised the final income tax rate on crypto transactions to 0.21% from the previous range of 0.1% to 0.2%, effective August 1, 2025. This policy is regulated under the Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 50 of 2025.

The festival, held on July 30-31, 2025, aims to promote the development of the country's energy sector, particularly in the areas of nickel, bauxite, and copper, and to support the growth of the national economy. The event also marks the launch of the Minerba One system, a digital platform designed to improve services for investors and mining operators.

A Chinese company has invested $100 million to build a coconut processing plant in Indonesia, supporting the government's efforts to boost local industrialization and reduce dependence on raw coconut exports. The investment is expected to increase added value and generate jobs for farmers and local communities.

The 34th National Working Consultation Meeting, themed 'Spirit of Indonesia Incorporated towards Golden Indonesia 2045', will unite business leaders to forge actionable solutions with the government to address economic challenges, with investment realization reaching Rp 477.7 trillion in Q2 2025, up from Rp 465.2 trillion in Q1.

United Tractors (UNTR) reported a 1.58% year-on-year decrease in coal production to 68.4 million tons in the first half of 2025, while its coal sales increased 3.4% year-on-year to 7.79 million tons. The company targets total coal sales of 13.7 million tons and gold sales of 240,000 geos for the entire year.

Chandra Daya Investasi (CDIA) shares extended their post-IPO rally, surging 9.91% to hit the upper trading limit at Rp 1,830, with a trading value of Rp 630.7 billion. The company's market capitalization has reached Rp 228.4 trillion, making it the 13th largest publicly listed company on the IDX market.

The US has delayed imposing a 19% tariff on Indonesian goods, which was set to take effect on August 1, as trade talks between the two countries are still ongoing. Indonesia's trade surplus with the US reached $5.44 billion from January to April 2025, up from $4.37 billion in the same period last year.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,906,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 8,000 per gram to Rp 1,752,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices at the Indonesian state-owned mining company.

On Monday, a significant transaction of 470 million shares of PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) worth IDR 3.22 trillion was recorded on the negotiation market, with a share price of IDR 6,850. The seller used DBS Vickers Sekuritas Indonesia, while the buyer used Maybank Sekuritas Indonesia as an intermediary.

PT Mayora Indah Tbk (MYOR) is expected to post a 10%-12% sales growth in 2025, driven by lower raw material costs and government support. The company's management has indicated a 'high-single digit' annual growth in sales for the second quarter of 2025.

PT Sinar Mas Multiartha Tbk's stock price has suddenly surged, reaching its highest level in five years, starting from July 24, 2025, after being stagnant due to illiquidity. The stock's price has jumped to a new high, marking a significant change in its recent performance.

Indonesia will reduce oil and gas imports from the Middle East and Asia as part of a new $15 billion energy import agreement with the United States, with plans to increase imports of liquefied petroleum gas (LPG) from the US. The deal is part of a broader reciprocal trade deal between Jakarta and Washington, which includes commitments to import US energy products and secure favorable tariff reductions.

PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk (MMLP) shares dropped 3.42% to IDR 565 after Astra's subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, announced its plan to acquire a majority stake in the company. The decline in share price is unusual, as acquisition announcements typically boost the target company's stock price.
Hapsoro, an insider, acquired 1,629,004,459 shares of PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk (BUVA.JK) on 2025-07-29, increasing their holding from 0 to 1,629,004,459 shares. The transaction type was a buy.

Damri (no ticker) has introduced a new electric bus route in Jakarta, partnering with PT Transportasi Jakarta and the Jakarta Provincial Government. The company aims to acquire 200 electric buses by the end of 2025, supporting the city's transition to an electric-based transportation system.

Pertamina Patra Niaga Jatimbalinus (PERTamina) has rerouted its fuel distribution due to the closure of the Gumitir road connecting Jember and Banyuwangi, East Java, which will last for two months until September 24, 2025. The company has prepared an alternative route to maintain energy distribution, affecting 8 gas stations in Bondowoso and 41 in Jember.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources reported that Indonesia's total coal reserves reached 31.96 billion tons by the end of 2024, based on data from 1,656 mining locations across 23 provinces. This data compilation is expected to provide insights for investors and stakeholders in the energy and mining sector.

The supply of gas for power plants and PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) is uncertain until the end of the year, with demand increasing for the power sector and gasification program. PLN Energi Primer Indonesia, a subsidiary of PT PLN, reported that the need for liquefied natural gas (LNG) has increased to 96 cargoes this year.

The Indonesian government is preparing to release a new economic stimulus package in the second half of 2023, which will include several incentives, but will not include a discount on electricity tariffs. This was confirmed by Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto.

The Indonesian government will utilize its budget surplus to support Red-White Cooperatives through four national banks, namely Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BSRI). The government will provide liquidity support to these banks through the State Budget (APBN) and the placement of government funds, including those from Bank Indonesia.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) has seen its stock price continue to rise, with its initial public offering (IPO) experiencing an oversubscription of 563.64 times, a record high in the Indonesian Stock Exchange's history. The company's strong investor confidence is attributed to the trust built by its affiliated company, Prajogo Pangestu, which has a track record of not selling its shares below the IPO price.

Digital banking stocks, such as Allo Bank (ALLO), have shown a positive trend in recent weeks, with Allo Bank's stock price increasing 12.89% in the last week to IDR 1,400 and surging 100% year-to-date. This is in line with the sector's encouraging financial performance despite the high cost of funds faced by the banking industry.

The Indonesian government is working to improve the online transportation ecosystem, including plans to increase tariffs for online motorcycle taxis and reduce commission fees for app providers. The Director General of Land Transportation at the Ministry of Transportation, Aan Suhana, stated that the government is finalizing regulations to create a fair and sustainable online transportation system.

PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI) reported a net profit of IDR 10.1 trillion in the first half of 2025, a 5.6% year-over-year decline. The bank's net interest income grew only 2.3% year-over-year, while non-interest income decreased 2.9% year-over-year, contributing to the decline in net profit.

The Indonesian government plans to issue kangaroo bonds, denominated in Australian dollars, and dim sum bonds, denominated in Chinese yuan, in the near future, with the kangaroo bond issuance expected to take place in August 2025 and the dim sum bond issuance in the fourth quarter of this year. This move aims to increase financing for the government.

The Financial Transaction Reporting and Analysis Center (PPATK) has announced a temporary suspension of dormant accounts, which are accounts that have not been used for transactions in 3-12 months, due to the discovery of many dormant accounts being misused. This move aims to prevent further misuse of such accounts.

PT Jhonlin Agro Raya Tbk (Jhonlin) reported a 18.66% year-over-year increase in sales to IDR 2.04 trillion as of June 30, 2025, from IDR 1.71 trillion in the same period in 2024. The company's strong performance in the first half of 2025 is a testament to its growth strategy.

PT Superior Prima Sukses Tbk (BLES) has inaugurated its fifth factory in Banjarnegara, Central Java, increasing its production capacity by 22% to 5.6 million m³ per year. The new factory has a production capacity of 1 million m³ of lightweight bricks per year, further solidifying BLES' position as a leading producer of lightweight bricks with its Blesscon and Superiore Block brands.

Bank Himbara is set to provide funding for Merah Putih cooperatives, a program initiated by President Prabowo Subianto, following the issuance of Minister of Finance Regulation No. 49/2025. The funding scheme is expected to support the development of village and sub-district cooperatives in Indonesia.

The majority of shariah stock indices in Indonesia surged until the end of trading on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on Monday, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) strengthening by 7.55% since the beginning of the year. This outperformed the general index, according to data from the IDX.

Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) reported a 12.2% year-on-year decline in net profit to IDR4.7 trillion in Q2 2025, citing lower-than-expected net interest margins. Despite this, the bank expects better loan growth in the second half of 2025, driven by its focus on wholesale loans, particularly in the small and medium enterprise (SME) segment.

PT Sinar Mas Multiartha Tbk's stock price has suddenly surged, breaking out of its illiquid trading pattern, and reaching its highest level in five years since July 24, 2025. The stock's price has jumped significantly, marking a significant turnaround for the company.

PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk (MMLP) shares dropped 3.42% to IDR 565 after Astra's subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, announced its plan to acquire a majority stake in the company. The decline in share price is unusual, as acquisition announcements typically boost the target company's stock price.

PT Mayora Indah Tbk (MYOR) is expected to post a 10%-12% sales growth in 2025, driven by declining raw material prices and government social assistance programs. The company's management guidance indicates a 'high-single digit' annual growth in sales for the second quarter of 2025.

The Indonesian government will utilize its budget surplus to support Red-White Cooperatives through four national banks, namely Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), Bank Mandiri (BMRI), and Bank Syariah Indonesia (BSRI). The government will provide liquidity support to these banks through the State Budget (APBN) and the placement of government funds, including those from Bank Indonesia.

The Indonesian government plans to issue kangaroo bonds, denominated in Australian dollars, and dim sum bonds, denominated in Chinese yuan, in the near future, with the kangaroo bond issuance expected to take place in August 2025 and the dim sum bond issuance in the fourth quarter. This move aims to increase financing for the government.

PT Pertamina Patra Niaga Jatimbalinus (PERTM) has rerouted its fuel distribution due to the closure of the Gumitir road connecting Jember and Banyuwangi, East Java, which will last for two months until September 24, 2025. The company has prepared an alternative route to maintain energy distribution, affecting 8 gas stations in Bondowoso and 41 in Jember.

Most of Indonesia's cacao plantations are over 20 years old and require rejuvenation, according to Soetanto Abdoellah, chairman of the Indonesian Cocoa Board. President Joko Widodo announced plans for nationwide cacao rejuvenation and replanting due to high global chocolate prices and increased demand.

Indonesia has achieved a significant investment of IDR 477.7 trillion in the first semester of 2025, marking an 11.5% increase compared to the previous year, with domestic investment contributing IDR 275.5 trillion and creating 665,764 new jobs. The investment is driven by sectors such as basic metals, transportation equipment, and green energy, with top contributors including Singapore, Hong Kong, China, the United States, and Malaysia.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has signed an implementing agreement with the UK's Foreign, Commonwealth & Development Office to develop a responsible and sustainable mineral transition in Indonesia, with a focus on nickel, cobalt, and lithium. The four-year program, worth £1.6 million, aims to strengthen policy and regulatory frameworks, enhance technical capacity, and promote international cooperation on clean energy and mineral transition.

Indonesia's Chief Economic Minister Airlangga Hartarto acknowledged that the country's limited special economic zones (SEZs) are hindering efforts to improve investment efficiency and reduce high logistics costs, which currently stand at around 12% of GDP. The government aims to bring logistics costs down to 8% by 2035 through regulatory reforms and expanded infrastructure investment in SEZs.

Indonesia and the European Union have reached a political agreement on the Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, which will allow Indonesia to export palm oil to the EU at 0% tariff, with a quota system in place. The agreement is expected to take effect next year, and will cover 80% of Indonesia's EU-bound exports, with the EU having imported around €17.5 billion worth of goods from Indonesia in 2024.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk allocates at least 25% of its coal production for domestic needs, with a production capacity of 75-80 million tons per year. The company aims to increase its coal production to 80 million tons per year in the future, with a target of 79-81 million tons by 2025.

PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (IDX: INCO) held an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders, approving the resignation of several commissioners and directors, and appointing new leaders, including Bernardus Irmanto as President Director and CEO. The company aims to continue its commitment to sustainable mining practices and responsible downstream processing, driving acceleration of strategic projects and creating shared value for Indonesia.

PT Hillcon Equity Management, an institution, sold 57,390,000 shares of PT Hillcon Tbk (HILL.JK) at IDR 322 per share, reducing its holdings from 8,029,521,500 to 7,972,131,500 shares. The purpose of the transaction is for investment.

PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminum, also known as MIND ID, is planning to increase its national aluminum production capacity to 900,000 tons per year by 2029, up from the current 275,000 tons, to reduce the supply-demand gap of 1.2 million tons per year. The company is preparing a new aluminum production facility project with a capacity of 600,000 tons per year, which will be combined with its existing facility to reach the target capacity.

The price of certified gold bars on PT Aneka Tambang's (ANTM) official website decreased by IDR 1,000 per gram to IDR 1,914,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by IDR 1,000 per gram to IDR 1,760,000 per gram. This marks a slight decline in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

Despite a 17% decline in its stock price this year, PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (PP) remains a favorite among investors, with its market capitalization reaching IDR 1.050 trillion in mid-July. The company's geothermal sector performance has helped it surpass PT Bank Central Asia Tbk's market capitalization, which has been affected by foreign selling.

Foreign capital outflow from Indonesia's domestic market reached IDR 11.30 trillion in the third week of July 2025, surpassing the previous week's outflow of IDR 10.49 trillion. This marks a significant increase in capital outflow from the country's financial market.

Despite Bank Indonesia's 75 basis point cut in benchmark interest rates and reduction in outstanding rupiah securities, credit growth remains slow, with a 7.6% annual growth in June 2025, slower than the 9.6% growth in January 2025. The slowdown is attributed to various non-monetary factors, including businesses' hesitation to expand due to uncertainty.

The Satgas Hilirisasi dan Ketahanan Energi Nasional has handed over 18 priority hilirisasi projects worth IDR 618.13 trillion to Badan Pengelola Investasi. According to Liza Camelia Suryanata, Head of Research at Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia (KIWOOM), these projects have the potential to bring significant profits for both state-owned and private companies.

The net profit of coal producer issuers is expected to decline quarter-on-quarter in Q2-2025 due to weak coal prices and sluggish export demand. Analysts Reggie Parengkuan and Ryan Winipta of Indo Premier Sekuritas predict a decline in earnings for coal producers in the second quarter of 2025.

Despite the pressure on large banks, several small banks in Indonesia have reported high profit growth in the first half of 2025, driven by factors such as decreased provisioning costs and increased revenue. The strong performance of these banks is a positive sign for the Indonesian banking sector.

Despite intense competition and weak consumer spending, Indonesia's telecom operators are expected to grow by the end of the year, driven by strategies to increase average revenue per user through product simplification and price adjustments to maintain revenue quality. This growth is expected to be achieved through a focus on improving revenue per user rather than relying on customer growth.

The transaction volume of BI-FAST, a digital banking service, reached 1.12 billion transactions in Q2 2025, a 42.87% year-over-year increase, with a total transaction value of IDR 2.788 trillion. The growth is driven by massive digital banking adoption and lower service fees compared to other interbank transfer services.

Lovina Beach Brewery (LOBE) has sold 15% of its shares to Asset Whale Pte. Ltd., a Singapore-based consulting and business development company, through a strategic partnership agreement. The deal is expected to support the launch of Lovina Beach Brewery's new global product.

PT Penta Valent Tbk (PEVE) reported a positive sales growth of 18.3% year-on-year (YoY) to IDR 1.68 trillion in Semester I-2025, driven by its pharmaceutical and healthcare product distribution business. The company's net profit also surged 56.85% YoY to IDR 28.73 billion, attributed to its shareholders as of June 30, 2025.

PT Krakatau Steel Tbk (KRAS) recorded a revenue of USD 460.83 million or IDR 7.48 trillion in the first half of 2025, representing a 3.63% year-over-year increase. This growth is a positive sign for the company's performance in 2025.

The decline in hotel industry has led to a 30%-35% drop in demand for mattresses and bedding, affecting companies like PT Alga Jaya Raya (ALGA). The company, which produces mattresses and bedding under the Alga brand, has seen a significant decline in sales in the first six months of the year.

PT PP Tbk (PTPP) reported a revenue of IDR 6.7 trillion in Semester I-2025, a 23.7% year-over-year decline from IDR 8.79 trillion. The company's construction service segment contributed the most to its revenue, with IDR 5.52 trillion, followed by EPC, property and realty, and financial services segments.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has rebalanced the constituents of its prominent indices, including IDX LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80, effective from August 1 to October 31, 2025. This rebalancing marks the fourth time this year, up from the previous frequency of twice a year.

The upcoming Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show (GIAS) 2025 has positively impacted Indonesian automotive stocks, with several shares surging ahead of the event's opening on August 3, 2025. Analyst Hijjah Marhama from MNC Sekuritas expects the market to respond positively to the event, as reflected in the stock price movements of automotive issuers.

SKK Migas aims to have 15 oil and gas projects online by 2025, with four projects already operational as of July 2025. The operational projects include Letang Tengah Rawa Expansion by Medco E&P Grissik Ltd., Terubuk by Medco E&P Natuna, Balam GS Upgrade by Pertamina Hulu Rokan, and Buic C14 by Exxon Mobil Cepu Ltd.

The Indonesian government targets to sell oil from community wells to contractors starting August 1, 2025, with an estimated additional 10,000-15,000 barrels per day. This effort follows the issuance of Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Regulation No. 14/2025 on cooperation in managing working areas to increase oil and gas production.

SKK Migas aims to have 15 oil and gas projects online by 2025, with four projects already operational as of July 2025. The operational projects include Letang Tengah Rawa Expansion by Medco E&P Grissik Ltd., Terubuk by Medco E&P Natuna, Balam GS Upgrade by Pertamina Hulu Rokan, and Buic C14 by Exxon Mobil Cepu Ltd.

The net profit of coal producer emitters is expected to decline quarter-on-quarter in Q2-2025 due to weak export demand and falling coal prices. Analysts Reggie Parengkuan and Ryan Winipta of Indo Premier Sekuritas predict a decline in earnings for coal producers in the second quarter of 2025.

The Satgas Hilirisasi dan Ketahanan Energi Nasional has handed over 18 priority hilirisasi projects worth IDR 618.13 trillion to Badan Pengelola Investasi. According to Liza Camelia Suryanata, Head of Research at Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia (KIWOOM), these projects have the potential to bring significant profits for both state-owned and private companies.

Hartadinata Abadi (HRta) and its subsidiary, Gemilang Hartadinata Abadi, have managed to avoid default by obtaining a debt extension from Bank Mandiri (BMRI) for their IDR 2.7 trillion debt due on July 23, 2025. As of March 31, 2025, HRta's consolidated cash and cash equivalents stood at IDR 342.45 billion, which is insufficient to cover its short-term liabilities of IDR 2.74 trillion.

Digital banks in Indonesia are offering high deposit interest rates, above 5%, to attract customers, with some banks offering up to 10% per annum for certain programs. According to the Financial Services Authority, the average deposit interest rate has increased by 38 bps to 192 bps over the past three years.

PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk and PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk, companies owned by Happy Hapsoro, saw their stocks continue to strengthen on Friday's trading, driven by corporate actions to raise funds through rights issue. The two companies' stocks rose in line with their efforts to secure funding in the capital market.

Hartadinata Abadi (HRta) has signed an agreement with Bank Mandiri to extend the payment of its IDR 2.4 trillion debt, which was due on July 23, 2025. The transaction is considered material as it exceeds 20% of the company's equity.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) and PT Indokripto Koin Semesta Tbk have entered the top 10 list of stocks with the most shareholders, with CDIA having 399,130 shareholders, ranking third after PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk with 674,650 shareholders and PT Bank Central Asia Tbk with 481,720 shareholders.

PT Sanurhasta Mitra Tbk and PT Bukit Uluwatu Villa Tbk, companies owned by Happy Hapsoro, continued to strengthen on Friday's trading, driven by corporate actions to raise funds through rights issue. The two stocks saw significant gains, reflecting investor optimism in the companies' fundraising efforts.

PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) has signed an agreement with PT Bank Mandiri Tbk to extend the payment of its IDR 2.4 trillion debt, which was due on July 23, 2025. The transaction is considered material as it exceeds 20% of the company's equity.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) and PT Indokripto Koin Semesta Tbk have entered the top 10 list of stocks with the most shareholders in the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX), with CDIA having 399,130 shareholders. CDIA ranks third, following PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk with 674,650 shareholders and PT Bank Central Asia Tbk with 481,720 shareholders.

PT Bank BTPN Syariah Tbk (BTPS) reported a 16.6% year-over-year growth in its performance in Semester I-2025, with a net income of IDR 643.85 billion. This growth is attributed to the company's cautious expansion strategy.

The certified gold price on Logam Mulia's official website decreased by Rp 19,000 per gram to Rp 1,915,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 19,000 per gram to Rp 1,761,000 per gram. This marks a decline in gold prices on the platform.

PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII) and PT Dian Swastatika Sentosa Tbk have solidified their positions as the top two leaders in the IDX index in 2025, with DCII's stock price surging 123.62% from IDR 155,050 to IDR 346,725 per share in just six trading days. This significant price increase has made it difficult for other stocks to surpass their positions.

PT Vale Indonesia Tbk is exploring collaboration with potential strategic partners, including from South Korea, for its nickel processing project using high pressure acid leaching technology in Sorowako, East Luwu, South Sulawesi, with an investment value of USD 1.9 billion. The project is expected to make a positive contribution to the company's revenue, net profit, and cash flow in the long term.

The increasing cost of raw materials is expected to negatively impact the profit margins of consumer goods companies such as PT Mayora Indah Tbk (MYOR), PT Cisarua Mountain Dairy Tbk (CMRY), and PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) in Q2 2025. According to Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia's equity research, the gross profit margin of these companies has been trending downward since 2021 due to rising commodity prices.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) is set to list on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) through an initial public offering (IPO) on July 9, 2025, offering up to 12.48 billion new shares, equivalent to 10% of its enlarged capital. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 2.37 trillion in fresh funds for the company.

PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana Tbk (SSMS) is focusing on improving its asset efficiency by evaluating and optimizing the use of depreciated assets, including vehicles and heavy equipment. This effort aims to enhance the company's overall performance and productivity.
