Danareksa's 22 priority programs, divided into three clusters, aim to optimize the portfolio of state-owned enterprises (BUMN) by the end of 2025. The programs focus on restructuring, consolidation, and development, which are expected to bring benefits to BUMN emitters.

The Indonesian government has officially appointed e-commerce companies, both domestic and foreign, to collect income tax from online sellers in the country. This move is aimed at facilitating tax compliance and is regulated under the Ministry of Finance Regulation No. 37 of 2025.

Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) is set to list on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) through an initial public offering (IPO) on July 9, 2025, offering up to 12.48 billion new shares, equivalent to 10% of its enlarged capital. The IPO is expected to raise IDR 2.37 trillion in fresh funds for the company.

PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana Tbk (SSMS) is focusing on improving its asset efficiency by evaluating and optimizing the use of depreciated assets, including vehicles and heavy equipment. This effort aims to enhance the company's overall performance and productivity.

Polytron (TICKER) is expanding its electric vehicle business by targeting to open eight showrooms by the end of 2025, with three already opened in Surabaya and Jakarta. The company, which entered the automotive industry in 2024, has released its G3 series electric car and aims to increase its portfolio in the new business line.

PT Metropolitan Land Tbk (MTLA) has launched the second phase of its Metland Cikarang project, featuring the Forest Serenity Urban City concept, in response to high market demand. The project aims to provide comfortable, strategic, and integrated housing in the Cikarang industrial area.

PT Pembangunan Jaya Ancol Tbk (PJAA) recorded a 12% decline in tourist visits in the first half of 2025 compared to the same period last year, attributed to external factors and long holidays that led to people taking trips outside the city instead of visiting recreational parks. The company's corporate secretary, Daniel Windriatmoko, explained that the decline was not due to internal factors.

The Indonesia Investment Authority is focusing on five priority sectors, including transportation, logistics & infrastructure, digital, green energy, and advanced materials, with potential projects in wind, geothermal, and solar energy. The authority aims to make these projects commercially feasible, according to Vice President Investment INA Joko Soegie.

Danareksa's 22 priority programs, divided into three clusters, aim to optimize the portfolio of state-owned enterprises (BUMN) by the end of 2025. The programs focus on restructuring, consolidation, and development, which are expected to bring benefits to BUMN emitters.

PT Puradelta Lestari Tbk (PURD) has achieved marketing sales of IDR 580 billion in the first half of 2025, which is 32% of its target for the year. The sales were driven by the sale of 18 hectares of industrial land, with the data center and FMCG sectors being the main contributors.

As of semester I-2025, the realization of credit distribution for the People's Business Credit (KUR) program has reached IDR 131.84 trillion, or 45.86% of the IDR 300 trillion target for 2025. The government is urging banks to increase their efforts to achieve the target in the second half of the year.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new regulation allowing village cooperatives to obtain loans from banks with village funds and central government transfers as collateral, with a maximum loan amount of IDR 3 billion and an interest rate of 6% per annum. The loan period can be up to 6 years.

PT Bank DBS Indonesia (DBSI) reported a 17.8% year-over-year increase in assets under management in its net worth individual segment as of May 2025, driven by growth in high-net-worth clients. The bank's DBS Treasure Private Client segment also saw a 5.2% increase in the number of accounts.

PT Indonesian Paradise Property Tbk aims to maintain its recurring income at around 70% by the end of 2025, despite challenges in the property industry, particularly in the hotel and commercial sectors. The company has managed to maintain its recurring income through its property portfolio.

The Indonesian government is preparing an economic stimulus package to boost growth in the second half of the year, which includes discounts on plane tickets, toll roads, and train tickets. The package is expected to be announced in September 2025 and will be effective for two months, from December 2025 to January 2026.

Despite declining purchasing power, Indonesian consumers are still driving demand for buy now pay later services, with multifinance paylater receivables increasing by 54.26% year-on-year to IDR 8.58 trillion as of May 2025. This trend is reflected in data from the Financial Services Authority.

PT Pembangunan Jaya Ancol Tbk (PJAA) reported a 12% decline in tourist visits in the first half of 2025 compared to the same period last year, attributed to external factors and long holidays that led to people taking trips outside the city instead of visiting recreational parks. The company's corporate secretary, Daniel Windriatmoko, explained that the decline was not due to internal factors.

PT Metropolitan Land Tbk (MTLA) has launched the second phase of its Metland Cikarang project, featuring the Forest Serenity Urban City concept, in response to high market demand. The project aims to provide comfortable, strategic, and integrated housing in the Cikarang industrial area.

PT Sawit Sumbermas Sarana Tbk (SSMS) is focusing on improving production and efficiency by conducting regular evaluations of potential risks from depreciated assets, including vehicles and heavy equipment. The company is taking steps to optimize its asset management to enhance overall performance.

PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk and PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk, subsidiaries of Chandra Asri Groups, have officially listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange through an initial public offering, raising Rp 2.37 trillion from the sale of 12.48 billion new shares. The IPO marks a significant milestone for the companies, with the funds raised set to support their future growth and development.

The Indonesian government has introduced a new regulation allowing village cooperatives to obtain loans from banks with village funds and central government transfers as collateral, with a maximum loan amount of IDR 3 billion and an interest rate of 6% per annum. The loan period can be up to 72 months.

The Indonesian government is preparing an economic stimulus package to boost growth in the second half of the year, which includes discounts on plane tickets, tolls, and train tickets. The package is expected to be announced in September 2025 and will be effective for two months, from December 2025 to January 2026.

The establishment of Koperasi Merah Putih has sparked concerns among banking industry players, including state-owned banks, due to unclear technical aspects and potential credit default risks that could erode profits and dividends. The risks associated with Koperasi Merah Putih may impact the banking industry's financial performance.

BCA's brand value increased by 42% to USD 4.4 billion, retaining its position as the world's strongest banking brand, while BRI's brand value rose by 36% to USD 7.3 billion. Bank Mandiri jumped 16 places in the ranking, prioritizing wholesale sector lending and investing in digital transformation.

PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) saw a significant increase in digital transactions, with inter-account transfers and virtual payments being the most widely used services, driven by increased smartphone internet penetration and the rise of e-commerce in Indonesia. The bank's digital arm, BCA Digital, reported a net income of $6.5 million in 2024, with its virtual account users surpassing 2.4 million by the end of the year.

PT Abadimukti Gunalestari sold 175,910,600 shares of PT Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk (GPRA.JK) on 2025-07-25, reducing its holding from 2,910,451,920 shares to 2,734,541,320 shares, with the purpose of investment strategy.
PT Abadimukti Gunalestari sold 175,910,600 shares of Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk, reducing its holding from 2,910,451,920 to 2,734,541,320. The transaction was made for investment strategy purposes.

The establishment of Koperasi Merah Putih has sparked concerns among banking industry players, including state-owned banks, due to unclear technical aspects and potential credit default risks that could erode profits and dividends. The risks associated with Koperasi Merah Putih may impact the financial performance of state-owned banks.

PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKU) stock price fell by 1.40% after the company's management issued a clarification regarding rumors circulating in the market. The correction occurred at the close of trading on the Indonesia Stock Exchange on Friday.

Poh Holdings Pte Ltd acquired 250,000,000 shares of PT Techno9 Indonesia Tbk, increasing its holding from 110,007,000 to 360,007,000 shares. The transaction, classified as an investment, was executed at a price of IDR 19 per share, representing a significant increase in ownership stake.

Indonesia will prioritize wheat and soybean imports from the US as part of a reciprocal trade deal, with the US reducing its import tariff on Indonesian products from 32% to 19%. The deal requires Indonesia to purchase around $4.5 billion worth of US agricultural products, equivalent to approximately IDR 73 trillion.

Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) reported a net profit of Rp 10.1 trillion in the first half of 2025, a 5.6% year-on-year decline, despite a 2.3% increase in net interest income to Rp 19.52 trillion. The bank's total lending grew 7.1% to Rp 778.7 trillion, driven by a 10.7% increase in consumer loans to Rp 147 trillion.

Five major US companies, including ExxonMobil, Oracle, Microsoft, Amazon Web Services, and General Electric, are set to invest a combined total of $23.21 billion in Indonesia. Notably, Apple's investment commitment remains uncertain, despite previous expectations of a $1 billion investment in a manufacturing plant in Batam.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) has decreased by Rp 11,000 per gram, from Rp 1,945,000 per gram to Rp 1,934,000 per gram. The buyback price also fell by Rp 11,000 per gram, from Rp 1,791,000 per gram to Rp 1,780,000 per gram.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its outstanding securities to around IDR 770 trillion by mid-2025, down from IDR 923 trillion at the end of 2024, in an effort to increase liquidity and encourage banks to lend to the real sector. This move is expected to support the country's economic growth.

Pertamina Hulu Rokan (PHR) aims to increase production by 2,800 barrels per day using Chemical Enhanced Oil Recovery (CEOR) technology at the Minas field, Rokan Block, Riau Province, with the target injection date set for December 2025. The production increase is expected to be felt in June 2026, with the company partnering with PT Pertamina Lubricants to achieve this goal.

PT Delta Dunia Makmur Tbk (DGWG) has officially opened a new carbamate factory in Cikande, Banten, with an initial investment of USD 20 million. The factory, which started construction in November 2023, has an initial capacity of 2,000 metric tons per year, equivalent to 4,900 metric tons of finished pesticide products per year.

PT Dharma Polimetal Tbk (DRMA) is confident about achieving its target this year, driven by solid exports and plans to expand production capacity, despite the dynamics of tariffs for components to the United States. The company is also considering adding new models, with a decision expected after August 1.

The Indonesian government has officially allocated natural gas to PT Citra Nusantara Gemilang Tbk (CNGG) for the development of a liquefied natural gas (LNG) facility in Karawang, West Java. The facility is part of CNGG's business expansion strategy to expand its gas network in Indonesia.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) has lifted the trading halt on PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) effective Friday, July 25, 2025, but has placed the company under surveillance due to significant cumulative price increases. CDIA was previously suspended for two days, July 23-24, 2025, pending further announcement.

The Indonesian government's ambitious project to build a 1 million barrel oil refinery and storage facility faces various challenges and funding risks, which could lead to project failure if not managed carefully. The project is part of 18 hilirisasi projects handed over to Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara by the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources.

Indonesia has rejected the US request for unrestricted access to its copper supply, emphasizing that only processed copper products can be exported under its downstream industrialization policy. Freeport Indonesia (IDX: FPID) is one of the country's largest copper producers, and any copper exports to the US must go through domestic smelting facilities, with potential investments totaling up to $35 billion.

Despite the recent rally in the IDX, big cap stocks such as PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) and PT Sumber Alfaria Trijaya Tbk (ALFA) have been lagging behind, with BREN's stock price dropping 1.28% to IDR 7,725 and ALFA's stock price falling 2.67% to IDR 2,190, collectively dragging down the IHSG by 6.37 points.

PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk (TOWR) has completed its rights issue, with PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, a subsidiary of Djarum Group, acquiring 7,391,464,952 shares or 91.44% of the total offered shares. The acquisition has resulted in a change in the ownership structure of TOWR.

The growth of third-party foreign exchange funds in Indonesian banks slowed down to 1.8% year-on-year to IDR 1,355.4 trillion as of June 2025, while foreign exchange credit disbursement grew 8.22% year-on-year to IDR 1,241.5 trillion as of May 2025.

Indonesia and the US have reached a trade agreement, where Indonesia will not be subject to import tariffs, while the US will impose a 19% tariff on Indonesian imports. The agreement is expected to benefit Indonesia, with a potential increase in exports to the US, which was the country's second-largest non-oil export destination in 2024, with a value of USD 17.9 billion.

The trade agreement between Indonesia and the US has raised concerns over the transfer of data from Indonesia, with the Minister of Communication and Digital, Meutya Hafid, clarifying that data transfer will be done based on existing laws and regulations. The agreement aims to facilitate the exchange of data between the two countries while ensuring the protection of personal data and compliance with international standards.

PT Bumi Serpong Damai Tbk (BSDE) plans to develop a new premium housing project in Cibubur through a joint venture with Sinarmas Land HK, with a total project value of IDR 2.8 trillion. The project will be developed through a joint venture between PT Karunia Sinar Mentari, which owns 51% of the shares, and Sinarmas Land HK.

PT Djarum's holding company, PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, acquired 62.93 million shares of PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk (SSIA) from Treasury at IDR 2,700 per share. The transaction took place on Tuesday, increasing Djarum's stake in SSIA.

The IDX Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 7,530, up 0.83% from the previous day, breaking through the 7,500 level. Analysts expect the index to continue its upward trend in the medium to long term, but may experience limited correction in the short term, with Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) being one of the recommended stocks.

The IDX Composite Index (IHSG) reached a record high of 7,530.9 on Thursday, but analysts predict it will struggle to return to its all-time high due to the anomaly of the current surge, which is only supported by a few stocks. The index is highly vulnerable to a reversal.

The Indonesia-US trade agreement has sparked controversy over the allowance of data transfer from Indonesia, with the Communication and Digital Minister assuring that the transfer will be done legally and securely. The agreement aims to facilitate data exchange between the two countries while protecting personal data.

Despite the recent uptrend in the IDX, several big cap stocks, including Barito Renewables Energy (BREN) and Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (ALFA), have underperformed, with BREN's stock price dropping 1.28% to IDR 7,725 and ALFA's stock price falling 2.67% to IDR 2,190. These declines have weighed on the IDX, with BREN and ALFA contributing to a 3.79-point and 2.58-point decrease, respectively.

PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk (TOWR) has completed its rights issue, resulting in a change in the ownership structure of its shareholders. PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, a subsidiary of Djarum Group, acquired 7,391,464,952 shares, equivalent to 91.44% of the total shares offered in the rights issue.

The expansion of Indonesia's mass rapid transit public transportation system could reduce carbon emissions, and a formal emissions trading system could monetize these reductions. PT PLN (PT PLN) has already benefited from selling carbon credits through renewable energy initiatives, and a broader multi-stakeholder involvement is needed to develop a collaborative and effective carbon trading framework.

Heddy Kandou, an insider, sold 250 million shares of PT Techno9 Indonesia Tbk (NINE.JK) at IDR 19 per share, reducing their holding from 852.66 million shares to 602.66 million shares. The sale is part of an acquisition process.

Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign fund, is in discussions with the US International Development Finance Corporation (DFC) for a critical mineral investment, following a US-Indonesia trade deal that could give Washington access to Jakarta's copper and other minerals. The deal would see Danantara gaining a new international partner, with DFC's portfolio surpassing $49 billion across 114 countries.

Danareksa, a state-owned investment management company, plans to use dividends received from state-owned companies under its management to pay off its debt. The company has received external funding of USD 17 billion, comprising USD 7 billion from sovereign wealth funds and USD 10 billion from 12 foreign banks in the form of revolving loan facilities.

Several national mining companies, including PT Vale Indonesia (Tbk), PT Aneka Tambang (Tbk), PT Bukit Asam (Tbk), and Inalum, have demonstrated their commitment to green mining through systematic and measurable environmentally responsible practices. These companies have implemented various initiatives, such as reclamation, environmental conservation, and community empowerment, to reduce their environmental impact.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has successfully regulated the mining sector, reducing the number of illegal permits from 12,500 to 4,250. The ministry's efforts have also led to an increase in state revenue, with non-tax state revenue deposits from the mineral coal sector expected to double or triple by 2025.

PT Antareja Mahada Makmur, a subsidiary of PT Putra Perkasa Abadi, has been appointed as the main contractor for PT Kembar Emas Sultra's nickel mining project in North Konawe, Southeast Sulawesi, with a target annual production of 8 million tons of nickel ore. The five-year project is scheduled to begin operations in the fourth quarter of 2025, with a total reserve of over 30 million tonnes of nickel ore.

The certified gold price on Logam Mulia's official website decreased by IDR 25,000 per gram to IDR 1,945,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by IDR 25,000 per gram to IDR 1,791,000 per gram. This price adjustment is reflected on the company's website, Logam Mulia (ANTM).

Palm oil stocks have seen a significant increase in the last month, driven by rising CPO prices and increasing demand. This trend is expected to continue, benefiting companies in the palm oil industry.

Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) reported weak sales performance in June 2025, with same-store sales growth (SSSG) declining 4.8% month-on-month, resulting in a 2.9% cumulative SSSG decline in the first half of 2025. The company's sales growth was negatively affected across all regions, with Jakarta, outer Java, and Java regions experiencing declines of 6.3%, 4.7%, and 4.4%, respectively.

PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk (EMTK) is expected to benefit from the decreasing interest rates and economic recovery, with its digital exposure through PT Bukalapak.com Tbk and media sector through PT Surya Citra Media Tbk. EMTK's net profit is projected to reach IDR 648 billion in 2025, with a price earnings ratio of around 3 times and price book value below 1 time.

Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) stock has surged over 128% this year, reaching a five-year high of Rp 2,560, driven by the entry of the Djarum Group and promising business prospects. Despite a recent correction, the stock has still risen 63.06% in the past month, with analysts expecting further growth.

PT Wijaya Karya Bangunan Gedung Tbk (WEKG) reported a 34.23% year-on-year decline in revenue to Rp 907.81 billion in the first half of 2023, due to tightened project selection and market adjustments. The company is focusing on efficiency to maintain its performance, according to Director Hadian Pramudita.

The Indonesian government's plan to implement the B50 biodiesel policy, which mandates a 50% blend of palm oil-based biodiesel and 50% petroleum diesel, may be delayed due to disparities in prices between crude palm oil and petroleum fuel. The policy was initially targeted to start in 2025, but its implementation may be pushed back to 2026, according to statements from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.

PT Pupuk Indonesia (TICKER) has partnered with Desa Merah Putih village cooperatives to strengthen the national fertilizer distribution system, supporting the government's food self-sufficiency agenda and implementation of Presidential Regulation No. 6 of 2025 on subsidized fertilizer management. This partnership aims to facilitate farmers' access to various types of fertilizers and agricultural inputs through the village-level cooperatives.

Morgan Stanley Capital International is set to release the results of its MSCI index review in August, which will take effect on August 27, 2025. PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk, PT Petrosea Tbk, and PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk, owned by Prajogo Pangestu, are potential candidates to be included in the MSCI index.

The Indonesian Parliament is set to discuss the revision of the Oil and Gas Law (UU Migas) by the end of 2023, prioritizing it after the Renewable Energy Bill and Electricity Law revisions are completed. The revised law is part of the national legislative priority program targeted to be completed this year.

Kalbe Farma (KLBF) is expanding its business in the medical equipment sector through its subsidiaries, including PT Forsta Kalmedic Global, which focuses on manufacturing medical equipment products. The company aims to increase revenue contribution from its medical equipment business by developing a business model for assembly and production in the country.

Bank CIMB Niaga (BNGA) has been focusing on developing fee-based income to mitigate the impact of slowing credit growth and high funding costs. The bank's president director, Lani Darmawan, emphasized the importance of non-interest income in maintaining business sustainability amid economic uncertainty.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced that it will require mining companies to submit their work plans and budgets annually starting 2026, replacing the previous three-year submission period. Companies are expected to submit their new work plans for 2026 production starting October 2025.

Astra International (ASII) continues to dominate Indonesia's automotive market, with its Toyota brand holding a 35% market share as of May 2025, up from 31% in the previous month. The company's diversified business portfolio has also contributed to its strength in the market.

Bank Rakyat Indonesia's (BRI) BRILink transactions reached 540 million times with a value of Rp 843 trillion in the first half of 2025, growing 9.8% year-on-year. This highlights the bank's success in expanding financial services to remote areas and contributing to low-cost fund collection and credit distribution.

The micro, small, and medium enterprises (UMKM) sector in Indonesia is experiencing slow credit growth, with a 2.18% annual increase to IDR 1.404 trillion as of June 2025, despite being a priority sector receiving liquidity incentives from Bank Indonesia. The sector's non-performing loan (NPL) ratio also rose to 4.49% from 4.41% in May, signaling a warning for the national economy.

Danatara, a sovereign wealth fund, plans to invest in 17 refineries in the US worth $8 billion, with 20% of its total investment portfolio to be allocated abroad. The company has secured a $17 billion loan from 12 foreign banks and a sovereign wealth fund, with no collateral required for a $10 billion revolving facility.

The Indonesian stock market (IHSG) rebounded yesterday, closing 1.7% higher at 7,469, driven by a 19.99% surge in DCII (DCII) shares and gains in property stocks. The market is still awaiting Q2 2025 financial reports from listed companies to confirm the impact of economic slowdown on their performance.

The Indonesian Police's special task force on food has escalated the investigation into the fake rice case, involving 15 producers of various brands, with laboratory tests and sample collections underway. The case is expected to have implications on the country's food industry and related stocks.

EMTK's stock price has surged 25.51% in the past month and 17.31% in the past week, driven by the positive sentiment towards technology stocks amidst interest rate cuts and economic recovery. The company is expected to post a net profit of Rp 648 billion in 2025, with a revenue growth of 46.1% year-on-year, and its cash position is expected to reach USD 1.3 billion by the end of 2025.

Pupuk Indonesia (PI) has partnered with Koperasi Desa Merah Putih to strengthen its national fertilizer distribution system, supporting the government's food self-sufficiency agenda and implementation of Presidential Regulation No. 6/2025 on subsidized fertilizer management. This partnership is expected to facilitate farmers' access to various types of fertilizers and agricultural inputs.

The implementation of Indonesia's B50 biodiesel policy, which aims to mix 50% solar and 50% palm oil-based biofuel, may be delayed due to the price disparity between crude palm oil and fuel oil. The policy was initially targeted to be implemented in 2026, but the delay may occur due to the significant price difference between domestic biodiesel and imported fuel oil.

Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia (ACES) reported weak sales performance in June 2025, with same-store sales growth (SSSG) declining 4.8% month-on-month, resulting in a 2.9% cumulative SSSG decline in the first half of 2025. The company's sales growth was negatively affected across all regions, with Jakarta, outer Java, and Java regions experiencing declines of 6.3%, 4.7%, and 4.4%, respectively.

Surya Semesta Internusa (SSIA) stock has surged over 128% this year, driven by the entry of Djarum Group and promising business prospects. Despite a recent correction, the stock remains strong, with a 63.06% gain over the past month.

Indonesia's payment infrastructure has seen significant growth, with Qris transactions rising 50% year-over-year and Bi-Fast growing 58% year-over-year, with Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) serving over 4,000 corporate clients through API-based services. The country is also developing a central bank digital currency, the digital Rupiah, with BNI preparing infrastructure for its eventual rollout.

PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BTN) has reduced fraud efforts by 80% using artificial intelligence, and is adopting a multi-layered risk approach to combat digital threats. The bank has also doubled its fraud detection accuracy and reduced verification workload by 80%, and is prioritizing employee behavior and customer education to build safer online habits.

Indonesia Airlines Group, backed by Singapore-based Calypte Holding Pte Ltd, has delayed its planned soft launch due to regulatory issues, pending verification of standard certificates and submission of a detailed business plan. The airline has secured €46.2 million in funding and plans to operate 20 modern aircraft, including Airbus A321neo and Boeing 787-9 jets, focusing on international routes.

Layman Holdings Pte Ltd sold 80,000,000 shares of Leyand International Tbk, reducing its holdings from 1,200,000,000 to 1,120,000,000 shares. The transaction was made based on an agreement between the seller and buyer, with a total value of IDR 2,000,000,000,000.

Indonesia's retail sector has welcomed the government's move to eliminate import tariffs on US goods, viewing it as a catalyst for shopping tourism and retail growth without harming domestic small businesses. However, industry leaders warn that applying similar tariff exemptions to Chinese goods could severely threaten Indonesia's small and medium enterprises, with a trade surplus of $5.44 billion from January to April 2025 with the US, and a trade deficit of $6.28 billion with China over the same period.

PT Arkha Tanto Prima, an insider, acquired 300,000,000 shares of PT Arkha Jayanti Persada Tbk (ARKA.JK), increasing its holding from 592,326,600 to 892,326,600 shares. The purpose of the transaction is to raise funds for investment and strengthen the company's position.

Indonesia will lift its local content policy for certain sectors in its trade deal with the US, allowing American companies to exempt from local content requirements, although the specific sectors and products have not been disclosed. The move is seen as a major concession by Jakarta to have US President Donald Trump drop reciprocal tariffs from 32% to 19%.

The Indonesian government plans to introduce an export levy on cocoa in the second half of 2025 to improve the quality of cocoa destined for export markets, with the revenue generated to be allocated to replanting initiatives and capacity-building efforts. The export value of processed cocoa products reached USD 2.62 billion in 2024, accounting for 1.05% of Indonesia's non-oil and gas exports.

The Indonesian government is preparing to extend its economic stimulus policies into the third quarter of 2025 to maintain momentum towards its full-year growth target of 5.2%. The new policy package, which includes incentives such as discounts on public transportation and toll road fees, is expected to continue stimulus measures implemented in the second quarter to boost economic activity.

Indonesia and the US have agreed on a framework for a reciprocal trade agreement, which will grant exporters from both countries unprecedented access to each other's markets, with key terms including the elimination of 99% of tariff barriers on US industrial and food products exported to Indonesia. The agreement is expected to strengthen bilateral economic ties, with estimated trade values including $3.2 billion in aircraft procurement, $4.5 billion in agriculture products, and $15 billion in energy products.

Astra International (ASII) is set to acquire 83.67% of PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk through its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, in a deal signed on July 21, 2025. The acquisition is part of Astra International's expansion strategy, further solidifying its position in the Indonesian market.

Indonesia has agreed to exempt US companies from local content requirements as part of a new tariff deal, which will allow companies like Apple (AAPL) to sell their products in the country without adhering to local sourcing rules. The deal also includes a reduction in tariffs on Indonesian goods from 19% to 13%, and the elimination of tariff barriers on over 99% of American products entering the Indonesian market.

The US and Indonesia have agreed to cut reciprocal tariffs, with Indonesia set to relax its critical mineral export curbs, but senior Indonesian ministers have clarified that the ban on ore exports will remain in place. Indonesia is the world's largest nickel producer, with production totaling 2.2 million metric tons in 2024, and has copper reserves of 21 million metric tons.

The price of certified gold bars on the official website of Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by Rp 24,000 per gram to Rp 1,970,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 24,000 per gram to Rp 1,816,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in the gold price in Indonesia.

BYD (no ticker) has launched its entry-level electric vehicle model, Atto 1, in Indonesia, priced at under IDR 200 million, making it the most affordable BYD model in the country. The launch is part of BYD's strategy to tap into the underserved entry-level EV segment in the region, with the model expected to be a strong contender in Indonesia's growing EV market.

PT Freeport Indonesia (IDX: FPIN) expects indirect impact from the 50% import tariff on copper and other metal commodities imposed by US President Donald Trump starting August 1. The company, one of Indonesia's largest copper producers, will be affected by this policy.

Indonesia's Energy Minister Bahlil Lahadalia has revealed opportunities for cooperatives, particularly the Red and White Village Cooperative, to manage mineral and coal mining concessions. According to the Mining Law No. 2/2025, cooperatives and small and medium-sized enterprises can operate mines, but the minister emphasized the need for special guidance for the Red and White Village Cooperative.

The Satuan Tugas Hilirisasi dan Ketahanan Energi Nasional has submitted 18 project proposals for hilirisasi projects worth $38.63 billion or IDR 618.3 trillion to Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara. The projects are outside of the electric vehicle battery ecosystem.

PT Cisadane Sawit Raya Tbk (CSRA) is leveraging the ongoing trend of strengthening global crude palm oil prices, which have risen 8% over the past year and 4% in the last month, to accelerate its strategic agenda, including infrastructure development and production capacity expansion.

Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) aims to achieve 7-8% revenue growth in 2025, driven by expansion and investment plans, including a capital expenditure of approximately Rp 4.5 trillion. The company will allocate Rp 3 trillion for store expansion and rental extensions, and Rp 1.5 trillion for the development of a distribution center.

The Indonesian Attorney General's office has named eight new suspects in a corruption case involving PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten, PT Bank DKI, and PT BPD Jawa Tengah, bringing the total number of suspects to 11, including former executives of PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (SRIL). The case involves alleged corrupt practices in the disbursement of credit to PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk (SRIL) and its subsidiaries.

The US government will impose a 19% import tariff on all Indonesian products starting August 1, 2025, following negotiations with the Indonesian government. The tariff rate has been reduced from the previous 32%.

PT Sumber Tani Agung Resources (STAA) reported a net profit of IDR 656.72 billion in 1H 2025, a 55.15% year-over-year (YoY) increase from IDR 485.54 billion in 1H 2024. The company's revenue also rose 33.22% YoY to IDR 3.58 trillion during the same period.

The IDX BUMN20 index, which tracks state-owned enterprises, has been underperforming, falling 1.09% to 352.34 on Tuesday, and down 2.27% year-to-date. The decline is attributed to the weakening of state-owned bank stocks, including Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI), and Bank Negara Indonesia (BBNI), which are also part of the big-cap stocks in the IHSG.

The decline in global coal prices and weak demand from China have negatively impacted the stock performance of Indonesian mining companies, including PT Alamtri Resources Indonesia Tbk, PT Alamtri Minerals Indonesia Tbk, and PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk. The companies' stock prices have been trending downward due to these external factors.

Astra International (ASII) plans to acquire 83.67% of PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk (MMLP), a modern warehousing company, to strengthen its property business pillar. Through its subsidiary, PT Saka Industrial Arjaya, Astra will become the new controlling shareholder of MMLP and will conduct a mandatory tender offer.

The non-bank financial industry in Indonesia is experiencing a slowdown in the first half of 2025, with indicators such as general insurance and reinsurance premiums growing only 3.43% year-on-year, significantly lower than the 16.94% growth in May 2024. The high interest rates and declining purchasing power of the community are among the factors contributing to this slowdown.

The Indonesian government's 2026 state budget is expected to increase, reaching IDR 3.8-3.82 quadrillion, up from IDR 3.621 trillion in 2025, with a maximum allocation of 14.83% of the country's Gross Domestic Product. This marks a significant increase in government spending, which may have implications for the country's economy and stock market.

PT Freeport Indonesia (IDX: FPIN) expects indirect impact from the 50% import tariff on copper imposed by US President Donald Trump starting August 1. The company, one of Indonesia's largest copper producers, will be affected by this policy.

The Indonesian Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources, Bahlil Lahadalia, has announced opportunities for cooperatives, particularly the Red and White Village Cooperative, to manage mineral and coal mining concessions. According to the Mining Law No. 2/2025, cooperatives and small and medium-sized enterprises can operate mines, but special arrangements are needed for the Red and White Village Cooperative.

The global nickel price has weakened by 0.12% to USD 15,492 per ton, with a year-to-year decline of 3.30%. In response, companies such as PT Vale Indonesia Tbk are preparing strategies to maintain their performance stability.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.72% or 53.45 points to 7,344.73, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 561.47 billion worth of shares. The index was weighed down by the basic materials sector, which declined 4.36%, according to Herditya Wicaksana, an analyst at MNC Sekuritas.

Sumber Alfaria Trijaya (AMRT) aims to achieve 7-8% revenue growth in 2025, driven by its capital expenditure of IDR 4.5 trillion, which will be used for store expansion and distribution center development. The company has allocated IDR 3 trillion for store expansion and IDR 1.5 trillion for distribution center development.

The Attorney General's Office has named eight new suspects in an alleged corruption case involving PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat dan Banten, PT Bank DKI, and PT BPD Jawa Tengah, which provided loans to PT Sri Rejeki Isman Tbk and its subsidiaries. The total number of suspects now stands at 11, including Zainuddin Mappa, former President Director of Bank DKI, and Iwan Setiawan Lukminto, President Director of Sritex from 2005-2022.

The Indonesian government's 2026 state budget is expected to increase, reaching IDR 3.8-3.82 quadrillion, up from IDR 3.621 trillion in 2025, with a maximum allocation of 14.83% of the country's Gross Domestic Product. This marks a significant increase in the country's budget, which is expected to have a positive impact on the economy.

DBS Indonesia (DBSI) has reduced its manual customer service load by 80% through its guided conversation feature, which uses chatbot-guided prompts to automate common banking queries. Since its launch, user adoption has jumped 17-fold, operational costs have dropped 25%, and customer satisfaction has risen 18%.

The 2025 Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show features 14 Chinese car brands showcasing electric vehicle lineups, surpassing 11 Japanese brands, marking a significant shift in Indonesia's car market landscape driven by the surge in electric vehicle adoption. The event reflects China's growing foothold in Indonesia's automotive market, particularly in the EV segment, with EVs accounting for 10% of total car sales in the first half of 2025.

Indonesia's finance minister, Sri Mulyani Indrawati, announced that the country's fiscal deficit is expected to widen to 2.78% of GDP in 2025, up from the earlier projection of 2.53%, due to a sharp decline in state revenue during the first half of the year. The revised projection follows a 9% drop in government revenue in H1 2025, with a budget deficit of Rp 204.24 trillion, or 0.84% of GDP.

Indonesia's business associations are urging caution despite the country securing a lower US tariff rate of 19%, compared to Vietnam's 20%, as they worry about the slight difference and Vietnam's larger export volumes in apparel and footwear. The associations are calling for deregulation and cost-cutting measures to remain competitive, with logistic costs in Indonesia currently at 14% of GDP and aiming to slash it to 8% by 2030.

Indonesia attracted approximately Rp 950 trillion in investment during the first half of 2025, marking a year-on-year increase from Rp 829.9 trillion recorded in the same period last year. About 30% of the investment flowed into downstream mining projects, reflecting the government's push to ban exports of raw nickel ore and copper concentrate and develop value-added industries within Indonesia.

The Indonesian government has handed over 18 projects worth $38.6 billion to Danantara, the country's sovereign wealth fund, for potential investment in the development of natural resources and domestic processing industries. Danantara, which has secured a $10 billion credit line, will invest in these projects if they meet the fund's investment criteria, with financing options including state-owned enterprises and domestic or foreign private companies.

Indonesia's Finance Ministry has laid off nearly 1,000 civil servants, or 1.26% of its workforce, as part of the government's efforts to streamline spending and boost efficiency. Despite the reduction, the country's fiscal performance remained robust in 2024, with a budget deficit of 2.29% of GDP and a 5% economic growth rate.

Coordinating Minister for Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto announced that the US import tariff reduction from 32% to 19% could take effect before August 1, 2025, depending on a joint statement from involved countries. This change will impact countries like the UK, Vietnam, China, and Indonesia, with the timeline for the announcement remaining flexible.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia (ANTM) increased by Rp 19,000 per gram, from Rp 1,927,000 to Rp 1,946,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by Rp 19,000 per gram, from Rp 1,773,000 to Rp 1,792,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

During the third meeting of G20 finance ministers and central bank governors in South Africa, Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati expressed concerns over the slow resolution of Pillar I, which addresses taxing rights on profits of multinational digital companies. The unilateral implementation of digital service taxes by various countries was also noted as a growing issue.

Indonesia's economic growth is expected to fall below 5% in the second quarter of 2025, contrary to the government's optimistic projection of achieving 5% growth in the second half. This slowdown is anticipated to impact fiscal conditions and increase pressure on the Indonesian workforce.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) surged by 86.28 points or 1.18% to 7,398.19, marking an 11-day consecutive rise, influenced by inflows into conglomerate stocks, particularly those linked to tycoon Prajogo Pangestu. Analyst Herditya Wicaksana from MNC Sekuritas predicts further potential gains with support at 7,346 and resistance at 7,440.

PT Pam Mineral Tbk recorded sales of Rp 1.05 trillion in the first half of 2025, a 152.07% increase year-over-year from Rp 419.19 billion in the previous year. This growth was driven by a 166.46% rise in nickel sales volume, from 707,597 metric tons in the first half of 2024 to 1,885,433 metric tons in the same period of 2025.

The rupiah weakened in the spot market, closing at IDR 16,323 per US dollar, a 0.16% decline on Monday. The Bank Indonesia JISDOR rate also fell by 0.17% to IDR 16,330 per US dollar compared to the previous day's close.

President Prabowo Subianto has initiated the launch of 80,000 'Koperasi Desa Merah Putih' from Desa Bentangan, Klaten, Central Java, as part of his administration's vision to enhance a people-based economy. The grand launch underscores Prabowo's commitment to this economic development initiative.

Companies such as OCBC NISP (OCBC), Astra Life, Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN), and Asuransi Central Asia (ACA) are shifting their focus towards designing apps that provide fast claims, secure systems, and helpful tools, rather than trying to become super apps. By prioritizing functional relevance, these institutions aim to become indispensable to their customers, with OCBC NISP spending 80% of its app development time on infrastructure, including fraud detection and anti-money laundering systems.

Pada awal pekan ini, Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) naik 1,18% atau 86,27 poin ke level 7.398,19 meskipun investor asing melakukan aksi jual bersih sebesar Rp 180,37 miliar. Pasar juga menantikan kebijakan suku bunga dari Bank Sentral China.

Despite being prioritized by the government and receiving macroprudential liquidity incentives from Bank Indonesia, the micro, small, and medium enterprises sector is still facing high credit interest rates. In contrast, other prioritized sectors have already benefited from reduced interest rates this year.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (IDX: KAI) introduces a special train ticket program that can be purchased two hours before departure, available for strategic routes such as Jakarta to Cirebon and Bandung to Tasikmalaya. The program aims to provide more convenience to passengers while optimizing seat availability.

The Indonesian aviation industry is expected to face slow growth in the second half of 2025 due to high operational costs, with no significant drivers for domestic market expansion, according to Bayu Sutanto of the Indonesia National Air Carrier Association. However, international passenger volumes at major airports like Soekarno-Hatta and I Gusti Ngurah Rai have surpassed pre-pandemic levels from 2019.

As of June 30, 2025, SKK Migas reported that national oil lifting reached 578,000 barrels per day, which is 95.5% of the APBN target of 605,000 barrels per day. This shortfall highlights the challenges in meeting the country's oil production goals.

PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk (BWPT), a crude palm oil producer, has settled its Series I Eagle High Plantations bonds due in 2024 by paying Rp 61.84 billion. The payment was disclosed in the Indonesia Stock Exchange, with the maturity date set for July 21, 2025.

China recorded a 30% year-on-year decrease in coal imports from Indonesia in June 2025, attributed to increased domestic coal production and a shift towards higher-calorie coal. In the first half of the year, China imported a total of 90.98 million tons of coal from Indonesia.

In the first half of 2025, high bank interest rates have led corporations to prefer debt securities over credit for funding, with 56.26% of corporate debt issuance aimed at working capital, up from 38.61% the previous year. This trend highlights a significant shift in corporate financing strategies due to increased funding costs.

Several companies listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange in 2025 have reported minimal usage of their IPO funds for the first half of the year. Readers are encouraged to subscribe for full access to detailed economic, business, and investment news and analysis.

Pertumbuhan kredit perbankan di Indonesia mengalami perlambatan, berada di bawah target regulator, namun kredit investasi tetap menjadi penopang dengan pertumbuhan dua digit. Menurut data Bank Indonesia, per Juni 2025, kredit investasi tumbuh 12,53% secara tahunan, meskipun melandai dari bulan sebelumnya yang tumbuh 13,74% yoy dan Desember 2024 yang tumbuh 13,85% yoy.

PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ACES) is planning to open new outlets outside Java to boost performance, despite facing challenges related to company rebranding. The company has allocated a capital expenditure of IDR 250-300 billion for the year, with IDR 43.55 billion utilized by March 2025.

The Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) is continuing its investigation into the alleged corruption case involving the procurement of electronic data capture (EDC) machines at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), with five witnesses recently examined. Previously, five individuals had been named as suspects in this corruption case.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk plans to acquire gold and copper mines owned by Wolfram Limited in Australia, while PT United Tractors Tbk is considering acquiring gold or nickel mines abroad, particularly in Australia. These expansions are part of a broader strategy by Indonesian mining companies to seek new opportunities overseas.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate three times in 2025, with the latest cut of 25 basis points bringing the BI rate to 5.25%. Previous reductions occurred in January and May, each by 25 basis points.

Corporate bonds worth IDR 161.2 trillion are set to mature by 2025, with significant contributions from state-owned enterprises (SOEs) like Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) at IDR 6.15 trillion, PT Sarana Multi Infrastruktur at IDR 5.56 trillion, and PT Sarana Multigriya Finansial at IDR 1.59 trillion. This influx is expected to impact the financial market significantly, as noted by Pemeringkat Efek Indonesia and Kustodian Sentral Efek Indonesia.

Online transport drivers in Jakarta protested, demanding a reduction in platform fees to 10%. The drivers, represented by the Association of Online Ojek Drivers Garda Indonesia, presented five demands to the platform companies.

PT Indonesia Kendaraan Terminal Tbk (IPCC) aims to maintain positive performance with growth above 15% despite global and domestic economic uncertainties. In Q1 2025, IPCC's operating revenue increased by 15.73% year-on-year to IDR 203.27 billion.

The life insurance industry in Indonesia experienced a 2.17% decline in premium income, totaling Rp 63.08 trillion by May 2025, due to ongoing consumer purchasing power pressures. Despite this, post-tax profits soared by 146.3% to Rp 7.34 trillion, according to the Financial Services Authority.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed Monday's trading with a 1.18% increase, reaching a level of 7,398.19, marking a 4.31% rise year-to-date. Stocks listed on the development board are increasingly dominating the top 10 movers of the IHSG.

The Indonesian Chamber of Commerce views the newly struck tariff deal with the US positively, expecting it to double trade to $80 billion in five years. The deal, which lowers tariffs from 32% to 19%, is expected to increase US exports to Indonesia, currently at $28.1 billion, and reduce the trade deficit.

The growth prospects for Indonesia's national aviation industry in the second half of the year remain limited due to high operational costs, with no significant drivers for domestic market expansion, according to Bayu Sutanto of the Indonesia National Air Carrier Association. However, international passenger volumes at Soekarno-Hatta and I Gusti Ngurah Rai airports have surpassed pre-pandemic levels from 2019.

Indonesia's economic growth is projected to fall below 5% in the second quarter of 2025, contrary to the government's optimistic forecast of reaching 5% in the second half. This slowdown is expected to impact fiscal conditions and increase pressure on the Indonesian workforce.

PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk (BWPT), a crude palm oil producer, has settled its maturing bonds from the Eagle High Plantations Sustainable Bonds I Phase I 2024 with a payment of IDR 61.84 billion. The payment was disclosed in the Indonesia Stock Exchange and was completed on July 21, 2025.

Indeks Harga Saham Gabungan (IHSG) naik 1.18% atau 86.27 poin ke level 7,398.19 pada hari Senin, meskipun investor asing melakukan aksi jual bersih sebesar Rp 180.37 miliar. Pasar menantikan kebijakan suku bunga dari Bank Sentral China yang akan diumumkan hari ini.

The rupiah weakened in the spot market, closing at IDR 16,323 per US dollar, a 0.16% decline on Monday. Meanwhile, Bank Indonesia's JISDOR rate also fell by 0.17% to IDR 16,330 per US dollar compared to the previous day's close.

The Special Task Force for Upstream Oil and Gas Business Activities reported that as of June 30, 2025, national oil lifting reached 578,000 barrels per day, which is 95.5% of the APBN target of 605,000 barrels per day. This shortfall indicates challenges in meeting the government's budgetary goals for the oil sector.

Garuda Indonesia is in talks with Boeing to acquire 50 aircraft as part of a US-Indonesia tariff agreement, with the deal estimated to be worth $3-4 billion. The airline plans to increase its fleet to 120 aircraft by 2030 and has reported a 1.6% year-on-year increase in operating revenue to $723.56 million as of March 31.

PT Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) is supporting the Red-and-White Village Urban Cooperative Program, aiming to establish 80,000 cooperatives across Indonesia, which will serve as key economic pillars in their respective communities. BNI is providing digital financial services, institutional capacity building, and access to financing to empower these cooperatives.

PT Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) is supporting the Red-and-White Village Urban Cooperative Program, aiming to establish 80,000 cooperatives across Indonesia, which will serve as key economic pillars in their respective communities. BNI is providing digital financial services, institutional capacity building, and access to financing to empower these cooperatives.

Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati announced that the country will issue its first-ever Australian-dollar-denominated 'kangaroo bonds' in August, aiming to open new pathways for Australian investors. The move reflects the country's deep bilateral ties with Australia and is expected to support Indonesia's growth and strengthen financial integration.

The Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, have collaborated to elevate the country's global investment footprint, with the ministry's diplomatic network to support Danantara's mission to become a world-class sovereign wealth fund. The partnership aims to strengthen collaboration and identify investment opportunities, with Danantara's Chief Investment Officer highlighting the importance of international partnerships and access to co-investors, capital, technology, and expertise.

PT Bayan Resources Tbk. has acquired a special coal terminal owned by PT Fajar Sakti Prima for IDR 3,305,999,298,000, with the terminal's development reaching IDR 151,696,017,668. The acquisition is expected to optimize the company's operational activities and provide more profitable terms.

The United States, under President Donald Trump, has agreed to reduce tariffs on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19% following negotiations with President Prabowo Subianto, with Indonesia reciprocating by allowing American goods at 0% duty and committing to significant imports from the US. The agreement, which includes major purchases such as $15 billion in US energy and $4.5 billion in American farm products, is pending a joint statement to finalize the specifics and timeline for implementation.

The Indonesian Palm Oil Association (GAPKI) has urged the government to resolve legal issues surrounding oil palm plantations encroaching on forest areas, as unresolved problems could significantly decrease national palm oil production and impact the industry's resilience. With only around 1.0 million hectares acquired out of a target of 1.17 million, GAPKI emphasizes the need for effective management to prevent potential production losses of approximately 4.0 million tons of palm oil, which could affect Indonesia's economy and global food prices.

Eddy Martono, chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Association, highlighted that despite potential zero percent export tariffs under the Indonesia–European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement, non-tariff barriers like the EU Deforestation Regulation pose significant threats to Indonesia's palm oil exports. He emphasized the need for a national traceability system and integrated regulations to ensure compliance with EU standards and strengthen Indonesia's position in the global supply chain.

The United States and Indonesia have reached a trade agreement that reduces tariffs on Indonesian exports to 19% and includes Indonesia's commitment to purchase $15 billion in U.S. energy, $4.5 billion in agricultural products, and 50 Boeing jets. The agreement, described as an 'extraordinary struggle' by Indonesia, marks President Trump's fourth trade deal announcement in three months, amid concerns over his volatile trade policies impacting businesses.

The United States and Indonesia have reached a trade agreement that reduces tariffs on Indonesian exports to the U.S. from 32% to 19%, while Indonesia will not impose tariffs on American exports. The deal includes Indonesia's commitment to purchase $15 billion in U.S. energy, $4.5 billion in American agricultural products, and 50 Boeing jets, marking a significant step in trade relations between the two countries.

Hashim Djojohadikusumo, President Prabowo Subianto's special envoy, emphasized the reliance of Western European countries on Indonesian palm oil for consumer goods, noting ongoing cooperation requests from European companies. Despite criticism, palm oil remains crucial to Indonesia's economy, with exports reaching $8.90 billion from January to May 2025, although experiencing fluctuations over recent years.

President Prabowo Subianto has launched 80,081 rural cooperatives to tackle food cartels, which have caused annual state losses of IDR 100 trillion (USD 6.1 billion). The cooperatives aim to shorten the distribution chain, making food prices more affordable, and will partner with state-owned enterprises to absorb unhusked rice from local farmers.

Indonesia's oil lifting reached 578,000 barrels per day in the first half of 2025, achieving 95.5% of the annual target, while total oil and gas production exceeded the target at 1.797 million barrels of oil equivalent per day. Despite strong production, oil and gas lifting was slightly below target at 1.557 million boepd, with hopes to meet 100% by year-end.

ENI (ENI), a major European energy company, intends to invest $10 billion in two offshore natural gas blocks in East Kalimantan, Indonesia, with production set to begin in 2027. This investment is expected to boost economic growth and employment in the region, with the provincial government holding a participating interest in the projects.

The number of investors in Indonesia's capital market rose to 17 million by June 2025, with domestic retail investors dominating at approximately 16.948 million, reflecting a 40% growth in 18 months. This growth is attributed to increased financial literacy and IDX's educational initiatives, with domestic retail investors accounting for 44% of the total transaction value in the first half of 2025.

Daikin has started mass distribution of its first locally manufactured residential air conditioners from its new $200 million factory in West Java, Indonesia, with the first 2,000 units of the 'Nusantara Prestige' series shipped this month. The facility aims to produce up to 1.5 million units annually by mid-2025 and plans to expand exports to the Philippines and other Southeast Asian markets by early 2027.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) aims to achieve a 10% annual growth in sales and net profit by 2025 through product and market diversification. The company plans to expand its export markets to Indochina, the Arabian Peninsula, and Africa, while continuing to distribute its flagship products to over 30 countries, with Malaysia, Nigeria, and the Philippines being the largest markets.

Barito Renewables Energy (BREN), led by energy tycoon Prajogo Pangestu, has overtaken Bank Central Asia (BCA) as the most valuable company on the Indonesia Stock Exchange with a market capitalization of Rp 1,070 trillion, compared to BCA's Rp 1,028 trillion. This shift highlights growing investor interest in renewable energy and strategic infrastructure, aligning with Indonesia's energy transition goals.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) has decided to delist eight issuers and two preferred stocks effective July 21, 2025, due to significant negative conditions impacting their business continuity. These conditions have adversely affected the companies financially and legally, with no adequate signs of recovery.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) increased by 24.89 points or 0.34% to 7,311.91 on Friday, marking a 3.75% rise over the week. Positive catalysts included a trade tariff agreement between Indonesia and the United States and a reduction in Bank Indonesia's interest rates.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened by 0.27% to Rp 16,297 per US dollar on Friday, despite a weekly decline of 0.49% from Rp 16,218. Analysts note a lack of significant economic data this week, with investors focusing on import tariff developments and upcoming remarks from Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell.

PT Perintis Triniti Properti Tbk (Triniti Land) has officially started the construction of Holdwell Business Park in Bandar Lampung, marked by a construction agreement with PT Surya Mulia Land as the main contractor. This project aims to establish the first modern business park in the region, as stated by Triniti Land's Chief Marketing Officer, Ronald Cassidy Yusuf.

Equity mutual funds experienced a 2.95% decline in returns in the first half of 2025 due to market volatility, according to Infovesta data. However, HPAM Tactical Equity from Henan Putihrai Asset Management achieved a notable return of 10.25% during the same period.

The distribution of People's Business Credit (KUR) for micro, small, and medium enterprises (UMKM) in the first half of 2025 showed positive results, with production KUR accounting for 60% of the total distribution. This achievement is attributed to President Prabowo Subianto's directive to enhance UMKM financing quality, as stated by Minister of Micro, Small, and Medium Enterprises Maman Abdurrahman.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% from 5.5% during the July 2025 Board of Governors meeting. This monetary policy is expected to provide opportunities for issuers to secure external funding.

In the third week of July 2025, foreign investors withdrew Rp 10.49 trillion from the Indonesian financial market, with significant outflows in the stock market and Bank Indonesia's rupiah securities. Non-residents recorded a net sell of Rp 1.91 trillion in the stock market and Rp 8.95 trillion in SRBI, while making a net purchase of Rp 0.38 trillion in the SBN market.

The performance of gold emitters is predicted to remain strong in the second half of 2025 due to increased gold demand, geopolitical tensions, and interest rate cuts by Bank Indonesia. Analyst Miftahul Khaer from Kiwoom Sekuritas highlights these factors as key in maintaining high gold prices.

The Indonesian government's commitment to import $4.5 billion worth of agricultural products from the United States as part of trade tariff negotiations is causing concern among local corn farmers. The specific commodities involved in the import agreement have not yet been disclosed, prompting close monitoring by the domestic corn sector.

The Indonesian government, through Perum Bulog, has launched a rice program aimed at stabilizing supply and prices, offering 5-kilogram packages of rice at Rp 62,500, aligning with the set price of Rp 12,500 per kg. This initiative, in collaboration with the National Food Agency, ensures the availability of rice with guaranteed quality and price stability.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 3.75% to 7,311.91 last week, driven significantly by stocks from Barito Group, including PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk, PT Barito Pacific Tbk, and PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk. These companies were among the top five movers out of the ten leading stocks on the Indonesian Stock Exchange during the period.

The Indonesian government is negotiating to secure a 0% tariff for key export commodities such as crude palm oil, coffee, cocoa, spices, cinnamon, nickel, and aircraft parts to the US market. Despite already achieving a tariff reduction from 32% to 19%, the efforts continue to further enhance trade benefits.

PT Pan Brothers Tbk (PBRX) is concentrating on maintaining business sustainability after completing its debt payment postponement, aiming for financial and sales improvements by 2025. The company's business performance has not yet recovered, as evidenced by a 43.85% year-on-year decline in sales to US $51.79 million in the first quarter of 2025.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) is at risk of correction on Monday after gaining 24.89 points or 0.34% to reach 7,311.91 last Friday. Global data may influence the IHSG's direction, following a 3.75% increase over the past week.

Indonesia will implement a 0% import tariff on 11,474 out of 11,552 HS codes for products originating from the United States, impacting government revenue. However, 78 HS codes, including alcoholic beverages and pork, will still incur varying tariffs.

Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, informally known as Danantara, now officially oversees all state-owned enterprises in Indonesia, ranging from large to small-scale companies. Employees of these enterprises will soon have the Danantara logo embroidered on their uniforms, replacing the traditional BUMN logo.

Bank Indonesia reports a significant increase in digital economic and financial transactions in the second quarter of 2025, with digital payment transactions growing by 30.51% year-on-year to reach 11.67 billion transactions. Mobile application transactions rose by 32.16% and internet transactions increased by 6.95% year-on-year.

BP Jamsostek recorded an investment return of IDR 29.6 trillion in the first half of 2025, marking a 13.62% increase from the same period in 2024. This growth occurred despite the fluctuating conditions in the capital market.

The sharia banking industry in Indonesia showed impressive performance with a financing growth of 8.37% year-on-year by the end of June 2025, surpassing the national banking industry's credit growth of 7.7%. PT Bank BJB Syariah reported a 9.5% annual growth in financing for the first half of 2025, driven by increased sharia financial literacy, growth in the halal sector and SMEs, and public trust in the fair and transparent sharia system, according to Arief Setyahadi, CEO of Bank BJB Syariah.

Credit growth in the banking industry has slowed to 7.77% year-on-year as of June 2025, down from 8.43% in May 2025, marking the slowest growth since March 2022. Bank Indonesia attributes this slowdown to stricter credit distribution standards and banks' preference for investing in government securities to manage non-performing loan ratios.

PT Elang Mahkota Teknologi Tbk, an insider, purchased 228,317,300 shares of PT Surya Citra Media Tbk, increasing its holding from 48,351,256,740 to 48,579,574,040 shares. The transaction was conducted in two tranches at prices of IDR 177 and IDR 187 per share, totaling IDR 228,317,300,000. This insider buy transaction may indicate the company's confidence in its future prospects.

PT Mayora Indah Tbk (MYOR) remains optimistic about the U.S. export market despite a new 19% import tariff imposed by the government starting August 1. The company is expanding its reach through Mayora USA Inc, fully controlled by its main commissioner, Jogi Hendra Atmadja.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) weakened by 2.15% by the end of June 2025, despite the challenging market conditions. However, PT Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia recorded a 48% annual growth in average monthly stock transaction values, reaching IDR 2.8 trillion.

The Indonesian government's plan to import crude oil, liquefied petroleum gas, and fuel from the United States as part of a tariff negotiation deal with President Donald Trump's administration is seen as a setback to Indonesia's energy self-sufficiency goals. The deal, which reduces reciprocal tariffs from 32% to 19%, could result in energy imports valued at nearly US $15 billion or approximately Rp 243 trillion, as confirmed by Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources Bahlil Lahadalia.

As of March 2025, bank loans in Indonesia increased by 9.16% year-on-year to IDR 7,908.42 trillion, with projections indicating further growth between 9% and 11%. Additionally, multifinance company receivables rose by 2.83% to IDR 504.58 trillion, and fintech P2P lending surged by 27.93% to IDR 82.59 trillion as of May 2025.

The Indonesian government, through Perum Bulog, has launched the Stabilization of Supply and Prices of Food (SPHP) rice program to curb rising rice prices, offering 5 kg packages at Rp 62,500. This initiative, in collaboration with the National Food Agency, aims to provide rice with guaranteed quality and pricing, aligning with the HET of Rp 12,500 per kg.

In the third week of July 2025, foreign investors withdrew Rp 10.49 trillion from Indonesia's financial market, with significant outflows from the stock market and Bank Indonesia's rupiah securities. Non-residents recorded a net sell of Rp 1.91 trillion in the stock market and Rp 8.95 trillion in SRBI, while purchasing a net of Rp 0.38 trillion in the SBN market.

The distribution of People's Business Credit (KUR) for micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) in the first half of 2025 showed positive results, with production KUR accounting for 60% of the total distribution. This success is attributed to President Prabowo Subianto's directive to enhance MSME financing quality, as stated by Minister Maman Abdurrahman.

Equity mutual funds experienced a 2.95% decline in returns during the first half of 2025 due to market volatility, according to Infovesta data. However, HPAM Tactical Equity by Henan Putihrai Asset Management achieved a notable return of 10.25% in the same period.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) increased by 24.89 points or 0.34% to 7,311.91 on Friday, marking a 3.75% rise over the week. Positive catalysts included a trade agreement between Indonesia and the United States and a reduction in Bank Indonesia's interest rates, though global data may influence a potential correction on Monday.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange has decided to delist eight issuers and two preferred stocks effective July 21, 2025, due to significant negative events impacting their business continuity. These events have adversely affected the companies financially and legally, with no adequate signs of recovery.

PT Bayan Resources Tbk is actively developing its coal facilities to increase production and fulfill long-term supply contracts with customers. The company aims to meet rising production targets, aligning with its strategic growth plans.

The Indonesian government's commitment to import $4.5 billion worth of agricultural products from the United States as part of trade tariff negotiations has raised concerns among local corn farmers. The specific commodities involved in the import agreement have not yet been disclosed, prompting close monitoring by the national corn sector.

Indonesia is set to benefit from the surge in global cocoa prices, which have increased significantly due to disease outbreaks in key producing regions in Latin America and Africa, with the country's exports of raw cacao and processed cocoa more than doubling to $2.65 billion in 2024. From January to May this year, Indonesia shipped $1.6 billion worth of cocoa, marking a 140 percent increase from the same period last year, as the government plans to begin new replanting efforts soon.

The price of Antam's certified gold bars increased by IDR 10,000 per gram to IDR 1,927,000, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 10,000 to IDR 1,773,000 per gram, resulting in a price difference of IDR 154,000 per gram. This significant price gap makes short-term trading less viable, although long-term investors have seen substantial returns, with a 24.95% profit for those who purchased a year ago.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) strengthened over five trading days from July 14-18, 2025, continuing its upward trend from the previous week. The index accumulated a 3.75% increase, closing at 7,311.91 on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened by 0.27% to Rp 16,297 per US dollar on Friday, recovering after four days of depreciation. Despite this gain, the rupiah still weakened by 0.49% over the week from its previous position of Rp 16,218 per US dollar last Friday.

President Prabowo Subianto of Indonesia and President Donald Trump of the United States have reached an initial trade agreement following previous tariff announcements in 2025. Despite earlier tariffs on Indonesian products remaining at 32%, recent negotiations have led to a preliminary consensus between the two nations.

Prajogo Pangestu has become the richest person in Indonesia and ranks 59th on Forbes' global list, as the stock prices of his companies have soared, leading to a market capitalization of IDR 2,444.74 trillion. This figure represents 18.69% of the total market capitalization of the Indonesia Stock Exchange, which stands at IDR 13,079 trillion.

Shares of PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII), a data server service provider, skyrocketed by 62.19% from IDR 151,050 to IDR 245,000 within a week, prompting the Indonesia Stock Exchange to label the stock as experiencing unusual market activity. Previously, DCII shares had been stable between IDR 140,000 and IDR 180,000 since April 2025 until mid-July 2025.

Danantara, an Indonesian investment management agency, has strengthened its strategic partnership with French global mining company Eramet to bolster downstreaming minerals in Indonesia. The partnership aims to develop a sustainable integrated ecosystem for raw materials of electric vehicle batteries in Indonesia, with Danantara managing long-term financing support and Eramet contributing technical expertise.

Shares of PT DCI Indonesia Tbk (DCII), a data server service provider, soared by 62.19% from Rp 151,050 to Rp 245,000 per share within a week, prompting the Indonesia Stock Exchange to label the stock as experiencing unusual market activity. Previously, DCII shares had been stable between Rp 140,000 and Rp 180,000 since mid-April 2025 until July 15, 2025.

Prajogo Pangestu has become the richest person in Indonesia and ranks 59th on Forbes' list of the world's wealthiest individuals, following a significant rise in the stock prices of his companies. As of Friday, his market capitalization reached IDR 2,444.74 trillion, representing 18.69% of the total IDX market capitalization of IDR 13,079 trillion.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened by 0.27% to IDR 16,297 per US dollar on Friday, recovering from a four-day decline. Despite this gain, the rupiah spot rate weakened by 0.49% over the week, while the JISDOR rate also showed a weekly decline of 0.49%.

Harga emas batangan bersertifikat di PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) naik Rp 10.000 per gram, mencapai Rp 1.927.000 per gram, sementara harga buyback juga meningkat Rp 10.000 per gram menjadi Rp 1.773.000 per gram. Untuk membaca artikel lengkap, pembaca perlu berlangganan dengan biaya Rp 20.000 per bulan setelah uji coba gratis 7 hari.

PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO) has signed a senior term facility agreement with PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk for US $135 million, equivalent to Rp 2.19 trillion, with an eight-year tenor. The company is subject to the terms and conditions of the facility agreement.

PT Pam Mineral Tbk (NICL) reported a significant increase in revenue for the first half of 2025, with sales reaching Rp 1.06 trillion, a 152.07% increase compared to Rp 419.19 billion in the same period in 2024. This substantial growth reflects the company's strong performance in both top line and bottom line metrics.

In 2025, metal mineral commodity prices have seen a substantial increase, with gold prices soaring by 27.73% to US $3,352.05 per troy ounce, according to TradingEconomics data. This trend highlights the ongoing economic dynamics affecting the commodity market this year.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 24.89 points or 0.34% to 7,311.91 on Friday, marking a weekly gain of 3.75%, driven by positive economic data from China and U.S. inflation figures. Notable gainers included Barito Pacific (BRPT), Indosat (ISAT), and Perusahaan Gas Negara (PGAS).

ASEAN is considering expanding the Regional Comprehensive Economic Partnership (RCEP) to include new members like Bangladesh, Sri Lanka, Chile, and Hong Kong, as a strategy to mitigate the economic uncertainties caused by US tariffs. The trade deal, which currently includes 15 countries and covers nearly a third of the global economy, is seen as a potential shock absorber for Southeast Asian economies facing increased US tariffs, with Indonesia recently negotiating a reduction in tariffs from 32% to 19%.

PT Pancaran Samudera Transport Tbk (PSAT), established in 2007, is optimistic about its business prospects in the domestic maritime sector, particularly in coal transportation. The company aims to provide integrated solutions in sea transportation, leveraging the significant potential in the industry.

PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk reported a significant increase in net profit, reaching Rp 7.77 billion in the first half of 2025, marking a 666.66% year-on-year growth from Rp 1.04 billion in the same period of 2024. This remarkable financial performance highlights the company's strong growth trajectory.

President Donald Trump has lowered the import tariff on Indonesian crude palm oil from 32% to 19%, providing a boost for Indonesian exporters. This decision is positively received by Indonesia's Minister of Agriculture, Amran Sulaiman, as it opens up greater export opportunities for crude palm oil producers.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate to 5.25% with the aim of lowering bank interest rates and boosting credit demand to stimulate the economy. However, banks report that tight liquidity conditions are hindering the transmission of this monetary policy change.

Indonesia's economy is at heightened risk of entering a crisis, as highlighted in mid-July 2025, due to the uncertain global economic conditions. The country's chances of revitalizing its manufacturing sector and strengthening consumer purchasing power are diminishing.

Indonesia's consumer loan growth is expected to slow down in H2 2025 as banks tighten lending standards, with non-performing loans (NPLs) increasing to 2.08% in Q1 2025, up 28 basis points from Q1 2024. Bank Central Asia (BCA), the market leader in consumer loans, has also increased mortgage rates consecutively over the past few months since end-FY2024.
