Despite a downturn in the national new car market, used car sales have shown growth, as evidenced by a 10% year-on-year increase in used car financing to Rp 117.55 trillion by May 2025. In contrast, new vehicle financing in the multifinance industry contracted by 0.24% year-on-year to Rp 234.18 trillion during the same period.

Due to a trade agreement, Indonesia's imports from the United States may increase as a result of a 0% export facility, while the import tariff from Indonesia to the US has been reduced to 19% from 32%. In return, Indonesia will import energy commodities worth US $15 billion and agricultural products worth US $4.5 billion from the US.

PT Martina Berto Tbk (MBTO) reported positive sales performance in the first half of 2025, achieving 85%–90% of its budget target despite challenging market conditions. CEO Bryan David Emil Tilaar emphasized the company's commitment to working hard and smart to navigate the difficult market landscape.

PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk (ITMG) is actively diversifying its business by expanding into new and renewable energy projects through its subsidiaries, PT ITM Bhinneka Power and PT ITM Energi Utama. A key focus is on developing solar rooftop power plants via its subsidiary, PT Cahaya Power Indonesia.

The Indonesian government is negotiating for a 0% tariff on key export commodities to the United States, despite the US having already reduced its reciprocal tariff on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19%. Susiwijono Moegiarso, Secretary of the Coordinating Ministry for Economic Affairs, stated that Indonesia is currently proposing specific commodity groups for this tariff reduction.

PT Adhi Karya Tbk (ADHI) reported securing new contracts worth Rp 3.5 trillion by the end of the second quarter of 2025, with 41% from building projects, 26% from infrastructure, and 18% from engineering industry. The company continues to diversify its portfolio across various sectors to enhance its market presence.

Despite concerns over tight liquidity, Bank Indonesia recorded a 6.96% year-on-year increase in third-party funds by June 2025, marking the highest growth rate in the first half of the year. This surge contrasts with the previous month's 3.9% growth, although it does not yet indicate a full economic recovery.

As of September 2024, only seven taxpayers have applied for the tax holiday incentive for investments in Ibu Kota Nusantara (IKN) and its partner regions, according to the Directorate General of Tax's financial report. Additionally, there have been no applications for tax holidays related to the IKN financial center, headquarters relocation to IKN, or super tax deductions.

Muhammadiyah is considering expanding its presence in the financial sector by potentially acquiring PT Bank KB Bukopin Syariah. This move follows their recent establishment of a people's economic sharia bank, indicating ongoing efforts to strengthen their role in Islamic banking.

The Indonesian government is developing a People's Business Credit (KUR) scheme for housing, expected to be formalized through a ministerial decision by the end of July 2025. Deputy Minister of State-Owned Enterprises, Kartika Wirjoatmodjo, shared insights on this scheme via Instagram, highlighting its impending launch.

The latest survey by Bank Indonesia indicates a slowdown in business activities, with the weighted net balance in Q2 2025 at 11.70%, up from 7.63% in Q1 2025, but significantly down from 17.20% in Q1 2024. This trend suggests a continued weakening of business momentum into the third quarter of 2025.

Business activity in Indonesia shows signs of weakening, with Bank Indonesia's survey indicating a weighted net balance of 11.70% in Q2 2025, up from 7.63% in Q1 2025 but significantly down from 17.20% in Q1 2024. The decline is expected to persist into the third quarter of 2025.

As of September 2024, only seven taxpayers have applied for the tax holiday incentive for investment in Ibu Kota Nusantara (IKN) and its partner regions, according to the Directorate General of Tax's financial report. PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO) has signed a senior term loan agreement with PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk for US $135 million, equivalent to Rp 2.19 trillion, with an eight-year term. The company is subject to the terms and conditions of the facility agreement.

PT Pam Mineral Tbk (NICL) reported a significant increase in sales, reaching Rp 1.06 trillion by the end of the first half of 2025, marking a 152.07% year-over-year growth compared to Rp 419.19 billion in the same period of 2024. This impressive financial performance was disclosed in the company's report to the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

Due to a trade agreement, Indonesia's imports from the US may increase as American exports to Indonesia benefit from a 0% tariff, while Indonesian exports to the US face a reduced tariff of 19% from 32%. In return, Indonesia will import US energy commodities worth $15 billion and agricultural products worth $4.5 billion.

The price of several metal mineral commodities has been rising throughout 2025, with gold prices increasing by 27.73% since the beginning of the year to $3,352.05 per troy ounce. This data is based on TradingEconomics as of Friday, highlighting a notable trend in the commodities market.

Apple (AAPL) remains committed to investing in Indonesia through its Chinese vendor Luxshare-ICT, despite a new US-Indonesia trade agreement that eliminates non-tariff barriers for US goods. The investment includes a factory in Batam for Apple's AirTag and research facilities, with a reported value discrepancy ranging from $200 million to $1 billion.

Amir Sunarko, an insider, purchased 18,987,342 shares of PT SLJ Global Tbk (SULI.JK) on 2025-07-15, increasing his stake. The transaction, valued at IDR 1,500,000,018, was conducted at IDR 79. This buy transaction suggests Amir Sunarko's confidence in the company's prospects.

Amir Sunarko, an insider, sold 13,761,468 shares of PT SLJ Global Tbk (SULI.JK) on 2025-07-15, decreasing his stake from 304,925,457 shares to 291,163,989 shares. The transaction was conducted at prices ranging from IDR 102 to IDR 103.

Indonesia will remove import tariffs on approximately 99% of US-origin goods as part of a new trade agreement, though certain products like alcoholic beverages and pork will still incur duties. This move aligns with Indonesia's broader strategy of reducing tariffs in various trade agreements, while negotiations continue to ensure key Indonesian exports like crude palm oil and nickel enter the US market without high tariffs.

Indonesia will import liquefied petroleum gas, crude oil, and refined fuel products from the United States valued at approximately $15 billion as part of a trade agreement that also reduces U.S. import tariffs on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19%. The technical arrangements for these imports will be managed by state-owned energy company Pertamina, with coordination meetings set to begin soon.

Indonesia is negotiating with the United States to eliminate tariffs on key export commodities such as palm oil, nickel, coffee, and cocoa, despite the current 19 percent import tariff on Indonesian products. While Indonesia has agreed to exempt 99 percent of US products from import duties, it will maintain tariffs on certain goods like alcoholic beverages and pork.

PT Barito Mas Sukses, a shareholder, sold 1,608,275,000 shares of PT Lovina Beach Brewery Tbk (STRK.JK) at IDR 15 per share, reducing its holding from 8,241,709,000 shares to 6,633,434,000 shares. The divestment will be followed by a strategic partnership.

The recent trade agreement between Indonesia and the United States has reduced tariffs on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19%, positively impacting the Jakarta Composite Index over the past two days. This agreement is expected to further influence related business sectors as more favorable trade terms are negotiated.

Indonesia and the US have reached a trade agreement that reduces US tariffs on Indonesian goods by 19%, while Indonesia eliminates tariffs and non-tariff barriers on US goods and pledges to buy $4.5 billion worth of farm products. To support local businesses amid increased competition, the Indonesian government is facilitating licensing and market access for micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) and enhancing their access to financing.

Vale Indonesia (VALE) aims to secure between $1 billion and $1.2 billion in financing over 2026-2027 to support its mine and smelter projects, with the first $500 million likely sourced from bank loans in early 2026. The company is developing nickel mines on Sulawesi Island and building high-pressure acid leaching smelters with partners like Ford and Zhejiang Huayou Cobalt, targeting the growing demand for electric vehicle batteries.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (BEI) has reopened trading for PT Chandra Daya Investasi Tbk and PT Indokripto Koin Semesta Tbk in the regular and cash markets starting from the first session today, Friday. This decision follows a temporary suspension of their shares on Thursday, signed by Yulianto Aji Sadono and Pande Made Kusuma Ari from BEI's transaction supervision and trading regulation divisions, respectively.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% during the governor's meeting, which is expected to positively impact various sectors, including property. Minarto Basuki, Director of PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk, stated that this rate cut is beneficial for the business world, particularly the property sector.

PT Berdikari Pondasi Perkasa Tbk (BDKR) is allocating Rp 80.32 billion for a share buyback, aiming to repurchase up to 10% of its fully paid shares without holding a general meeting of shareholders. This initiative is part of their strategic financial management to enhance shareholder value.

PT Sidomulyo Selaras Tbk (SDMU) intends to convert its debt to creditors by issuing 2.27 billion new Series B shares through a private placement, representing 66.68% of the company's issued and fully paid capital. The nominal value of each share is set at Rp 25, as part of this corporate action.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened by 0.33% against the US dollar, closing at Rp 16,340 per dollar in the spot market, following Bank Indonesia's decision to lower the benchmark interest rate to 5.25%. According to JISDOR, the rupiah also saw a slight decline of 0.25% to Rp 16,329 per dollar compared to the previous day.

Despite increasing demand for subsidized housing, developers face challenges in offering affordable homes for low-income communities. PT Ingria Pratama Capitalindo Tbk highlights the high interest in landed houses, especially in city buffer zones where land prices remain relatively affordable.

President Donald Trump announced a new tariff agreement with Indonesia, reducing tariffs to 19% from 32%, accompanied by duty-free conditions for goods entering Indonesia. Currency analyst Ibrahim Assuaibi noted that Indonesia may not be ready to handle the influx of cheaper goods.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) increased by 1.32% or 95 points to 7,287.02 on Thursday, marking its ninth consecutive day of gains and accumulating a 6.14% rise since July 4, 2025. Among the top leaders during this period, only two state-owned enterprises, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BBRI) and Telekomunikasi Indonesia (TLKM), were included.

Several new companies on the Indonesia Stock Exchange experienced a brief period of excitement following their initial public offerings (IPOs) before facing scrutiny from the exchange authorities. President Donald Trump announced a 19% tariff on Indonesia after direct negotiations with President Prabowo Subianto, which is lower than the previously proposed 32% and better compared to other Southeast Asian countries. The deal includes Indonesia's commitment to purchase 50 Boeing aircraft and various U.S. energy and agricultural products, raising concerns about potential financial burdens and strategic needs for Indonesia.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed at 7,287.02, rising by 95 points or 1.32% on Thursday, marking its fifth consecutive day of gains. However, this upward trend is not supported by any new government policy sentiment.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate by 75 basis points to 5.25% in 2025, but this has not automatically led banks to lower lending rates due to tight liquidity. Despite high net interest margins, banks are maintaining credit interest rates to manage funding costs.

BP Tapera has proposed raising the prices of subsidized houses, citing inflation as a key reason for the increase in building material costs. This proposal was discussed in a meeting with the Ministry of Infrastructure and Regional Development Coordination.

PT HM Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) is expected to see an 80.8% year-on-year increase in net profit to IDR 1.9 trillion in Q2 2025, driven by recovery from last year's 10% excise hike. In contrast, PT Gudang Garam Tbk's profit is projected to decline sharply by 69% from IDR 925.5 billion in Q1 2024.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) increased by 1.32% to 7,287.02 on Thursday, influenced by the anticipation of the upcoming Q2 2025 earnings season. Investors are advised to be cautious of potential short-term profit-taking towards the end of the week.

PT Dharma Samudera Fishing Indonesia Tbk is striving to meet its performance targets for 2025, despite facing challenges from geopolitical conflicts and potential trade wars with the United States. The company's CEO, Ewijaya, acknowledges the difficulties in the second half of the year, emphasizing the need for strategic planning to navigate these issues.

PT AKR Corporindo Tbk (AKRA) is expected to see positive performance growth in the second quarter of 2025, following a slight downturn in the first quarter. Despite a 2.28% increase in revenue to IDR 10.25 trillion, net profit decreased to IDR 565 billion from IDR 595 billion year-over-year.

The IDX Sector Basic Materials index has shown significant growth in 2025, closing at 1,571.54 with a 1.02% increase on Thursday. Year-to-date, the index has surged by 25.54%, marking it as a leading sector on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate three times this year by 25 basis points each, but mortgage borrowers still need to wait for lighter installments. According to Welly Yandoko, EVP Consumer Loan at PT Bank Central Asia, factors such as bank liquidity, cheap fund ratios, non-performing loans, and competition in the mortgage business also influence credit interest rates.

PT Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk, known as Mayapada Hospital, is set to expand its hospital network with the topping off of its eighth facility in Jakarta Garden City, East Jakarta, by July 29, 2025. This expansion aims to capitalize on future business growth opportunities in the healthcare sector.

The national car sales in Indonesia dropped by 9.7% to 390,467 units in the first half of 2025, impacting the growth of the vehicle insurance sector. With economic prospects still uncertain, significant growth in this business line is unlikely for the remainder of the year.

PT Berdikari Pondasi Perkasa Tbk (BDKR) is allocating Rp 80.32 billion to repurchase up to 10% of its fully paid shares without holding a general meeting of shareholders. This strategic move aims to enhance shareholder value and optimize the company's capital structure.

Minarto Basuki, Director of PT Pakuwon Jati Tbk, stated that the rate cut is beneficial for the business world, particularly the property sector.

PT Sidomulyo Selaras Tbk (SDMU) intends to convert its debt to creditors by issuing 2.27 billion new Series B shares through a private placement, representing 66.68% of the company's issued and fully paid capital. The nominal value of each share is set at Rp 25.

The US plan to impose a 50% import tariff on copper starting August 1 may disrupt global trade flows, posing risks to local miners, but could also present an opportunity if Indonesia faces a lower tariff rate than rival producers. Copper prices surged 13% to a record high of $5.69 per pound following the announcement, with analysts warning of potential inflationary effects in the short term.

Vietnamese electric car manufacturer VinFast plans to unveil a new right-hand drive electric car model for Indonesian consumers at the Gaikindo Indonesia International Auto Show in 2025, expanding its product portfolio in the country to five models. The company is also growing its presence with 24 showrooms and aims to establish 500 service workshops across Indonesia, alongside partnerships with local taxi and charging station companies.

Shares of PT Sariguna Primatirta Tbk (CLEO) have declined by 13.24% over the past month, reaching Rp 590 per share, and have dropped 20.95% since the beginning of the year. Although there was a 2.63% increase on Thursday, the overall performance for the week remains down by 0.85%.

Alamsyah acquired 1,567,500,000 shares of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk (IOTF.JK) at IDR 30 per share, increasing their holding from 1,567,500,000 to 3,135,000,000 shares. This buy transaction represents a significant increase in ALAMSYAH's ownership stake in the company, becoming a controlling shareholder.

On July 17, 2025, Darren Suciono sold 1,567,500,000 shares of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk (IOTF.JK) at IDR 30 per share, divesting his entire stake in the company. This transaction marks a significant change in the company's ownership structure.

PT Citra Tobindo Sukses Perkasa, a subsidiary of PT Aneka Tambang Tbk, has been requested for a debt payment suspension by PT Tembesi Sarana Transportasi. The case has been filed at the Jakarta Central District Court's Commercial Court under case number 199/Pdt.Sus-PKPU/2025/PN Niaga Jkt.Pst.

Chinese companies are increasingly entering the Indonesian market by acquiring publicly listed firms on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, attracted by lower acquisition costs compared to private companies. Indonesia is seen as a strategic market due to its potential and resource availability for production needs.

Indonesia has secured a reduction in the US reciprocal tariff on its palm oil exports from 32% to 19%, giving it a competitive advantage over Malaysia, which faces a 25% tariff. This move could enhance Indonesia's dominance in the US palm oil market, where it already accounts for 85% of imports, while Malaysia continues negotiations for a better deal.

The United States will lower its import tariffs on Indonesian products from 32% to 19% starting August 1, 2025, under a new bilateral agreement between President Donald Trump and President Prabowo Subianto, marking the lowest US tariff imposed on any ASEAN country under the Trump administration, excluding Singapore. While this move is seen as a diplomatic win for Indonesia, challenges remain in diversifying its export base and reducing dependence on raw materials, as Indonesian fisheries exporters face tighter margins with the end of zero-tariff access.

The performance of PT Tunas Baru Lampung Tbk is expected to be driven by the government's B50 policy, which aims to enhance energy independence. This program, an extension of the B40 policy, targets a foreign exchange efficiency of up to US $20 billion annually by reducing diesel imports.

Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is developing an electric vehicle battery ecosystem through six joint ventures, aiming to create an ecosystem from upstream mining to EV battery manufacturing. The company targets to produce battery cells and modules with a capacity of 15 gigawatt hours and plans to build an EV battery recycling facility in East Halmahera, North Maluku.

PT Asuransi Jiwa IFG has increased its shareholding in three companies from different sectors: PT PP Properti Tbk (PPRO), PT Semen Baturaja Tbk, and PT SMR Utama Tbk. As of July 11, 2025, IFG Life owns 5,883,939,907 shares in PPRO, marking an increase of 300,925,600 shares from July 10, 2025.

The Indonesian stock market is buoyed by two positive developments: Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% in July 2025, and the US reducing tariffs on Indonesian goods from 32% to 19%. Analysts believe these factors will invigorate the market in the short term, though investors should remain cautious of potential disruptions to the IHSG's movement.

Foreign institutional investors have been actively accumulating shares of PT Astra International Tbk (ASII) despite a downturn in automotive sales, driven by the company's solid fundamentals and attractive valuation. Notably, foreign investors recorded a net buy of ASII shares worth IDR 77.99 billion on Wednesday, with a total accumulation of IDR 226.3 billion over the past five days.

A retail investor at a securities company reported receiving a Rp 1.8 billion bill for purchasing 16,541 lots of BBTN shares, despite only intending to buy 9 lots worth Rp 1 million. The investor was confused by the unexpected charge, late fees, and threat of forced sale, claiming no such transaction was made.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) increased by 51.54 points or 0.72% to 7,192.01 on Wednesday, driven by a trade tariff agreement between Indonesia and the United States reducing tariffs from 32% to 19%. Alrich Paskalis Tambolang, an equity research analyst at Phintraco Sekuritas, attributes the IHSG's rise to this negotiation outcome.

The United States has reduced its import tariffs for Indonesia from 32% to 19%, which is lower than the tariffs imposed on Vietnam at 20% and significantly lower than those on China, which exceed 50% for many categories. This adjustment also places Indonesia in a more favorable position compared to India, which faces tariffs ranging from 23% to 25% for textiles and footwear.

The Indonesian stock market is experiencing positive momentum due to Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% in July 2025, and the United States reducing tariffs on Indonesia from 32% to 19%. Analysts suggest these factors will invigorate the market in the short term, though investors should remain cautious of potential disruptions to the IHSG's movement.

The Otoritas Jasa Keuangan (OJK) has issued regulations governing the collaboration between social media influencers and securities companies for marketing activities in the capital market. This is outlined in POJK Number 13 of 2025, which details the scope of advertising partnerships between securities companies and social media influencers.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened by 0.12% to Rp 16,287 per US dollar in the spot market, following the release of inflation data showing an upward trend. The currency was also affected by Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25%.

Reksadana pendapatan tetap mencatatkan return tertinggi sebesar 4,16% year-to-date hingga 14 Juli 2025, mengungguli reksadana pasar uang dan campuran yang masing-masing memberikan return 2,64% dan 1,53% YTD. Sementara itu, reksadana saham masih mengalami penurunan dengan return minus 1,72% YTD.

Despite a record-high rice stock of 4.2 million tons and increased national production, rice prices remain above the government-set price ceilings, with medium rice averaging Rp 14,297 per kg and premium rice at Rp 16,060 per kg. The government is intervening by releasing rice reserves and planning long-term reforms in distribution and oversight to stabilize prices and prevent fraudulent practices.

Ekonomi Indonesia masih tertekan dengan pertumbuhan kredit perbankan yang melambat, hanya mencapai 7,77% secara tahunan per Juni 2025, turun dari 8,43% pada bulan sebelumnya. Ini merupakan pertumbuhan terendah sejak Maret 2022, menunjukkan tantangan yang dihadapi sektor perbankan dalam mencapai target yang ditetapkan regulator.

PT Eastparc Hotel Tbk will distribute an interim dividend of Rp 9.07 billion, equivalent to Rp 2.2 per share, for the fiscal year 2025. Shareholders listed by July 28, 2025, are eligible to receive the dividend, following the board's approval on July 14, 2025.

The Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU-CEPA), anticipated to be implemented by September 2025, is expected to double Indonesia's textile export value by expanding market access to the European Union. The Indonesian Filament Yarn and Fiber Producers Association highlights the potential for significant export growth with this agreement.

Liquidity in the banking sector is tightening, particularly for digital banks, with some exceeding the healthy loan deposit ratio threshold of 92% set by regulators. The slow growth of third-party funds industry-wide forces digital banks to compete fiercely with established conventional banks for public deposits.

PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR) reported a 6% year-on-year increase in revenue to Rp 34.3 trillion in Q1 2025, despite a 30% drop in net profit to Rp 3.2 trillion. Analyst Indy Naila from Edvisor Profina Visindo suggests that revenue diversification into heavy equipment and green energy sectors could support future growth.

PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRTA) distributed dividends totaling Rp 96.71 billion or Rp 21 per share to its shareholders, yet the stock price remained flat at Rp 585 per share. Despite this, HRTA's stock has surged 70.76% year-to-date.

PT Malindo Feedmill Tbk (MAIN) is optimistic about increasing its poultry product exports by the end of the year, targeting US $373,000 despite global geopolitical pressures and domestic purchasing power decline. The company plans to explore new export markets to achieve this goal.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 0.72% to 7,192.01 following a trade tariff agreement between Indonesia and the U.S., reducing tariffs from 32% to 19%. Additionally, Bank Indonesia's decision to cut the benchmark interest rate from 5.5% to 5.25% provided a positive impact, particularly benefiting cyclical sectors such as banking, property, automotive, retail, and entertainment.

Indonesia's agreement with the US to lower tariffs in exchange for $15 billion in American energy imports could exacerbate its oil trade deficit, which has already reached $7.7 billion in the first five months of 2025. Economist Bhima Yudhistira warns that this deal may increase pressure on the Indonesian rupiah and necessitate higher energy subsidies, potentially reaching up to Rp 320 trillion in the 2026 fiscal year.

Indonesia's Chamber of Commerce and Industry praised the US decision to reduce import tariffs on Indonesian products from 32% to 19%, viewing it as a chance to boost exports and potentially double trade to $80 billion in five years. The agreement involves Indonesia purchasing $15 billion in American energy products and 50 Boeing aircraft, while Indonesian industries prepare to meet increased demand.

The Indonesian government plans to import 2 million cattle over the next five years to support a free nutritious meal program, with half of these being dairy cows. As of July 2, 2025, only 43% of the beef cattle import target has been met, with 231,593 cattle imported out of the 534,977 allocated for the first quarter of 2025.

PT Wijaya Karya (WIKA) reported a substantial decrease in new contracts, securing only Rp 4.3 trillion by the end of the first half of 2025, compared to Rp 10.25 trillion in June 2024. This reflects ongoing pressure on the performance of state-owned construction companies in Indonesia.

PT Waskita Karya Tbk (WSKT) is close to completing the modernization of the Rentang irrigation area in Indramayu, West Java, with the project valued at IDR 571.1 billion nearly 100% finished. The irrigation system is expected to soon facilitate water flow to agricultural lands, according to Corporate Secretary Ermy Puspa Yunita.

Despite a downturn in automotive sales, foreign institutional investors have been actively accumulating shares of PT Astra International Tbk (ASII), driven by the company's solid fundamentals and attractive valuation. Recently, foreign investors recorded a net buy of ASII shares worth IDR 77.99 billion on Wednesday, with a total accumulation of IDR 226.3 billion over the past five days.

PT Asuransi Jiwa IFG has increased its shareholding in three companies from different sectors: PT PP Properti Tbk (PPRO), PT Semen Baturaja Tbk, and PT SMR Utama Tbk. As of July 11, 2025, IFG Life holds 5,883,939,907 shares in PPRO, an increase of 300,925,600 shares from July 10, 2025.

PT Waskita Karya Tbk (WSKT) is close to completing the modernization of the Rentang irrigation area in Indramayu, West Java, with the project valued at IDR 571.1 billion nearly 100% finished. The irrigation system is expected to soon be operational to supply water to agricultural lands, according to Corporate Secretary Ermy Puspa Yunita.

The Indonesian Ministry of Environment has requested the Bogor Regency government to revoke environmental permits for eight companies operating in the Puncak area due to illegal constructions and activities damaging the ecosystem, following landslides and floods in Cisarua in March and June 2025. The violations include environmental destruction, unauthorized activities, and negative impacts from permitted operations on land owned by PTPN VIII.

The trade agreement with the United States imposes a 19% reciprocal import tariff, which is considered high and poses risks to Indonesia's trade balance, particularly in the energy sector. President Donald Trump announced that Indonesia has committed to purchasing $15 billion in energy, $4.5 billion in agricultural products, and 50 Boeing 777 aircraft.

The Indonesian stock market is buoyed by Bank Indonesia's decision to cut its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% in July 2025 and the US reducing tariffs on Indonesia from 32% to 19%. Analysts suggest these factors will stimulate the market in the short term, though investors should remain cautious of potential disruptions to the IHSG's movement.

Minister of Agriculture Andi Amran Sulaiman emphasized the importance of bold decision-making and cross-sector collaboration to drive downstream agro-industry development, citing opportunities in industrializing strategic agricultural commodities like coconut, cocoa, and cashew. He proposed raising Rp1 trillion investment through a shareholding scheme to build processing factories across Indonesia, highlighting the potential to increase export value up to 10,000 percent.

Indonesia's Trade Minister, Budi Santoso, sees the recent reduction in US import tariffs as a major investment opportunity for factories in neighboring countries to relocate to Indonesia, particularly in the production of 10 key export commodities. The Indonesian Employers Association (Apindo) is committed to evaluating the effects of the tariff exemption and is preparing mitigation proposals to help industries adapt.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources (ESDM) has supported the police in uncovering an illegal coal mining operation in Taman Hutan Raya Bukit Soeharto, East Kalimantan, resulting in the seizure of 351 containers of illegal coal and the arrest of three suspects. The operation, which has been ongoing since 2016, involved the illegal mining and distribution of coal to Surabaya.

Minister of Agriculture Andi Amran Sulaiman emphasized the importance of bold decision-making and cross-sector collaboration to drive downstream agro-industry development, citing opportunities in industrializing strategic agricultural commodities like coconut, cocoa, and cashew. He proposed raising Rp1 trillion investment through a shareholding scheme to build processing factories across Indonesia, highlighting the potential to increase export value up to 10,000 percent.

The article discusses the collaboration between the government and mining companies to ensure sustainable mining practices, focusing on post-mining reclamation and environmental management. Companies like PT Vale Indonesia and PT Timah are actively involved in reclamation projects, which include revegetation and artificial reef creation, benefiting both the environment and local communities economically and socially.

In a significant trade agreement, the US has reduced import tariffs on Indonesian products from 32% to 19%, while Indonesia will open its market to US products without import duties and commit to purchasing $15 billion in US energy products and $4.5 billion in agricultural goods. Additionally, Garuda Indonesia will acquire 50 Boeing jets, marking a successful negotiation following intense discussions between both countries' officials.

The European Union and Indonesia have reached a political agreement to advance a free trade deal, aiming to strengthen economic ties and create new market opportunities amid global tariff challenges. The agreement, expected to be finalized by the third quarter of 2025, will address issues such as tariffs on Indonesian goods and strategic economic incentives, while also navigating past disputes over palm oil and nickel exports.

US President Donald Trump announced a new trade deal that reduces tariffs on Indonesian goods to 19% and grants tariff-free access to American products, likely narrowing Indonesia's trade surplus with the US. Indonesia has committed to purchasing $15 billion in American energy products, $4.5 billion in agricultural goods, and 50 Boeing aircraft, while the US recorded a $9.7 billion trade deficit with Indonesia in the first five months of 2025.

The Jakarta Composite Index (JCI) closed higher at 6,979.88 on May 14, 2025, following U.S. President Donald Trump's announcement of reduced tariffs on Indonesian goods, while the rupiah weakened against the U.S. dollar. In exchange for tariff reductions, Indonesia committed to purchasing $15 billion in U.S. energy products and $4.5 billion in agricultural goods, alongside 50 Boeing jets, as Asian markets showed mixed results and Wall Street faced inflation concerns.

The Indonesian government, through Minister of Environment Hanif Faisol Nurofiq, is promoting Weda Bay Industrial Park to become a pioneer in the development of a green nickel industry in Indonesia. PT Indonesia Weda Bay Industrial Park (IWIP) welcomed the government's direction and committed to strengthening its environmental management system and promoting energy efficiency, waste management, and environmental rehabilitation.

President Prabowo Subianto announced that Jakarta's decision to acquire 50 Boeing jets, including many 777s, is part of a trade agreement with the US, which also involves lowering tariffs on Indonesian goods. The purchase, valued at $15 billion, aims to upgrade Garuda Indonesia's fleet, supported by a $1 billion financial package from Danantara, amid broader economic agreements involving US energy and agricultural products.

PT Freeport Indonesia is aiming to produce 441,000 tons of copper cathodes from its new smelter in Gresik, East Java, by 2025, while also producing gold and silver bullion as part of its domestic mining downstreaming process. The smelter, inaugurated by President Joko Widodo, required an investment of IDR 56 trillion and is part of the company's efforts to support the electric vehicle and energy transition sectors.

Shares of PT TBS Energi Utama Tbk have decreased by 11.80% over the past month, closing at Rp 785 per share on Tuesday. The decline follows significant sell-offs by major institutional shareholders, including a recent action by PT Bara Makmur Abadi as disclosed in a BEI information release on July 11, 2025.

Indonesian fisheries exporters are preparing for tighter margins as the United States plans to impose a 19 percent tariff on Indonesian seafood products starting August 1, up from the current 10 percent, which could significantly impact the $1.9 billion US market, particularly shrimp exports. Industry leaders urge the Indonesian government to simplify licensing and reduce fees to maintain competitiveness, while also calling on banks to increase credit ceilings to manage higher working capital needs under the new tariff regime.

Bank Indonesia has reduced its benchmark interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.25% to support sustainable economic growth and maintain rupiah stability, with further rate cuts possible if needed. The move aligns with a controlled inflation outlook and follows a tariff agreement with the US, which is expected to boost Indonesia's economic growth to between 4.6% and 5.4% in the second half of 2025.

PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk, affiliated with Prajogo Pangestu, has commenced a stock split action with a 1:10 ratio, reducing the nominal share value from Rp 200 to Rp 20 per share. This move is part of the company's strategic financial adjustments to enhance stock liquidity and marketability.

PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO) has signed a contract on July 14, 2025, to provide overburden removal services for PT Barasentosa Lestari (BSL) in Musi Rawas Utara, South Sumatra. This agreement positions PTRO as the mining services contractor for BSL's project.

The LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80 indices on the Indonesia Stock Exchange have underperformed throughout 2025, with declines of -5.71%, -4.97%, and -4.26% respectively. In contrast, the Composite Stock Price Index (IHSG) has seen a slight increase of 0.86% since the beginning of the year.

PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BBTN) has reduced fraud efforts by 80% using artificial intelligence, and is adopting a multi-layered risk approach to combat digital threats. The bank has also doubled its fraud detection accuracy and reduced verification workload by 80%, and is expanding customer education to build safer online habits.

Harga logam mulia, khususnya emas, menunjukkan prospek yang menjanjikan di tengah ketidakpastian geopolitik dan perdagangan global, meskipun fluktuasi jangka pendek mungkin terjadi. Berdasarkan data Bloomberg, harga emas spot telah naik 1,34% dalam sepekan dan menguat 22,57% sejak awal tahun, mencapai US $3.361,5 per ons troi pada hari Selasa.

Danantara Indonesia has reported its performance up to the first half of 2025, highlighting collaborations with three global sovereign wealth funds: Qatar Investment Authority, Future Fund Australia, and China Investment Corporation. The report was presented by Mohamad Al-Arief, Managing Director of Global Relations Governance at Danantara Indonesia.

Despite being integral to Indonesia's economic system, cooperatives face challenges in growth and public perception, with 130,119 active cooperatives and assets totaling Rp 275.06 trillion as of December 2023. The government's initiative to form 80,000 'Koperasi Desa Merah Putih' has sparked debate over its alignment with cooperative principles of grassroots development and mutual cooperation.

Perusahaan Umum Pembangunan Perumahan Nasional (Perumnas) is contributing to President Prabowo Subianto's initiative to build 3 million homes annually by providing 2,000 hectares of land, which can accommodate 161,000 housing units across Indonesia. This effort is part of a broader strategy to support affordable housing development in the country.

Shares of several digital banks have significantly outperformed major banks over the past week, with Allo Bank Indonesia (BBHI) leading the charge. On Tuesday, BBHI rose 5.8% to Rp 1,095, marking a 55.32% increase over the past month and a 25.14% rise in the last week.

As of July 11, 2025, foreign investors have injected Rp 17.2 trillion into the Indonesian bond market over the past month, with a year-to-date foreign net buy reaching Rp 70 trillion. This inflow is attributed to Bank Indonesia's interest rate cuts in the first half of 2025 and anticipated rate cuts by the Federal Reserve in the latter half of the year, according to Rully Arya Wisnubroto, Head of Research and Chief Economist at Mirae Asset Sekuritas.

PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk (TOWR) faces challenges from the consolidation of XL Smartfren networks, with an estimated 700 tower replacements expected by 2025 due to Indosat Ooredoo Hutchison's system phase-out and XL Smart's site rationalization. However, increased demand for fiber optics presents a growth opportunity for the company, affiliated with the Djarum Group.

The unilateral import tariffs imposed by the US on products from various countries, including Indonesia, pose a threat to the export performance of Indonesian companies. However, the health sector is projected to continue its business momentum despite these challenges.

Cement producers are facing challenges due to a 4.6% year-on-year decline in national cement consumption as of May 2025, with bulk cement sales dropping by 5.8% year-on-year. The most significant decrease occurred outside Java, with a 17.4% year-on-year decline, influenced by the slowdown in Nusantara capital city project activities.

The credit card business in banking continues to grow in the first half of the year, with transactions reaching 161.41 million in the first four months of 2025, marking a 12.6% year-on-year increase according to Bank Indonesia. However, the transaction value only rose by 4.7% year-on-year to IDR 146.07 trillion.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance anticipates the government debt ratio to rise to between 39.66% and 39.73% of GDP by 2026, driven by increased spending needs primarily funded through debt. This projection surpasses the 2025 state budget target of 39.43% of GDP.

US President Donald Trump announced a deal with Indonesia to reduce tariffs on Indonesian copper to 19% in exchange for tariff-free access to US goods, including a $15 billion purchase of US energy and $4.5 billion in American farm products. The agreement also includes Indonesia's commitment to buy 50 Boeing jets, while the US aims to secure access to Indonesia's high-quality copper reserves, crucial for electric vehicles and advanced electronics.

In just nine months of his presidency, Prabowo Subianto has strategically traveled to numerous countries, securing significant trade agreements, including a tariff reduction with the US and a comprehensive economic partnership with the EU. These efforts are part of Indonesia's strategy to enhance its global trade competitiveness, particularly in key industries like clean energy and digital technology, while balancing relations with major global powers.

Several investment management companies have successfully increased their assets under management by double digits despite market volatility in the first half of 2025. For instance, PT BRI Manajemen Investasi reported a 23% annual increase in total assets under management, reaching IDR 51.7 trillion by June 2025, with mutual fund management rising 29% to IDR 41 trillion.

The Indonesian government, through BPI and Antara, has secured a $10 billion syndicated loan, with $3 billion already drawn, to fund national strategic projects like chemical plants and housing programs. This loan is notable for not being guaranteed by the state, not supported by the budget, and not recorded in the national budget (APBN).

The Indonesian government anticipates economic growth of 4.7% by the end of the year, falling short of the 5% target due to global economic slowdown, as stated by Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, Director General of Economic and Fiscal Strategy at the Ministry of Finance. Despite various stimuli, the projected growth rate remains at 4.7% through the end of 2025.

The financing industry is striving for efficiency as the credit market remains sluggish, with several multifinance companies successfully reducing their operational expense ratios. PT CIMB Niaga Auto Finance achieved a significant improvement, lowering its operational expense to income ratio to 66.3% in June 2025, a decrease from 72.1% in the same period last year.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 43.32 points or 0.61% to 7,140.47 on Tuesday, marking its seventh consecutive day of gains. Over the past week, the index has accumulated a 3.42% increase, and it has grown by 0.86% since the beginning of the year.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) rose by 43.32 points or 0.61% to 7,140.47, despite a foreign net sell of Rp 327.76 billion, driven by gains in stocks of Prajogo Pangestu's companies, banking, and property sectors. Analysts predict a potential 25 basis points cut in Bank Indonesia's benchmark rate to 5.25%, supported by a stable rupiah and aimed at boosting economic growth amidst weak consumer purchasing power.

The U.S. has reduced additional import tariffs on Indonesian textile products from 32% to 19%, enhancing Indonesia's competitiveness in the American market compared to Vietnam and Bangladesh. This tariff reduction is part of a trade agreement where Indonesia will purchase $15 billion in American energy products, $4.5 billion in agricultural goods, and 50 Boeing aircraft, while providing tariff-free access to American products.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance projects the government debt ratio to rise to between 39.66% and 39.73% of GDP by 2026, up from the 2025 target of 39.43%. This increase is attributed to higher spending needs, with a significant portion expected to be financed through debt.

Perusahaan Umum Pembangunan Perumahan Nasional (Perumnas) is set to support President Prabowo Subianto's initiative to build 3 million homes annually by providing 2,000 hectares of land, which can accommodate 161,000 housing units across Indonesia. This initiative is part of a broader effort to enhance housing availability for the public.

The Indonesian government anticipates economic growth of 4.7% by the end of the year, falling short of the 5% target due to global economic slowdown, as stated by Febrio Nathan Kacaribu, Director General of Economic and Fiscal Strategy at the Ministry of Finance. Despite various stimuli, the projected growth rate remains modest, with similar expectations for the end of 2025.

Industri baja nasional bersiap menghadapi tantangan perdagangan akibat perpanjangan bea masuk anti-dumping oleh China sebesar 20,2% dan tarif resiprokal Amerika Serikat. Mulai 1 Agustus 2025, produk baja Indonesia yang masuk pasar akan dikenakan tarif tambahan sebesar 32%.

Harga emas spot mengalami kenaikan 1,34% dalam sepekan terakhir, mencapai US$ 3.361,5 per ons troi, dengan peningkatan 22,57% sejak awal tahun. Ketidakpastian geopolitik dan perdagangan global terus mendukung prospek positif logam mulia meskipun ada fluktuasi jangka pendek terkait perkembangan ekonomi.

The performance of Indonesia's leading stock indices, LQ45, IDX30, and IDX80, has been weak throughout 2025, with declines of -5.71%, -4.97%, and -4.26% respectively. In contrast, the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) has seen a slight increase of 0.86% since the beginning of the year.

PT Petrosea Tbk (PTRO) has signed a contract on July 14, 2025, to provide overburden removal services for PT Barasentosa Lestari (BSL) in Musi Rawas Utara, South Sumatra. This contract positions PTRO as the mining services contractor for BSL's operations in the region.

PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk, a mining company affiliated with Prajogo Pangestu, has commenced a stock split action with a 1:10 ratio, reducing the nominal share value from Rp 200 to Rp 20 per share. This move is part of the company's strategy to enhance stock liquidity and attract more investors.

The Indonesian government is investigating major corporations, including Wilmar Group, PT Belitang Panen Raya, PT Sentosa Utama Lestari, and PT Food Station Tjipinang Jaya, for allegedly adulterating rice and selling it as premium, potentially causing consumer losses of up to IDR 99 trillion annually. The Food Task Force of the Indonesian National Police has summoned these companies regarding suspected violations in quality and packaging standards.

PT Abadimukti Gunalestari sold 112,155,200 shares of Perdana Gapura Prima Tbk (GPRA.JK) on 2025-07-15, reducing its holding from 3,022,607,120 shares to 2,910,451,920 shares, representing a 2.62% decrease in ownership. The transaction was made for investment purposes.

Bank Indonesia is likely to keep its interest rate at 5.5% during the July 2025 meeting, as economic uncertainty from U.S. import tariffs persists. This decision is influenced by ongoing foreign capital outflows from domestic financial markets, according to a survey of economists and insights from Bank Syariah Indonesia's Chief Economist, Banjaran Surya Indrastomo.

PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (WIFI) is expected to see significant performance growth due to massive expansion and strategic partnerships, according to Liza Camelia Suryanata from Kiwoom Sekuritas Indonesia. The anticipated growth in early 2025 signals potential revenue and profit increases in the coming years.

Indonesia's labor-intensive industries, such as textiles and footwear, are at risk of losing global competitiveness due to the US's reciprocal tariff policies, which impose higher tariffs on Indonesian products compared to neighboring countries. The Indonesian Employers Association is calling for stronger support from the government to provide fiscal and non-fiscal incentives to help keep these industries competitive.

Indonesia may lose its palm oil market to Malaysia if it fails to secure a lower tariff than its neighbor in negotiations with the US government, with the country's palm oil exports reaching $8.9 billion between January and May 2025. The Indonesian Palm Oil Association is pushing for trade diversification into new markets, including the European Union and Turkey, to mitigate the impact of looming tariffs.

PT Petrosea Tbk has signed a mining services contract with PT Barasentosa Lestari worth IDR 3.5 trillion, covering stripping and overburden removal services at a coal mine in South Sumatra. This contract is part of Petrosea's long-term strategy to increase value creation through business expansion and development in the region.

Indonesia's payment infrastructure is rapidly evolving with the expansion of real-time digital transaction capabilities, as seen in the increased usage of QRIS and BI-FAST systems, which have significantly boosted non-cash transactions to 80% of all transactions. Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) is at the forefront, serving over 4,000 corporate clients and government agencies through API-based services, while also preparing for the rollout of the digital rupiah amidst a streamlined regulatory landscape and ongoing cybersecurity challenges.

The Indonesian Energy Coal Suppliers Association has requested that the government implement export duties on mining commodities in stages, considering the current pressure on the national mining sector from falling demand and commodity prices. The association hopes for flexibility through incentives for domestic mining to maintain industrial competitiveness and support downstreaming energy self-sufficiency agendas.

PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk is taking a cautious approach in diversifying its business into non-coal sectors, particularly renewable energy. The company emphasizes careful execution in its strategic shift to ensure sustainable growth and investment returns.

The stock price of PT Sinergi Inti Andalan Prima Tbk has experienced a significant increase since the beginning of the 2025 trading year. There are currently no signs of a reversal in this upward trend.

The Indonesian Employers Association warns that the US's plan to impose a 32% tariff on Indonesian goods could lead to mass layoffs, especially in labor-intensive sectors, and cause significant economic challenges such as rupiah volatility and a decline in the manufacturing PMI. Additionally, there is concern over a potential influx of Chinese goods into Indonesia, which could further strain local industries and exacerbate economic instability.

Indonesia may cancel plans to import energy commodities from the U.S. if Washington does not lower tariffs on Indonesian goods, as negotiations led by the chief economic minister continue. The U.S. plans to impose a 32% tariff on Indonesian imports starting August 1, while Indonesia aims to increase imports from the U.S. by $34 billion, with $10-15 billion allocated for energy commodities, contingent on tariff reductions.

PT Sentra Investa Maksima, an insider, sold 3,200,000 shares of PT Lavender Bina Cendikia Tbk (BMBL.JK) on July 14, 2025, at IDR 16 per share, reducing its holding from 122,616,900 shares to 119,416,900 shares. The purpose of the transaction was for liquidity.

Indonesia's external debt reached $435.6 billion in May 2025, marking a 6.8% increase from the previous year, with a manageable debt-to-GDP ratio of 30.6% and 85% of the debt being long-term. Government debt rose by 9.8% to $209.6 billion, while private sector debt saw a 0.9% contraction, indicating prudent management and economic resilience according to Bank Indonesia.

The Ministry of Investment is promoting coal downstreaming projects, with PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) and PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGN) expected to play key roles in increasing added value and reducing dependence on imports. The projects aim to produce synthetic natural gas, which can be used in the electricity industry or as a raw material for petrochemical products, and boost domestic ammonia and methanol production.

President Prabowo Subianto of Indonesia met with European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen in Brussels to finalize a political agreement on the Indonesia-EU Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), aiming to reduce tariffs on traded goods to zero percent. This agreement comes as both regions seek to diversify trade in response to US President Donald Trump's tariff campaigns, with the EU planning to impose countermeasures if necessary.

The 2025 Jakarta Asian Banking Finance – Insurance Asia Summit focused on the impact of digital disruption, with executives from companies like PwC, AXA, and Citi discussing the need for innovation and data-driven strategies. Key topics included the role of AI in fraud detection, the integration of banking services into lifestyle apps, and the importance of regulatory alignment and cybersecurity resilience.

Keputusan Menteri ESDM Nomor 72 Tahun 2025 menetapkan empat jenis Harga Batubara Acuan (HBA) berdasarkan nilai kalori batubara, yaitu HBA untuk 6.322 kcal/kg GAR, HBA I untuk 5.300 kcal/kg GAR, HBA II untuk 4.100 kcal/kg GAR, dan HBA III untuk 3.400 kcal/kg GAR. Harga patokan batubara selanjutnya dihitung berdasarkan kualitas batubara yang meliputi nilai kalor, kandungan air, kandungan sulfur, dan kandungan abu.

President Prabowo Subianto and European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen discussed increasing European investment and technological cooperation with Indonesia, as both sides near the conclusion of a comprehensive economic partnership agreement. The agreement is expected to boost Indonesia's exports to the EU by over 50% within three to four years, with 80% of exports enjoying zero tariffs, benefiting industries such as footwear, textiles, and renewable energy.

President Prabowo Subianto arrived in Brussels for high-level talks with EU leaders to finalize the Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (CEPA), which aims to eliminate tariffs on a substantial share of bilateral trade. The agreement, expected to be signed in the third quarter of 2025, could boost Indonesia's exports to the EU by over 50% within three to four years by improving market access and removing key trade barriers.

PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, an insider, sold 361,445,800 shares of Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA.JK) at IDR 75 per share, reducing its stake from 21.96% to 21.07%. The purpose of the transaction was divestment. This sale represents a significant reduction in PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's ownership in Darma Henwa Tbk.

PT Hengjaya Mineralindo won the gold award at the 2025 Indonesia Sustainable Responsible Awards in the biodiversity management category for its flagship program, Bio-Spark, demonstrating the company's commitment to sustainable and environmentally conscious mining practices. The Bio-Spark program is an integrated biodiversity conservation initiative developed across a 196.78-hectare area within the company's mining business permit area.

Thiess has obtained a 14-month contract extension from PT Wahana Baratama Mining for the Wahana coal mine in South Kalimantan, Indonesia, continuing its overburden removal and coal mining activities. This extension, which highlights Thiess's commitment to safety and operational excellence, is expected to increase production output through 2025 and 2026.

Regional tax revenue in Indonesia has decreased by 8.06% year-on-year to IDR 107.7 trillion as of June 2025, falling short of the 6% annual growth target. The decline is attributed to economic pressure, posing a challenge to fiscal independence in the regions.

Indonesia's trade surplus is at risk of reversing to a deficit this year due to the government's plan to import energy and agricultural products from the US, with an investment value of $34 billion. This move is expected to impact the country's trade balance.

The banking, telecom, and mining sectors in Indonesia are expected to face challenges in Q2 2025, with lower-than-expected profits and revenue growth. However, consumer goods companies, particularly those focused on staple foods, are expected to meet Bloomberg's consensus estimates, driven by the government's stimulus package.

Indonesia's economy is showing signs of slowing down, with car sales declining 22.6% year-over-year and 12.3% month-over-month, with only 57,760 units sold in the latest month. This decline is a worrying signal for the economy, highlighting the need for swift action from fiscal and monetary authorities.
PT United Tractors TBK (UNTR) shares have been on a three-day winning streak, closing at IDR 22,200 on Thursday. Despite this rebound, the potential for further price increases appears limited.

Four securities firms have recommended buying PT Japfa Comfeed Indonesia Tbk (JPFA) shares, coinciding with the stock's price increase since July 2, 2025. The recommendation is expected to further boost the stock's value.

PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur TBK's (IOTF) stock price surged despite the sale of shares by its new controlling shareholder, PT Gaia Artha Dinamic (Gaia), which is unusual as large sales typically lead to a decline in stock price. The stock price rose after Gaia sold part of its ownership, contradicting the usual market trend.

Amid high market volatility in 2025, investors are advised to be selective in choosing quality assets that can adapt to macroeconomic cycles. The equity market is currently under pressure due to a combination of global sentiments, including the development of US tariffs and high geopolitical tensions.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) reached 7,000 on Thursday, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 393.79 billion, bringing the total net sell to IDR 4.8 trillion in July and IDR 55.75 trillion in 2025. Meanwhile, the labor market condition remains concerning, with the unemployment rate increasing to 7.28 million people in February 2025.

PT Timah Tbk (TIMAH) reported a decline in its Q1 2025 performance due to heavy rain disrupting operations, but management expects production to improve in the second half of 2025 with more favorable weather conditions and resolution of legal issues. The company is optimistic about its prospects, citing the completion of legal hurdles related to overlapping mining areas.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.21% against the US dollar on Thursday, closing at Rp 16,224 per dollar, driven by a decline in the US dollar. The Federal Reserve's June meeting minutes revealed that most officials expect a rate cut by the end of the year.

PT Chandraya Daya Investasi Tbk (CDIA) saw its stock price surge 25% to IDR 320 per share on its second day of trading, with a total transaction value of IDR 586.3 billion. The company's stock has been on an upward trend since its listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange.

The growth of middle-lower class savings in Indonesia has slowed down to 3.7% due to global uncertainty, compared to 4.8% in January 2025. This has led to difficulties in finding formal employment and a shift to informal sectors, resulting in unstable income.

Four companies, including PT Diastika Biotekindo Tbk, PT Trimatra Trans Persada Tbk, PT Merry Riana Edukasi Tbk, and PT Prima Multi Usaha Indonesia Tbk, have been listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, raising a total of IDR 30.09 billion in IPO funds, which will be used to support their expansion plans.

The Indonesian insurance industry saw a 3.43% year-over-year increase in premium revenue to IDR 66.08 trillion in May 2025, but the sector's risk-based capital ratio decreased to 311.04% from 326.66% in the same period last year. No specific company mentions were made in the article.

PT Kalbe Farma Tbk (KLBF) is strengthening its business strategy by expanding into the Southeast Asian market, focusing on specialty product penetration to drive continuous growth amidst global market uncertainty. The company aims to capitalize on regional market opportunities to fuel its business expansion.

The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) rose 0.88% to 7,005.37 on Thursday, driven by factors including global index gains, new stock listings, and corporate action information. The index is expected to continue its upward trend on Friday, influenced by market sentiment and investor attention to US President Donald Trump's import tariff policy.

PT Gaia Artha Dinamic sold 195438200 shares of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk, reducing its holding from 395393100 to 199954900. The transaction type was a sale, with a purpose of Transaksi Penjualan Saham IOTF oleh GAIA.

The Indonesian textile industry is at risk of significant job losses and reduced production due to a potential 32% US import tariff, which could affect up to 70,000 workers if not negotiated down by the government. The US accounts for 40% of Indonesia's textile exports, and the industry is already disadvantaged compared to competitors like Vietnam, which benefits from a lower US tariff and larger production capacity.

The Indonesian government plans to implement a mandatory biodiesel 50% program in 2026, which is expected to increase the demand for crude palm oil (CPO) and potentially raise its global market price. The program will require around 5.3 million tons of CPO, which will be diverted from exports to support domestic biodiesel production.

The European Union's deforestation regulation, to be applied from the end of 2025, is expected to pose challenges to Indonesia's palm oil industries, but also drive improvement in governance. The regulation may trigger the acceleration of Indonesian sustainable palm oil certification, especially among smallholders, with only around 1% currently certified.

Indonesia's palm oil industry is expected to face challenges in 2025, including high import tariffs imposed by the US and structural problems within the country, which may weaken its competitiveness in the global market. The industry is also facing declining export demand and increasing production costs due to geopolitical conflicts and regulatory issues.

South Sumatra has banned coal trucks from using public roads after the partial collapse of the Muara Lawai Bridge, highlighting the strain on infrastructure from Indonesia's booming coal industry. The province, contributing 50 million tons to the national coal output, faces significant road damage and repair costs, prompting calls for mining companies to build dedicated transport routes.

Foreign institutional investors have purchased 583.9 million shares of PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) between July 2-10, 2025, despite the stock's failure to rebound from its decline since May 22, 2025. The stock currently trades at IDR 8,575 per share.

Four companies from the healthcare, logistics, and education sectors made their debut on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, lifting the Jakarta Composite Index above 7,000. Notable performances included Diastika Biotekindo (DB) and Merry Riana Edukasi (MRE) both surging 34%, while Trimitra Trans Persada (TTP) rose 25%, and Prima Multi Usaha Indonesia (PMUI) fell 15% on its first trading day.

A proposed policy change to shorten the work plan and budget period from three years to one year is expected to have varying impacts on the Indonesian mining sector, with some companies likely to be negatively affected and others to benefit. The proposal was initiated by the Indonesian Parliament's Commission XII in a working meeting with the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources.

PT Indonesia Battery Corporation emphasizes the importance of developing an integrated electric vehicle battery ecosystem in Indonesia to enhance the country's role in the global EV battery market, aligning with President Prabowo Subianto's goal of increasing the added value of mining products. The project, involving a total investment of USD 5.9 billion and creating up to 8,000 direct and 35,000 indirect jobs, is a joint venture with PT Aneka Tambang and Ningbo Contemporary Brunp Lygend Co. Ltd., covering both upstream and downstream battery ecosystems.

Indosat Ooredoo's IM3 has narrowed the download speed gap with XL Axiata, reaching 24.2 Mbps. This development intensifies the competition among Indonesian telecom operators to improve their network quality.

The Indonesian government has continued to strengthen trade relations with the United States, marked by a crucial meeting between the Indonesian delegation led by Coordinating Minister of Economic Affairs Airlangga Hartarto and high-ranking US officials. The two countries agreed to expedite tariff negotiations over the next three weeks to achieve the best possible outcome, with a focus on cooperation in the mining sector, particularly in critical minerals such as nickel, copper, and cobalt.

The Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources stated that 70% of Indonesia's coal energy sources are supplied by the island of Kalimantan, with a production target of 710 million tons in 2024, which was exceeded by 117.76% to reach 836.1 million tons, valued at USD 37.773 billion. The non-tax state revenue from the mineral coal sector in 2024 reached IDR 140,460 trillion, 123.75% of the target, equivalent to 52% of the total PNBP from the Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources.

PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) has increased the price of its 24-karat gold by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,894,000 to Rp 1,902,000. The buyback price has also risen by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,738,000 to Rp 1,746,000.

Amman Mineral (AMMN) has disbursed USD 2.85 million for exploration activities in the Sumbawa region, West Nusa Tenggara, with a focus on the Elang block, where exploration value reached USD 2.2 million. The company has completed seven drill holes, totaling 3,500.7 meters, and collected 1,479 core samples for further testing.

Sukarto Bujung Rajin, also known as 'Crazy Rich Palembang', has increased his stake in PT Buyung Poetra Sembada Tbk and PT Multi Indocitra Tbk by purchasing 1,770,100 shares and 100,500 shares, respectively, between July 1 and July 8, 2025. This move is part of his efforts to expand his ownership in these two companies.

Mark Dynamics Indonesia (MARK) reported export sales of Rp 173.80 billion in Q1 2025, accounting for 85.60% of its total revenue of Rp 203.03 billion. The company remains cautious about the impact of geopolitical and global economic dynamics on its export market.

PT Kimia Farma Tbk (KAEF) has revised its 2023 consolidated financial report following the discovery of irregularities by the Attorney General's Office. The revised report is expected to provide a more accurate picture of the company's financial performance.

Inpex Corporation's subsidiary, Inpex Masela, Ltd, is completing the final stage of the tender process for the LNG Abadi project, with the front-end engineering design phase set to begin soon. The project is considered strategic and important for both Inpex and Indonesia, according to Executive Project Director Jarrad Blinco.

PT Pertamina has signed a memorandum of understanding to purchase liquefied petroleum gas, gasoline, and crude oil from the United States as part of a negotiation on import tariffs with the government. FKS Group and Sorini Agro Asia Corporindo have also signed agreements to buy corn from Cargill.

Colliers Indonesia reports that the supply of office space in Jakarta has not increased in the first half of 2025, with a predicted decrease in unabsorbed office space in the Central Business District from 1.9 million square meters in 2024 to 1.8 million square meters in 2025.

PT Summarecon Agung Tbk (SMRA) has acquired land in Serpong, Banten, and Bekasi, West Java, with a total value of Rp 3.8 trillion, expanding its land bank to support future growth. The acquisition includes 121.7 hectares of land in Serpong and 3.35 hectares in Bekasi.

The outstanding credit of Indonesian banks grew 8.43% year-over-year to IDR 7.998 trillion in May 2025, a slower pace compared to the previous month's 8.88% growth and December 2024's 10.46% growth. The slowdown is mainly attributed to weak demand for working capital credit.

State-owned banks in Indonesia are tasked with supporting the government's priority programs, including the 3 million housing program, Red-White Cooperative program, and downstreaming program, with a financing target of up to IDR 3 billion per cooperative. The banks are expected to provide financing for the formation of 80,000 Red-White Cooperatives.

Despite the government's rice stockpiles reaching a record high of 4.24 million tons, rice prices have continued to rise, with medium and premium rice prices exceeding the government's highest retail price by 13%. The high prices are attributed to the high cost of purchasing rice from farmers, which has led to increased production costs and limited distribution to the market.

Several Indonesian coal miners, including PT Indo Tambangraya Megah Tbk (ITMG), PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI), and PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR), are diversifying into the mineral sector through acquisitions and expansions, with a total investment value of over IDR 1 trillion (approximately USD 70 million).

PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk (DSNG) is set to repay its IDR 176 billion bond, which is part of its IDR 415 billion continuous bond issuance in 2020, with a 5-year tenure and a 9.90% coupon rate. The company has ensured that the bond repayment will not affect its operational, legal, financial, or business continuity.

PT Chandra Daya Investasi, a subsidiary of petrochemical giant PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (CAPC), has listed its shares on the Indonesian Stock Exchange, with its initial public offering (IPO) oversubscribed 563.64 times. The company's shares were in high demand, with the centralized allocation oversubscribed 563.64 times and the fixed allocation oversubscribed 15.06 times.

The Indonesian government plans to increase its infrastructure spending by IDR 68.8 trillion next year, as proposed by the Ministry of Public Works, to strengthen management and technical program support. This move is in line with President Prabowo Subianto's administration's focus on infrastructure development.

PT Petrindo Jaya Kreasi Tbk (PJKA) will conduct a 1:10 stock split on July 15, 2025, which will change the nominal value of its shares from IDR 200 to IDR 20 per share, increasing the total number of shares from 11.24 billion to 112.41 billion.

Indokripto Koin Semesta TBK, a cryptocurrency futures exchange, has listed on the Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) through an initial public offering (IPO), raising Rp 220.58 billion by offering 2.2 billion shares at Rp 100 per share. The IPO was oversubscribed by more than 180 times, with over 200,000 investors participating.

Indonesian retail sales grew 2% year-over-year in June 2025, according to a survey by Bank Indonesia, driven by seasonal factors. The real sales index reached 233.7, slightly higher than the 1.9% annual growth in the previous month.

Indonesia's life insurance industry saw a 1.33% decline in premium revenue to IDR 72.53 trillion in the first five months of the year, with Ciputra Life (no ticker) experiencing a 14.54% drop in premium revenue to IDR 207.25 billion as of May 2025.

The Indonesian government's debt has reached IDR 9.116 trillion as of June, sparking concerns about the country's fiscal sustainability. The debt has increased by IDR 315.4 trillion in the first semester of 2025, with no significant impact on the country's economic growth.

Indonesia and the US have agreed to intensify negotiations on reciprocal tariffs over the next three weeks, following a high-level meeting between Coordinating Minister of Economy Airlangga Hartarto and US Secretary of Commerce Howard Lutnick. The meeting aimed to finalize a mutually beneficial agreement, covering non-tariff barriers, digital economy cooperation, economic security, and investment partnerships.

Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, is advised to prioritize long-term real sector investments to maximize its contribution to national economic growth, with a focus on intermediate industries to reduce dependency on imports and create jobs. The fund has secured USD 7 billion in international investment commitments and recently attracted USD 10 billion from ACWA Power for large-scale clean energy projects.

PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, a shareholder, sold 666,666,666 shares of Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA.JK) at IDR 75 per share, reducing its holding from 9,598,771,188 shares to 8,933,210,522 shares. The transaction, categorized as divestment, resulted in a 1.63% decrease in PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara's ownership in Darma Henwa Tbk.

The number of Indonesian corporations defaulting on online loan payments is on the rise, with entrepreneurs often requiring quick funds for expansion or operational needs. This trend is expected to continue, posing a significant risk to the financial sector.

United Tractors (UNTR) aims to achieve 240,000 ounces of gold production in 2025, a slight increase from 235,000 ounces in the previous year, with the company having already recorded 100,000 ounces of gold sales as of May 2025. The company is also eyeing expansion into copper mining, particularly in Australia, and is financially well-positioned to seize opportunities.

PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) has reduced the price of its 24-karat gold by Rp 12,000 per gram, from Rp 1,906,000 to Rp 1,894,000. The buyback price has also decreased by Rp 12,000 per gram, from Rp 1,750,000 to Rp 1,738,000.

Indonesia's loan growth slowed to 8.1% YoY in May 2025 due to tight liquidity and weak credit appetite, with UOB Kay Hian (UOBKH) economists expecting another 25 basis point rate cut in H2 2025 to support liquidity. Government spending is also expected to accelerate towards the end of 2025 to stimulate the economy.

The Indonesian Energy Ministry is considering direct appointment for oil and gas blocks, deviating from the current tender-based system, to provide more certainty and ease for investors in the upstream sector. The move is part of the ministry's efforts to revise the 2001 Oil and Gas Law to attract more investment.

PT Timah Tbk and PT Bukit Asam Tbk are preparing strategies to adapt to the potential change in the submission of work plans and budgets for mineral and coal mining permit holders from a three-year to a one-year period. The move comes after the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources approved the proposal to evaluate the submission of work plans and budgets for mining companies on a yearly basis.

The Indonesian government plans to impose export tariffs on coal and gold next year, which is expected to increase the burden on the domestic industries. The decision was made during a working meeting between the government and the House of Representatives' Commission XI, attended by Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati, Minister of National Development Planning Rachmat Pambudy, and Bank Indonesia Governor Perry Warjiyo.

China has extended anti-dumping duties on stainless steel billet and hot-rolled coil (HRC) products, but the impact is expected to be minimal on Indonesian steel issuers. The move is seen as a trade protection measure by China to safeguard its domestic industry.

PT Pancaran Samudera Transport Tbk (PSAT) and PT Asia Pramulia Tbk have listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, with PSAT raising IDR 200.1 billion from its IPO, offering 222.35 million shares at IDR 900 per share. This brings the total number of listed companies on the exchange to 16 in 2025.

Deposits from individual and corporate customers in Indonesian banks grew only 4.4% year-over-year in May 2025, a significant slowdown from 12.3% growth in May 2024. The growth rate has been declining since January 2025, according to data from the Deposit Insurance Corporation.

PT Pancaran Samudera Transport Tbk (PSAT) and PT Asia Pramulia Tbk have listed on the Indonesia Stock Exchange, with PSAT raising IDR 200.1 billion from its IPO, offering 222.35 million shares at IDR 900 per share. This brings the total number of listed companies on the exchange to 16 in 2025.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.21% against the US dollar to IDR 16,205 per dollar, following President Donald Trump's decision to delay tariffs on 14 countries, including Indonesia, until August 1. The delay is seen as an opportunity for a trade agreement to be reached.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has provided a $150 million loan to its subsidiary, PT Mitra Eneri Pelayaran, to support its oil and gas business operations. This loan is part of the company's strategy to optimize its internal cash flow and comes after two other subsidiaries received a $500 million loan facility from several banks.

The Indonesian manufacturing industry, particularly the palm oil sector, is expected to be negatively impacted by the 32% import tariff imposed by the US, with exports potentially decreasing by 15-20%. This could lead to additional pressure on the industry, which has already been experiencing contraction.

The Indonesian stock market index rose 0.05% to 6,904.39 on Tuesday, influenced by mixed sentiment including concerns over potential non-performing loans and the impact of the US reciprocal tariff announcement, but supported by the initial public offering (IPO) sentiment.

The prospects for corporate bonds in Indonesia remain promising for the rest of 2025, driven by refinancing needs and lower interest rates. The total value of corporate bonds maturing this year has reached IDR 161 trillion.

Credit growth in Indonesia's banking sector continues to slow down since the beginning of 2025, with some banks revising their growth targets downward. Despite this, major banks are still holding onto their ambitious targets set at the start of the year.

The Indonesian government's plan to impose export tariffs on coal in 2026 may increase pressure on coal miners, potentially reducing their profit margins and affecting their cash flow. PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) and other coal miners may need to absorb the additional cost or pass it on to customers, which could impact their competitiveness in the global market.

The Indonesian Ministry of Marine Affairs and Fisheries plans to certify small islands in the country to prevent their sale on foreign online platforms. The government aims to take ownership of the land on these islands, with the plan still in the discussion phase.

PT Mitra Adiperkasa Tbk, which operates 3,791 retail stores with 31,766 employees, is committed to running a business that considers environmental, social, and governance (ESG) practices.
