The project, which was initiated four years ago during the presidency of Joko Widodo, aims to create an integrated ecosystem for electric vehicle batteries.

The Indonesian sovereign wealth fund, Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Andalan Nusantara, has instructed state-owned enterprises (BUMN) to hold their annual shareholder meetings (RUPS) by June, as required by law. This comes after the fund previously prohibited non-publicly traded BUMN from holding RUPS in early May.

The Indonesian Life Insurance Association reported a 1.5% year-over-year decline in premium income from life insurance agents, reaching IDR 13.9 trillion in Q1-2025, following a 2.4% decline in January-March 2024. The decline is attributed to the decreasing popularity of unit-linked products and the increasing use of digital channels.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) has launched a $5.9 billion electric vehicle battery ecosystem project, one of several large-scale projects by Indonesian state-owned enterprises. The project is developed in collaboration with Indonesia Battery Corporation and CATL.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) surged 0.96% or 65.26 points to 6,897.40 in the last trading session, despite still recording a 0.14% decline over the four-day trading period from June 23-26, 2025.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) has been weakening, down 2.58% since the start of the year, and is expected to remain limited in growth by the end of 2025, but Maybank Sekuritas Indonesia maintains its target of 7,300 for the year, assuming a 6% growth in earnings per share.

PT Industri Jamu dan Farmasi Sido Muncul Tbk (SIDO) aims to improve its performance in the remaining 2025 period after experiencing a decline in the first quarter. The company's sales grew well year-on-year in April-May, resulting in a positive increase in its first-half 2025 performance compared to the first quarter.

Insider Vientje Harijanto acquired 21,641,200 shares of PT Malacca Trust Wuwungan Insurance Tbk, increasing their stake from 124,441,296 to 146,082,496 shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 2,164,120,000,000, was executed at IDR 100 per share.

Indonesian coal miners are realigning their strategy to focus on domestic sales and smelting due to shrinking export opportunities, with thermal coal exports to China and India dropping 12.3% and 14.3%, respectively, in the first five months of 2025. Miners are also urging the government to roll back regulations that add financial strain to the already challenging market.

Surono Subekti, an experienced individual investor, has increased his stake in PT Brigit Biofarmaka Teknologi Tbk (BRBF) to 8.89% by acquiring an additional 310,000 shares, bringing his total holdings to 53,310,000 shares. This move marks a significant increase in his ownership of the company.

Despite the news of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel on June 24, the Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) failed to rise, instead experiencing a correction. Meanwhile, most global stock markets moved upwards during the same period.

Djarum Group, through its entity PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, acquired 559.185 million shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a hospital network operator, at a price of IDR 1,875 per share, valuing the transaction at around IDR 1.05 trillion. This acquisition expands Djarum Group's investment portfolio.

Indonesia's national cement consumption decreased by 4.6% in May 2025 due to normalization of demand from the new capital city project and ongoing purchasing power challenges. This decline is expected to continue for several months, affecting the performance of major cement producers such as Semen Indonesia (SMGR) and Indocement Tunggal Prakarsa (INTP).

President Prabowo is set to launch the groundbreaking of the Feni Haltim energy project in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara on June 29, 2025, with an investment value of $6 billion or approximately Rp 97.8 trillion. The project will establish a new energy zone based on nickel as a raw material.

The Indonesian Anti-Corruption Commission (KPK) is investigating alleged corruption in the procurement of goods and services, specifically EDC machines, at PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BRI). The KPK has summoned former BRI Vice President Director Catur Budi Harto for questioning, but has not yet named any suspects.

Indonesia's tax revenue in Semester I-2025 is expected to contract 35-40% compared to the same period last year, which recorded IDR 885 trillion. This contraction is predicted despite an assumption of positive growth in other tax revenues.

The Directorate General of Taxes is finalizing regulations to appoint marketplaces as tax collectors for online sellers, with a 0.5% final income tax rate applicable to micro, small, and medium-sized enterprises with annual sales above IDR 500 million. Online sellers with sales below IDR 500 million will be exempt from the tax.

Merry Riana Education, a Indonesian education company, is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite challenging market conditions. The company's founder and commissioner, Merry Riana, remains optimistic about the listing, citing the company's organic growth since 2014.

Indonesia's government is facing fiscal pressure this year, with a budget deficit since the beginning of the year, and is considering increasing bond issuance to address the issue, with a current deficit of Rp 21 trillion or 0.09% of GDP as of May.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 1.2% against the US dollar this week, closing at Rp 16,209 per dollar on Thursday, as the US dollar weakened. The rupiah also strengthened 1.01% against the dollar in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (Jisdor) to Rp 16,233 per dollar.

Despite a challenging market, some Indonesian investment firms are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025, following negative investment results in Q1 2025, with PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk (SRTG) reporting a net loss of IDR 6.85 trillion, a 197.82% increase from Q1 2024.
The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 0.96% to 6,897.40 on Thursday, but still experienced a 1.02% decline over the past week. The index has been trending downward despite the daily gain.

PT Martina Berto Tbk (MBTO) reported a 3.2% year-over-year increase in revenue to IDR 431.6 billion in 2024, leading to an 86% improvement in net loss to IDR 4.46 billion. The company's bottom line improved significantly compared to a net loss of IDR 31.93 billion in 2023.

Indonesia's import system is seen as protectionist, with non-tariff measures hindering the meat industry, particularly for beef, which is mostly imported. The government is considering abolishing import quotas to increase availability and affordability of high-quality beef, supporting food security and consumer welfare.

Bank Indonesia reported a financial surplus of IDR 52.19 trillion in 2024, a 43.77% increase from IDR 36.3 trillion in 2023, driven by high revenue of IDR 228.66 trillion and expenses of IDR 161.3 trillion.

PT Metrodata Electronics Tbk (MTDL) is expanding its business lines, including selling and distributing Infinix smartphones, targeting positive growth in Indonesia's entry-level to mid-range market. The company aims to capitalize on increasing demand in this segment.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,907,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 17,000 per gram to Rp 1,751,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

Deep Source Pte. Ltd., a Singapore-based company, is set to acquire 1.472 billion shares or 77.19% of PT Master Print Tbk's total issued and paid-up capital, valued at an undisclosed amount, making it the new controlling shareholder of Master Print.

PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion through its subsidiary, PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk, over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The buyback is aimed at stabilizing the company's stock price and increasing shareholder value.

Badan Pengelola Investasi is set to invest $120 million in PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy TBK, a subsidiary of PT Pertamina (PERTM) in the energy sector. The investment, worth approximately IDR 1.9 trillion, was agreed upon several weeks ago, according to Chief Investment Officer Pandu Sjahrir.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has signed an agreement with Repsol E & P, S.à.r.l. to acquire a 24% stake in the Corridor block from Fortuna International Inc for $425 million. The transaction is expected to be completed in Q3-2025.

Merry Riana Education TBK is set to launch its initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) on July 9, 2025, despite current challenging market conditions. The company remains optimistic about its listing plans.

PT Eka Sari Lorena Transport Tbk (LRNA) is struggling to overcome various challenges in the bus transportation industry, aiming to improve its financial performance after a disappointing 2024. The company's overall business segment performance was unsatisfactory last year.

Several Indonesian investment firms, including PT Saratoga Investama Sedaya Tbk. (SRTG), are working to improve their performance in the second half of 2025 after reporting negative investment results in the first quarter. These efforts come amidst fluctuations in the Indonesian stock market.

Indonesia is set to launch a new energy zone in Halmahera Timur, Maluku Utara, in June 2025, which will be the country's first battery energy industrial zone, developed in partnership with Chinese investors and state-owned enterprises. The zone will focus on nickel-based energy production.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has announced that global conglomerates and contractors are interested in expanding geothermal energy in Indonesia. This move is expected to boost the country's renewable energy sector and attract significant investments.

Several national banks in Indonesia are hosting large events, such as concerts and marathons, to attract new customers and increase digital transactions. Bank Tabungan Negara (BTN) is expecting a 15-20% increase in transactions and digital service activations through its Jakarta International Marathon event.

Medco Group's Ijen geothermal power plant, located in Banyuwangi, offers a unique look into renewable energy with its steam-powered turbines, producing electricity while maintaining a low environmental impact. The plant, operated by Medco Energi Internasional (MEDC), is a key project for the company's green energy initiatives.

BI-Fast transactions reached 393.73 million, a 45.45% year-over-year increase, with a total value of IDR 969.43 trillion, a 38.17% year-over-year increase, driven by massive digital banking adoption and lower costs.

Lo Kheng Hong has increased its stake in PT Salim Ivomas Pratama Tbk (SIPD), a palm oil plantation company, to 5.02% with 778,857,000 shares. This is an increase from the previous day, when Lo Kheng Hong did not hold more than 5% of the company's shares.

Bank Negara Indonesia's net interest margin (NIM) is expected to decline in Q2 2025, driven by softer interest earnings, particularly in the corporate segment, with loan growth set to accelerate in the second half of the year. The bank's operational expenses are constrained by ongoing digital investment, which surged 33.4% year-over-year.

A research report by BRI Danareksa Sekuritas predicts that the long holiday in Q2 2025 will not significantly increase data traffic and SIM card sales for Indonesian telecom operators, with many operators still distributing old stock with large discounts. The report highlights the uneven absorption of SIM cards, particularly offline.

The Indonesian Palm Oil Association (GAPKI) has proposed the establishment of a committee to accelerate the certification process of palm oil under the Indonesian Sustainable Palm Oil (ISPO) scheme, with only 58% of its 1,177 member companies having secured ISPO certificates for 3.6 million hectares of plantation areas.

Indonesian telco operators' data quota scheme is being criticized for allegedly causing consumer losses of up to tens of trillions of rupiah per year. The operators are defending their practice, citing business norms and ministerial regulations.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,932,000 to Rp 1,924,000 per gram, while the buyback price also fell by Rp 8,000 per gram, from Rp 1,776,000 to Rp 1,768,000 per gram, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang. This marks a decline in gold prices in the country.

The Indonesian stock market index fell 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.143 on Wednesday, driven by pressure on big cap stocks, particularly in the banking sector. Despite this, Asian markets were mixed, with some gains seen amid hopes for a continued ceasefire between Iran and Israel and a positive response to the latest statement from the Federal Reserve governor.

PT Widodo Makmur Perkasa Tbk (WIDO) expects its revenue to reach IDR 830 billion by the end of the year, a 57% increase from IDR 539 billion in 2024. This growth is expected to have a direct impact on the company's operational performance and bottom line.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.33% to Rp 16,300 against the US dollar on Wednesday, driven by positive sentiment following the announcement of a ceasefire between Iran and Israel by US President Donald Trump. The currency's appreciation was also reflected in the spot market, where it gained 0.48% to Rp 16,292, according to Jisdor Bank Indonesia.

Several companies, including PT RMK Energy Tbk (RMKE), have announced plans to issue bonds and sukuk in the Indonesian stock exchange, with RMKE targeting to raise Rp 1.5 trillion from its bond issuance. The first phase of the issuance will involve Rp 500 billion in bonds.

PT Ifishdeco Tbk, a nickel mining company, plans to venture into the palm oil business with a 1,504.26 hectare land in Sulawesi. The company aims to diversify its business portfolio with this new venture.

PT Bangun Kosambi Sukses Tbk (BKSU) plans to conduct a share buyback with a maximum value of IDR 1 trillion over a three-month period from June 25, 2025, to September 24, 2025. The company, a subsidiary of PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIKD), aims to implement this buyback strategy to support its business growth.

Ubs Ag London, an institution, bought 150,000,000 shares of PT Visi Media Asia Tbk, increasing its holding to 1,817,894,074. The transaction is a buy, and the company operates in the consumer-cyclicals sector, specifically media-entertainment.

PT Indoritel Makmur Internasional Tbk (Indomaret) has opened 300 new stores in the first half of 2025, reaching 30% of its target of 1,000 new stores for the year. The company is taking a cautious approach to expansion, considering factors such as location selection.

The number of companies planning to go public in Indonesia has decreased, with only 14 companies in the pipeline with a total valuation of IDR 7.01 trillion, down from 102 companies in March 2025. This decline may be a sign of an impending economic crisis, as companies are hesitant to raise funds due to uncertain market conditions.

The Indonesian Corruption Eradication Commission (KPK) has named a former director of PT Sritex (SRTX) as a suspect in a corruption case, complicating the company's bankruptcy process. The alleged corruption involves misused credit facilities from PT Bank Pembangunan Daerah Jawa Barat and Banten and PT Bank DKI, which could lead to the seizure of Sritex's assets.

The Indonesian Parliament's Commission XI will conduct a fit and proper test on July 1, 2025, to select a new Deputy Governor of Bank Indonesia (BI) to replace Doni Primanto Joewono, whose term ends in July. The test will be held before the Commission submits its recommendations to the President.

In May 2025, Indonesian deposit rates surprisingly increased despite the central bank's rate cut, driven by competition among banks to attract deposits. The average 3-month deposit rate rose to 5.71% from 5.69% in April, while the 24-month rate increased to 4.38% from 4.34%.

PT Apexindo Pratama Duta Tbk (APEX) aims to improve its performance by 2025 through rig utilization, following a 3.82% year-over-year decline in revenue to $22.87 million in Q1-2025. The company is taking steps to address its poor performance in the first quarter of this year.

PT Provident Investasi Bersama Tbk (PROVID) has received approval from its shareholders to implement strategic corporate actions, including a rights issue and a capital increase without pre-emptive rights. The approval was granted during an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders and an independent shareholders' meeting on Wednesday.

The Indonesian mutual fund industry has recorded a positive achievement, with assets under management reaching IDR 806.5 trillion as of May, up 0.88% from the previous month. Despite this growth, the industry still faces risks, particularly from escalating geopolitical tensions and slowing economic growth.

PT Dayamitra Telekomunikasi Tbk's (MTel) performance in the first three months of the year remains sluggish, but its strong dominance in the national market with a 44% market share helps maintain its solid position among digital infrastructure companies. The company's extensive national network, including areas outside of Java with long-term contract offerings, supports its market lead.

Djarum, through its subsidiary PT Dwimuria Investama Andalan, has acquired 559.185.300 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk, a hospital operator, at a price of IDR 1.875 per share. The acquisition marks Djarum's expansion into the hospital sector.

The Indonesian government is set to impose income tax on online marketplace sellers, with the Directorate General of Taxes finalizing a legal framework to simplify tax administration and ensure fair treatment for micro, small, and medium-sized businesses. The move is expected to affect sellers on platforms such as Lokapasar.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.54% or 37.03 points to 6,832.14 on Wednesday, amid global financial uncertainty due to Middle East tensions. The decline marks a continued downward trend in the first half of 2025.

The Ministry of Investment and Batam authorities signed a memorandum of understanding on June 24, 2025, creating an investment desk in Batam’s free trade port zone to streamline permits via the OSS system and boost investment, which accounts for 29–30% of Indonesia’s economy. The initiative, backed by the Ministry’s investment desk and BP Batam’s licensing authority, aims to accelerate projects such as the AI‑driven Nongsa Digital Park, Solar Home System initiative, and the Sekupang Health SEZ partnership with Mayapada Hospital, with Batam already attracting about US$6.09 billion in investment from Q1 2020 to 2025.

The escalating conflict between Israel and Iran has sent shockwaves to the global energy market, causing a 9% surge in Brent crude prices, and Indonesia, as a net oil importer, is particularly vulnerable to the impact on its trade balance and fiscal condition.

The Indonesian Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has set the reference price for nickel at USD 15,221/ton and gold at USD 3,313.97/troy ounce for the second period of June 2025, representing a 1.19% decrease and 1.06% increase, respectively, compared to the previous period.

The Indonesian Investment Ministry has set up an investment desk in Batam's free trade port zone to accelerate investment realization and boost economic growth, with the region recording approximately $6.09 billion in investment from 2020 to Q1 2025. The initiative aims to improve the investment climate in Batam by enhancing transparency, efficiency, and responsiveness, with key projects including the AI-driven Nongsa Digital Park and the Solar Home System initiative.

PT Jayamas Medica Industri Tbk (JMIF) is preparing to expand its market reach globally, capitalizing on the strategic opportunity to supply healthcare equipment amidst rising import tariffs imposed by the US on several countries, including China. The company sees potential for growth in the global market, driven by increasing demand for healthcare equipment.

PT Citra Marga Nusaphala Persada Tbk (CMNP) has decided not to distribute dividends for 2024, citing the need to focus on several projects in 2025, including the construction of two toll roads. The company will use its 2024 net profit to fund these projects.

The Kompas100 index has declined 5.87% since the beginning of the year, outpacing the 2.98% drop in the IHSG index, due to factors including the correction of large-cap stocks in the index. According to Mirae Asset's Head Research & Chief Economist, Rully Arya Wisnubroto, the decline is driven by several factors.

PT Bukit Asam (PTBA) is diversifying its business into non-coal sectors, focusing on renewable energy and coal downstreaming, with the goal of increasing non-coal business contributions to total revenue. The company is actively developing solar power plants and other renewable energy sources.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.84% to Rp 16,353 per US dollar following a ceasefire agreement between Iran and Israel, according to Bloomberg. The currency's movement remains uncertain, but the agreement has provided a positive impact on the rupiah's value.

Jantra Grupo Indonesia (JGRI) aims to achieve significant revenue growth in 2025, targeting IDR 74.3 billion, a 27.69% increase from 2024 projections, driven by network expansion and strategic partnerships. The company's director, Imam Sujono, announced the target, which is expected to drive business growth.

PT Pantai Indah Kapuk Dua Tbk (PIK2) is expanding its accessibility through the development of the Kamal-Teluknaga-Rajeg toll road and the Transjabodetabek T31 transportation system, which is expected to increase the number of visitors and support residential sales, with a target of Rp 5.31 trillion in revenue for 2025.

PT Ultrajaya Milk Industry & Trading Company Tbk (ULTJ) plans to buy back its shares with an allocation of IDR 1.45 trillion, funded from its internal cash reserves. The buyback will cover the cost of share repurchase, brokerage commissions, and other expenses.

Gold prices dropped 2.53% to $3,320.7 per ounce, while Antam's gold price fell 0.92% to IDR 1.93 million per gram, amid easing geopolitical tensions in the Middle East. The decline in gold prices is expected to continue its bearish trend.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) closed 1.21% higher at 6,869.17 on Tuesday, driven by positive market response to the ceasefire announcement between Iran and Israel. However, analysts warn of potential limited correction still looming over the IHSG.

Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat (MIKA) plans to aggressively expand its business, allocating IDR 1 trillion for capital expenditure in 2023, up from IDR 704 billion in the previous year. The expansion plans include building new hospitals, including RS Kasih in Cirebon and RS Mitra Keluarga in Sidoarjo, scheduled to be completed in 2025.

PT Pancaran Samudera Transport, a shipping company, plans to use IPO funds to add vessels and working capital, aiming for 10%-15% growth in performance this year, after reporting revenue of IDR 980.16 billion and net profit of IDR 243.36 billion in 2024.

Danatara Asset Management, through Badan Pengelola Investasi, has injected $405 million into PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA) as part of the airline's restructuring process that began in 2022. The investment, in the form of a shareholder loan, aims to support Garuda Indonesia's continued operations.

Despite being the world's 4th largest rice producer, Indonesia's domestic rice prices remain high, with 150 areas experiencing price increases in the third week of June. This is contrary to expectations that abundant rice production would lead to lower prices.

The Indonesian stock market and rupiah exchange rate experienced fluctuations on Tuesday, with the IHSG index rising 1.21% to 6,869.17 and the rupiah strengthening 0.84% to Rp 16,354 per dollar, despite ongoing global tensions and uncertainty.

PT Merry Riana Edukasi, a small-cap education business, is set to list on the Indonesian Stock Exchange (IDX) with a 25% stake or 266.66 million shares offered. This move is part of the IDX's support for small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) to go public.

Bank Indonesia's expansion of the QRIS cross-border payment system to Saudi Arabia and China is expected to drive growth in digital wallet transactions, with predictions of 10%-15% annual growth in QRIS transactions and 15%-20% growth in cross-border QRIS transactions via digital wallets.

Indonesia's non-performing loan (NPL) ratio increased to 2.24% in April 2025, up from 2.17% in March 2025 and 2.08% in December 2024, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. The rising NPL ratio is attributed to the country's economic downturn, which may continue to impact the banking sector.

The non-performing loan ratio of Bank Rakyat's micro, small, and medium-sized business loans increased to 11.91% in March 2025, up from 10.70% in the same period last year, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. This is concerning as the majority of Bank Rakyat's loan disbursements are to this sector.

Bank Indonesia has introduced a macroprudential policy to incentivize banks to lend to priority sectors, such as micro, small, and medium enterprises. The policy aims to boost credit growth and support economic development.

PT Akseleran Keuangan Inklusif Indonesia, a fintech peer-to-peer lending company, has failed to pay its lenders, sparking concerns about the industry's stability and potentially deterring individual lenders from investing in fintech lending. This incident highlights the ongoing issues with defaults in the Indonesian fintech industry.

PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk (ASSA) has allocated IDR 1.3-1.5 trillion for capital expenditure in 2025, primarily for purchasing new vehicles to support its rental and logistics business expansion. The company's financial director, Jerry Fandy, stated that the allocation is conservative and reflects the company's commitment to strengthening its main business lines.

Moody's has affirmed PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) 's Baa2/P-2 deposit ratings, citing strong profitability, capital adequacy, and funding, despite high asset risk due to its lending to small enterprises. BRI's profitability is expected to decrease in 2025 due to higher funding and credit costs, although its capitalization will remain strong.

PT. United Tractors Tbk has received an appreciation award from the Ministry of Education for its contributions to the development of vocational education in Indonesia, recognizing its efforts in bridging the gap between education and industry. The company has been involved in the development of over 1,700 schools across Indonesia since 2007, providing comprehensive vocational training programs to support the transformation of vocational education.

PT United Tractors Tbk (UTRK) and its subsidiaries, PT Agincourt Resources, PT Bhumi Jati Power, and PT Komatsu Remanufacturing Asia, have won the Top CSR Awards 2025 for their commitment to sustainable development through various corporate social responsibility programs. The company's CSR initiatives focus on education, health, environment, disaster relief, and economic development, and have been recognized for their positive impact on the community.

PT United Tractors (UNTR) and its subsidiary PT Pamapersada Nusantara have received awards at the Bina Mitra UMKM Award 2025 for their initiatives in empowering small and medium enterprises (SMEs) in Indonesia. The awards were given by the CFCD Foundation, supported by the Ministry of Industry, Ministry of Cooperatives and SMEs, and the Indonesian Chamber of Commerce and Industry.

PT United Tractors Tbk (UT) has made significant progress in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, with an 11.15% decrease in Scope 1 & 2 emissions in 2024 from the 2019 baseline, and has increased its use of renewable energy to 31.94%. The company has implemented various initiatives to support its commitment to achieving Astra's net zero emissions target by 2050.

The Indonesian government has revoked four nickel mining permits in Raja Ampat, Papua, citing environmental concerns and violations of regulations. The revoked permits belonged to PT Anugerah Surya Pratama, PT Mulia Raymond Perkasa, PT Kawei Sejahtera Mining, and PT Nurham, while PT Gag Nikel's permit remains intact due to its good waste management practices.

PT United Tractors Tbk (UT) has made significant progress in reducing greenhouse gas emissions, achieving an 11.15% decrease in Scope 1 & 2 emissions in 2024 from the 2019 baseline, and increasing the use of renewable energy to 31.94%. The company has implemented various initiatives, including the use of biodiesel B35 and renewable energy certificates, to support its commitment to Astra's net zero emissions target by 2050.

The Indonesian government has revoked four nickel mining permits in Raja Ampat, Papua, citing environmental concerns and regulatory violations. The revoked permits belong to PT Anugerah Surya Pratama, PT Mulia Raymond Perkasa, PT Kawei Sejahtera Mining, and PT Nurham, while PT Gag Nikel's permit remains intact due to its good environmental management practices.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.52% to Rp 16,484 per US dollar on Monday, according to Jisdor Bank Indonesia, amid geopolitical tensions that sparked market concerns. The rupiah spot rate also fell 0.58% to Rp 16,492, according to Bloomberg data.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 1.74% to 6,787,140 on Monday, with almost all sectors experiencing pressure, amid concerns over the impact of the US involvement in the Israel-Iran conflict and the potential closure of the Strait of Hormuz. The closure of the Strait of Hormuz could affect global commodity prices, as it accounts for 20% of global crude oil consumption and 10% of LNG trade.

PT Diastika Biotekindo Tbk (CHEK) plans to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO) of up to 815 million shares on the Indonesian Stock Exchange. The company aims to list on the exchange with the ticker symbol 'CHEK'.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 10,000 per gram to Rp 1,932,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 10,000 per gram to Rp 1,776,000 per gram. This is according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

PT Trimitra Trans Persada Tbk, a logistics company owned by taipan Djoko Susanto, is seeking to raise IDR 152.05 billion through an initial public offering (IPO) to fund its warehouse expansion and logistics fleet addition. The company plans to issue up to 563.24 million shares with a nominal value of IDR 100 per share, with an offering price range of IDR 240-270 per share.

PT Pancaran Samudera Transport is set to conduct an initial public offering (IPO) from July 2-4, 2025, offering 222.353 million shares, or 15% of its total shares, to the public at a price to be determined after bookbuilding. The company aims to raise funds to support its business growth.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 1.69% to 6,790.13 on Monday, amid escalating tensions in the Middle East, with investors avoiding risky assets and waiting for further clarification on the situation. The Head of Research at Kiwoom Sekuritas, Liza Camelia Suryanata, attributed the decline to the increased risk of conflict escalation.

Six companies in Indonesia are proceeding with their initial public offerings (IPOs) despite geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, with five of them launching their bookbuilding process simultaneously on Monday. The companies are seeking funding through the Indonesian Stock Exchange.

The surge in global oil prices is expected to negatively impact Indonesian companies that rely on oil as a raw material or fuel, while benefiting oil and gas producers. The price of West Texas Intermediate crude oil rose 2.41% to $75.83 per barrel, while Brent crude oil prices jumped 2.19% to $78.96 per barrel.

The Badan Pengelola Keuangan Haji (BPKH) aims to reach IDR 188 trillion in managed funds by 2025, a 9.52% increase from IDR 171.65 trillion in 2024. This target was announced by BPKH member Harry Alexander at the Muamalat Tower.

The recent US attack on Iran has led to a risk-off sentiment in global markets, causing a potential capital outflow in emerging markets, including Indonesia, where government bond yields have increased, with the 5-year yield rising to 6.47% and the 10-year yield increasing to 6.81%.

PT Midi Utama Indonesia Tbk (MIDI) is expanding its business by increasing the number of stores outside of Java Island and venturing into a new business line called JA-DI, a coffee shop chain. This new business is expected to boost the company's performance.

PT Catur Sentosa Adiprana Tbk (CSAP) has announced that it will distribute a 2024 dividend of IDR 36.94 billion, or 19.17% of its 2024 net profit of IDR 192 billion. The company made the announcement at its annual general meeting of shareholders.

PT Indah Kiat Pulp & Paper Tbk and PT Pabrik Kertas Tjiwi Kimia Tbk, both part of the Sinarmas group, will distribute dividends to their shareholders based on the results of their annual general meeting of shareholders on June 16, 2025. The dividend distribution is a positive outcome for the companies' shareholders.

PT CIMB Niaga Auto Finance (CNAF) has experienced an 8% year-over-year decline in shariah financing to IDR 1.12 trillion as of May 2025, due to the weak automotive market. To mitigate the impact, the company is diversifying its market through various strategies.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 1.74% or 120 points to 6,787.14 on Monday, marking its fourth consecutive day of decline, with a total decline of 4.64% in the past week and 4.14% since the start of the year.

Danantara Asset Management, a subsidiary of state-owned investment management agency Daya Anagata Nusantara, has extended a $405 million shareholder loan to Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) to support the airline's long-term transformation and recovery strategy. The loan is part of a broader $1 billion funding commitment to support critical aspects of the airline's turnaround, including maintenance, repair, and overhaul operations.

The merger between Northstar Group and Ares Management Corp. has sparked concerns over the growing foreign influence in Indonesia's strategic sectors, including technology and energy, with Ares Management absorbing Northstar's operations and key investment projects in Indonesia, managing over US$546 billion in global assets. The deal has also raised red flags over the significant benefits to early shareholders, with some reportedly profiting up to 275 times their initial stake, mostly favoring foreign stakeholders.

Danantara Asset Management, a subsidiary of state-owned investment management agency Daya Anagata Nusantara, has extended a $405 million shareholder loan to Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) to support the airline's long-term transformation and recovery strategy. The loan is part of a broader $1 billion funding commitment to support critical aspects of the airline's turnaround, including maintenance, repair, and overhaul operations.

Northstar Group is set to merge with Ares Management Corp., a US-based public investment manager with $546 billion in assets under management, as early as July. The deal is expected to be completed next month, according to sources involved in the agreement.

Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng, an insider, acquired 2,544,900 shares of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (SQMI.JK) at IDR 43 per share, increasing their stake to 3,152,947,229 shares or approximately 0.06% of the company's total shares. The transaction, valued at IDR 5,595,900,000, is for personal investment purposes.
Hasmoro acquired 724,600 shares of PT Medikaloka Hermina Tbk. (HEAL.JK) through a buy transaction, increasing their holding from 737,510,989 to 738,235,589 shares, representing an investment purpose.

PT Indokripto Koin Semesta TBK (COIN) is set to become the first crypto company to list on the Bursa Efek Indonesia through an initial public offering, offering up to 2.2 billion shares with a nominal value of IDR 100 per share. The listing will represent up to 25% of the company's fully paid and placed capital.

PT Victoria Investama Tbk acquired 390,213,000 shares of its own stock, increasing its holding from 9,572,044,411 to 9,967,417,411 shares. The transaction, categorized as 'Penguatan Permodalan Entitas Anak' or strengthening of subsidiary capital, was conducted at a price of IDR 115 per share. This buyback transaction indicates the company's confidence in its future prospects and potential to increase shareholder value.

Crude palm oil (CPO) producers are projected to maintain their growth until 2025, driven by the positive trend in CPO prices, which have risen 4.79% in a week and 5.62% in a month to MYR 4,115 per ton. This growth is expected to continue until the end of Q2-2025.

Indonesia's Ministry of Energy and Mineral Resources has revised its rooftop solar power regulation, removing restrictions on installation capacity and introducing a quota system, which has increased business certainty and is expected to boost the industry's growth, with a target of 3.9 GW of installed capacity by 2025.

PT Summarecon Agung Tbk (SMRA) is increasing its expansion focus in Serpong, Tangerang Regency, through a series of trillion-rupiah affiliate transactions. This move is expected to strengthen the company's presence in the region.

The ongoing trade war and recent escalation of Iran-Israel conflict have led to a decline in global economic prospects, with international organizations already revising down their economic growth projections for this year and next. Indonesia's Finance Minister Sri Mulyani Indrawati has emphasized the need for the country to focus on its domestic economy and develop a strong backbone to withstand the uncertainty.

The merger between XL Axiata (EXCL) and Smartfren Telecom (FREN) is expected to have a limited impact on Dayamitra Telekomunikasi (MTEL), a telecommunications tower rental company, as most of its services are used by Telkomsel. The company's affiliation with PT Telkom Indonesia (TLKM) is seen as a factor in minimizing the impact.

The Indonesian stock market may experience continued pressure this week due to geopolitical tensions in the Middle East, particularly following the US military aggression against Iran. Analysts predict a shift in investment assets if the situation escalates.

The Indonesian banking industry experienced a tightening of liquidity in April 2025, but showed signs of improvement in June 2025, with banks' ownership of government securities increasing to IDR 1.183 trillion as of June 18, 2025, up from IDR 1.165 trillion on April 14, 2025.

The US intervention in the Iran-Israel conflict may lead to increased pressure on the rupiah exchange rate, with the rupiah weakening 0.54% in the past week, and the dollar strengthening 0.06% to IDR 16,397 on Friday.

Despite economic uncertainty and slowing consumer spending, Indonesian retailers are still distributing dividends, with the dividend-to-net-profit ratio serving as an indicator of their business strategies and priorities. The varying dividend payout levels reflect differences in strategy among retailers, with some prioritizing profit retention over shareholder returns.

PT Mitra Pack Tbk, a distributor of several packaging brands, aims to increase its revenue by 20-30% to IDR 231-250 billion this year, driven by expansion plans and positive industry prospects. The company expects its net profit to rise 15% to IDR 16 billion, with sales reaching at least IDR 231 billion by 2025.

Bank Indonesia reported that banking credit growth slowed down to 8.43% in May 2025, lower than the 8.88% growth in April 2025 and 10.39% growth in December 2024. Banks are opting to place their funds in securities rather than increasing credit disbursement.

The Indonesian government is considering a proposal to allow industrial zones to import liquefied natural gas (LNG) directly, in response to frequent complaints from industrial players about gas supply issues. The regulation would enable industrial zones to import gas independently if domestic supply is insufficient.

The Indonesian government has lifted quotas on live cattle imports, including dairy and beef cattle, due to a national shortage of dairy cattle, with only 540,000 dairy cattle available, meeting only 18-20% of national demand. This move aims to increase domestic milk production.

Gold prices have been consolidating after a significant surge in April, with Antam's gold bar price dropping 0.91% to IDR 1.942 million per gram, despite a 26% year-to-date increase. The decline follows a 1.93% correction in spot gold prices to USD 3,385.7 per troy ounce.

The multifinance industry in Indonesia has seen a significant increase in bond issuances, with a total value of Rp 11.64 trillion as of May 2025, a 20.44% increase from the same period last year. This trend is driven by the decline in benchmark interest rates, making bonds a more attractive investment option.

The Indonesian property insurance industry experienced a 14.1% year-over-year decline in premium revenue in Q1 2025, reaching IDR 7.8 trillion. The decline is attributed to economic uncertainty, according to Asosiasi Asuransi Umum Indonesia (AAUI) Chairman Budi Herawan.

The Indonesian government's expenditure on the productive sector has slowed down, sparking concerns about economic growth in Q2-2025. The realization of state expenditure until May 2025 reached IDR 1.016,3 trillion, an 11% decrease compared to the same period last year.

PT Garuda Metalindo Tbk (GMET) is looking to diversify into non-automotive segments as the Indonesian automotive industry faces decline due to economic weakness, with the company seeking to capitalize on various opportunities. The industry is experiencing a downward trend due to decreased consumer purchasing power, increased layoffs, rupiah depreciation, and high interest rates.

Akseleran, an Indonesian fintech firm, is under scrutiny for alleged fraud, with regulators investigating refinancing practices involving six borrowers with outstanding loans worth IDR 178.2 billion. This development has raised concerns about the company's governance and the overall peer-to-peer lending industry in Indonesia.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 0.88% to 6,907.14 on Friday, marking a cumulative decline of 3.61% over the week. Analysts predict a limited upside for the index on Monday, with support at 6,894 and resistance at 6,981, but caution against potential corrections.

Despite facing challenges from global nickel price corrections, Harita Nickel (TBNK) remains optimistic about achieving positive results this year, with management expecting an increase in performance compared to 2024. The company is confident about its prospects, citing its ability to navigate the current market conditions.

BYD's entry into PT Surya Semesta Internusa Tbk's (SSIA) industrial area is expected to trigger the formation of an electric vehicle production ecosystem, attracting companies from various sectors such as battery suppliers, automotive component manufacturers, and global carmakers to operate in the area. This move is seen as a catalyst for the growth of the electric vehicle industry in Indonesia.

PT Energi Mega Persada Tbk (ENRG) plans to raise capital through a private placement of 2.48 billion new shares, without preemptive rights, to fund the development of the Malacca Strait block. The company, affiliated with the Bakrie Group, aims to use the proceeds to support its business growth.

Indonesia's new regulation requiring exporters to bring back foreign exchange earnings has been in effect for over two months, but has only resulted in $22.9 billion in foreign exchange deposits from March to April 2025. The regulation has yet to show a significant impact on the country's economy.

Indonesia's state budget deficit reached IDR 21 trillion by the end of May 2025, sparking concerns over economic instability. The deficit is still in line with the 2025 budget allocation of IDR 616.2 trillion, according to Finance Minister Sri Mulyani.

The Indonesian Attorney General's office has seized trillions of rupiah in a recent investigation, sparking public interest and going viral on social media. The investigation is related to a government project aimed at addressing food security issues, but has allegedly been mismanaged and corrupted.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by IDR 6,000 per gram to IDR 1,942,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 6,000 per gram to IDR 1,786,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices at the company.

PT Paperocks Indonesia Tbk (PPRI) reported a solid performance in Q1 2025, with revenue increasing by 4.18% year-over-year to Rp 42.19 billion. The company's net profit also saw a significant increase during the same period.

PT Blue Bird Tbk (BLUE) has allocated IDR 1.8 trillion for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for fleet expansion and renewal. The allocation is similar to last year's, with the majority of the funds going towards adding and replacing vehicles in its fleet.

PT Lotte Chemical Titan Tbk (LCTT) targets 5% growth in 2025, despite the challenging petrochemical industry conditions due to economic slowdown and volatile raw material prices. The company's director, Calvin Wiryapranata, stated that 2024 will be a tough year for the petrochemical industry, citing unfavorable market conditions.

PT Blue Bird Tbk (BLUE) has allocated IDR 1.8 trillion for capital expenditure this year, which will be used for fleet expansion and renewal. The allocation is similar to last year's, with the majority of the funds going towards adding and replacing vehicles in its fleet.

The Indonesian rupiah weakened 0.54% against the US dollar in a week, driven by the strengthening of the US dollar amid cautious Federal Reserve policy. The rupiah spot rate stood at Rp 16,397 per dollar, a 0.06% increase from the previous day's trading.

According to a United Nations Conference on Trade and Development report, Indonesia's foreign direct investment in 2024 is estimated to be $24.21 billion, significantly lower than the $900.2 trillion reported by the Ministry of Investment. The difference between the two estimates is approximately $537.02 trillion.

The Indonesia Sharia Stock Index surged 4.31% since the start of 2025, while the IDX-MES BUMN Index jumped 12.28%. Meanwhile, the Jakarta Islamic Index fell 0.48%, and the JII70 and IDX Sharia Growth Indexes declined 1.49% and 5.72%, respectively.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance predicts that tax expenditure will reach IDR 515 trillion in 2025, a 2.1% increase from the previous projection of IDR 445.5 trillion. This growth is expected despite a contraction in state spending realization over the past five months.

PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk (INDF) and PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) have announced cash dividend distributions for 2024, with INDF distributing Rp 2.45 trillion or Rp 280 per share. The decision was approved by shareholders at the annual general meeting of shareholders held on Friday.

PT Jasa Armada Indonesia Tbk (IPCM) will distribute IDR 125.16 billion in dividends, equivalent to 75.02% of its net profit in 2024. The dividend includes an interim dividend of IDR 20.05 billion, or IDR 3.80 per share, which was paid in January 2025.

The number of fintech lending borrowers in Indonesia has increased by 58.7% to 15.4 million as of Q1-2025, according to data from the Financial Services Authority. This growth poses a challenge for fintech lending companies to maintain a healthy loan portfolio.

Indonesia's insurance industry is still lagging behind in aviation insurance, with most premiums going to foreign players due to factors such as international ownership of aircraft leasing companies. The local insurance market share in aviation insurance remains limited, according to the Chairman of the Indonesian General Insurance Association, Budi Herawan.

BCA Digital has launched BluAccount Teens, a digital banking platform that allows teenagers to open their own savings accounts and make payments via QR codes or online. Since its launch in July 2024, over 2,500 accounts have been opened, with total deposits reaching $61,300 and an average account balance of $67.

Citi has appointed Benny Aroeman as Head of Markets in Indonesia, bringing over 30 years of experience in delivering derivatives and risk management solutions to Indonesian clients. Aroeman joins from ANZ Indonesia, where he held a similar role, and has previously worked at DBS Indonesia (DBS), HSBC Indonesia, and Deutsche Indonesia.

The Indonesian stock market plummeted 1.96% to 6,968.64, with foreign investors selling Rp 1.25 trillion worth of shares, amid concerns over Middle East tensions and the potential for the Federal Reserve interest rates to remain high. OCBC Sekuritas (OCBC) analyst Liga Maradona attributed the decline to the unresolved Middle East conflict and the Fed's hawkish stance.

PT Bank Tabungan Negara Tbk (BTN) reports that 90% of its mortgages are accessed by low-income borrowers, with 61% of customers living in suburban or rural areas, and 31% of recipients being women, promoting financial inclusion and long-term profitability. The bank's subsidized mortgage program, KPR Subsidi, aligns with Indonesia's national housing initiative and supports the government's broader economic inclusion agenda.

PT Primadaya Plastisindo Tbk (PDPP) aims to boost production of polyethylene terephthalate-based gallons and recycled products to improve its performance, after reporting a 17.02% year-over-year decline in revenue to IDR 106.07 billion in Q1-2025.

The credit risk ratio in the micro, small, and medium enterprises (MSMEs) sector continues to rise, alongside a slowing growth trend in credit growth, highlighting the need for extra attention from the government and regulators, as MSMEs contribute 6.6% to Indonesia's domestic product in Q1-2025.

Indonesia's competitiveness ranking dropped 13 places to 40th out of 69 countries in the 2025 IMD World Competitiveness Ranking, due to economic issues and high unemployment rates. This marks a significant decline from its previous ranking of 27th in 2024.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) and its subsidiary, PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk, plan to diversify their business by acquiring an Australian gold and copper mine, Wolfram Limited, to capitalize on the global bullish gold price trend, aiming to boost business growth in 2025.

Bank Indonesia has extended the credit card payment relaxation policy, which allows cardholders to pay 5% of their total bill, until December 2025. The policy was first introduced in December 2020 in response to the COVID-19 pandemic and has been renewed annually since then.
Bank Indonesia reported a 3-basis-point increase in profit margin to 2.04% in April, leading to a 2-bps increase in the basic interest rate to 9.27%. The interest rate further rose to 9.75% in May.

The US dollar index rose 0.01% to 98.91 after the Federal Reserve's decision to hold interest rates, resulting in a 1% increase over the past week and putting pressure on other currencies, including the rupiah, which fell 0.57% to RP 16,406. The decision also affected other currencies, such as the pound sterling, which decreased 0.02% to 1.3425, and the Japanese yen, which dropped 0.25% to 145.59.

Mitra Adiperkasa Tbk's (MITA) 2025 prospects are solid, driven by its retail sales segment which grew 6.71% YoY to Rp 7.79 trillion revenue, despite an 8.65% decline in its cafe and restaurant segment to Rp 719.49 billion.

PT Global Mediacom Tbk (GLOBAL) has started offering IDR 1.4 trillion bond to investors since Thursday, with electronic allocation and distribution on June 20 and 24, 2025, and listing on the Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) on June 25, 2025.
PT J Resources Asia Pasifik Tbk (JRAS) reported a 7.4% year-over-year increase in consolidated gold production to 100,600 ounces in 2024, up from 93,700 ounces in 2023.

Harita Nickel (TICKER) is optimistic about its revenue and net profit in 2025, anticipating an increase due to improved operational performance from its subsidiary, PT Gane Permai Sentosa, which has started production this year. The company expects to increase production, driven by the contribution of its subsidiary, PT GTS, which has begun operations.

Chandra Daya Investasi, a subsidiary of PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk, plans to raise funds through an initial public offering (IPO) on the Indonesian Stock Exchange, following the success of its sister company PT Barito Renewables Energy Tbk. The IPO is expected to be one of the most successful this year.

PT Archi Indonesia Tbk (ARCI) is intensifying its exploration efforts to discover new high-grade gold resources, focusing on the eastern and western corridors of the Toka Tindung mine. The company aims to find additional gold deposits and resources to capitalize on the current trend of rising gold prices.

PT Bursa Efek Indonesia (BEI) is conducting a survey from June 16 to June 26, 2025, to gather input from stock market players on its plan to adjust the lot size of stock trading. The adjustment aims to deepen the market, according to Direktur Pengembangan Bursa Efek Indonesia, Jeffrey Hendrik.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) dropped 1.96% to 6,968.64, driven by external sentiments including geopolitical tensions, global monetary policy, and potential US tariff policies. Foreign investors also pulled out of the market with a net sell value of IDR 1.25 trillion.

Indonesian Paradise Property Tbk (INPP) has allocated Rp 1.1 trillion for capital expenditure in 2025 to accelerate the completion of commercial projects and property sales, which are the company's priorities for the year. The allocation will be distributed across several major cities, including Jakarta, Semarang, Bandung, and Balikpapan, with approximately 30% allocated to Jakarta and 30-40% to Semarang.

Indonesia's pension fund investment returns reached IDR 5.7 trillion in Q1 2025, a 12.9% decrease from the same period last year. The decline is attributed to the ongoing trade war and geopolitical tensions.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) dropped 1.96% to 6,968.64, surpassing the decline of other regional indices such as Malaysia, Singapore, and Vietnam. The fall was attributed to escalating geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran since Friday.

PT Trina Mas Agra Indonesia, a joint venture between Trina Solar Co Ltd, PT Daya Sukses Makmur Selaras, and PT PLN Indonesia Power, has inaugurated Indonesia's largest integrated solar cell module manufacturing facility, with an investment of over IDR 1.5 trillion and a production capacity of up to 1 GW per year. The facility is expected to contribute approximately IDR 3.7 trillion during the investment phase and generate IDR 1 trillion annually upon full operation, driving 8% economic growth per year in its sector.

The Indonesian government has introduced four types of coal price benchmarks, known as HBA, based on calorific values ranging from 3,400 to 6,322 kcal/kg GAR, which will be used to calculate the benchmark coal price influenced by coal quality factors. The HBA values will consider factors such as calorific value, moisture content, sulfur content, and ash content to determine the price of coal.
Mind ID, a holding company for the mining industry, reported a net profit of IDR 36.53 trillion in 2024, a 50.11% increase from IDR 24.33 trillion in 2023.

Shares of conglomerate companies, including Bakrie Group, have seen significant gains, with PT Bumi Resources Minerals' stock price surging 32.37% since the start of the year, driven by improved corporate actions and financial performance.

PT Putra Rajawali Kencana (PUTR) aims to achieve a 30% year-on-year revenue growth to IDR 364.39 billion this year, driven by expansion in logistics services for the energy, plantation, and chemical industries. The company's revenue was IDR 280.30 billion last year.

The Indonesian government has delayed the implementation of a sugar tax on packaged sweetened beverages, which was previously set to take effect in 2025, alleviating concerns among consumer goods businesses that the tax would increase their operational burdens.

PT Alam Sutera Realty Tbk (ALSO) has decided not to distribute dividends for 2024, with the last dividend payment made in 2017, citing challenging performance. The company made this decision during its 2024 annual general shareholders' meeting.

Danareksa, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, aims to invest $5 billion in 2023, with initial investments going to companies such as PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (Tbk) and PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (Tbk), which could boost liquidity and investor interest in the short term.

The Jakarta Composite Index) dropped 0.67% to 7,107.79 on Wednesday, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 646.61 billion worth of shares, amid escalating Israel-Iran conflict and uncertainty in the financial market.

Indonesia's trade finance sector showed a positive trend in early 2025, driven by an improvement in national export performance, with Bank Mandiri (BMRI) recording a 69% year-on-year growth in export transaction volume to USD 31.4 billion in May 2025.

The Indonesian government has launched seven retail bond products in 2025, with the first product, ORI027, absorbing the largest demand in history with total sales of IDR 37.36 trillion. Despite a decline in retail bond demand since the beginning of the year, the government remains optimistic about the prospects of retail bonds for the rest of the year.

Wealth management in Indonesian banking continues to show strong growth, with several banks recording double-digit growth in managed funds, despite a slowdown in third-party fund growth, with a 4.49% annual growth rate as of May, according to Bank Indonesia.

PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia (GOTO) has received shareholder approval for a $200 million share buyback, equivalent to IDR 3.3 trillion, following an annual and extraordinary general meeting of shareholders.

PT Perusahaan Perkebunan London Sumatra Indonesia Tbk reported a solid performance in the first three months of 2025, with a net profit of IDR 391.8 billion, up 45% year-over-year. The company's revenue also increased significantly by 47% year-over-year to IDR 1.2 trillion.

The US Federal Reserve kept its interest rate between 4.25%-4.5%, while Bank Indonesia held its rate at 5.5%, causing Indonesia's composite stock index to drop 0.67% and foreign investors to sell Rp 646.61 billion worth of shares.

PT Eratex Djaja Tbk (ERAT) is facing a lawsuit from supplier CV Pacific Indojaya over unpaid debts, with the first hearing scheduled for June 19, 2025. The lawsuit was filed on June 12, 2025, at the Jakarta Central District Court.

The Indonesian government has delayed the implementation of a sugar tax on packaged drinks, a move welcomed by the country's food and beverage industry. The decision is expected to benefit companies operating in the sector.

Bank Indonesia's data shows that outstanding bank credit grew only 8.43% year-on-year in May, slowing down from 8.88% in the previous month and 10.39% in December 2024, potentially weakening economic growth.

PT PLN (PLN) achieved a positive performance in 2024, with revenue increasing by 12% to Rp 545.38 trillion compared to the previous year. The company's success is attributed to the government's support in helping PLN remain strong amidst global economic and geopolitical challenges.

The Indonesian government is set to introduce new regulations for online ride-hailing drivers, aiming to improve their welfare, with Grab Indonesia (GRAB) participating in the discussion. The new regulations will categorize online drivers as micro, small, and medium enterprises.
Bank Indonesia reported a slowdown in credit growth, with a 8.43% increase in May 2025, the lowest since 2021, while deposits rose 4.29% in the same period, the lowest since December 2023.

PT Madhani Talatah Nusantara, an insider and shareholder, sold 666,666,666 shares of PT Darma Henwa Tbk (DEWA.JK), an energy company in the oil-gas-coal sub-sector, reducing its holding from 9,598,771,188 to 8,933,210,522 shares, representing a decrease of 6.83%.
Indonesia's Ministry of Finance recorded a new debt realization of IDR 349.3 trillion by May 2025, a 164.22% increase, which accounts for 45% of the 2025 budget of IDR 775.9 trillion.
As of May 2025, the government's spending realization reached IDR 1.0163 trillion, only 28.1% of the budget of IDR 3.6213 trillion, and 11.26% lower compared to the same period last year.

Global geopolitical tensions and rising inflation pressure are delaying interest rate cuts, despite weakening economic growth indicators. The Indonesian Finance Minister, Sri Mulyani Indrawati, notes that the global uncertainty is a significant challenge for future monetary policy direction.

Bank Indonesia's data shows a decline in consumer confidence index in May 2025, reaching its lowest level since September 2022, while the job availability expectation index also decreased in April 2025, indicating pessimism among the public.

United Tractors (UNTR) has increased its stake in geothermal energy developer PT Supreme Energy Rantau Dedap by acquiring an additional 103,638 and 129,291 shares, further solidifying its position in the renewable energy sector. This move is part of the company's efforts to diversify its business portfolio and invest in sustainable energy solutions.

The Financial Services Authority (OJK) has issued a new regulation, OJK No. 7/2025, which will come into effect on January 1, 2026, requiring policyholders to share 10% of the total claim amount, with a maximum of IDR 300,000 for outpatient care and IDR 3 million for inpatient care.

PT Aspirasi Hidup Indonesia Tbk (ASPI) has announced a cash dividend of IDR 579.87 billion, or IDR 33.87 per share, equivalent to 65% of its 2024 net profit. The dividend distribution was approved by shareholders at the company's annual general meeting of shareholders.

PT Ciputra Development TBK (CTRA) aims to achieve Rp 11 trillion in marketing sales in 2025, similar to last year's target, with Rp 3.15 trillion already recorded in the first quarter, accounting for 29% of the company's target for the year.

PT Solusi Sinergi Digital Tbk (SSIA) has raised IDR 2.5 trillion bond through its subsidiary PT Integrasi Jaringan Ekosistem (Weave), with two series of bonds offering a coupon rate range of 9.5%-11.5%. The bond issuance consists of two series, with tenors of 370 days and 2 years, respectively.

Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, has signed an investment agreement with PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (CAPC) to build a chlor-alkali-ethylene dichloride plant, marking its first investment project. The partnership is part of the fund's goal to invest in strategic sectors and drive economic growth.

The Jakarta stock index rose 0.54% to 7,155.85 on Tuesday, driven by a weakened US dollar and strengthened rupiah, with investors awaiting the Federal Open Market Committee's meeting results and global geopolitical developments.

Despite facing challenges such as weakened purchasing power, Kalbe Farma (KLBF) is expected to maintain a stable margin through its expansion in the healthcare equipment and pharmaceutical segments. The company still has concerns about high raw material prices and yet-to-be fully recovered purchasing power.

In Q1 2025, all digital banks in Indonesia turned a profit, but their gains are still dwarfed by global players like Kakao Bank (KR) which reported a profit of IDR 4.3 trillion with 20 million customers in 2023.

Bank Central Asia (BBCA) has reported a cost-to-income ratio of 28.5% in Q1 2025, the lowest among its peers, and is prioritizing margin stabilization over aggressive loan growth, with a loan-to-deposit ratio of 80% as of April 2025. The bank's loan growth stood at 3.2% in May and 12.8% year-on-year, with a target of 6-8% for 2025.

The multifinance sector in Indonesia has seen a significant growth of 11.08% in used vehicle financing, reaching Rp 117.15 trillion as of April 2025. This growth is a positive sign for the industry, which has been struggling with declining new car sales.

Four regional banks in Central Java and East Java, including BPR Rejeki Insani, BPR Dutabhakti, BPR Bina Kharisma Insani, and BPR Bina Sejahtera Insani, will merge to strengthen the banking industry, with BPR Bina Sejahtera Insani becoming the acquiring bank.

Moody's expects Bank Tabungan Negara's profitability to decline to 0.55%-0.65% by 2025, citing higher credit costs, while the bank's low nominal leverage ratio may overstate its balance sheet buffers. Despite strong capital ratio, the bank faces solvency risks due to high asset risk and low provisioning.

DBS Bank Indonesia (DBS) has launched Spark Savings, a savings account with a yearly interest rate of up to 3.25%, allowing customers to donate a portion of their interest earnings to social partners. The bank has reached over $368m) in green and social financing as of November 2024.

Super Bank Indonesia, backed by Grab Holdings and Singtel, is considering an initial public offering that could raise $200-300M and value the company at $1.5-2B. The Jakarta-based digital bank may take place as soon as this year.

Indonesian banks are expected to deliver net profit growth in the 2024/25 fiscal year, with Bank Central Asia (BBCA) and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) to lead the growth. Bank Negara Indonesia (BMRI) and Bank Mandiri (BMRI) are expected to deliver low-to-mid single-digit net profit growth, while BRI is expected to continue its restructuring in the second half of 2025.

Bank Mandiri (BMRI) has introduced a carbon footprint calculator on its superapp, Livin' Mandiri, to encourage customers to become sustainability champions, with the bank having $17.7 billion worth of sustainable loans as of September 2024. The app's 'Livin' Planet' feature suggests practical ways to offset harmful environmental practices, such as planting trees, and provides financing for climate-based programs.

Moody's expects Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI) to report a return on assets of 1.8-1.9% in 2025, driven by its robust capitalization and stable funding structures. The bank's credit costs are expected to remain modest at 1.3%, with a liquidity coverage ratio well above the regulatory minimum.

Moody's expects Bank Central Asia (BCA) to maintain its high asset quality and profitability in 2025, driven by its robust transaction banking franchise and low funding costs, with net income expected to remain stable at around 3.8% of tangible assets.

Bank Mandiri's net interest margin is expected to decline to 5.1% in 2025, while loan growth may only reach 1% due to tight liquidity, according to UOB Kay Hian's report. Despite this, the bank's asset quality is expected to improve thanks to better quality new retail loans.

Amar Bank (no ticker) is offering an embedded banking service that allows partners to integrate banking features into their apps and websites in under a month, with a net income of $9.25m in Q3 2024, up 20.37% from last year.

The Financial Services Authority reported that Indonesia's sharia insurance industry contributed IDR 9.84 trillion as of April 2025, an 8.04% year-over-year growth. Despite its potential, the industry still lags behind, with a small market share.

PT Semen Gombong, a subsidiary of Medco Group, has canceled its plans to develop a cement factory in Kebumen, Central Java, following the rejection of its environmental impact analysis. The cancellation comes amid growing concerns over environmental priorities and national overcapacity in the cement sector, with the Indonesian Cement Association calling for a nationwide moratorium on new cement plant developments.

Bank Indonesia is predicted to keep its benchmark interest rate unchanged at 5.5% in its meeting this week, considering global factors, after cutting it by 25 basis points in May. According to Banjaran Surya Indrastomo, Head of Economics at Bank Syariah Indonesia, the central bank has already utilized some of its monetary policy easing space in May.

The escalating conflict between Iran and Israel may put pressure on Indonesia's economy if global oil prices rise, affecting the rupiah exchange rate. As of yesterday, Brent crude oil prices fell 1.91% to $72.81 per barrel, while West Texas Intermediate crude oil prices dropped 2.01% to $71.51 per barrel.

A series of massive selling actions have been observed in PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA) stocks throughout June 2025, primarily driven by foreign institutional investors engaging in profit-taking activities. The selling action is a significant event in the stock's performance, but specific financial metrics are not provided in the given news snippet.

The stock of Magran Living (MGLV) was suspended from trading on Monday, June 16, 2025, due to a significant cumulative price increase of 59.49% since the start of June, reaching a three-year high of Rp 252 per share. The suspension aims to cool down the market after the stock price surged from Rp 158 per share at the end of May 2025.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) is considering adjusting its trading hours to better serve all segments of investors, according to Jeffrey Hendrik, IDX Director of Development. The move aims to keep up with other exchanges and potentially increase trading hours or shift them.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has successfully lifted its first oil from the Forel field in the South Natuna Sea Block B, Riau Islands, with a production rate of 10,000 barrels of oil per day. The oil is stored in the Marlin Natuna floating production, storage, and offloading facility before being transported.

Several sectoral indices in Indonesia have shown significant gains, with the technology sector surging 69.75% and the basic materials sector rising 21.53% year-to-date, amidst geopolitical tensions and trade uncertainty. The transportation and logistics sector has also strengthened, with a 9.96% gain.

Several Indonesian steel and iron companies are adjusting their business strategies in response to the 50% tariff increase by the US, with PT Krakatau Steel Tbk (KRAS) focusing on diversifying its market and reducing dependence on protectionist markets.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) aims to launch a gold ETF in the second half of 2025, pending regulatory approval from the financial services authority. The IDX expects the necessary regulations to be issued in Q3 2025, with the ETF listing to follow in Q4.

PT Jasa Marga Tbk (JSMR) is set to improve its performance this year, driven by toll rate hikes and the operationalization of new toll roads connected to the Trans-Java toll road, which will offset the negative impact of the government's 20% toll rate discount policy.

The number of bank branches in Indonesia decreased by 3,208 units to 21,035 units as of March 2025, reflecting a shift in strategy towards digitalization, according to the Financial Services Authority. This digitalization enables customers to access services anywhere and anytime, focusing on operational efficiency.
Hotel Fitra International Tbk (FITT) aims to reach IDR 15.1 billion in 2025, a 13.19% annual growth from IDR 13.34 billion in 2024, and targets double-digit revenue growth by 2025.

China's exports to ASEAN, including Indonesia, surged 13% year-on-year to $51.3 billion, with Indonesia being the third-largest market for Chinese producers. The value of Indonesia's imports from China in May 2025 alone reached $6.8 billion, or around IDR 110.5 trillion.

Outstanding credit for micro, small, and medium-sized businesses grew only 2.3% year-on-year to IDR 1.4 trillion as of April, still lower than the 3.37% growth in December 2024, according to Bank Indonesia data.

Bank Indonesia reported 5.57 billion mobile banking transactions in Q1 2025, a 28.22% year-over-year increase, with a total value of IDR 6.45 trillion, up 23.45%. This growth is driven by the increasing adoption of superapps that enable customers to perform various transactions, including investments.

PT FKS Food Sejahtera Tbk (FKSF) anticipates a boost in purchasing power with the disbursement of the 13th salary payment and economic stimulus package in June and July 2025, coinciding with the school holiday season. The company references research data showing the national snack food market, particularly the extruded snack segment, is expected to grow over 10% as of April 2025.

PT Pelita Teknologi Global Tbk (PELI) will distribute a 20% cash dividend from its 2024 net profit, equivalent to IDR 1.62 billion, after receiving approval from shareholders through an annual general meeting of shareholders. The dividend distribution is part of the company's corporate action.

Bank Indonesia lowered its interest rate by 25 basis points to 5.5% to stimulate the economy, citing stable inflation, anticipation of potential US Federal Reserve rate cuts, and slowing consumption and investment. The move aims to boost the real sector, which grew only 4.87% in Q1-2025.

PT Adhi Karya Tbk (ADHI) saw a decline in new contract values, from Rp 9.4 trillion in 2024 to Rp 2.6 trillion in January-May 2025, reflecting the deteriorating performance of state-owned enterprises in 2025.

Danantara, Indonesia's sovereign wealth fund, plans to acquire Bank Syariah Indonesia, which may involve divestments from Bank Mandiri (BMRI), Bank Negara Indonesia (BNI), and Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI), with potential losses for the banks. The acquisition is subject to regulatory approval and may lead to transitional challenges for Bank Syariah Indonesia.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange has reconstituted three ESG indices, effective June 2, 2025, with PT Sinar Eka Selaras Tbk (ERAJYA) added to the ESG Sector Leaders IDX. The reconstitution is the result of an evaluation by the Indonesia Stock Exchange and the Biodiversity Foundation.

Alexander Ramlie, President Director of Amman Mineral Internasional Tbk (AMMN), has resigned from his position, effective June 14, 2025, to take on a new position as Commissioner of the company. The news was disclosed by the company's Secretary, Vemmy Febrianti, in a letter to the Indonesia Stock Exchange.
The certified gold price at PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) rose by IDR 8,000 per gram to IDR 1,968,000 per gram, while the buyback price also increased by IDR 8,000 per gram to IDR 1,812,000 per gram.

PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk. (ASA) is considered an attractive alternative stock due to its diversified business model, as well as its rapid expansion in logistics. This is seen as a positive development amid the challenging business environment this year.

PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk's (TOWR) stock has consistently declined since the beginning of the year, with a 16.41% drop to IDR 535 per share, and a 13.01% decline in the past month and 2.73% in the past week.

As of Q2 2025, most listed companies in Indonesia have held their annual general meetings of shareholders for the 2024 fiscal year, with a majority of them allocating their net profit as dividends, including state-owned enterprises.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed 0.53% lower at 7,166.06 on Friday, with analysts expecting further correction or technical rebound depending on global and domestic sentiment. No specific company mentions were made in the article.

Indonesia's consumption tax, comprising value-added tax and luxury goods sales tax, contracted, resulting in a negative tax receipts for the January-April period, with a total of Rp 175.7 trillion, down 19.6% from the same period last year.

As of March 2025, Bank Rakyat Indonesia (BRI) recorded an outstanding green credit of IDR 89.9 trillion, an 8.18% annual increase, with IDR 61.16 trillion allocated to sustainable natural resource management and the rest to environmentally friendly sectors.

The US-China trade war has led to a surge in Chinese exports to ASEAN, including Indonesia, with China's exports to ASEAN reaching $51.3 billion in May 2025, a 13% year-over-year. Citigroup Inc. (C) cited data from China General Administration of Customs as the source.

The Indonesian economic confidence index dropped to 106 in May 2025, the lowest since April 2022, due to concerns over job availability and income. The index is expected to remain pessimistic in the coming months due to the impact of the Israel-Iran war on the economy.
BTN Syariah's syariah home financing grew 18.7% year-on-year to IDR 43.45 trillion as of March 2025, while its total KPR only increased by 7.8% year-on-year to IDR 286.5 trillion.

PT Integra Indocabinet Tbk (INCI) aims to achieve 25% sales growth in 2025 despite global trade war uncertainty, with the company's Q1-2025 performance meeting expectations. The target may still change depending on the new tariff policy announcement on July 9, 2025, which could directly impact the export market.
The Indonesian rupiah is expected to weaken against the US dollar due to geopolitical tensions between Israel and Iran, with the rupiah spot rate weakening 0.37% to Rp 16,304 per dollar on Friday.

Despite a decline in interest rates over the past year, digital bank interest rates in Indonesia remain high, with some banks offering base interest rates of up to two digits, particularly for consumer and micro, small, and medium-sized enterprise (UMKM) segments. Bank Amar Indonesia (no ticker) has set its base interest rate at 9.69% to 24.04% as of April 2025.

The Jakarta stock index closed at 7,166.06, down 0.53% on Friday, despite foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 478.76 billion. Analysts provide stock recommendations for Monday, with no specific company mentions.

The Indonesian pension industry's total assets reached IDR 1.551 trillion as of April 2025, growing 8.26% year-over-year, while PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BCA) saw its pension assets grow 2.9% year-over-year to IDR 5.96 trillion.

PT Autopedia Sukses Lestari TBK, part of Triputra Group, reported a 21.38% annual revenue increase to RP 222.51 billion in Q1-2025, driven by higher used car sales via caroline.id. The company is preparing for further expansion to capitalize on the growing demand for used cars.

Bank Indonesia's digital rupiah project has entered the proof of concept stage, focusing on blockchain-based technology for a digital cash ledger. The digital currency will initially be used for transactions in the money market before being expanded for public use.

PT Sampoerna Agro Tbk (SGRO) aims to maximize its performance this year by focusing on increasing crude palm oil productivity, targeting a 5% annual growth in fresh fruit bunch production. In Q1-2025, the company's CPO production increased by 11% year-on-year, with a 15% year-on-year increase in CPO sales volume.

Bank Indonesia reported a 5.1% year-over-year contraction in retail sales, but expects a 2.6% year-over-year increase in May 2025, driven by sales of cultural and recreational goods, food and beverages, and household appliances, coinciding with the Waisak and Isa Almasih holidays.
