Indonesia requires $625.37 billion to meet its national development goals by 2029, with only 40% of the funds covered through central and regional government budgets. The government is calling for greater participation from the private sector and state-owned enterprises to bridge the gap, with each expected to contribute 30% or around $187.61 billion over the next five years.

Indonesia's electric motorcycle sales dropped 40% year-on-year in the first half of 2025 due to consumer hesitation over the continuation of government subsidies. Polytron (no ticker) cited uncertainty over subsidies as the biggest factor, with many consumers postponing purchases in hopes of receiving a Rp 7 million incentive.

Tokopedia sellers must integrate with the TikTok Shop Seller Center by June 9, 2025, as announced by Bytedance, the new owner of Tokopedia after acquiring it from PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia Tbk (GOTO). The integration, which started on April 8, aims to encourage sellers to switch to the new system.

Motor prices in Indonesia are expected to increase by 2025, with prices potentially rising by Rp 500,000 to Rp 2 million due to a 12% tax increase and the implementation of the Opsi Penjualan Saham (OPSN) policy.

The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) increased by 0.74% in the second week of June 2025, recovering from a 0.87% decline in the first week. The index closed at 7,166.06 on Friday, with a high of 7,239.95 and a low of 7,133.38 during the period.

United Tractors (UNTR) is taking steps to reduce its energy consumption, including the use of LED lights and solar panels, as part of its commitment to green building and reducing carbon emissions. The company aims to lower its emissions by 30% by 2030, with initiatives such as energy-efficient lighting and solar panel installation in its office buildings.

China's exports to ASEAN surged 13% year-over-year to $51.3 billion in May 2025, according to a Citigroup Inc (C) report citing China's General Administration of Customs data. The growth is attributed to the escalating trade war between the US and China in the first half of 2025.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 9,000 per gram, from IDR 1,951,000 to IDR 1,960,000, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 9,000 per gram, from IDR 1,795,000 to IDR 1,804,000. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company involved in this price change.

PT Mitra Bara Adiperdana Tbk (MBAP) is diversifying its business to reduce dependence on the coal sector, which is facing challenges such as export competition and fluctuating prices, with the company starting to implement diversification efforts since 2022.

Indonesia is facing a shortage of coconuts and coconut-based products, despite being the world's second-largest producer, with exports to China reaching 68,065 tons in January-February 2025, valued at $29.5 million, has reduced domestic supply, leading to a shortage that has persisted even after Ramadan and Eid celebrations.

Foreign investors, including ByteDance, Sea Limited, and Alibaba Group, have taken control of Indonesia's e-commerce industry, with Shopee, Lazada, and TikTok Shop being the top three e-commerce platforms in terms of GMV, with a total value of USD 55.1 billion, USD 18.8 billion, and USD 16.3 billion, respectively.

The growth of mortgage credit disbursement in Indonesia is heavily influenced by interest rates, with banks having a larger portion of cheap funds able to offer more competitive credit rates. Despite Bank Indonesia's recent 25 basis point cut in the benchmark interest rate to 5.5%, mortgage rates are not expected to decrease immediately, particularly for banks with high funding costs.

Bank Indonesia is expanding its QRIS cross-border cooperation to Saudi Arabia, China, and Japan, following successful implementation in Malaysia, Singapore, and Thailand, with the transaction value continuing to increase.

Indonesian banks are innovating to grow their agent banking business, which not only contributes to commission revenue but also encourages low-cost fund collection, with some banks simplifying registration for new agents. This move is expected to drive business growth and increase deposits.

PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk (FAST) raised capital through a private placement, issuing 533.33 million new shares at a nominal value of IDR 50 per share, potentially gaining IDR 80 billion in additional capital.

Famon Awal Bros Sedaya (FAMS) has acquired a 51.01% stake in Lynas Medikal, a distributor of medical equipment and pharmaceuticals in Indonesia, for Rp 17.25 billion. The acquisition involves the purchase of 17,250 shares, expanding Famon Awal Bros Sedaya's presence in the Indonesian healthcare industry.
The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) fell 0.53% to 7,166.06 on Friday, its third consecutive decline this week, but still up 1.37% for the week.

PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk (MIKA) aims to achieve double-digit growth in revenue and net profit throughout the year. The company's management remains optimistic about its business prospects until the end of the year.

The Indonesian government targets the implementation of the Indonesia-European Union Comprehensive Economic Partnership Agreement (IEU CEPA) to start in Q4 2026 or early 2027, expecting a 5.4% annual export growth. The agreement aims to increase market access, potentially boosting export performance.

Indonesian banks' liquidity is expected to improve in the second half of 2025 due to recent rate cuts and higher foreign borrowing limits, which could free up funds for lending. Net interest margins are expected to compress in Q2 2025, but may ease in H2 2025

PT Toba Pulp Lestari Tbk's (TOBA) trading volume significantly increased to thousands of lots per day, accompanied by a rapid price increase, peaking at IDR 920 per share on June 5, 2025. The stock saw a crossing of 1.283 billion shares on the same day, facilitated by Indo Premier Sekuritas.

The World Bank's updated poverty measurement has increased the poverty line, resulting in 68.2% of Indonesia's population, or 194.4 million people, living below the poverty line of IDR 49,244 per day. This is in contrast to the Indonesian government's report, which stated that 24.06 million people, or 8.57% of the population, lived in poverty as of September 2024.

The Indonesian government has established 78,719 village cooperatives as of June 4, 2025, with 17,659 units, but the rapid establishment process has raised concerns of corruption and political influence.

The Indonesian government is set to revise and announce a new national poverty line standard this year, according to Luhut Binsar Pandjaitan, Chairman of the National Economic Council. The new standard is expected to be announced soon, with a report already prepared for review.

The Indonesian government has reshuffled the management of state-owned enterprises in the energy and mining sector, appointing individuals with backgrounds in the military and politics, including two police generals, to key positions at Mind ID, a holding company for Indonesia's mining industry. The move is seen as part of a broader effort to restructure the country's state-owned enterprises.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia rose by IDR 000 per gram to IDR 1,951,000 per gram, while the buyback price also increased by IDR 23,000 per gram to IDR 1,795,000 per gram. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company behind the Logam Mulia gold bars.

The Indonesian government's tax revenue realization until the end of April 2025 was only IDR 557.1 trillion, a 10.8% year-on-year decline, due to economic pressure, particularly in consumption. The government is struggling to collect taxes amid the country's economic downturn.

Majority of global securities firms recommend buying GoTo's stock with an average target price of IDR 98,22 per share for the next 12 months, with 24 out of 30 institutions giving a 'buy' rating. Six institutions have given a 'hold' rating.

The Indonesia Stock Exchange (IDX) plans to increase liquidity by introducing liquidity providers, targeting an 11.5% increase in transaction value. The implementation is set to take place in the third quarter.

The Indonesian consumer confidence index fell to 117.5 in May 2025, a 4.2-point decline from the previous month, marking the lowest level in nearly three years. This decline serves as a warning to the government that the economy is not healthy, as economic growth is still supported by consumption.

The Indonesian Electric Motorcycle Industry Association reported a sharp decline in electric motorcycle sales in Q1 2025, with only 30% of last year's total sales of 62,700 units. The industry had targeted 200,000 unit sales for the year.

The Directorate General of Civil Aviation announced that Jetstar Asia plans to close all its operations, including those in Indonesia, as informed by the General Manager of South East Asia and South Asia of Qantas Group. The closure was announced verbally on June 11, 2025, with no official written notification received yet.

PT Mega Manunggal Property Tbk (MMLP) is optimistic about its performance this year, driven by new clients, including from China, and expects to exceed its target with an occupancy rate of over 90% by the end of the year.

PT Aneka Tambang Tbk (ANTM) and PT Bukit Asam Tbk (PTBA) have announced plans to pay out cash dividends to their shareholders, with ANTM distributing Rp 3.6 trillion or Rp 151.77 per share. The two companies, which are part of the state-owned mining holding company Mind ID, made the announcements at their annual general meetings of shareholders.

The association recorded a decline in domestic cement sales volume to 3.8 million tons in March 2025, down from 4.9 million tons in March 2024, with a 7.4% decrease in sales volume for the first quarter of 2025 to 13.4 million tons. This decline in sales was noted by Asosiasi Semen Indonesia, but no specific company such as Semen Indonesia (SMGR) was mentioned in the article.

Siam Cement Public Company Limited's subsidiary, SCG Chemicals Public Company Limited, is considering selling a 10.57% stake in PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk, a company owned by taipan Prajogo Pangestu. The sale is part of the company's strategy, according to a management letter to the Thailand Stock Exchange.
PT Hartadinata Abadi Tbk (HRta) aims to reach IDR 27 trillion in revenue this year, a 47% increase from last year's realization, with a projected net profit of IDR 600 billion, up 35% year-on-year.

PT Summarecon Agung Tbk (SMRA) has decided to distribute a dividend of IDR 148.57 billion for 2024, as approved in the company's annual general meeting of shareholders. This move is expected to benefit the company's investors and stakeholders.

The Indonesian government has tasked Perum Bulog (BULOG) to purchase 1 million tons of corn from farmers at a price of IDR 5,500 per kilogram, with a revised moisture content requirement of 18-20%. This move aims to support local farmers during the harvest season.

Indosat (ISAT) has set more rational targets for 2025, lowering its revenue and EBITDA growth targets to 3% each, and its net profit growth target to 6%. The company had previously set ambitious targets, including a 10% EBITDA growth target, which analysts deemed challenging to achieve.

The global nickel price has dropped 14.26% over the past year, currently standing at $15.129 per ton, which may negatively impact Indonesian mining companies. The decline in nickel prices may lead to a decrease in revenue for these companies.

Tokopedia and TikTok Shop have launched a new Seller Center to help small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs) manage their business operations more efficiently. The launch is part of Tokopedia and TikTok Shop's commitment to driving sustainable growth and innovation in Indonesia's e-commerce ecosystem.

Logam Mulia's (ANTM) certified gold prices rose by Rp 18,000 per gram to Rp 1,928,000 per gram, while buyback prices also rose by Rp 18,000 to Rp 1,772,000 per gram. This marks a significant increase in gold prices in the Indonesian market.

PT Adi Sarana Armada Tbk (ASA) is strengthening its vehicle rental business by focusing on corporate clients with long-term contracts, which helps to mitigate the impact of seasonal fluctuations on rental volume and tariffs.

Malindo Feedmill is expanding its market reach and strengthening operational performance, targeting export markets in Japan, Singapore, and Oman, with plans to enter the Middle East and Asian markets. The company aims to increase its export market share, particularly for processed chicken products.
The Indonesian rupiah rose 0.09% to IDR 16,260 per dollar, supported by recent capital inflows, according to Lukman Leong, an analyst at Doo Financial Futures.

PT Chandra Asri Pacific Tbk (TICKER) will distribute $30 million in cash dividends, equivalent to IDR 489 billion, from its 2018 retained earnings. The company's shareholders approved the agenda to change the use of retained earnings from 2018, totaling $123.55 million.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) fell 0.11% to 7,222.45 on Wednesday, despite foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 79.04 billion. Analysts have provided several stock recommendations for today.

Several companies in Indonesia's LQ45 index have not yet distributed dividends, with some still awaiting approval from shareholders at their annual general meeting. The dividend distribution process typically requires shareholder approval before the announcement.

Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusaha Tengah (Danantara) is evaluating the funding needs of state-owned enterprises, including PT Garuda Indonesia Tbk (GIAA), which has requested funding for the procurement of 15 aircraft. The evaluation is part of Danantara's role in supporting the expansion of state-owned enterprises.

President Prabowo Subianto has reportedly prepared the structure of a national revenue authority, which will be directly responsible to the President, according to Edi Slamet Irianto, a member of the National Campaign Team's taxation expert council.

Syariah stock mutual funds recorded a 1.69% return as of June 5, 2025, but their performance varies greatly depending on their investment focus, according to Research Analyst Arjun Ajwani of Infovesta Kapital Advisori.

PT Citra Nusantara Gemilang Tbk (CNGG) will distribute a dividend of IDR 4.7 billion, equivalent to 50% of its 2024 net profit of IDR 9.41 billion, driven by a 34.67% increase in revenue to IDR 508.50 billion.

The government has revoked four nickel mining permits in the Raja Ampat region, including those of PT Anugerah Surya Pratama, PT Mulia Raymond Perkasa, PT Kawei Sejahtera Mining, and PT Nurham, and is set to revise its policy to allow for continued mining in the area.

Blibli received approval from shareholders to increase capital without preemptive rights, aiming to implement a management and employee stock ownership plan. The approval was obtained during an extraordinary general meeting of shareholders held on Wednesday.

The Indonesian Financial Authority is developing a gold exchange-traded fund, which can serve as an investment alternative for non-bank financial industries, such as pension funds and insurance companies, with a potential market value of IDR 20,000 per month. OJK Deputy Commissioner Iwan Pasila stated that gold can compensate for stock price fluctuations, making it a viable investment option.

Indonesia is considering implementing a wealth tax to address the country's widening wealth gap, with only 1% of the population holding more than half of the national wealth, while the bottom 50% hold less than 5%. The government is studying the implementation of a wealth tax, which could generate up to IDR 150 trillion in revenue.

The Indonesian government is set to issue mining permits for micro, small, and medium enterprises, with the Minister of Energy and Mineral Resources requesting the Minister of Cooperatives and Small and Medium Enterprises to identify eligible businesses. The move is expected to be formalized through a forthcoming government regulation.

Despite a decline in domestic travel demand, Indonesia's travel insurance market continues to thrive, particularly for international travel segment, with PT Great Eastern General Insurance (GREAT) citing a significant impact on the domestic travel market due to government's efficiency policy and decreased purchasing power. The market is expected to remain resilient, driven by growing demand for mobility protection.

Indonesian banks are issuing bonds to diversify their funding sources amid tight liquidity, with the loan-to-deposit ratio reaching 87.95% in March 2025. This move is seen as an effort to mitigate the pressure, as reflected in the data from the Financial Services Authority (OJK).

Global crude oil prices have fallen below $70 per barrel, down 16% year-on-year, which is expected to impact various sub-sectors in the manufacturing industry, particularly in reducing production costs and fuel costs.

Indonesia is shifting from a resource-based to a demand-based approach to manage its vast mineral resources, focusing on strategic minerals like nickel, copper, and lithium to support the global energy transition, with a goal of becoming a major industrial nation by 2045.

The Jakarta Stock Exchange (IHSG) is expected to test the resistance area of 7,254-7,325 due to positive sentiment from the US-China trade talks, with the index still holding above the psychological support of 7,000. The market is waiting for the release of consumer price index data this week.

The M0 adjusted position in May 2025 reached Rp 1.939.1 trillion, representing a 14.5% year-over-year growth, but a decline from the Rp 1.952.3 trillion recorded in April 2025. This growth is lower than the 13% year-over-year growth in the previous period, which was in line with the momentum of the lebaran holiday season.

The Indonesian Ministry of Finance has introduced a new regulation to strengthen the legal basis for international information exchange, aiming to prevent tax evasion and avoidance, and to obtain information on tax obligations. The move is expected to improve tax transparency and compliance.

Following Bank Indonesia's 25bps rate cut to 5.50% in May 2025, several companies, including PT Bank Mandiri Taspen, PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI), and PT Eagle High Plantations Tbk, are set to issue corporate bonds, signaling a more vibrant bond market.

In the last three years, Indonesia's blue chip stocks have underperformed the market, with the Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) only showing a 0.38% increase from May 2022 to May 2025. This is despite being considered a long-term investment portfolio.

Indonesia's foreign exchange reserves stood at $152.49 billion at the end of May 2025, barely changed from $152.47 billion in April, despite the government's issuance of global bonds, including Samurai bonds. The reserves were influenced by tax and service receipts, as well as foreign exchange earnings from oil and gas exports, offset by government foreign debt payments and rupiah stabilization efforts.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) rose 1.64% to 7,230.74 on Tuesday, with foreign investors recording a net buy of IDR 1.03 trillion. Analysts have provided several stock recommendations for the day.

PT Satyamitra Kemas Lestari Tbk (SMKL) is expanding its operations to Central Java by establishing a new factory in Batang, with a total capital expenditure of Rp 500 billion allocated for 2025. As of now, the company has already spent Rp 243.8 billion on land acquisition, land preparation, design, licensing, and building materials for the new factory.

PT Sillomaritime Perdana Tbk (SILLO) has announced a cash dividend distribution of IDR 280.12 billion, equivalent to 98.78% of its 2024 net profit of USD 17.41 million. The dividend payout of IDR 103 per share for the 2024 was approved by shareholders at its annual general meeting.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened by 0.10% to IDR 16,275 on Tuesday, following a long weekend, with economists citing a lack of new catalysts and ongoing trade negotiations between the US and China. The rupiah's strengthening was also reflected in the Jakarta Interbank Spot Dollar Rate (JISDOR) which rose 0.01% to IDR 16,277.

PT Vale Indonesia Tbk (INCO) is implementing strategic projects to boost its future growth, including selling nickel ore, which has contributed $2.54 million in revenue in Q1-2025. The move is seen as a way to strengthen INCO's commercial strategy.

PT Tower Bersama Infrastructure (TBK) is allocating IDR 3-4 trillion in capital expenditure this year to build new towers to meet customer needs, with the majority of the allocation to be used for this purpose. The company aims to boost revenue from its tower and fiber optic business.

PT Mandom Indonesia Tbk (MANDOM) is experiencing challenges due to a shift in spending habits and decreased purchasing power in the first half of the year, affecting its production and trading of skincare, haircare, cosmetics, and perfumes. The company is looking for ways to adapt to this new dynamic.
In May 2025, all Indonesian mutual fund indices recorded positive returns, with the stock index growing 4.44% and the mixed index increasing 2.92%.

PT Daimler Commercial Vehicles Manufacturing Indonesia (DCVMI) has opened a new factory in Cikarang, West Java, with an investment of IDR 500 billion, aiming to increase production capacity to 5,000 units per year. The factory will produce Mercedes-Benz branded vehicles, including trucks and buses, and will serve as a regional production hub.

Garuda Indonesia (GIAA) reported an 80% seat occupancy rate during the Idul Adha long weekend, driven by high mobility and demand for travel during the period. The airline optimized its seat availability to meet the increasing demand.

PT Mitra Adiperkasa Tbk (MAPI) has acquired GS Supermarket's assets and operational support network in Indonesia through its subsidiary, PT Swalayan Sukses Abadi, following GS Supermarket's decision to cease operations in the country by May 31, 2025.

Three corporations issued bonds in the first week of June, raising IDR 9.85 trillion in funds, driven by refinancing needs and Bank Indonesia's interest rate cuts. This trend is expected to continue for the rest of the year.

The Indonesian stock market index (IHSG) surged 1.65% to close at 7,230.84 on Tuesday, with senior technical analyst Mayang Anggita of Panin Sekuritas (PANIN) stating that the index needs to break through the 7,175-7,240 resistance level to continue its upward trend.

The Indonesian government, represented by the Director General of Mineral and Coal, participated in the Canada Mining Fair 2025, where they discussed strategic reforms in the mineral and coal subsector and signed a memorandum of understanding with the Canadian government to strengthen cooperation on critical minerals and energy transition. The partnership aims to promote sustainable mining practices and support the energy transition in Indonesia.

The Indonesian Financial Authority's co-payment scheme is expected to widely impact the healthcare industry, affecting not only insurance participants but also the performance of hospital operators such as PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk and PT Siloam International Hospitals Tbk. According to a study by CGS International, the majority of revenue for these hospital operators comes from private insurance patients who will be subject to the co-payment scheme.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia increased by IDR 5,000 per gram to IDR 1,909,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 5,000 per gram to IDR 1,753,000 per gram. PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is the company behind the Logam Mulia gold bars.

The Indonesian stock market has underperformed its regional counterparts, with foreign investors pulling out Rp 4.7 trillion in the period of June 25, 2025, amid a week of declines. The outflow of foreign funds has led to a loss of momentum for blue-chip stocks, while regional markets such as the Kospi in Korea have remained in the green.

Barito Renewables Energy Tbk (BREN) has been the top laggard stock in the IHSG index, with its share price dropping 31.54% year-to-date to IDR 6,350 per share. The company's decline has contributed 113.13 points to the IHSG's decline.

The Indonesian paper industry is struggling to compete with cheap imports from countries like China, Korea, and Japan, leading to decreased profitability for local players, particularly small to medium-sized producers. The Indonesian Pulp and Paper Association is urging the government to provide balanced protection for the industry and is also encouraging internal transformation through increased efficiency, modern technology, and reduced production costs.

The Indonesian rupiah exchange rate strengthened slightly by 0.04% to IDR 16,291 on Monday, and 0.19% to IDR 16,277 on Thursday, according to Bloomberg and Bank Indonesia (IDX) data, respectively, despite global uncertainty and limited domestic positive sentiment.

PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk (ICBP) is adopting an expansion strategy to boost performance amidst weakening consumer purchasing power, including raising the price of its Indomie instant noodles by IDR 100 per pack starting mid-February 2025. The company is also launching new products and expanding its overseas market to drive growth.
The Jakarta stock index ended in the green zone, closing at 7,113.42, up 0.63% or 44.39 points from the previous day, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 720.62 billion.

This week is the last chance for investors to buy shares from mining sector companies to receive dividend yields, with multiple companies entering the cum-dividend period. Investors can purchase shares before the deadline to receive dividend payouts.

The last trading day for PT Hanjaya Mandala Sampoerna Tbk (HMS P) shares with dividend rights for the 2024 fiscal year ended on Tuesday, and the shares will enter ex-dividend trading on Wednesday. Investors who want to receive dividends must purchase the shares by Tuesday.

A study by Centre Research Energy Clean Air and Center Economic and Law Studies found that nickel smelter activities in three provinces contributed Rp 83.17 to national GDP. The study, conducted by Centre Research Energy Clean Air, analyzed the impact of nickel hilirisasi in Sulawesi Tengah, Sulawesi Tenggara, and Maluku Utara provinces.

Micro, small, and medium businesses are still waiting for clarity on the continuation of the 0.5% final income tax rate, as the government has yet to publish new rules on the matter, leaving millions of businesses uncertain. The Directorate General of Taxation has confirmed that there is no new regulation regarding the extension of the tax rate.

PT Adhi Karya Tbk's (ADHI) new contract acquisition decreased to IDR 2.6 trillion by May 2025, with 23% from state budget, 56% from state-owned enterprises, and 20% from private companies. This decline is in line with the company's overall performance slowdown in early 2025.

PT Surya Biru Murni Acetylene Tbk (None) will distribute a cash dividend of IDR 3.7 billion, equivalent to IDR 4 per share, following approval from the Annual General Meeting of Shareholders. The dividend is based on the company's net profit for the 2024 fiscal year.

Bank DKI has received shareholder approval to conduct an initial public offering, with the Financial Services Authority supporting regional development banks to go public, potentially increasing their number in the Indonesia Stock Exchange.
Indonesia's cement sales declined in Q1 2025, with Kalimantan region experiencing the largest drop, amid a slowdown in economic growth and a 5.46% in infrastructure spending to IDR 400.3 trillion.

Erajaya Active Lifestyle, a subsidiary of PT Sinar Eka Selaras Tbk (Erajaya), has reported positive performance in the first quarter of 2025, with the management aiming to continue growth despite economic uncertainties in Indonesia. The company's optimism is driven by its strong first-quarter results.

The Real Estate Indonesia Association has expressed concerns over the government's plan to impose a new tax on landed homeowners, citing that it will further strain the already sluggish property sector. The association's deputy chairman, Bambang Ekajaya, warned that the plan could derail the government's goal of addressing the national housing backlog of around 15 million units.

Dato' Sri Chong Thim Pheng acquired 6,000,000 shares of Wilton Makmur Indonesia Tbk (SQMI.JK) on June 9, 2025, increasing his holding from 3,141,351,329 to 3,147,351,329 shares. The purpose of the transaction was personal investment.

PT Sinar Mas Agro Resources Technology Tbk (SMAR) plans to expand its business by selling bio-CNG gas from its palm oil waste processing, potentially adding new profits to its business. The company will seek shareholder approval at its annual general meeting on June 16, 2025.

Bank Syariah Indonesia Tbk (BRIS) saw its stock price drop 14.33% to IDR 2,570 per share, from IDR 3,000 per share, making it the fifth top loser in the past week. The price even touched IDR 2,460, the lowest level in the last month.

Global oil prices have moved away from macro assumption for the 2025 state revenue and expenditure budget, potentially widening the fiscal gap. Brent oil price rose 0.5% to $65.15 per barrel, while West Texas Intermediate oil price fell 0.3% to $63.04 per barrel.

Indonesia's automotive sales declined 4.8% year-over-year in Q1 2025, with motorcycle sales also dropping 3% year-over-year, according to Gabungan Industri Kendaraan Bermotor Indonesia, amid unstable domestic and global macroeconomic conditions.

Retail stocks in Jakarta, such as PT Map Aktif Adiperkasa Tbk (MAPA) and PT Ace Hardware Indonesia Tbk (ACES), have plummeted by 34.58% and 32.28% year-to-date, respectively, due to the weakening economy.

The US decision to increase tariffs on aluminium imports from 25% to 50% starting June 4, 2025, may alter the global aluminium trade landscape, but PT Indonesia Asahan Aluminium (INALUM) reports that direct exports to the US are relatively low at 1,600 tons per year. This accounts for only 0.5% of INALUM's total aluminium billet sales, suggesting a limited impact on the company's overall business.

PT Perusahaan Gas Negara Tbk (PGAS) will distribute a total of $271.5 million in dividends, equivalent to 80% of the company's net profit in 2024. The dividend payout translates to IDR 3,820 per share.

PT SLJ Global Tbk (SLJG) reported a significant increase in revenue from US$344,062 to US$3.56 million in Q1 2025, resulting in a net loss of US$483,742 in March 2024 to a net profit of US$165,258 in Q1 2025.

Ray Dalio, founder of Bridgewater Associates, will continue to serve as an unpaid adviser to Danareksa, Indonesia's state-owned investment firm, despite earlier reports that he had pulled out of the role. Dalio's involvement was announced in March, and he joins other high-profile advisers, including Helman Sitohang, Jeffrey Sachs, and Thaksin Shinawatra.

PT Surya Toto Indonesia (SURF) has allocated IDR 180 billion for capital expenditure in 2025, with IDR 100 billion to be used for renovating its office building in Cikupa, Tangerang Regency and Serpong, South Tangerang City. The capital expenditure is part of the company's strategy to strengthen its operational activities.
PT Sejahteraraya Anugrahjaya Tbk (SRAJ) has decided not to distribute dividends from its 2024 net profit, as announced at its annual general meeting of shareholders on Thursday.

PT Astrindo Nusantara Infrastruktur Tbk (BIPi) reported a 13.53% decline in revenue to USD 562.96 million in 2024, but saw a 23.19% increase in net profit to USD 10.41 million. The company is focusing on expanding its renewable energy projects to improve performance.

The IDX Energy index closed at 2,829.59, up 0.50% from the previous day, and has risen 4.88% since the start of 2025, outperforming the general stock price index and other sectoral indices. The index has been on an upward trajectory throughout 2025.

As of March 2025), there are 1,345 rural banks in the country, with 13 banks having assets of only IDR 1-5 billion and 55 banks with assets of IDR 5-10 billion. The Financial Services Authority's efforts to consolidate these small banks have not yet shown significant progress.

PT CIMB Niaga Auto Finance (CIMB Niaga Auto Finance) recorded a 7% decline in credit approval rate to 55% as of May 2025, compared to 62% in the same period last year. The company has become more cautious in granting credit approvals, reflecting a more conservative approach in the multifinance industry.

Bank Syariah Indonesia's shares are under pressure due to rumors that it will become a new state-owned bank, with Badan Pengelola Investasi, and Danantara reportedly negotiating to buy 51.47% of PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), 23.24% of PT Bank Negara Indonesia Tbk (BBNI), and 15.38% of PT Bank Rakyat Indonesia Tbk (BBRI) shares.

The Indonesian government has increased the export levy on crude palm oil from 7.5% to 10%, which may tighten supplies of subsidized cooking oil brand Minyakita. The higher levy has weakened incentives for exporters to fulfill their domestic market obligations, according to Sahat Sinaga, Chairman of the Indonesian Palm Oil Council.

The Indonesian stock index (IHSG) dropped 1.19% in a week, with foreign investors selling Rp 4.7 trillion worth of shares, mainly in big-cap stocks such as PT Bank Central Asia Tbk (BBCA), PT Bank Mandiri Tbk (BMRI), and PT Astra International Tbk (ASII).

At least eight Indonesian companies, including PT Buma Internasional Grup TBK (BUMI), established new subsidiaries in May 2025, expanding their business into various sectors including technology, healthcare, and energy. The new subsidiaries will engage in various activities such as seaweed cultivation, processing, and sales.

PT Dharma Satya Nusantara Tbk (DSNG) will distribute IDR 254.39 billion in cash dividends, equivalent to IDR 24 per share, following a 35.6% year-over-year increase in net profit to IDR 1.1 trillion in 2024.

Despite a decline in the Purchasing Manager's Index (PMI) to 47.4 in May 2025, Indonesian manufacturing companies such as PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Kalbe Farma Tbk. (KALF), and PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk. (UNVR) have shown resilience in their performance. The PMI, reported by S&P Global, had contracted from 46.7 in April 2025.

The certified gold price in Indonesia dropped by IDR 25,000 per gram to IDR 1,904,000 per gram, while the buyback price also decreased by IDR 25,000 to IDR 1,748,000 per gram. Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) is affected by this price change.

PT Baramulti Suksessarana Tbk (BSSR) will distribute US$20 million in dividends for 2024, with each share receiving US$0.00764 or approximately IDR 123.82. The dividend distribution was approved by shareholders during the annual general meeting.

Indodax, a cryptocurrency exchange, reported IDR 15.24 trillion in transaction volume in April 2025, contributing 42.83% of the national total. The national cryptocurrency transaction value in April 2025 was IDR 35.61 trillion, a growth from IDR 32.45 trillion in the previous month.

Indonesia's economy is struggling with rising unemployment, which reached 7.28 million people in February 2025, and decreased consumer spending, resulting in a decline in production and sales in various industries, including retail and manufacturing.

The Jakarta Composite Index rose 0.63% to 7,113.42 on Thursday, despite foreign investors recording a net sell of Rp 720.62 billion. The index weakened 1.19% over the week, with foreign investors selling a net Rp 4.7 trillion.
Baramulti Suksessarana Tbk's (BSSR) stock price fell 1.91% to IDR 4,100 per share on Thursday, following a 7.03% decline in a week, due to investor disappointment over dividend distribution.

Bytedance, the new owner of Tokopedia, has requested sellers to integrate with Tokopedia & TikTok Shop Seller Center by June 9, 2025, with many sellers expressing concerns and complaints on social media. The integration is mandatory for sellers to continue operating on the platform.

The Jakarta stock index (IHSG) declined 0.87% to 7,113.42 in the first week of June, with the IDX High Dividend 20 and IDX ESG Leaders indices experiencing the largest drops of 3.73%. This follows a 6% gain in May.

Mayapada Healthcare has started construction of Tower 3 at its Jakarta Selatan hospital, with an investment of between Rp 900 billion and Rp 1.4 trillion, following a fresh injection of funds from Bain Capital Credit LP, a private equity firm from the United States.

The majority of ASEAN countries' manufacturing industries remained sluggish in May 2025, with most purchasing managers' indexes (PMIs) staying below 50, despite a slight increase from the previous month. Only Thailand, Singapore, and Singapore recorded PMIs above 50, with Singapore and the Philippines experiencing corrections from the previous month.

PT Cakra Bhakti Para Putra, a controlling shareholder, purchased 6,236,000 shares of PT Steel Pipe Indonesia Tbk (ISSP) at IDR 296 per share on June 4, 2025. The acquisition is part of the company's efforts to adjust its share ownership in ISSP.

The price of certified gold bars in Indonesia decreased by Rp 9,000 per gram, from Rp 1,938,000 to Rp 1,929,000, while the buyback price also dropped by Rp 9,000 per gram, from Rp 1,782,000 to Rp 1,773,000, according to Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM).

PT Merdeka Battery Materials TBK (MBMA) experienced a significant increase in trading volume after officially joining the MSCI Indonesia Small Cap Index on June 2, 2025, with its stock price surging 24.86% to IDR 452 on Wednesday. The company's trading volume reached 1.54 billion shares, a substantial increase from the previous day's 129.9 million shares.

Despite facing challenges such as weakened consumer purchasing power, suppressed economic growth, and uncertain global economic conditions, top consumer goods issuers like PT Indofood CBP Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Indofood Sukses Makmur Tbk. (INDF), PT Mayora Indah Tbk. (MYOR), and PT Cisarua Mountain Dairy Tbk. (CSDY) are still preferred. These companies are expected to continue performing well despite the economic headwinds.

The number of crypto investors in Indonesia has reached 14.16 million as of April 2025, surpassing the number of stock investors, which stands at 7.001 million. This marks a significant increase of 450,000 crypto investors from the previous month.

PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk, the operator of KFC and Taco Bell in Indonesia, has issued 533.33 million new shares at IDR 150 per share, raising IDR 80 billion in funds, with two major conglomerates, Group Salim and Group Gelael, purchasing the entire issue.

Life insurance sales through bancassurance channels in Indonesia decreased by 2.4% to IDR 18.61 trillion in Q1 2025, compared to the same period in 2024, due to reduced customer activity at bank branches. The Indonesian Life Insurance Association reported the decline in premiums received by industry players from bancassurance channels.

Despite a decline in banking stocks in April 2025, some securities firms, including Ciptadana Sekuritas Asia, are projecting a better performance for the sector in the coming months, driven by positive sentiments and expected 5% profit growth in 2025.

A large transaction of 101.696 million shares of PT Adaro Andalan Indonesia Tbk (AADI) occurred in the negotiated market, valued at IDR 673.74 billion, at a price of IDR 6,625 per share. This transaction took place at 11:13 Jakarta time, below the daily trading price range of IDR 6,800-7,000 per share.

Bank Indonesia aims to achieve a 4.8-5.6% growth in the sharia economy this year, driven by an increase in sharia financing. The target is higher than last year's projection of 4.7-5.5%, with sharia banking financing growth expected to reach 8-11%.

The Indonesian government is expected to face a significant surge in state bond repayment obligations in June 2025, with a total of IDR 178.9 trillion worth of bonds maturing. This is the highest amount compared to other months in 2025.

PT Remala Abadi Tbk's shares have been moving sideways after being acquired by PT Iforte Solusi Infotek, a subsidiary of PT Sarana Menara Nusantara Tbk, in a deal worth Rp 535.7 billion. The acquisition was completed on April 30, 2025, with the share price closing at Rp 1,425, before declining to Rp 1,350 on May 9, 2025, and later stabilizing at Rp 1,400.

The stock price of PT Abadi Nusantara Hijau Investama TBK (PACK) has surged to Rp 3,340 per share, a significant increase from Rp 100 in November 2024, with a record high of Rp 3,510 per share. This marks an all-time high for the company's stock.

The price of certified gold bars at Logam Mulia PT Aneka Tambang (ANTM) increased by IDR 14,000 per gram to IDR 1,938,000 per gram, while the buyback price also rose by IDR 14,000 per gram to IDR 1,782,000 per gram.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk's stock has been stuck around IDR 120 in the past two weeks, despite positive sentiment and improving financial reports, while its affiliates PT Bumi Resources Minerals Tbk and PT Darma Henwa Tbk have seen significant gains. The company's financial reports have been improving, but its stock price has not reflected this.

PT HM Sampoerna Tbk (HMSP) stock has risen 31% from its lowest point of IDR 496 on April 8, 2025, to IDR 650 on Wednesday. Despite this increase, the stock is still down 12.16% compared to the same period last year.

The Indonesian government is expected to face a significant increase in debt repayment obligations in June 2025, with State Bond Notes (SBN) worth Rp 178.9 trillion due for repayment. This amount is the highest compared to other months in 2025, with SBN repayments in May and July amounting to Rp 42.4 trillion and Rp 34.7 trillion, respectively.

PT Fast Food Indonesia Tbk, the operator of KFC restaurants, has raised capital through a private placement, issuing 533.33 million new shares at IDR 150 per share. The move is seen as a response to the current volatile stock market conditions.

PT Buyung Poetra Sembada Tbk (BPOETRA) aims to increase sales by maximizing synergy between its distribution networks, as seen in its collaboration with Hoki and Indomarco at the National Sales Kickoff event in Jakarta, which will expand Hoki's product reach to various segments of Indonesian society. This strategy is expected to enhance the company's market penetration capabilities.

PT Kereta Api Indonesia (KAI) has launched a 30% discount program to support national economic growth in the transportation sector. The program is part of the government's stimulus package to maintain people's purchasing power and encourage economic growth.

Daewoong Bio Indonesia, a subsidiary of South Korea-based Daewoong Group, has acquired PT Wietasha Putrindowisata, owner and operator of Alam Kulkul Boutique Resort in Kuta, Bali, to expand into the hospitality sector. The acquisition aims to transform the resort into a wellness-focused destination with a symposium center.

PT Mitra Keluarga Karyasehat Tbk (Mika) will distribute a cash dividend of IDR 43 per share, equivalent to 52.2% of its net profit last year, following approval from its annual general meeting of shareholders. The dividend payment will be made within 30 days after the announcement of the RUPST results.

The Indonesian rupiah strengthened 0.09% against the US dollar on Wednesday, reaching Rp 16,295 per dollar, driven by a combination of global and domestic sentiments, including the impact of President Donald Trump's tariffs on steel and aluminum. The rupiah's strengthening was also reflected in the Jisdor Bank Indonesia rate, which weakened 0.10% to Rp 16,305 per dollar.

Indonesia's sharia banking market has shown little growth in recent years, with assets reaching IDR 936.2 trillion as of March 2025, accounting for only 7.35% of the total banking industry assets. The market share has only slightly increased from 6.47% in 2020, prompting regulators to continue pushing for consolidation among industry players.

The Indonesian stock index rose 0.34% to 7,069.04 on Wednesday, with technical indicators suggesting a potential short-term correction. However, if the index can hold above the 20-day moving average of around 7,038, there is a possibility of a continued rebound.

PT Arsari Tambang, a mining company owned by Hashim Djojohadikusumo, brother of Indonesian President Prabowo Subianto, is set to launch a tin solder factory in Batam by July 2025 through its subsidiary PT Solder Tin Andalan Indonesia. The new factory will contribute to the country's mining downstreaming project.
Logam Mulia's certified gold price decreased by IDR 16,000 per gram to IDR 1,924,000 per gram, while the buyback price also dropped by IDR 000 per gram to IDR 1,768,000 per gram.

PT Bumi Resources Tbk (BUMI) has obtained permission to reorganize its financial balance sheet, allowing it to show a profit without being burdened by past deficits. The company received approval at its annual general meeting of shareholders and extraordinary general meeting of shareholders on Monday.

The Indonesian government has cancelled the planned discount on PLN tariffs, instead increasing the allocation for wage subsidies from IDR 150,000 to IDR 300,000 per month. The government had previously announced plans to provide economic stimulus, including a discount on PLN tariffs.

PT Medco Energi Internasional Tbk (MEDC) has received approval from its Annual General Meeting of Shareholders to distribute dividends for the 2024 fiscal year, totaling $63.29 million. The company will proceed with the dividend distribution to its shareholders.

Badan Pengelola Investasi Daya Anagata Nusantara, the sovereign wealth fund of Indonesia, plans to invest $5 billion by 2025, focusing on themes such as hilirisasi, food security, energy security, manufacturing, and renewable energy. The fund's Managing Director, Danantara Arief Budiman, announced the investment target.

The Jakarta Composite Index (IHSG) closed 0.28% lower at 7,044.82 on Tuesday, with foreign investors recording a net sell of IDR 736.24 billion. Analysts recommend Golden Energy Mines (GEM) at IDR 9,375.

Most Asian currencies weakened against the US dollar, with only the Japanese yen, Thai baht, and Chinese yuan strengthening in the past week, according to Bloomberg data. The currencies are sensitive to US President Donald Trump's tariff policy and geopolitical tensions.

The Indonesian tire industry is expected to see growth in production and sales volumes, according to the Indonesian Tire Association and the Indonesian Rubber Council, despite concerns over weakening consumer purchasing power amid economic pressures.

PT Adaro Minerals Indonesia Tbk (ADMR) will distribute $120 million, or approximately IDR 1.95 trillion, in dividends, marking its first dividend payout since its initial public offering in January 2022). The dividend distribution has received approval from the company's annual general meeting of shareholders.
PT GoTo Gojek Tokopedia TBK (GOTO) reported a 4.1% year-over-year (YoY) increase in transaction value to IDR 144.6 trillion, with net revenue increasing 40.4% YoY to IDR 4.3 trillion in Q1 2025.

PT Pertamina Geothermal Energy Tbk (PGEOTH) has approved a dividend payout of $136.4 million from its 2024 net profit of $160.3 million, with the remaining $24 million retained as earnings. The company's annual general meeting of shareholders was held on Tuesday.

Indonesia's economic slowdown, projected until 2026, has led to a rise in unemployment, with 7.28 million people unemployed as of February 2025, with over 65% of them being educated individuals. The country's education system has failed to address the needs of the workforce, with over 60% of workers employed in fields unrelated to their academic background.

The gold price is projected to continue its upward trend, with a current spot price of $3,382.80 per ounce, and Antam's gold price increasing by 1.83% to IDR 1,94 million per gram. Bloomberg data shows the gold price has risen 2.47% from the start of the week.

The Indonesian government's subsidized loan program for micro, small, and medium enterprises has failed to meet its target, with only 36% of the Rp 300 trillion target achieved as of May 2025. The program, which offers lower interest rates than non-subsidized loans, is crucial for boosting credit to these enterprises.
The multifinance industry's outstanding financing grew only 3.67% in April 2025, a significant decrease from 4.60% in March. This marks the 11th consecutive month of slowing growth since June 2024.

OCBC Indonesia has partnered with Ant International to deliver embedded financial services to small and medium-sized enterprises (SMEs), aiming to benefit thousands of small businesses in Indonesia over the next few years. The partnership will utilize Ant International's alternative-data modelling, credit strategy, and automated credit decision capabilities to offer differentiated services to SMEs within digital ecosystems.

Several Indonesian banks, including Bank JTrust Indonesia and Bank Maspion Indonesia, have yet to meet the free float regulation, while Bank Mayapada's capital adequacy ratio stands at a minimum of 10.47% as of March 2025, potentially attracting new investors from both domestic and foreign sources.

The venture capital industry in Indonesia has seen a turnaround after experiencing prolonged contraction, with financing increasing by 1.04% annually to Rp 16.49 trillion as of April 2025. This growth marks a significant improvement from the previous months, including a 0.34% contraction in March 2025 and a 0.93% decline in the month prior.

PT Unilever Indonesia Tbk (UNVR) will distribute IDR 3.35 trillion, or 99.7% of its net profit, as dividends, with IDR 1.56 trillion already paid out as interim dividends and IDR 1.79 trillion to be paid out as final dividends by July 2, 2025.

PT Gaia Artha Dinamic is acquiring 2.61 billion shares of PT Sumber Sinergi Makmur Tbk, a telecommunications equipment distributor, in a backdoor listing deal. The acquisition is part of a growing trend of backdoor listings in Indonesia.

The Indonesian government has launched a stimulus package to boost domestic economic growth, but economists believe its impact on household consumption and liquidity in the real sector will be limited. The IDR 24.4 trillion stimulus will contribute less than 0.2% to Indonesia's IDR 22,000 trillion GDP.

Around 35 listed companies are expected to distribute a total of IDR 51.47 trillion in dividends, mostly from their 2024 financial year performance, which is expected to boost liquidity in the stock market.
PT Asuransi Jasa Indonesia (Jasindo) reported a 68.34% increase in profit to IDR 67.81 billion as of April 2025, attributed to efficiency in operational lines and risk management.

Lembaga Pembiayaan Ekspor Indonesia (EXIMBKPI) is expected to maintain its robust capitalization, with a 32.9% in March 2025, following a IDR5T capital infusion from the government. However, its high stock of problem loans will continue to weigh on its net interest margin, with a modest return on assets expected over the next 12-18 months.

Indonesia and China have signed a Memorandum of Understanding (MoU) to establish a framework for promoting bilateral transactions in local currencies, expanding the scope of their earlier agreement. The MoU was signed by the governors of Bank Indonesia and the People's Bank of China, with the Chinese Premier and Indonesian President present at the event.

Jakarta's banking industry has been cautious in disbursing syndicated loans for large projects, reflecting a 11.53% year-on-year decline in syndicated loan agreements worth USD 7.73 billion as of June 2, 2025, according to Bloomberg data.

PT United Tractors Tbk (UNTR) is shifting its focus to the agricultural sector, particularly in food estate projects, amidst a change in government allocation. The company is selling heavy equipment for these projects, with Director Iwan Hadiantoro citing a change in domestic heavy equipment market trends.
